It is obvious that they meant well, but I am just, I am having a really rough time, like I said, I broke up with my boyfriend, and it is just freaking me out.
I mean, just because most of the men I have known in my life happen to be jerks, does not mean I should just assume Leonard and Sheldon are. Right?
She asked me a question. I should probably nod.
That is exactly what I thought. Thank you for listening. You are a doll.
Oh-oh. Turn your pelvis.
Sheldon and Leonard’s living room. Howard is there, playing on a dance video game.

His imaginary girlfriend broke up with him.
Been there.
Hello. Sorry I am late. But I was in the hallway, chatting up Penny.
Really? You? Rajesh Koothrapali, spoke to Penny?

What did she say? Is she still mad at me?

She hugged you? How did she hug you? Is that her perfume I smell?
intoxicating, is not it?
The hallway, Leonard puts a note under Penny’s door. It opens.
Hi.
Oh.
What is going on?

Um, here’s the thing. Penny. Just as Oppenheimer came to regret his contributions to the first atomic bomb, so too I regret my participation in what was, at the very least, an error in judgement. The hallmark of the great human experiment is the willingness to recognise one’s mistakes. Some mistakes, such as Madame Curie’s discovery of Radium turned out to have great scientific potential even though she would later die a slow, painful death from radiation poisoning. Another example, from the field of ebola research….
Leonard.
Yeah.

Penny’s apartment. Sheldon and Leonard are trying to construct furniture.
Six two inch dowels.
Check.
One package, Phillips head screws.
Check.
Guys, seriously, I grew up on a farm, okay, I rebuilt a tractor engine when I was like twelve, I think I can put together a cheap Swedish media centre.
No, please, we insist, it is the least we can do considering.
Considering what? How great this place looks?
Oh boy, I was afraid of this.
What?
These instructions are a pictographic representation of the least imaginative way to assemble these components. This right here is why Sweden has no space program.
Well, uh, it looked pretty good in the store.
It is an inefficient design, for example Penny has a flat screen TV, which means all the space behind it is wasted.
We could put her stereo back there.
And control it how?
Run an infra-red repeater, photocell here, emitter here, easy peasy.
Good point, how you gonna cool it?
Hey guys, I got this.
Hang on Penny. How about fans, here and here?
Also inefficient, and might be loud.
How about liquid coolant? Maybe a little aquarium pump here, run some quarter inch PVC…
Guys, this is actually really simple.
Hold on, honey, men at work. The PVC comes down here, maybe a little corrugated sheet metal as a radiator here.
Oh, really, show me where we put a drip tray, a sluice and an overflow reservoir?
And if water is involved we are going to have to ground the crap out of the thing.
Guys, it is hot in here, I think I will just take off all my clothes.
Oh, I have got it. How about if we replace panels A, B and F and crossbar H with aircraft grade aluminium.
Right, then the entire thing’s one big heat sink.
Perfect, Leonard, why do not you and Sheldon go down to the junk yard and pick up about six square metres of scrap aluminium, Raj and I will run down to my lab and get the oxy-acetaline torch.
Meet back here in an hour?
Done.
Got it. .
Okay, this place does look pretty good.

Well, at least now you can retrieve the black box from the twisted smouldering wreckage that was once your fantasy of dating her, and analyse the data so that you do not crash into geek mountain again.

So?

Wait, are you asking me out?
I was going to characterise it as the modification of our colleague/friendship paradigm, with the addition of a date-like component. But we do not need to quibble over terminology.

There is a generally accepted pattern in this area, I would pick you up, take you to a restaurant, then we would see a movie, probably a romantic comedy featuring the talents of Hugh Grant or Sandra Bullock.
Interesting. And would you agree that the primary way we would evaluate either the success or failure of the date would be based on the bio-chemical reaction during the goodnight kiss.
Heartrate, pheromones, etc, yes.
Well, why do not we just stipulate that the date goes well and move to the key variable.
You mean, kiss you now?
Yes.
Can you define the parameters of the kiss?
Closed mouth but romantic. Mint?
Thank you. . Shall I count down from three?

What do you think.

Fair enough. On the plus side, it was a good kiss, reasonable technique, no extraneous spittle. On the other hand, no arousal.
None?
None.

Thank you.
None at all?
Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.

You might be bound by them right now.

Have you ever harmed yourself, or allowed yourself to be harmed except in cases where a human being would have been endangered?
Well, no.
I smell robot.
Hey, what is going on.

Also, Sheldon may be a robot.

Oh, we tried kissing, but the earth did not move. I mean any more than the 383 miles that it was going to move anyway.
Oh, I have seen that look before. This is just going to be two weeks of moping and tedious emo songs, and calling me to come down to pet stores to look at cats. I do not know if I can take it.
You could power down.
Well, as usual, Wolowitz has the solution. I happen to know a place where there are plenty of eligible women, and Leonard could have his pick.
A salsa class. The four guys and a random fat bloke salsa opposite five middle-aged women.
Remember the Latin hips. Shoulders stay still, and we sway. One two three. Five six seven.
I think Mrs Tishman’s got her eye on you. I have been there, you are in for a treat.
The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.

If you are compiling a mix CD for a double suicide. Oh, I hope that scratching post is for you.

Do you know there are only eight consonants in the Hawaiian language.

The stairwell of the apartment building. Sheldon is carrying a box of his things.

Sounds yummy. I look forward to your work with bacon.

I am not just fixing my eggs, I am fixing everyone’s eggs.

Use new eggs. .

Penny’s car
How come you did not go into work today.

So you got canned, huh?
Theoretical physicists do not get canned. But yeah.
Well, maybe it is all for the best, you know I always say, when one door closes, another one opens.
No it does not. Not unless the two doors are connected by relays, or there are motion sensors involved.
No, no, I meant…
Or the first door closing causes a change of air pressure that acts upon the second door.
Never mind.
Slow down. Slow down, please slow down.
We are fine.
Look, you are not leaving yourself enough space between cars.
Oh, sure I am.
No, no. Let me do the math for you, this car weighs let’s say 4,000lb, now add say 140 for me, 120 for you.
Oh, I am sorry, did I insult you? Is your body mass somehow tied into your self worth?
Well, yeah.
Interesting. Anyway, that gives us a total weight of, let’s say, 4,400lb.
Let’s say 4,390.

The supermarket.
This is great. Look at me, out in the real world of ordinary people, just living their ordinary, colourless, workaday lives.
Thank you.
No, thank you. And thank you, ordinary person. Hey, you want to hear an interesting thing about tomatoes.

Uh, yes, but anyone who knows anything about the dynamics of bacterial growth knows to pick up their refrigerated foods on the way out of the supermarket.
Oh, okay, well maybe you should start heading on out then.
No, this is fun. Oh, the thing about tomatoes, and I think you will really enjoy this, is, they are shelved with the vegetables, but they are technically a fruit.
Interesting.
Is not it?

Oh boy.
What now?

Well then you will want some manganese.
On the stairwell of the apartment building.

What?

You want me to buy thirty years worth of tampons?
Well, thirty, thirty five, hey, when did your mother go into menopause?
Okay, I am not talking about this with you.

Oh, Penny, this is a natural human process, and we are talking about statistically significant savings. Now, if you assume 15 tampons per cycle and a 28 day cycle, are you fairly regular? Okay, no warehouse store, but we are still on for put-put golf, right?

Like luminous fish.

The stairwell of the apartment building.

Mommy.
Hi baby.

Because one of the great minds of the twenty-first century is raising glow-in-the-dark fish and weaving sarapes.

Really, when was the last time you left the house.

That was three weeks ago.

Howard, I am sorry… we are… we are
No, no, you are quark-blocking us.
I do not know what to say.
Wow.
Howard, listen…
No, it is okay, it is your Millenium Falcon, you and Chewbacca do whatever you want to do. Me and Princess Leia here will find some other way to spend the evening.
Howard, wait. Sheldon, I think we should tell them.
Okay, sure. I do not see a problem with that.
There is no symposium, Leonard lied to me, is not that right Leonard.
Well… I do not know what to say.
It is okay, I do, look, Leonard is helping Sheldon through a family crisis, he made up the whole story about the symposium with Dr Farmin..farm…ian
Good for you.
Hah, yeah! Because he did not want Sheldon to be embarrassed, and there is nothing to be embarrassed okay, every family in America has a relative holed up in a garage somewhere huffing paint thinner.
No, I am lost too, I think she skipped a step.

No, look, Sheldon’s cousin Leo escaped rehab, and he is in a Motel 8 at Long Beach, the whole family’s going out for an intervention. Leonard is driving Sheldon down there to help him through this because he is such a good man.
Oh, another hug, thank you.
Alright you guys, good luck.
Thanks Penny.
Yeah, uh, break a leg.
Break a leg.
So, road trip to Long Beach.
No, we are not going to Long Beach.
Why not?
Because Sheldon does not have a drug addicted cousin Leopold.
Oh, too bad. I have always wanted to go to Long Beach.
It is a very nice community. The Queen Mary is docked there, once the largest ocean liner in the world, it is now a hotel and restaurant where they host a surprisingly gripping murder mystery dinner.
Sounds fun.
I am game.
Shotgun.
No, no, no, Leonard gets nauseous unless he sits in front, and even then it is iffy.
Wait, are we really going to Long Beach?
Leonard’s bedroom. The bedside table is piled with Queen Mary memorabilia.
Leonard…
Let it go, Sheldon, the murderer was the first mate whether it makes sense to you or not.
No, that is the least of our worries. I have been doing some research on addiction, both the biochemical and behavioural aspects, and I think there is a problem with the current version of our lie.
What are you talking about, it is fine, she bought it, it is over.
Sadly, it is not. Substance abuse is a lifelong struggle, but beyond that I have realised that the Leo I described would not have agreed to go to rehab.
Why not?
Because Leo is a middle child.
There is no Leo, how can you say that?

You did not read the bio, did you? He is not just a middle child, he is the quintessential middle child, from a broken home to boot. Psychologically speaking, the attention he gets by rebelling even to the point of self-destruction is more emotionally valuable than the help he would get at rehab.
I have got a solution.
Great, what is it?
Get out.
Fine. We will talk in the morning.
The living room. Leonard enters in his dressing gown. There is a strange man eating cereal at the kitchen table.
Morning.
Who are you?
I am Sheldon’s cousin Leo.
Oh, God! Sheldon does not have a cousin Leo.

Au contraire. I am 26 years old, I am originally from Denton, Texas, but I was a Navy brat so I was brought up on a variety of military bases around the world, as a result I have often felt like an outsider, never really fitting in, which is probably the reason for my substance abuse problem.
Excuse me, we just went over this. As the quintessential middle child, your addiction is rooted in your unmet need for attention.
Oh, Sheldon, are we really going to go with pop psychology.
For your information, this is all based on solid research, stick with the character profile I wrote for you.
Sheldon?
I am sorry, Leonard, this is Toby Loobenfeld, he is a research assistant in the particle physics lab, but he also minored in theatre at MIT.
It was more of a double major actually. Theatre and physics. You can guess which one my bourgeois parents pushed me towards.
Yeah, I got it, Sheldon, why?
Well, you see, while Leo would not have gone into rehab, it is completely plausible that we would have talked him into leaving the motel, and coming home with us.
Oh…!
Sheldon, how about this as my motivation. When I was fourteen years old I was abused in the Philippines by a club footed Navy chaplain.
No. We are going with middle child, and a generic predisposition to inadequate serotonin production.
Swell, how do I play genetic predisposition?
Subtextually, of course. Morning Penny.
Hi. How did the intervention go.
Unfortunately, we were not able to convince him to go to rehab.
Well, based on what you told me, I am not surprised.
But we did convince him to leave the motel. Come say hello. Leo, this is Penny, our friend and neighbour.
Hi Leo, how are you feeling?
Let me ask you something, Penny. Have you ever woken up in a fleabag motel, covered in your own vomit, next to a transsexual prostitute?
No.
Then do not ask me how I am feeling.
Well, that is Leo. Hey, um, why do not you tell me about your showcase last night?
Oh, it was okay I guess, was not a big turn out but they both really seemed to like it.
There were only two people there?
By the end. Yeah.
Damn you, Chaplain Horrigan!
I am… I am sorry.

The Philippines. 1992. The Subic Bay Naval Station. A young boy on the cusp of manhood. His only companions mongrel dogs and malarial mosquitos. Desperate and alone he reached out to a man who promised to introduce him to a merciful, loving God, but who instead introduced him to a gin pickled tongue shoved down his adolescent throat. What choice did he have but to drink, shoot and snort his pain away.
Do not forget his genetic predisposition towards addiction.
That is never been proven.
There have been studies.
Not double blind studies.
How could there be a double blind study, who would be the control group.
As you can see, detoxing can get pretty ugly, let’s give them some privacy.
Yeah. Hey, do you want to come over to my place, have coffee?
Sounds good.
I have a video of me singing last night, do you want to see it?
Gee, why would not I?
This is even better than you coming to the showcase, because now I get to watch you watch me.
Yeah! Funny how things work out.
And that he loved the companionship and the wisdom that his own father failed to provide.
Your parents made the right decision.
I cannot work like this!
The apartment. Penny is on the sofa with Toby. They are watching TV.
This is amazing. Just sitting on a couch, watching TV with a woman. Not being drunk, or high, or… or… wondering if you are a dude down there.
Leo, you are a very sweet, really funny guy. You are gonna do okay.
One day at a time, Penny, one day at a time.
How long is he going to stay here.
He is a homeless drug addict, Leonard, where is he going to go? Boy, you have a lot to learn about lying.

The living room of the apartment. Leonard and Sheldon are playing the three dimensional chess game from the original Star Trek series. It is Leonard’s move. He takes his time, moving round the board and checking things from various angles. Finally he tentatively makes a move. Sheldon moves almost immediately.
Checkmate.
O-o-o-o-h! Again?
Obviously you are not well suited for three-dimensional chess, perhaps three dimensional candyland would be more your speed.
Just reset the board.
It must be humbling to suck on so many different levels.
Hi guys.
Hey!
Did you get my mail.
Yeah, right here. How was Nebraska?
Oh, better than North Dakota! I guess that joke’s only funny in Nebraska.
From the data at hand you really cannot draw that conclusion. All you can say with absolute certainty is that that joke is not funny here.
Boy, it is good to be back.
How was your family?
Ugh, it was the worst trip, everyone got sick over the weekend.
Sick?
Here we go.
What kind of sick?
Oh, the flu I guess.
I do not need you to guess, I need you to know, now when did the symptoms first appear?
Maybe Friday.
Friday, was that morning or afternoon?
I… I do not…
Think woman, who blew their nose and when?
Sheldon, relax, she does not have any symptoms, I am sure she is not contagious.

Oh please, if influenza was only contagious after symptoms appear it would have died out thousands of years ago. Somewhere between tool using and cave painting, homo habilus would have figured out to kill the guy with the runny nose.
Penny, you will have to excuse Sheldon, he is a bit of a germophobe.
Oh, it is okay, I understand.
Thanks for your consideration, now please leave.
You’d better go before he starts spraying you with Lysol.
Okay, well, thank you for getting my mail.
No problem. Welcome home.
What?
The kitchen
What the hell are you doing?
I am making petrie dishes to grow throat cultures.
With lime jello?
I need a growth medium, and someone polished off the apricot yoghurt. Here, swab my throat.
I do not think so.
Leonard! If I am going to get ahead of this thing I need to find out what is growing in my throat.
Sheldon, you are not sick. This is, but you are not.
We have no idea what pathogen Typhoid Penny has introduced into our environment. And having never been to Nebraska I am fairly certain that I have no cornhusking antibodies.
Sheldon, do not you think you are overreacting?
When I am lying comatose in a hospital relying on inferior minds to cure me, these jello cultures and my accompanying notes will give them a fighting chance.
I am going back to bed.
Wait. Put this in the bathroom.
What for?
I need to measure my fluid intake and output to make sure my kidneys are not shutting down.
I mix pancake batter in this!
No, that measuring cup has always been for urine.
You had time to make a label for everything in this apartment, including the label maker, but you did not have ten seconds to make one that said urine cup?
It is right here on the bottom.
Huh. I guess I owe the Betty Crocker company a letter of apology.
Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon wakes up and coughs. Picks up an electronic thermometer and takes his temperature.
Oh, dear God. Leonard! Leonard, I am sick!
Leonard! Leonard I am sick!
Leonard! Leonard! Leonard. Leonard, my comforter fell down, and my sinuses hurt when I bend over. Leonard? Ow!
Hey.
Leonard, where are you?
I am at work.
At six-thirty in the morning?
Yes.
On Sunday?
Yes.
Why?
They asked me to come in.
Well, I did not hear the phone ring.
They texted me.
Well, as I predicted, I am sick. My fever has been tracking up exponentially since 2am, and I am producing sputum at an alarming rate.
No kidding?
No. Not only that, it has shifted from clear to milky green.
Alright, well, get some rest and drink plenty of fluids.
What else would I drink? Gasses? Solids? Ionised plasma?
Drink whatever you want.
I want soup.
Then make soup.
We do not have soup.
I am at work, Sheldon.
Is that a dog?
Yes,
In the lab?
Yes, they are training dogs to operate the centrifuge for when they need dogs to operate the centrifuge for blind scientists, I have to go.
Howard’s bedroom. The phone is ringing.
Howard, it is the phone.
I know it is the phone, Ma, I hear the phone.
Well who’s calling at this ungodly hour?
I do not know.
Well ask them why they are calling at this ungodly hour.
How can I ask them when I am talking to you! Hello.
Howard, it is Leonard, code Milky Green.
Dear Lord, not Milky Green!
Affirmative, with fever.
Who’s on the phone.
It is Leonard.
Why is he calling.
Sheldon’s sick.
Were you playing with him?
For God’s sake, Ma, I am twenty six years old.
Excuse me Mr Grown-up. Whadda-ya want for breakfast.
Chocolate milk and eggoes please!
Howard, listen to me.
Hang on, call waiting.
No, do not, do not….
Hello.
Howard, I am sick.
Howard’s sleeping, this is his mother. Why are you calling at this ungodly hour?
I need soup.
Then call your own mother. It was Sheldon.
I tried to stop you.
It is my own fault, I forgot the protocol we put in place after the great ear infection of ’06.
You call Koothrappali, we need to find a place to lay low for the next eighteen to twenty four hours.
Stand by. Ma, can my friends come over?
I just had the carpets steamed.
That is a negatory. But there is a Planet of the Apes marathon at the New Art today.
Five movies, two hours apiece. It is a start.
The Cheesecake Factory.
Homeless crazy guy at table eighteen.
No, just crazy. Sheldon, what are you doing here?
I am sick, thank you very much.
How could you have gotten it from me, I am not sick.
You are a carrier. All these people here are doomed. You are doomed!
Shhh! Sheldon, what do you want.
I want soup.
Why did not you just…. Why did not you just have soup at home.
Penny, I have an IQ of 187, do not you imagine that if there were a way for me to have had soup at home I would have thought of it?
You can have soup delivered.
I did not think of that. Clearly febrile delirium is setting in, please bring me some soup while I still understand what a spoon is for.
Okay, what kind of soup do you want.
Well, my mother used to make me this split pea with little frankfurter slices and these home made croutons.
We have Chicken Tortilla and Potato Leek.
Can I get any of those with little frankfurter slices and home made croutons?
No.
Then surprise me. Would you call that moss green or forest green?
The cinema. Everyone is wearing ape masks.
Look at this, everyone went chimp.
Well I’d like to point out, I voted for orang-utan, but you shouted me down. .
Oh, hi Penny!
Hey, where are you?
I am… uh… at work.
You sound funny.
I am… uh… in a… I am in a radiation suit. What is up?
Yeah, well I am at work too, and you will never guess who’s here infecting my entire station.
Sheldon’s at the Cheesecake Factory. Just tell him to go home.
He will not leave, he says he is afraid he will pass out on the bus and someone will harvest his organs.
He is paranoid, and he is established a nest.
Can you please come get him?
Uh, yeah, I’d be… I’d be happy to Penny. I feel really guilty.
You did what you had to do.
Take your stinking paws off my popcorn you damn dirty ape.
The stairwell.
Thanks for bringing me home.
Oh, it is okay, I did not really need to work today, it is not like I have rent or car payments or anything.
Good. Good.
Okay, well, you feel better.
Wait, where are you going?
Um, home, to write some bad cheques.
You are going to leave me?
Sheldon, you are a grown man, have not you ever been sick before?
Well, of course, but, not by myself.
Really, never?
Well, once. When I was fifteen, and spending the summer at the Heidelberg Institute in Germany.
Studying abroad?

No, visiting professor. Anyway, the local cuisine was a little more sausage-based than I am used to, and the result was an internal blitzkrieg with my lower intestine playing the part of Czechoslovakia.
And there was no-one there to take care of you?
No. No, my mum had to fly back to Texas to help my dad because the house had slipped off the cinderblocks again.
Again?
It was tornado season. And it was an aluminium house. Anyway, the housekeeper in the faculty residence did not speak any English, when I finally managed to convince her I was sick, she said “
What does that mean?
Based on what happened next, I assume it means “would you like an enema?”
Okay, sweetie, I will take care of you, what do you need?
Well, my mom used to give me sponge baths.
Okay, ground rules, no sponge baths, and definitely no enemas.
Agreed.
The cinema.
Here we go, ten and a half hours of apey goodness.
Oh dammit, my glasses. Okay, I am blind here guys, can you help me find them?
Sorry. Found ‘em.
Oh great.
Sorry, do not you have a spare.
Yeah, at home.
Well if you leave now, you can be back before the gorillas rip the crap out of Charlton Heston.
Unless Sheldon’s there, in which case you will be trapped forever in his whiny hyper neurotic snot-web.

Hi, Penny. I was wondering, is Sheldon still at the restaurant? Okay, that was very nice of you. Okay, gotta go, got kind of a full blown Chernobyl thing here, gotta go, bye. He is home, I am screwed. Ten and a half hours of apey blurriness.
How about Lasic?
You want me to get eye surgery?
Would you rather go back to the apartment and deal with Sheldon, or have a stranger carve out your corneas with a laser beam?
Well?
I am thinking!
Sheldon’s bedroom.
Okay, nice and cosy, okay, I will see you later.
Wait. Will you please rub this on my chest.
Oh, Sheldon, cannot you do that yourself?
Vaporub makes my hands smell funny.
But Sheldon….
Please, please, please, please, please, please, please.
I cannot believe I am doing this.
No, no, counter-clockwise or my chest hair mats.
Sorry.
Can you sing “Soft Kitty”.
What?
My mom used to sing it to me when I was sick.
I am sorry, honey, I do not know it.
I will teach you. “Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur, happy kitty, sleepy kitty, purr purr purr.” Now you.
Soft kitty, warm kitty…
Little ball of fur. Keep rubbing.
Little ball of fur.
The living room door, a fibre-optic camera emerges from underneath. We see the scene from its point of view. Cut to outside. Raj is holding a laptop, Howard is feeding the camera under the door.
What do you see, what do you see.
The living room appears to be empty.
Okay, he must be in his bedroom. My spare glasses are in my bedroom, on my dresser, next to my Bat-signal.
I am not going in there.
Raj?
No way, Jose.
Well I cannot do it, I cannot see anything.
It is all right, wireless mini-cam and Bluetooth headset. We will be your eyes.
Fine.

One more thing. This is a subsonic impact sensor. If Sheldon gets out of bed and starts to walk, this device will register it and send a signal to the laptop. At that point, based on the geography of the apartment and the ambulatory speed of a sick Sheldon, you will have seven seconds to get out, glasses or no glasses.
Will not my footsteps set it off?
No, you will be on your hands and knees. Now you will need to get the sensor as close as you can to Sheldon’s room.
Well, how do I carry it if I am on my hands and knees?
Stay low. Bear left. Now keep true.
What?
It means go straight.
Then just say go straight.
You do not stay go straight when you are giving bearings, you say keep true.
Alright I just hit my head.
Because you did not keep true. Okay, turn right.
The… the picture’s breaking up.
Angle your head to the right. A little more. A little more. That is it, now just keep true. Alright, you are close enough to Sheldon’s room, deploy the sensor. Now turn it on.
It was not on?
No.
Then why did I have to crawl?
Oh, I guess you did not.
Okay, it is on.
Good. From this point forward you will have to crawl.
I know.
Hang on, the sensor’s picking up something, turn your head back.
You rat bastard.
Told you the sensor would work.
Hi!
You deliberately stuck me with Sheldon.
Well, I had to, you see what he is like.
Penny! Penny, I am hungry.
Uh, it is okay, sweetie, good news, Leonard’s home!
No!
Here you go, good luck, bye.
W-wait!
Leonard, I am hungry!
Wait! Penny! Take me with you!
I want grilled cheese.
Do you think Penny will come here and take care of us?
I do not think Penny’s ever coming here again.
I am very congested.
Yeah, so?
Can you go to the kitchen, and get me the turkey baster labelled mucus.
If I stand, I will vomit.
Under the sink, yellow Tupperware bowl.
The University cafeteria.
Here’s the problem with teleportation.
Lay it on me.

Assuming the device could be invented which would identify the quantum state of matter of an individual in one location, and transmit that pattern to a distant location for reassembly, you would not have actually transported the individual. You would have destroyed him in one location, and recreated him in another.
How about that.
Personally, I would never use a transporter. Because the original Sheldon would have to be disintegrated in order to create a new Sheldon.
Would the new Sheldon be in any way an improvement on the old Sheldon?
No, he would be exactly the same.
That is a problem.
So, you see it too.
Dr Hofstadter, Dr Cooper.
Dr Gablehouser.
Gentlemen, I’d like you to meet Dennis Kim. Dennis is a highly sought after Doctorial candidate and we are hoping to have him do his graduate work here.
Graduate work, very impressive.
And he is only fifteen years old.
Not bad, I myself started graduate school at fourteen.
Well, I lost a year while my family was tunnelling out of North Korea.
Advantage Kim.
I thought maybe you boys could show Dennis around, let him see why we are the best physics research facility in the country.
I already know you are not. You do not have an open science grid computer, or a free electron laser, and the string theory research being done here is nothing but a dead end.
Excuse me, that is my research, and it is by no means a dead end.
Well, obviously you do not see it yet, but trust me, you will.

Dennis, we discussed this, we are in the process of updating our equipment, and we welcome your input on our research goals, and we have agreed to look the other way if you want to use up to 20% of the grant money you attract to smuggle your grandfather out of Pyongyang. We want him here boys, make it happen.
Yes sir.
You can count on us, we are on it. What the hell do you mean, dead end.
I mean, the whole landscape of false vacuums in string theory could be as large as ten to the five-hundredth power. In addition… ooh, look, chocolate milk.
I sense a disturbance in the force.
A bad feeling I have about this, mmm-hmmm.
A corridor.
So, Dennis, how long have you been in America.
A year and a half.
No kidding, you speak English really well.
So do you. Except for your tendency to end sentences with prepositions.
What are you talking about?
That.
He is not wrong. Alright, and this is my office.
Is this part of the tour?
Nope. Goodbye.
Come on, Sheldon, we have hardly shown him anything.
Oh, alright, this is my desk, these are my books, this is my door, please close it behind you. Goodbye.
Looks like you are doing work in quantum loop corrections.
Keen observation, goodbye.
You see where you went wrong, do not you?
Leonard.
Huh, yeah?
Get him out.
Come on, Dennis, I will show you the rec centre, they have got nautilus equipment.
Do I look like I lift weights.
Not heavy ones.
It is startling to me you have not considered a Lorentz invariant field theory approach.
You think I have not considered it? You really think I have not considered it?
Have you considered it?
Get him out Leonard.
Come on, Dennis, I will show you the radiation lab.
Wow, you won the Stephenson award.
Yes, in fact I am the youngest person ever to win it.
Really, how old?
Fourteen and a half.
You were the youngest person ever to win it.
It is like looking into an obnoxious little mirror, is not it?
The living room of the apartment.
Mmm, this is really delicious, is not it? Oh, sweetie, you are so damaged.
Hey, I am damaged too. How about a hug for Howie?
Sure. Raj, hug Howard.
Uh-uh-uh.
Something you’d like to share? A tale of woe perhaps.
Fifteen years old. Dennis Kim is fifteen years old, and he is already correcting my work. Today I went from being Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart to… you know, that other guy.
Antonio Salieri?
Oh, God, now even you are smarter than me.
You know, Sheldon, you do not have so many friends that you can afford to start insulting them.
Just eat, Sheldon, you will feel better.
Why waste food. In Texas when a cow goes dry they do not keep feeding it, they just take her out and shoot her between the eyes.
I am confused, did Sheldon stop giving milk?
You cannot let this kid get to you. You always knew that someday someone would come along who was younger and smarter.
Yes, but I assumed I would have been dead hundreds of years, and that there would be an asterisk by his name because he would be a cyborg.
So, you have got a bit of competition, I really do not see what the big deal is.
Well of course you do not, you have never excelled at anything.
I do not understand, exactly how did he get any friends in the first place?
We liked Leonard.
Well, what are you going to do, Sheldon, give up?

Yes. That is what a rational person does when his entire life’s work is invalidated by a post-pubescent Asian wunderkind. He ceases his fruitless efforts, he donates his body to scientific research, and he waits to die.
You know, I am confused again, is he waiting, or do we get to shoot him between the eyes?
The same, later that night
Hey.
Hey.
I have decided you are right. My career is not over.
Great.
But, since the arrival of Dennis Kim has rendered my research pointless, I just have to find something else to focus on.
Great.
So I have decided, I am going to collaborate with you.
Great.
What exactly is it you do? I know you chatter on about it all the time, but I have never really paid attention.
Okay, well, right now I am designing an experiment to study the soft component of cosmic radiation at sea-level, but I really do not need any help.
Oh, sure you do. Now, see, what is this here in the schematic, is that a laser array?
Yes.
No. Hmmm. What happens if you use argon lasers instead of helium neon?
It would blow up.
Are you sure?
Pretty sure.
Pretty sure’s not very scientific, is this how you normally work, just hunches and guesses and stuff?

Okay, Sheldon, I understand that you are going through a bit of a career crisis, you are searching for some other area where you can feel valuable and productive but I need to tell you something and I want you to listen carefully.
Alright.
Go away.
If you are concerned about sharing credit with me, you are name can go first… I am going.
Howard’s lab.
It is a small brown paper bag, Ma, I am looking at it right now. How are two ding-dongs tomorrow going to help me today?
So, this is engineering, huh?
I will talk to you later.
Engineering. Where the noble semi-skilled labourers execute the vision of those who think and dream. Hello, oompah-loompahs of science.
Sheldon, what are you doing here?
I just came by to say hello.
I have been at this lab for three years, you have never came by to say hello.
Well, up until now I have had better things to do. So, what are we making today?
A small payload support structure for a European science experimental package that is going up on the next space shuttle.
Really, how does it work?
When this is done, it will be attached to the payload bay, and the sensor apparatus will rest on it.
Uh, huh. So it is a shelf?
No, you do not understand, during acceleration it needs to stay perfectly level and provide… yeah, okay, it is a shelf.
Now, I notice you are using titanium, did you give any consideration to carbon nanotubes, they are lighter, cheaper and half twice the tensile strength.
Sheldon, there is a diploma in my office that says I have a masters in engineering.
And you also have a note from your mother that says I love you, bubbula. But neither of those is a cogent argument for titanium over nanotubes.
Sheldon.
Yes.
Go away.
Did Leonard tell you to say that?
No, I thought of it all by myself.
Huh. It cannot be a coincidence. There must be some causal link I am missing.
Raj is exiting his office.
Go away.
Curiouser and curiouser.
The apartment.
Is he here?
If he were, I would not be.
Do you know what he did. He watched me work for ten minutes, and then started to design a simple piece of software that could replace me.
Is that even possible?
As it turns out, yes.
Something’s got to be done about him, Leonard.
Like what? He will never be able to cope with the fact that some fifteen year-old kid is smarter and more accomplished than he is.
Well, what if something were to happen to this boy so he was no longer a threat to Sheldon?
Then our problem would be solved.
Hang on, are we talking about murdering Dennis Kim? I am not saying no.
We do not have to go that far, there are other means available.
We cannot send him back to North Korea. He knows how to get out.
The only thing we need to do is make this Kim kid lose his focus.
That will not happen, he is not interested in anything but physics.
What about biology?
What?
You know, biology? The one thing that can completely derail a world class mind.
Howard, he is fifteen.
Yeah, so, when I was fifteen I met Denise Polmerry and my grade point average fell from a 5.0 to a 1.8.
She was sleeping with you?
No, I just wasted a lot of time thinking about what it would be like if she did.

Oh, good, you are all here. Look, I have decided that if the three of you drop whatever it is you are working on and join me, we could lick cold fusion in less than a decade, twelve years tops. Hmm. Could it be me?
Outside Penny’s apartment.
Oh, hey guys, what is up?
We need a hot fifteen year-old Asian girl with a thing for smart guys.
What?
Howard, that is racist, any fifteen year-old girl will do the trick.
It is possible she may have misunderstood us.
Sheldon’s office. He is making measurements on maps. There is a knock on the door.
Dr Cooper? Oh, are we interrupting?
No, no, please, come in. Yeah, I think you will appreciate this, very exciting.
Oh, what are you working on?

Something remarkable. Since my prospects for the Nobel Prize in physics have disappeared, thank you very much, I have decided to refocus my efforts and use my people skills to win the Nobel Peace Prize. Look, I am going to solve the Middle-East Crisis by building an exact replica of Jerusalem in the middle of the Mexican desert.
To what end?
You know, it is like the baseball movie, build it and they will come.
Who will come?
The Jewish people.
What if they do not come.
We will make it nice, put out a spread.
Okay, well, um, speaking of spreads, we are having a small welcoming party this afternoon for Mr Kim, who’s agreed to join us here at the University.
Of course he has, the oracle told us little Neo was the one. You can see the Matrix, cannot you.
Okay, well, uh, obviously you are very busy with your… uh, um, come Dennis. You will have to excuse Dr Cooper, he is been under a lot of… um… he is nuts.
Ah, la-la-la, Hava Nagila. They will come, they will settle and I will win the prize…
The welcoming party
I really do not understand your objections, Professor Goldfarb, why would not the Senoran Desert make a perfectly good promised land?
Go away.
We could call it Nuevo Cherusalem.
Please go away.
Said Pharoah to Moses.
Why are all these young women here?
It is take your daughter to work day.
Really, I was not aware of that.
Oh, yes. There was a very official email that was sent to everyone whose insurance files indicated they had daughters between the ages of 14 and 16.
Hm?
Smooth.
Thank you.
There is the man of the hour.
Okay, so we now have a socially awkward genius in a room full of attractive age-appropriate women.
All he has to do now is hook up with one of them.
Does anyone else see the flaw in this plan?
We need a social catalyst.
Like what? We cannot get fifteen year-old girls drunk.
Or can we?
No, we cannot.
I do not think you mean we cannot. I think you mean we should not.

Hey, Howard. You are a Jew. If there was another wailing wall, exactly like the one in Jerusalem, but close to taco stands and cheap prescription drugs, would you still be able to wail at it? Okay, it is definitely me.
Okay, we cannot leave this to chance, lets pick a girl, and figure out how to get her together with Dennis.
Okay. How about that one.

Uh-uh. I know the type, cheerleader, student council, goes out with jocks, will not even look at anybody in the gifted programme. And if, after two years of begging, she does agree to go out with you, it turns out to be a set-up and you are in the back seat of your mom’s car with your pants off while the whole football team laughs at you.
Are you crying?
No, I have allergies.
Okay, uh, how about her?

Sure. If he wants to spend a couple of years doing her homework while she drinks herself into a stupor with non-fat White Russians, while you are the one holding her head out of the toilet while she is puking and telling you she wishes more guys were like you, and they she gets into Cornell because you wrote her essay for her, and you drive up to visit her one weekend and she acts like she does not even know you.
Okay, so not her either. How about her?
Interesting, kind of pretty, a little chubby so probably low self-esteem.
I think that is our girl. One of us should go talk to her.
I cannot talk to her, you do it.
I cannot just go up and talk to her. Howard, you talk to her.
Oh no, she will never go for the kid once she gets a peek at this.
You know, if we were in India this would be simpler. Five minutes with her dad, twenty goats and a laptop and we’d be done.
Well, we are not in India.
Alright, why do not we do it your way then? We will arrange for this girl to move in across the hall from Dennis so he can pathetically moon over her for months on end.
Okay, that was uncalled for.
You started it, dude.

Could I have everyone’s attention please. What a wonderful occasion this is. And how fortunate that it should happen to fall on take your daughter to work day. We are here to welcome Mr Dennis Kim to our little family.
Welcome Dennis Kim.
Mr Kim was not only the valedictorian at Stamford University, he is also the youngest recipient of the prestigious Stephenson Award.
Youngest till the cyborgs rise up!
And now, without any further ado, let me introduce the man of the hour, Mr Dennis Kim. Dennis! Dennis!
What?
Would you like to tell us a little bit about your upcoming research.
Um, no thanks. I am going to the mall with Emma.
Well, uh, well, uh….
The kid got a girl.
Unbelievable.
Did anyone see how he did it?

Do not worry, I have got this. Ladies and Gentlemen, honoured daughters. While Mr Kim, by virtue of his youth and naivety, has fallen prey to the inexplicable need for human contact, let me step in and assure you that my research will go on uninterrupted, and that social relationships will continue to baffle and repulse me. Thank you.
He is back.
Yeah, mission accomplished.
Forget the mission, how did that little yutz get a girl on his own?
I guess times have changed since we were young. Smart is the new sexy.
Well, why do we go home alone every night, we are still smart.
Maybe we are too smart. So smart it is offputting.
Yeah, let’s go with that.
The park. The four guys are carrying remote control rockets.
Unbelievable. Components I built are on the International Space Station, and I get a ticket for launching a model rocket in the park.
I do not know if the ticket was so much for the launch as it was for you telling the policewoman “you have to frisk me, I have a rocket in my pants.”
Hey, look at that. It is Dennis Kim.
Wow, I almost did not recognise him.
You know, I kind of feel bad about what we did to him.
Yeah, we really ruined his life.
Screw him, he was weak.
The apartment. Howard is looking at his mobile phone.
Ooh, more details about the new Star Trek film. There is going to be a scene depicting Spock’s birth.
I’d be more interested in a scene depicting Spock’s conception.
Oh, please. For Vulcans, mating, or, if you will, Pon Farr, it is an extremely private matter.
Still, I’d like to know the details. His mother was human, his father was Vulcan, they could not just conceive.
Maybe they had to go to a clinic. Imagine Spock’s dad in a little room with a copy of pointy ears and shapely rears.
How come on Star Trek everybody’s private parts are the same. No alien lady ever told Captain Kirk, hey, get your thing out of my nose.
Hi, can you help me, I was writing an email and the A key got stuck. Now it is just going “aaaaaaa”.
What did you spill on it?
Nothing. Diet coke. And yoghurt. A little nail polish.
I will take a look at it.
Gentlemen, switching to local nerd news. Fishman, Chen, Chowdry, McNair are not fielding a team in the university physics bowl this year.
You are kidding, why not?
They formed a barbershop quartet, and got a gig playing Knotsbury Farm.
Wow, so in your world, you are like, the cool guys.
Recognise.
This is our year! With those guys out, the entire physics bowl will kneel before Zod.
Zod?
Kryptonian villain. Long story.
Good story.
Well count me out.
What? Why?
You want me to use my intelligence in a tawdry competition? Would you ask Picasso to play Pictionary? Would you ask Noah Webster to play Boggle? Would you ask Jacques Cousteau to play Go Fish?
Come on, you need a four person team, we are four people.
By that reasoning we should also play bridge, hold up a chuppah and enter the Olympic bobsled competition.
I want tickets to that please.
Sheldon, what, do I need to quote Spock’s dying words to you.
No, do not.
The needs of the many.
Outweigh the needs of the few.
Or the one. Dammit, I will do it.
The cafeteria.
Okay. First order of physics bowl business. We need a truly kick-ass team name. Suggestions.
How about the perpetual motion squad? It is beyond the laws of physics, plus a little heads up for the ladies.
The ladies?
Perpetual motion squad, we can go all night.
I like it.
I do not. Teams are traditionally named after fierce creatures, thus intimidating ones opponent.
Then we can be the Bengal Tigers.
Poor choice. Gram for gram, no animal exceeds the relative fighting strength of the army ant.
Maybe so. But you cannot incinerate a Bengal Tiger with a magnifying glass.
Let’s put it to a vote. All those in favour….
Point of order. I move that any vote on team names should be unanimous. No man should be forced to emblazon his chest with the bengal tiger, when common sense dictates it should be an army ant.
Will the gentleman from the great state of denial yield for a question?
I will yield.
After we go through the exercise of an annoying series of votes, all of which the gentleman will lose, does he then intend to threaten to quit if he does not get his way?
He does.
I move we are the Army Ants, all those in favour?
The apartment.

Good afternoon, and welcome to today’s physics bowl practice round. I am Penny, and I will be your host, because apparently I did not have anything else to do on a Saturday afternoon, and is not that just a little sad? Gentlemen, are you ready?
Yes.
Of course.
Fire away.
You know, it is none of my business, but is not a guy who cannot speak in front of women going to hold you back a little?
Oh, uh, he will be okay once the women are mixed into the crowd. He only has a problem when they are one on one and smell nice.
Oh, thanks Raj, it is vanilla oil.
I was actually the one who noticed, okay, let’s just start.
Okay, the first question is on the topic of optics. What is the shortest light pulse ever produced? Dr Cooper.
And of course, the answer is 130 adoseconds.
That is correct.
I knew that too.
Good for you, sweetie. Okay, next question. What is the quantum mechanical effect used to encode data on hard disk drives? Howard.
And of course, the answer is giant magneto resistance.
Right.
Hey, I buzzed in.
But I answered, it is called teamwork.
Do not you think I should answer the engineering questions? I am an engineer.
By that logic I should answer all the anthropology questions because I am a mammal.
Just ask another one.
Okay. What artificial satellite has seen glimpses of Einsteins predicted frame dragging?
And of course it is Gravity Probe B.
Sheldon, you have to let somebody else answer.
Why?
Because it is polite.
What do manners have to do with it? This is war. Were the Romans polite when they salted the ground of Carthage to make sure nothing would ever grow again?
Leonard, you said I only had to ask questions.
The objective of the competition is to give correct answers, if I know them, why should not I give them?
Some of us might have the correct answers too.
Oh please, you do not even have a PhD.
Alright, that is it.
Howard, sit down.
Okay.
maybe we should take a little break.
Good idea, I need my wrist brace, all this button pushing is aggravating my old Nintendo injury.
I agree.
What did he say?
He compared Sheldon to a disposable feminine cleansing product one might use on a summer’s eve.
Yeah, and the bag it came in.
The same, later. Sheldon is on his laptop. Leonard enters.
Leonard, excellent, I want to show you something.
Can it wait, I need to talk to you.
Just look. I have designed the perfect uniforms for our team. The colours are based on Star Trek, the original series. The three of you will wear support red, and I will wear command gold.
Why do they say AA?
Army Ants.
Is not that confusing? AA might mean something else to certain people.
Why would a physics bowl team be called anodised aluminium?
No, I meant…. never mind. Hey, check it out. I got you a Batman cookie jar!
Oh neat, what is the occasion?
Well, you are a friend, and you like Batman, and cookies, and you are off the team.
What?
Howard, Raj and I just had a team meeting.
No you did not.
Yes we did, I just came from it.
Okay, I do not know where you just came from, but it could not have been a team meeting because I am on the team and I was not there, ergo the team did not meet.
Okay, let me try it this way, uh, I was at a coffee klatch with a couple of friends and one thing led to another and it turns out you are off the team.
Why?
Because you are taking all the fun out of it.
Well, I am sorry, is the winner of the physics bowl the team that has the most fun?
Okay, let me try it this way, you are annoying and no-one wants to play with you any more.

I see. Well. At this point I should inform you that I intend to form my own team and destroy the molecular bonds that bind your very matter together, and reduce the resulting particulate chaos to tears.
Thanks for the heads up.
You are welcome. One more thing.
Yes.
It is on, bitch.
The cafeteria.
So who’d he get to be on his team.
He will not say. He just smiles, and eats macaroons out of his bat jar.

He is using psychological warfare. We must reply in kind. I say we wait until he looks at us, then laugh like, yes, you are a smart and strong competitor, but we are also smart and strong and we have a reasonable chance of defeating you.
How exactly would that laugh go?
Hee hee hee hee hee hee hee!
That sounds more like, we are a tall thin woman who wants to make a coat out of your Dalmatians.
Guys, let’s remember that Sheldon is still our friend and my room mate.
So?
So nothing, let’s destroy him.
Gentlemen.
Hee hee hee hee hee hee hee!
Okay, we are going to need a strong fourth for our team.
You know who’s apparently very smart, is the girl who played TV’s Blossom. She got a PhD in neuroscience or something.
Raj, we are not getting TV’s Blossom to join our physics bowl team.
How about the girl from the Wonder Years?
Gentlemen, I believe I have found the solution to all our problems.
We cannot ask Leslie Winkle.
Why? Because you slept together and when she was done with you she discarded you like last night’s chutney?
Yes.
Sometimes you have got to take one for the team.
Yeah. Sack up, dude.
Fine. Here I go, taking one for the team. In the sack. Hey Leslie.
Hi guys.
Leslie, I have a question for you, and it might be a little awkward, you know, given that I…
Hit that thang.
Leonard, there is no reason to feel uncomfortable just because we have seen each other’s faces and naked bodies contorted in the sweet agony of coitus.
There is not? Gee, cos it sure sounds like there should be.
Rest assured that any aspects of our sexual relationship regarding your preferences, your idiosyncrasies, your performance, are still protected by the inherent confidentiality of the bedroom.
That is all very comforting, but if it is okay, I’d like to get on with my question now.
Proceed.
We are entering the physics bowl and we need a fourth for our team.
No thanks, I am really busy with my like sign dilepton super symmetry search.
Dilepton, schmilepton, we need you.
Sorry.
Well, we tried. Just have to face Sheldon mano-e-mano-e-mano. A-mano.
Wait, you are going up against Sheldon Cooper?
Yes.
That arrogant, misogynistic East-Texas doorknob that told me I should abandon my work with high energy particles for laundry and child bearing?
She is in.
The Physics Bowl.
So, how do you feel? Nice and loose? Come to play? Got your game face on? Are you ready?
Oh, yeah. You know you do not have to stay for the whole thing.
Oh, no, no, I want to. It sounds really interesting.
Gentlemen.
Sheldon.
Sheldon.
Hee hee hee hee hee hee hee hee.
Sheldon. I am just going to sit down.
So, is that your team.

Actually, I do not need a team, I could easily defeat you single-handedly. But the rules require four, so may I introduce, the third floor janitor, he lady from the lunchroom, and, my Spanish is not good, either her son or her butcher. And what about your team? What rat have you recruited to the SS Sinking Ship?
Hello, Sheldon.
Leslie Winkle?
Yeah, Leslie Winkle. The answer to the question, who made Sheldon Cooper cry like a little girl?

Yes, well, I am polymerised tree sap and you are non-organic adhesive so, whatever verbal projectile you launch in my direction is reflected off of me, returns on its original trajectory, and adheres to you.
Oh, ouch.
Okay, if everyone could please take your seats.
Here’s your tee-shirt.
PMS? It is a couple of days early, but…
No, it stands for Perpetual Motion Squad.
Oh, right, of course, what was I thinking?
Good afternoon everyone, and welcome to this year’s physics bowl. Today’s preliminary match features two great teams… AA versus PMS.
All night long, y’all!
Okay, well let’s jump right in, first question, for ten points. What is the isospan singlet partner of the Pi Zero Meson? PMS?
The Eta Meson.
Correct.
Formal protest.
On what grounds?
The Velcro on my wrist brace caught on my shirt.
Denied. Alright, for ten points, what is the lightest element on earth with no stable isotope. AA?
And of course, the answer is Technetium.
Terrific. Next question, what is the force between two uncharged plates due to quantum vacuum fluctuation. PMS?
Sheldon can suck on, the Casimir Effect.
Correct.
How does a quantum computer factor large numbers. PMS?
Shor’s Algorithm.
Correct.
4.1855 times ten to the seventh ergs per calorie.
Prevost’s theory of exchanges.
Lamda equals one over Pi R squared N
760 degrees celsius, the approximate temperature of the young lady in the front row.
Mr Wolowitz, this is your second warning.
A sigma particle.
Yes, assuming the hypothetical planet has a mass greater than the earth.

Correct. Ladies and gentlemen, I hold in my hand the final question. The score now stands AA 1150, PMS 1175. So, for one hundred points, and the match, please turn your attention to the formula on the screens. Solve the equation.
Holy crap.
What the hell is that.
It looks like something they found on the ship at Roswell.
Come on, think, Leslie.
Leonard, it is not going to work if you rush me, you have to let me get there.
You are never going to let that go, are you?
Ten seconds. PMS.
Sorry, I panicked.
Then guess.
Um, eight. Point four.
I am sorry, that is incorrect. AA, if you can answer correctly, the match is yours.
He does not have it. He is got squat.
AA, I need your answer.
The answer is minus eight by alpha.
Hang on, hang on a second, that is not our answer. What are you doing?
Answering question. Winning physics bowl.
How do you know anything about physics?
Here I am janitor, in former Soviet Union I am physicist. Leningrad Politechnica. Go Polar Bears.
Well that is a delightful little story, but our arrangement was that you sit here and not say anything, I answer the questions.
You did not answer question.
Hey look, now maybe you have democracy now in your beloved Russia, but on this physics bowl team I rule with an iron fist. . Ow!
AA, I need your official answer.
Well it is not what he said.
Then what is it?
I want a different question.
You cannot have a different question.
Formal protest.
Denied.
Informal protest.
Denied. I need your official answer.
No. I decline to provide one.
Well, that is too bad, because the answer your teammate gave was correct.
That is your opinion.
Alright, the winner of the match is…
Hang on. Sheldon, is proving that you are single-handedly smarter than everyone else so important that you would rather lose by yourself than win as part of a team.
I do not understand the question.
Go ahead.
The winner is PMS!
The apartment. Sheldon goes to sit in his spot.
Sorry, somebody’s sitting there.
Who?
My Physics Bowl Trophy!
That trophy is meaningless, I forfeited, therefore you did not win.
I know someone who would disagree.
Who?
My Physics Bowl Trophy! “Leonard is so smart, Sheldon who?”
Alright that is very immature.
You are right, I am sorry. I am not!
Okay, new contest.
What are you doing?
I am settling once and for all who is the smartest around here. Okay, are you ready?
Absolutely.
Bring it on.
Okay. Marsha, Jan and Cindy were the three daughters of what TV family? The Brady Bunch. Okay, Sammy Hagar replaced David Lee Roth as the lead singer in what group?
The Brady Bunch?
Van Halen. Alright, Madonna was married to this Ridgemont High alum. Oh my God, Sean Penn!
How do you know these things?
I go outside and I talk to people. Alright, here, what actor holds the record for being named people magazine’s sexiest man alive?
William Shatner.
Wait, I do not think it is Shatner.
Then it is got to be Patrick Stewart.
No.
Formal protest.
Alright, singer who sang “Oops I Did It Again.” Okay, Tweetie Bird, taught he taw a what?
Romulan.
Yes. He taught he taw a Romulan.
The apartment.
Well, this sandwich is an unmitigated disaster. I asked for turkey and roast beef with lettuce and swiss on wholewheat.
What did they give you?

Turkey and roast beef with swiss and lettuce on wholewheat. It is the right ingredients but in the wrong order. In a proper sandwich the cheese is adjacent to the bread to create a moisture barrier against the lettuce. They might as well have dragged this thing through a car wash.
I do not believe it.
I know, it is basic culinary science.
Some guy is auctioning off a miniature time machine prop from the original film and no-one is bidding on it.
A time machine from the movie The Time Machine?
No, a time machine from Sophie’s Choice.
Boy, Sophie could have used a time machine in that movie. Did you see it, it is rough.
Oh, that is cool.
Uh-huh.
It is only $800?
Yeah. And that is my bid.
You bid $800.
It was a spur of the moment thing, I figured it would go for thousands and I just wanted to be a part of it.
There is only 30 seconds left in the auction.
Do you have $800?
Not to blow on a miniature time machine.
Do not worry, the way these things work there is people waiting ‘til the last second to bid, and then they swoop in and get it, it is called sniping.
Fifteen seconds.
Come on, snipers.
Ten, nine, eight…
Where are your snipers?
Five.
Snipe.
Four.
Snipe.
Three.
Snipe!
Two.
SNIPE!
One.
Aaaa-aw!
Congratulations, you are the proud owner of a miniature time machine.
You lucky duck.
I wonder why no-one else bid, this is a classic piece of sci-fi movie memorabilia.
Yeah, I know, I still cannot afford it.
Why do not we share it? We will each put in two hundred bucks and we will take turns having it in our homes.
A time share time machine? I am in. Sheldon?
Need you ask? But I still do not understand why no-one else bid.
The lobby. The guys stand around a full sized time machine.
I understand why no-one else bid.
The same
Did the listing actually say miniature?
I just assumed. Who sells a full sized time machine for $800?
In a venn diagram, that would be an individual located within the intersection of the sets “no longer want my time machine” and “need $800”.
It is actually a tremendous bargain, even with shipping it works out to less than four dollars a pound.
Cocktain shrimp are $12.50.
How are we going to get it upstairs?
If we take the dish off it might fit in the elevator.
Yes but the elevator’s been broken for two years.
I have been meaning to ask you, do you think we should make a call about that?

Not necessary, I have a masters in engineering, I remotely repair satellites on a regular basis. I troubleshoot space shuttle payloads. When the Mars rover started pulling to the left I performed a front end alignment from 62 million miles away. No, that baby’s broken.
The stairwell, approaching the apartment door. Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the last part of the stairs.
Come on, guys, push.
If I push any harder I am going to give birth to my colon.
I cannot feel my fingers, hurry up.
It is the same amount of work no matter how fast you go, basic physics.
Sheldon?
Yeah.
If my fingers ever work again, I have got a job for the middle one.
Oh, hey guys.
Uh, hi Penny. Take a break, guys!
What are you doing?
Oh, just, you know, moving… something upstairs.
What is it?
It is… you know, time machine.
Yeah, okay, neat, but I really got to get to work, so….
Uh, just give us a few minutes.
I do not have a few minutes, I am running really late.
Then I have a simple solution, go up to the roof, hop over to the next building, there is a small gap, do not look down if you are subject to vertigo, and use their stairwell.
You are joking, right?
Oh, I never joke when it comes to vertigo.
Damn, okay, I will just take the roof.
Hey, if you wait for us to set up the time machine, I can drop you off at work yesterday. Time travel joke, it is not… never mind.
For what it is worth, I thought it was humorous.
Let’s just do this. Guys, ready to push?
In a minute. Howard stepped outside to throw up.
The living room. The time machine is set up.
I do not know what you were worried about. I think it really works in the room.
Yeah. It is by far the coolest thing I have ever owned.

The exact time machine that carried actor Rod Taylor from Victorian England into the post-apocalyptic future, which society had splintered into two factions, the sub-terranean Morlocks, who survived by feasting on the flesh of the gentle surface dwelling Eloy.
Talk about your chick magnets.

Oh yeah. The guy who lives next to me is always like, I have a Jacuzzi on my balcony, I have a Jacuzzi on my balcony. But wait until I tell him, I have got a time machine on my balcony. Stuff that in your speedos, Jacuzzi Bob!
Gentlemen, I know we said we’d take turns, but I think you’d agree that practicality dictates it remain here.
You cannot just keep it here, what if I meet a girl and say, “you wanna come up and see my time machine, it is at my friends house,” how lame is that?
He is got a point.

Alright, I think we are going to need some ground rules, in addition to the expected no shoes in the time machine and no eating in the time machine, I propose that we add pants must be worn at all times in the time machine.
Seconded.
I was going to put down a towel.
I still want it on my balcony. I say we move it on a bi-monthly basis.
That sounds fair.
Hold on. Bi-monthly is an ambiguous term, do you mean move it every other month, or twice a month?
Twice a month.
Then no.
Okay, every other month.
No.
Sheldon, you cannot be selfish, we all paid for it, so it belongs to all of us. Now out of the way so I can sit in my time machine. Okay, I am setting the dials for March 10, 1876.
Good choice, Alexander Graham Bell invents the telephone and calls out for Dr Watson.
Wait a minute, I’d want to see that too.
So, when it is your turn you can.
But if we all go back to the same point in time, Bell’s lab is going to get very crowded, he will know something’s up.
Also, since the time machine does not move in space, you will end up in 1876 Pasadena.
And even if you can make it to Boston, what are you going to do, knock on the door and say to Mrs Bell, “hey Mrs Bell, big fan of your husband, can I come in and watch him invent the telephone?”
Mrs Bell was deaf, she is not even going to hear you knock.
Oh, I have a solution, first go into the future and obtain a cloaking device.
Ooh, how far into the future?
If I remember correctly, Captain Kirk will steal a cloaking device from the Romulans on Stardate 5027.3, which will be January 10 2328 by pre-federation reckoning.
Okay, I am setting the dials for January 10, 2328. Here we go into the future. That was fun.
My turn.
Okay, first of all, what you call a gap was nearly three feet wide, I slipped and skinned my knee.
Are you okay?

Zzz-zz-zz-zz! Second of all, the door to the stairwell of the other building was locked, so I had to go down the fire escape which ends on the third floor, forcing me to crawl through the window of a lovely Armenian family, who insisted I stay for lunch.
That does not sound too bad.
It was eight courses of lamb, and they tried to fix me up with their son.
Sorry.
Not done. By the time I finally got to work, they’d given my shift away. Yeah, that is right, I have lost an entire day’s pay thanks to this… this…
Time machine.
The lights flash and the dish spins, you wanna try it?
No! I do not want to try it, my God, you are grown men, how could you waste your lives with these stupid toys and costumes and comic books and… and now that… that…
Again, time machine.
Oh please, it is not a time machine, if anything it looks like something Elton John would drive through the Everglades.
It only moves in time. It would be worse than useless in a swamp.
Pathetic. All of you, completely pathetic.
My turn!
Later that night, Leonard is sitting in the time machine, turning the lights on and off. Sheldon enters.
Leonard, it is two in the morning.
So?
So it is my turn. Why did you set it for the day before yesterday?
Because I want to go back and keep myself from getting a time machine.

You cannot. If you were to prevent yourself from buying it in the past, you would not have it available in the present to travel back and stop yourself from buying it, ergo you would still have it. This is a classic rookie time travel mistake.
Can I go back and prevent you from explaining that to me?
Same paradox. If you were to travel back in time and, say, knock me unconscious, you would not then have the conversation that irritated you, motivating you to go back and knock me unconscious.
What if I knocked you unconscious right now?
It will not change the past.
But it would make the present so much nicer.
Are you upset about something?
What was your first clue?
Well, it was a number of things. First the late hour, then your demeanour seems very low energy, plus your irritability…
Yes I am upset.
Oh! I do not usually pick up on those things. Good for me.
Yeah, good for you.
Oh, wait. Did you want to talk about what is bothering you?
I do not know. Maybe.
Wow, I am on fire tonight.
Uh, here’s the thing. Girls like Penny never end up with guys who own time machines.
I disagree. Your inability to successfully woo Penny long predates your acquisition of the time machine. That failure clearly stands on its own.
Thanks for pointing it out.

In addition, your premise is flawed. In the original film, Rod Taylor got Yvette Mimeaux with that very time machine. In Back to the Future, Marty McFly got the opportunity to hook up with his extremely attractive young mother.
Those are movies.
Well of course they are movies. Were you expecting me to come up with an example involving a real life time machine? That is absurd.
The stairwell. It is the previous day, and again Leonard and Sheldon are pulling the time machine up the stairs.
Come on, guys, push.
If I push any harder I am going to give birth to my colon.
Oh, hey guys.
Uh, hi Penny. Take a break, guys!
What are you doing?
Oh, just, you know, moving a… time machine.
Yeah, okay, neat, but I really got to get to work, so….
No problem.
But, what about your time machine.
Some things are more important than toys.
Oh, I am scared.
Do not worry baby, I have got you.
Oh, Leonard.
It is still my turn.
The living room.
What are you doing?
I am packing up all my collectibles and taking them down to the comic book store to sell.
Well is that really necessary. If you need money you can always sell blood. And semen.
It is not about money.
We brought food.
Lox and bagels, the breakfast of time travellers.
Terrific, does anyone want to buy my share of the time machine?
Why?
Because I do not want it any more.
Why?
Just… personal reasons.
My spidey-sense tells me this has something to do with Penny.
Look, do you want to buy me out or not?
I will give you a hundred dollars, which will make me half owner, and we will put it on my balcony.
Screw his balcony, I will give you a hundred and twenty and we will put it in my garage.
I paid two hundred dollars for my share.
Dude, everyone knows a time machine loses half its value the minute you drive it off the lot.
I will go for two hundred, that time machine stays right where it is.
Three hundred, and I will throw in my original 1979 Mattel Millenium Falcon with real light speed sound effects.
No, no more toys or action figures or props or replicas or costumes or robots or Darth Vader voice changers, I am getting rid of all of it.
You cannot do that, look what you have created here, it is like nerdvana.
More importantly, you have a Darth Vader voice changer?
Not for long.
Oh, I call dibs on the Golden Age Flash.
Hang on, I need that to complete my Justice Society of America collection.
Too bad, I called dibs.
Well you cannot just call dibs.
I can and I did, look up dibs on Wikipedia.
Dibs does not apply in a bidding war.
It is not a bidding war, I am selling it all to Larry down at the comic book store.
Why Larry? Did Larry call dibs?
Will you forget dibs!
He offered me a fair price for the whole collection.
What is the number, I will match it.
I will match it, plus a thousand rupees.
What is the exchange rate.
None of your business. Take it or leave it.
Mom, my bar-mizvah bonds, how much do I got? Thanks. I can go twenty six hundred dollars and two trees in Israel.
Forget it guys, if I sell to one of you, the other two are going to be really mad at me.
Who cares, as long as you pick me.
Okay, Leonard, put down the box, let’s talk.
Sorry Raj, my mind is made up.
No. I cannot let you do this.
Sheldon, get out of my way.
None shall pass.

Okay. I did not want to do this but, I have here the rare mint condition production error Star Trek: The Next Generation Geordi LaForge, without his visor in the original packaging. If you do not get out of my way, I will open it.
Okay man, be cool, we are all friends here.
What the hell’s going on?
You hypocrite!
What?

Little Miss “grown ups do not play with toys”. If I were to go into that apartment right now, would I find Beanie Babies? Are you not an accumulator of Care Bears and My Little Ponies? And who is that Japanese feline I see frolicking on your shorts? Hello,Hello Kitty!
Okay, okay look, if this is about yesterday, Leonard, I am really sorry about what I said, I was just a bit upset.
No, I needed to hear it.
No you did not. Look, you are a great guy, and it is things you love that make you who you are.
I guess that makes me large breasts.
Still, I think it is time for me to get rid of this stuff and… you know… move on with my life.
Really?
Yeah.
Oh. Wow. Good for you.
Thanks. Hey, do you want to, I do not know, later…

Character: Good looking man coming up stairs
Replica: Excuse me. Hey, Penny!
Hi Mike.
Are you ready to go.
Yeah, I just have to change.
I will give you a hand.
Oh, stop it! Bye guys.
My turn on the time machine.
A jungle. As the camera moves, the time machine becomes visible. Sheldon is sitting in it The disk stops spinning, and he looks around. The dials read APR 28 802,701.
It worked. It really worked. They said I was mad, but it worked.
Sheldon, are you okay?
We have to get rid of the time machine.
It is a little big for the living room, is not it?
Yeah, that is the problem, it is too big.
I am glad you agree. I hired some guys to help us move it, come on in fellas.
Oh no, Morlocks? Eat him, eat him. Aaaaargh. Leonard!!!!!!!!
A corridor at the University.
On the other hand, some physicists are concerned that if the super collider actually works, it will create a black hole and swallow up the Earth ending life as we know it.
Psh, what a bunch of crybabies. No guts, no glory man.
Hey, check it out, the school of pharmacology is looking for volunteers.
We are testing a new medication for social anxiety, panic attacks, agoraphobia and obsessive compulsive disorder. Why would they be looking for test subjects here?
I do not know, Raj. Maybe the comic book store does not have a bulletin board. What is going on?
Shhh! Hot girl in Sheldon’s office.
Sheldon’s office? Is she lost?
Do not think so. I followed her here from the parking lot.
Maybe she is his lawyer.
Well she is free to examine my briefs.
Howard…
I know, I am disgusting, I should be punished. By her, oh look, I did it again.
Well, that should do it.
Thank you for coming by. Hello.
Oh, hey buddy.
Buddy.
Sorry I am late, I am working on a project that may take me up on the next space shuttle.
How can you be late, I was not expecting you at all.
Nobody ever expects me, sometimes you just look and… BAM! Howard Wolowitz.
Sheldon, are you going to introduce us?
Oh, alright, this is Missy, Missy this is Leonard and Rajesh and you have already met Howard.
It is nice to meet you.
You too, swell, also.
Yeah.
So, how do you two know each other.
Oh, he once spent nine months with my legs wrapped around his head.
Excuse me?
She is my twin sister, she thinks she is funny but frankly I have never been able to see it.
It is because you have no measurable sense of humour, Shelly.
How exactly would one measure a sense of humour? A humourmometer?
Well, I think you are delightfully droll. Or as the French say, Tres Drole.
Okay, so let me see if I got this. Leonard, Howard and… I am sorry what was your name again.
Rajesh.
The same.
So Missy, what brings you all the way from Texas?
Was it perhaps destiny, I think it was destiny.
My friend’s getting married in Disneyland tomorrow night.
Destiny, thy name is Anaheim.
And I had to drop off some papers for Shelly to sign for my dad’s estate.
The papers could have been mailed, Mom just sent you here to spy on me, did not she.
I guess that is why they call you a genius.
They call me a genius because I am a genius. Tell Mom that I currently weigh 165 pounds, and that I am having regular bowel movements. Enjoy the wedding, goodbye.
Woah, woah.
If the wedding’s not until tomorrow, why do not you stay with us tonight?
Oh, I do not think so. Shelly does not like company. Even as a little boy he’d send his imaginary friends home at the end of the day.
They were not friends, they were imaginary colleagues.
Look, you are here, we have plenty of room.
No we do not.
Come on, Shelly, she is family.
So what? I do not issue invitations to your mother.
Well it would be nice not to have to drive out to Anaheim in rush hour.
And do not ever call me Shelly.
So it is settled. You will stay with us.
I will walk you to your car. You are in structure 3 level C, right?
What just happened?
The apartment.
So anyway, we are eight years old, and Sheldon converts my easy-bake oven to some kind of high-powered furnace.
Hee-hee, just classic.
I needed a place to fire ceramic semi-conductor substrates for home-made integrated circuits.
He was trying to build some kind of armed robot to keep me out of his room.
Made necessary by her insistence on going into my room.
Anyway, I go to make those little corn muffins they give you, there is a big flash, next thing you know my eyebrows are gone.
Ha-ha, not your eyebrows?
Yep. I had to go through the entire second grade with crooked eyebrows my Mom drew on.
Is that what that was? I just assumed that the second grade curriculum had rendered you quizzical.
Hey, Leonard, you left your underwear in the dryer downstairs.
Those are not mine.
Really, they have your little name label in them.

Yeah, no, I do, I use those… uh… just to polish up my… spear-fishing equipment. I spear fish. When I am not crossbow hunting, I spear fish. Uh, Penny, this is Sheldon’s twin sister, Missy. Missy, this is our neighbour Penny.
Hi.
Wow, you do not look that much alike.
Can I get a hallelujah.
Fraternal twins come from two separate eggs, they are no more alike than any other siblings.
Hallelujah.
Hey, guess what. I have been accepted as a test subject for a new miracle drug to overcome pathological shyness.
Hey, good for you, Raj.
Yes, I am very hopeful. Hello Missy. They mentioned there may be side effects.
The same, later.
So, Missy. Have you ever met a man from the exotic subcontinent of India?
Well, there is Dr Patel at our church.
Ah yes, Dr Patel, good man.
Do you like motorcycles, ‘cos I ride a hog.
A hog? You have a two cylinder scooter with a basket on the front.
You still have to wear a helmet.
Have you ever heard of the Kama Sutra?
The sex book?
The Indian sex book. In other words if you wonder wonder who wrote the book of love, it was us.
Hey, Sheldon’s sister’s pretty cute, I w….
I was not staring!
I did not say you were, I just said she was cute.
Oh. Huh, um, maybe, if you like women who are tall… and perfect.
Sheldon, why are you ignoring your sister?
I am not ignoring my sister. I am ignoring all of you.
I brought snacks.
Oh my! Gherkins and….
Onion dip, it is onion dip.
Oh.
We do not entertain much.
Missy, do you enjoy pajamas?
I guess.
We Indians invented them. You are welcome.
Yeah, well my people invented circumcision. You are welcome!
Missy, I am going to go get my nails done. Do you want to come?
God yes. Thanks.
You are welcome.
Bye guys.
Bye Missy.
Bye Missy, see you.
Goodbye Leonard!
Uh, yeah, no, uh, bye Penny.
Okay, you two have to back off.
Why should I back off, you back off dude.
Excuse me, this is my apartment and she is my roommate’s sister.
So what, you have already got Penny.
How do I have Penny? In what universe do I have Penny?
So I can have Penny?
Hell, no!
Excuse me, can I interject something. I am ordering pizza online, is everyone okay with pepperoni?
Sheldon, can I talk to you in private?
I guess. Do not worry, I was going to order you cheeseless.
Thank you.
That is okay. Lactose intolerance is nothing to be embarrassed about.
I am a fancy Indian man, we invented pajamas!
Hey, look at me, I do not have a foreskin.
Sheldon’s bedroom.
Sheldon, are you aware that your sister is an incredibly attractive woman?

Hmmm? She certainly has the symmetry and low body fat that western culture deems desirable. It is noteworth that at other points in history, heavier women were the standard for beauty because their girth suggested affluence.
That is fascinating, but I…
I did not say it was fascinating, I said it was noteworthy.
Alright, noted. But my point is that Koothrappali and Wolowitz… they are hitting on your sister.
Oh. Okay. You know, I do not want to criticise your rhetorical style but, we’d be a lot further along in this conversation if you’d begun with that thought.
That is great, but I….
What I am saying is that we took quite an unnecessary detour from what I now understand to be your thesis.
Whatever. You have to do something about it.
Why?
Because she is your sister.
I do not understand. Yes, we shared a uterus for nine months, but since then we have pretty much gone our own separate ways.
Okay, uh…. oh, consider this. With your father gone, it is your responsibility to make sure that Missy chooses a suitable mate.
I had not considered that. We do share DNA.
Uh-huh.
So there is the possibility, however remote, that resting in her loins is the potential for another individual as remarkable as myself.
Exactly. And, you owe it to yourself and to posterity to protect the genetic integrity of your sister’s future offspring.
You are right. If someone wants to get at Missy’s fallopian tubes, they will have to go through me.
The living room. Raj and Howard are on the floor, fighting.
I am Shiva the destroyer, I will have the woman!
