The last thing I would ever call you is a geek.
Ha. Well, that is what I am, queen of the nerds.
Well, if you like, I could show you the lab we are working in. We have got some cool toys, you know, lasers and stuff.
You know, I have always wanted to see a big science lab.
Since when?
Since always.
Leonard, are you okay here?
Uh, yeah. I guess.
How ’bout we go see it now? Maybe afterwards we take the bike up the coast, we grab a little bite to eat…
Um,yeah, yeah, that sounds great, let me just get my jacket.
Boy, she will do, huh?
Yeah, if you like that type.
So, you and her?
No, just neighbours.
Really. I do not know how you live next door to that without doing something about it.
Actually, science is my lady.
Okay. Let’s go.
All right. See you tomorrow, Leonard.
See ya. ‘Bye, Penny. Have fun.
Yes? Did you forget your key?
A gift shop.
I do not see anything in here a woman would want.
You are kidding. You have got lotions and bath oils and soaps, that is the estrogen hat trick.
What it is is a cacophonous assault of eucalyptus, bayberry, cinnamon and vanilla. It is as if my head were trapped in the pyjamas of a sultan.
Sheldon, if you do not like this stuff, let’s just go next door and build her a bear.
I told you before, bears are terrifying.
Come on, bath stuff, it is perfect! You got a scented candle, a cleansing buff, spearmint and green tea scented bath oil, promotes relaxation.
That presupposes Penny is tense.
She knows you. She is tense. We all are. Buy a basket!
Excuse me, we are ready.
No, we are not. Let’s say for a moment that I accept the bath item gift hypothesis, I now lay the following conundrum at your feet, which size?
This one. Let’s go.
You put no thought into that.
I am sorry. Uh, this one. Let’s go!
I have insufficient data to proceed. Excuse me, miss?
Yes?
If I were to give you this gift basket, based on that action alone and no other data, infer and describe the hypothetical relationship that exists between us.
Excuse me?
Here. Now, are we friends? Colleagues? Lovers? Are you my grandmother?
I do not understand what you are talking about and you are making me a little uncomfortable.
See? Sounds just like you and Penny. We will take it.
The university cafeteria.
Hey, Leonard. Come, join us.
Oh, hey, Dave. And Penny, what a surprise.
Hey, Leonard. Dave was just showing me around the university. You know, this place is unbelievable!
Yeah, I know. I have been offering to show you around for a year and a half. You always said you had yoga.
I never said that.
Maybe I heard you wrong. A lot of words sound like yoga.
This is an amazing woman, Leonard. She has a curious and agile mind, not to mention being curious and agile in other respects.
Oh, shut up!
Yes, please shut up. So, um, Dave, do not you think you and I should get back to the lab? You know, that dark matter is not going to detect itself.
Actually, I was thinking about taking the afternoon off so I could work on another experiment with Penny.
Really? We are going to do an experiment?
Uh-huh. We are going to explore the effects of tequila shots on a gorgeous 22-year-old woman.
It is not an experiment! You saw what happened last night.
You ready to go?
Yeah. Oh, can I drive the motorcycle?
Yeah, why not? You cannot do any worse than Leonard.
That is funny. By the way, my leg is killing me. Thanks for asking.
The apartment.
Mmm, great news, Leonard, I have solved my Penny gift dilemma.
Yippee.
You see, the danger was that I might under or over-reciprocate, but I have devised a foolproof plan. See, I will open her gift to me first and then excuse myself, feigning digestive distress.
Brilliant.
It is, is not it? Is it okay if I hide them in your room? The smell makes me nauseated.
Do whatever you want.
Thank you, that is very gracious. Gentlemen.
Why could not you have just done what Leonard did and get Penny a new boyfriend?
My leg is killing me. Thanks for asking.
Penny’s apartment.

Okay, I have just one question for you. While I am perfectly happy with the way things are between us, you said that you did not want to go out with me because I was too smart for you! Well, news flash, lady, David Underhill is ten times smarter than me! You’d have to drive a railroad spike into his brain for me to beat him at checkers! Next to him, I am like one of those sign-language gorillas who knows how to ask for grapes! So, my question is, what is up with that?
Why are you yelling at me?
Sorry, I am sorry, I am sorry! Never mind, we are cool.
Dave is not smarter than you. He is an idiot.
Really? Why would you say that?
Because a smart guy takes the nude photos of his wife off his cell phone before he tries to take nude photos of his girlfriend.
He tried to take nude photos of you?
That is what you took from that? The guy is married!
Oh, yeah. I am so… oh, that is terrible.
And you, if you are so okay with the way things are between us, why are you so jealous?
Well, uh, the important thing is he is married and that is terrible!
Nice save, genius. Eggnog?
Lactose.
It is just rum. It stopped being eggnog like half an hour ago.
Smooth.
Smoother than you.
Come on, it is Christmas, just give me this one.
Okay, Merry Christmas.
By the way, my leg is killing me. Thanks for asking.
The apartment. Leonard opens the door to Penny.
Merry Christmas.
Merry Christmas.
How’s your leg?
Very good, thanks for asking. Come on in.
Ah, good, Penny, you are here to exchange gifts. You will be pleased to know I am prepared for whatever you have to offer.
Okay, here.
I should note I am having some digestive distress, so, if I excuse myself abruptly, do not be alarmed. Oh, a napkin.
Turn it over.
To Sheldon, live long and prosper. Leonard Nimoy.
Yeah, he came into the restaurant. Sorry the napkin’s dirty. He wiped his mouth with it.
I possess the DNA of Leonard Nimoy?!
Well, yeah, yeah, I guess. But look, he signed it.
Do you realize what this means? All I need is a healthy ovum and I can grow my own Leonard Nimoy!
Okay, all I am giving you is the napkin, Sheldon.
Be right back.
Here. Open it.
Oh, a gift certificate for motorcycle lessons. Very thoughtful.
Yeah, and I checked. Not letting the bike fall on you while standing still is lesson one.
Oh, then, I think you will appreciate what I got you.
Okay. 101 Totally Cool Science Experiments for Kids.
You know, ’cause you are so into science.
Sheldon! What did you do?!
I know! It is not enough, is it? Here.
Leonard, look! Sheldon’s hugging me.
It is a Saturnalia miracle.
The apartment.
All right, that is the last servo. Behold the Mobile Omnidirectional Neutralization and Termination Eradicator. Or…
MONTE.

Featuring one articulated razor-sharp killing saw, one polycarbonate grinding and flipping wheel, steel armour plate exoskeleton top and bottom, and enough horsepower to drive a 110 pounds of mechanized death from zero to holy crap in 4.8 seconds.
Is it wrong to say I love our killer robot?
As with my father, I both love and fear it.
All right, enough chitchat, let’s destroy something.
One, two, three, go.
Okay. What shall be first to taste the wrath of Monte?
Maybe we should start small.
Okay. Ooh, perhaps today is the day we finally find out what is inside the Magic Eight Ball.
Did it when I was four. It is an icosahedral dye floating in tinted blue water.
Man, call spoiler alert before you say things like that.
How about the toaster oven?
What did the toaster oven ever do to you?
What did I ever do to Jimmy Mullins in the third grade? He still punched me in the face with my own fists. Sorry, you little nerd, you were just in the wrong boys’ room at the wrong time.
Gentlemen, goggles.
Yeah, this is an auspicious moment. Yeah, like Robert Oppenheimer or Neil Armstrong, we need the appropriate words to mark this historic scientific event.
How about “Die, toaster, die”?
That will do it.
All right, what is next?
The stairwell.
No, I think I am just going to stay in tonight and do laundry.
Outside in stairwell
Oh yeah, they still got the full Monte.
Leonard?
Uh-huh?
What the hell?
Killer robot. We built it.
Yeah, well, it almost killed me.
If it wanted to kill you, you’d be dead.
So, who exactly does it want to kill?
I am sorry, are you unaware of the upcoming Southern California Robot Fighting League Round Robin Invitational?
You know, since I moved last year, not all my mail has been forwarded.
It is a big deal. There is an awards banquet and a dance afterward. Perhaps you’d like to come with me. I know the other fellas would be really excited to see a girl there.
How is it supposed to be a dance if I am the only girl?
Well, that may be a slight exaggeration. You’d be the only doable girl.
You are a pig, Howard.
How is doable anything but a compliment?
Howard, why do not we just work on the robot?
Please, Leonard, not now. Once again, Penny and I have begun our little tango.
Our tango?
The carnal repartee, the erotic to and fro. But as delicious as the appetizer might be, at some point we will have to succumb and eat the entree while it is still… hot.
I am begging you, stop talking.
Look, normally I can just ignore you. I mean, I get it, you are a little peculiar. You know, like Sheldon.
Yeah, excuse me, Penny, but in this room, you are the one who’s peculiar.
Yeah, you might be right. But back to you. I know you think you are some sort of smooth-talking ladies’ man, but the truth is, you are just pathetic and creepy.
Um, so what are you saying?

I am saying it is not a compliment to call me doable. It is not sexy to stare at my ass and say, “Ooh, it must be jelly ’cause jam do not shake like that.” And most important, we are not dancing a tango, we are not to’ing and fro’ing. Nothing is ever going to happen between us. Ever.
Wait a minute. This is not flirting, you are serious.
Flirting? You think I am flirting with you? I am not flirting with you, no woman is ever gonna flirt with you, you are just gonna grow old and die alone.
Thanks for the heads up.
Howard, where you going?
I am going home to live my creepy, pathetic life.
Wow.
Well, someone had to say it. What?
He said maybe we should enter you in the killer robot competition.
Howard’s bedroom.
Howard, the phone is ringing!
Here’s a crazy idea, Ma, answer it!
Hello? All right, hold on. It is your friend, Leonard! He wants to know why you are not at school today!
I do not go to school, Ma. I work at a university.
That is a school! Now pick up the phone!
I do not want to talk to anybody.
Should I ask Leonard to bring over your homework?!
I do not have homework. I am a grown man with a master’s degree in engineering!
Excuse me, Mr. Fancy-Pants. Want me to get you a Popsicle?
Cherry, please!
I ate the cherry. All that is left is green.
You make me want to kill myself.
The university cafeteria. Other end of the phone call.
What is going on?
I do not know, now they are just yelling about Popsicles. Sounds like Penny really got to him.

I am not surprised. Despite his hard and crusty shell, Howard is a very sensitive man. Do you know he writes poetry? Mostly about men from Nantucket and hermits named Dave, but he does it with real sensitivity.
Hey, Hofstadter. Word around the pwasma wab is you built a wobot?
Yes, we did, Kripke.
His name is Monte.

Well, if you have any dewusions about entewing him against my wobot, the Kwipke Kwippler in the Southern California Wobot Fighting League Wound Wobin Invitational, aka the S.C.aw.F.L.aw.aw.I., his name is gonna be Swrap Metal.
Come on, is that really necessary?

Leonard, I believe it is. This is trash talk, and trash talk is a traditional component in all sporting events. Kripke, your robot is inferior and it will be defeated by ours because ours exceeds yours in both design and execution. Also, I am given to understand that your mother is overweight.
Oh, snap.
Now, of course, if that is the result of a glandular condition and not sloth and gluttony, I withdraw that comment.
What difference does it make? Fat is fat.
There are boundaries.
Tell you what, forget the S.C.aw.F.L.aw.aw.I., let’s settle this woboto a woboto.
What do you mean?
There is no guawantee we have gotta go against each other in the Wound Wobin, so let’s thwow down. You know, unless you are afwaid.
We accept your challenge. Name a time and place.
Tomowow, thwee o’clock, the kinetics wab.
Make it so.
No, do not make it so. Barry, we cannot fight you tomorrow, our engineer is incapacitated.
What is wrong with him?
He is depressed because he is pathetic and creepy and he cannot get girls.
We are all pathetic and cweepy and cannot get girls, that is why we fight wobots. If you are not there, you will be exposed to widicule.
I am curious, what part of America is that accent from?
Outside Penny’s door.
Hey.
Hey, you got a minute?
Yeah, come on in. What is up?
I need you to apologize to How…
Get out.
Come on. Wolowitz will not come out of his house and we need him for a robot battle.
Well, then have the robot go and get him.
The robot did not hurt his feelings.
His feelings needed to be hurt.
He is been in bed for two days.
Yeah, probably with a blow-up doll.
He is not with a… does it really matter who or what he is with? The guy is devastated.
Oh, please, how could I possibly devastate Howard?
Okay, do not take this as a criticism, but you kind of have that overexposed-to-gamma-rays thing going on.
What does that mean?
You know, like, most of the time, you are the easygoing Bruce Banner, but then, when you get angry, you kind of turn into, like, you know, grrrrr!
I turn into a bear?
Seriously? Gamma rays? Bruce Banner? You did not get The Incredible Hulk from that? Never mind, just, please go talk to him.
And say what? That I did not mean it, because I meant it.
Well, maybe you can go at it from a different angle, like, um, you see a glimmer of goodness in him and you only said what you said because you want to nurture it and make it shine.
Oh, pthththth.

Okay, let’s try it this way. Remember the day that we first met and you asked me to go to your boyfriend’s apartment to get your TV back and he was nine feet tall and he took my pants off and you said… what was that? What did you say? Oh, yes, you said you owed me one.
Okay, come on, that is not fair.
I came home with no pants.
Fine, I will go over there tomorrow.
Thank you. I should probably give you a heads up about his mother.
What about her?
She is a delightful woman. You will love her.
Howard’s bedroom.
Howard, there is a blonde girl, Patsy, here to see you!
Who?
Okay, now she is saying it is Penny.
I do not want to talk to her.
Hey.
Ma!
She ran past me. Was I supposed to tackle her?
So, I just came by to see how you were doing.
I am fine.
Good. Your mom seems nice.
People move away from her on the bus. What do you want?
Okay, look. Howard, I just want to apologize for some things that I have said. About you. I have been informed that you have feelings. And apparently, I have hurt them. So, I am sorry. Howard.
Fine, you are sorry. Good-bye.
So, you are okay?
Hey, I am a big boy. I am not traumatized by some random comment from some random woman. I mean, get over yourself.
Okay. Well, bye.
The apartment. The guys are watching footage on a laptop screen.
Oh, my God. That is Kripke’s robot?
As you can see, the Kwippler is weducing the Chevy Cavawier to wubble.
I cannot watch anymore.
Sheldon, we have to call it off.
We do not have that option, we have accepted the challenge. We cannot run away from a fight.
Oh, please, we have spent our whole lives running away from fights. Personally, I can squeeze through a hole in a fence half my size.
Impressive as that may be, Monte is not us. Monte has no fear.
Sheldon, did we all not just watch the same video? Kripke’s robot just had angry sex with a mid-sized automobile.
You are overlooking the fact that we now know what we are up against and we can modify Monte so that he is prepared.
You want to prepare him? Install a bladder and a pair of shorts so he can wet himself.
Excuse me, but how are we going to make any modifications without Wolowitz? Have you heard from Penny yet?
Not yet.
Have faith, gentlemen. We do not need Wolowitz, engineering is merely the slow younger brother of physics. Watch and learn. Do either of you know how to open the toolbox?
Howard’s bedroom.

And then, when I was 14, I met Marcy Grossman. She was so beautiful. She just got her braces off but they left a little of the overbite. It was so hot, like a sexy little chipmunk. I did not have the courage to ask her out, but I dedicated a song to her at the ninth grade talent show.
Aw, that sounds sweet.
Marcy Grossman is sunshine, on a cloudy day, when it is cold outside, Marcy Grossman is the month of May…
Oh, it is cute.
I guess you’d say, what can make me feel this way, Marcy Grossman, Marcy Grossman, Marcy Grossman, Talkin’ ’bout Marcy…
That is great.
Grossman.
Oh, it is fun.
And then she came up with that sexy little chipmunk mouth and spit in my hair. Which brings us to tenth grade.
Howard, do you think maybe sometimes you try too hard?
Look at me. What chance do I have if I do not try too hard?
Well, you’d have a terrific chance. I mean, you are smart, you are funny, you have a cool job. You build stuff that goes into outer space.
I guess.
Look, I am telling you, I have known you for, like, a year and a half and this is the first time I feel like I am talking to a real person. And you know what? I like him, he is a nice guy.
You really think so?
Yes.
I do not know.
I do.
The lab.
Nice little bot you have got here.
I am aware.
What is this do, spin?
Yep. At 3400 RPM. It can cut through steel like it was wubber.
Neat. Good work. Sheldon, we have got to call this off.
No, Leonard. For years, merciless thugs like Kripke have made my life a series of painful noogies and humiliating wedgies and the insensitively named Indian burns. That stops now.
But, Sheldon, we do not have a chance. The only improvement you were able to make on the robot was to put fresh batteries in the remote.
What you fail to realize is Kripke suffers from a fatal flaw, overconfidence from his robot’s massive size and its overwhelming power.
That is not overconfidence, that is observation.
Trust me, Kripke will fall easy prey to my psychological warfare. Observe. Kripke! I would ask if your robot is prepared to meet its maker, but as you are its maker, clearly the two of you have met.
What is his pwoblem?
Way to bust out the Jedi mind tricks, dude.
I just want to make sure that we are all clear, standard robotic fighting league rules apply.
Are you cwazy? This is a stweet fight, the stweet has no rules.
He is right, Leonard. The paradigm is to the death.
I will, however, give you the opportunity to concede my supewiowity now and offer me your wobot as the spoils of war.
Never. I’d rather see Monte dead than in your hands.
That could be easily awanged. Weady, set, go?
Do it.
Alwight then. Weady. Set. Go.
Come on, Sheldon, you got this.
Indeed. We are prepared for anything he can throw at us. That is new.
Run, Monte, run!
Go, Monte! Go Monte!
Go, go, go, go!
Do not hurt us, do not hurt us,
The apartment. Monte is in pieces on the table.
Well, so much for making up for the emotional wounds of childhood.
I did this. Monte was killed by my hubris and my pride. No matter what anybody says, this is my fault.
No one’s arguing with you, dude.
I got your text. How bad is… Oy.
Forget the robot. What happened to you?
He slipped and fell.
Yes, I slipped and fell. In the bathroom. Bounced right off the tub.
Yes, now he knows what bathtubs are capable of doing when you do not treat them with respect.
Yeah. They sucker punch you when your eyes are closed.
So what do you think, Howard? It is not that bad, right?
Oh, no. A little electrical tape, some solder. Are you insane? I have seen space probes that crashed into the desert that were in better shape than this.
You are right. Monte’s gone. We will bury him in the morning. A simple ceremony. I will speak. Leonard, you will play your cello.
Sheldon, honey, are not you getting a little carried away? I mean, it is just a toy robot.
Just a toy robot?
Penny.
I know, I got it. Sheldon, I am sorry.
Well, do not get the wrong idea. The way I see it, I am halfway to pity sex.
The university cafeteria
Mmm, gentlemen, I put it to you, the worst tapioca pudding is better than the best pudding of any other flavour.
First off, that is axiomatically wrong, because the best pudding is chocolate. Secondly, the organic structure of tapioca makes it a jiggling bowl of potential death. It is extracted from the plant…
Hey, I am thinking of growing a mustache.
Ah, no kidding! A Fu Man Chu? A handlebar pencil?
It is extracted from the plant…
I am not sure yet. You know, George Clooney has one now!
Really? I once saw him shopping at Ralph’s. He was buying tequila.
Oh, you’d think a guy like that would have some kind of booze lackey.
Alright this is cruel, we better let him finish before his head explodes.
Alright Sheldon, why is tapioca…
Tapioca is extracted from the root of the plant Manihot Esculenta. Due to a high concentration of cyanide it is poisonous in its raw form and lethal if prepared improperly.
Feel better now?
It is also indigenous to Brazil, as is the Cocoa Bean, from which we get chocolate, the best pudding. And you promised you would not do that anymore!
Hey Hofstadter!
Hey Kripke.
Heard about your watest pwoton decay expewiment, twenty thousand data wuns and no statistically significant wesults. Vewy impwessive!
What a jerk.
Do not feel bad Leonard, negative results are still results.
Even twenty thousand of ’em.
Alright, please do not cheer me up anymore.
C’mon, do not let him get to you. It is Kripke.
Yeah, he is a ginormous knob.
That is why he eats by himself, instead of sitting here at the cool table.
Fo’ shizzle.

Hey it is true, Kripke lacks the basic social skills that we take for granted, but he also controls the new open science grid computer that I need to use to run some simulations of structure formation in the early universe.
Good luck getting time on it. The only people he lets use it are his friends.
Well then, the solution is simple. I shall befriend him. Kripke!
Yeah?
What’d you say of the idea of you and I becoming friends?
I would say, I have no intewest in becoming your fwiend.
Really? That seems rather short sighted, coming from someone who is generally considered altogether unlikable. Why do not you take some time to reconsider?
Yeah, I will do that.
Well I think we are off to a terrific start.
The apartment.
There you go. Now any e-mail from Wolowitz will go right into your spam folder.
Thanks! I mean the e-mail does not bother me as much as the vacation pictures of him in a bathing suit.
Yeah, I got the same one. And that is not a bathing suit, it is a tan line.

Hello. This is Sheldon Cooper. I am leaving a message for Barry Kripke. Barry, It was pleasant seeing you today in the cafeteria. I saw that you purchased the chef’s salad. Apparently, you did not know that the chef’s salad is kitchen trickery, to utilize scrap meat. Nevertheless, I hope you enjoyed it. I am following up on our pending friendship, and I look forward to hearing from you regarding its status. Sheldon Cooper.
What is up with Ichabod?
Oh he is trying to make a new friend.
Oh really? Well, good for him.
Well, unless he is makes one out of wood like Gepetto, I do not think it is gonna happen.
Well, how did you guys become friends?
There was a flier on the bulletin board at the university. Roommate wanted. Whistlers need not apply.
And you moved in anyway?
I assumed he was joking. You’d be surprised how many particle physicists have a whimsical side.
Well, what about Howard and Raj, I mean how did you become friends with them?
I do not know, how do carbon atoms form a benzene ring? Proximity and valence electrons.
Well yeah, sure. When you put it that way. But it all worked out, right?
I suppose. I do miss whistling though.
Oh come on, really?
First warning.
Outside Penny’s door.
Penny Penny.This is for you.
Hello Sheldon.
Hi.
What is this?
It is a questionnaire I devised. I am having some difficulty bonding with a colleague at work, so I am doing a little research to better understand why my current friends like me.
Yes. Well, that is a good question. But is this really the best way to figure it out?
Yeah, I agree, the social sciences are largely hokum. But, short of putting electrodes in your brain and monitoring your response to my companionship, this is the best I can do.
Okay, question 1. Rank the following aspects of Sheldon Cooper in order of appeal. Intelligence. Ruthless attention to hygiene. Playfulness. Java applet writing?

I know, I may have started off with a fairly obvious one. You did an aspect of my most appealing trait, playfulness. Why do not you just go ahead and write that number 1. I am afraid you are on your own for the rest. It should take you no more than 3 hours.
Wait! How many questions are on this thing?
Only 211. Do not worry, in deference to you, I have kept them on a high school graduate reading level.
Thanks pal.
You got it, buddy.
Sheldon honey, did you ever consider making friends by being, I do not know, pleasant?
Well that is certainly a thought-provoking hypothesis. May I suggest it as the topic for your essay.
The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
Your questionnaire, very disappointing.
I answered every question Sheldon.
You answered the multiple choice questions in a pattern. A B B A C. A B B A C.
Aw, you picked up on that huh?
How could I not?
Come on! There is over 200 questions. And look at some of these things. Sheldon is to camaraderie, as the space shuttle is to blank?

There are a number of acceptable answers, for example, C: near earth transport, but certainly not B: avocado rancher. And your essay, suggesting that I’d have better luck making friends if I wait ’til the Cylons take over? Please.
Hold on. I put some real work into that!
Yes, well it is better than what Wolowitz did. He drew a raccoon with what appears to be, a distended scrotum.
It is kinda cute, until you get to the scrotum.
What hope do I have for establishing new relationships given that my current friends apparently cannot take a few hours out of their lives to help me?
Sheldon, I am not going to defend a big-balled raccoon.
I do not see how you could.
What I am trying to say is that, maybe you cannot approach this as a purely intellectual exercise.
What do you mean!?
Well, remember when you tried to learn how to swim using the internet?
I did learn how to swim.
On the floor.
The skills are transferrable. I just have no interest in going in the water.
Then why learn how to swim?

The ice caps are melting Leonard. In the future, swimming is not going to be optional. But you do bring up an interesting point. I do not have to break new ground here, I am sure much of the research already exists.
No! no, my point is, if you want to learn how to make friends, then just go out to a coffee shop or a museum. Meet people. Talk to them. Take an interest in their lives.
That is insane on the face of it. Come on.
Where are we going?
You are driving me to the mall. I am going to acquire a book that summarizes the current theories in the field of friendmaking.
Why do not you just lie down on the floor and swim there?
A bookshop.
Coping with the death of a loved one. My condolences.
Thank you.
Family or friend?
Family.
Too bad. If it’d been a friend, I am available to fill the void. It is just as well, she smelled like moth balls.
Okay, if you are gonna start sniffing people, I am gonna go get a hot pretzel.
Excuse me. Do you have any books about making friends?
Um, yeah but they are all for little kids.
I assume the skills can be extrapolated and transferred.
Uh, I guess. They are right over there by the wooden train set.
Oh! I love trains!
I bet you do.

Oh my! That is awfully sticky. Alright, let’s see. Bernie Bunny has Two Daddies Now. It is probably about homosexual rabbits. Jerry the Gerbil and the Bullies on the Bus. Read it, not helpful. Oh! Here we go. Stu the Cockatoo is New at the Zoo. Author Sarah Carpenter lives in Fort Wayne, Indiana, with her husband and best friend Mark, and their cockatoos too. Hardly makes her an expert in making friends, would not you agree?
I do not like birds, they scare me.
Me too! Most people do not see it. What are you reading?
Curious George.
Oh I do like monkeys!
Curious George is a monkey.
Somewhat anthropomorphized but yes. Say, maybe sometime you and I can go see monkeys together. Would you like that?
Okay.
Sheldon, what are you doing?
I am making friends with this little girl. What is your name?
Rebecca.
Hi Rebecca, I am your new friend, Sheldon.
No you are not, let’s go.
We were really hitting it off.
Do not look up, there is cameras.
The stairwell.
I am curious. In the “How Well Do You Know Sheldon” section, what do you put for his favourite amino acid?
Lysine.
Damn it. I had Lysine and changed it.
Oh good! You are just in time. I believe I have isolated the algorithm for making friends.
Sheldon, there is no algorithm for making friends!
Hear him out. If he is really on to something, we can open a booth at Comic-Con, make a fortune.
See, my initial approach to Kripke, had the same deficiencies as those that plagued Stu the Cockatoo, when he was new at the zoo.
Stu the cockatoo?
Yes, he is new at the zoo.
It is a terrific book. I have distilled its essence into a simple flowchart that would guide me through the process.
Have you thought about putting him in a crate while you are out of the apartment?

Hello, Kripke. Yes, Sheldon Cooper here. It occurred to me you had not returned any of my calls because I had not offered any concrete suggestions for pursuing our friendship. Perhaps the two of us might share a meal together… I see. Well then perhaps you’d have time for a hot beverage. Popular choices include tea, coffee, cocoa… I see. No, no, no, wait. Do not hang up yet. What about a recreational activity? I bet we share some common interests. Tell me an interest of yours. Really? On actual horses? Tell me another interest of yours. Oh no, I am sorry, I have no desire to get in the water until I absolutely have to. Tell me another interest of yours.
Uh-oh, he is stuck in an infinite loop.
I can fix it.

Mmhmm. Mmhmm. It is interesting. But is not ventriloquism, by definition, a solo activity? Yeah? Tell me another interest of yours. Hmmm. Is there any chance you like monkeys? What is wrong with you? Everybody likes monkeys. Hang on, Kripke. A loop counter? And an escape to the least objectionable activity! Howard, that is brilliant! I am surprised you saw that.
Gee. Why cannot Sheldon make friends?

Alright Kripke, that last interest strikes me as the least objectionable and I would like to propose that we do that together. Tomorrow. Yes, I will pay. Alright, goodbye. Alright! Time to learn rock climbing.
Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
You know, I am a fan of ventriloquism. Maybe you, me and your dummy could go get a hot beverage. He could talk while you drink.
Nope, I wanna climb some wocks.
This appears significantly more monolithic than it did on my laptop. No, one expects to see Hominids learning to use bones as weapeons.
You afwaid of heights, Cooper?
Hardly. Fear of heights is illogical. Fear of falling, on the other hand, is prudent and evolutionary. What would you say is the minimum altitude I need to achieve to cement our new-found friendship?
Come on, they have birthday parties here. Wittle kids climb this.
Little kid Hominids, perhaps. Is this your entire job? Your parents must be so proud.
Let’s go, Cooper.
Coming, Kripke. Okay. Harness seems to be secure. Small amount of incontinence just now, but the website said that is to be expected. Hey, this is not so bad. A bit like vertical swimming.
Hey, look at you, Cooper. You are almost halfway to the top.
I am? I was wrong. It IS a fear of heights.
You alwight there, Cooper?
Not really. I feel somewhat like an inverse tangent function that is approaching an asymptote.
Are you saying you are stuck?
What part of an inverse tangent function approaching an asymptote did you not understand?
Understood all that. I am not a mowon. Just keep going.
Yeah, I do not think I can.
Well, then. Cwimb back down.
No, that does not seem any more likely.
So what is the pwan, Cooper?
Well, it is not exactly a plan but I think I am going to pass out.
The apartment.
I am sorry. Can we please just do it one more time?
It is a little thing but you really do miss it.
Hello, everyone. I brought my new friend, Barry Kripke, home for dinner.
Oh…
Hewo to you, too.
How was rock climbing?
He passed out. Just hung there like a big sawami.
D-d-d! That is where I sit.
Ooh, you have a special spot. What kind of wacko are you?
How much time you got?
Want some Chinese food?
Tewific. Got any dental fwoss?
In the bathroom.
Be right back. I gotta fwoss the Indian food out of my teeth if I am gonna eat Chinese.
Sheldon, are you okay?
Oh yes, I pass out all the time. But, it was worth it. I have made substantial progress in bonding with Kripke, which brings me to an awkward moment.
What is that?
Maintaining five friendships promises to be a Herculean task. So, I am going to have to let one of you go.
Me, me. Let it be me.
Leonard, you are my roommate, my source of transportation and you help me fold my sheets when they come out of the dryer. You are safe.
Can I whistle?
Do not be silly. Howard, you do not have a PhD, your cologne is an assault on the senses and you are not available for video games during the Jewish high holidays.
Guilty as charged. I am out.
No. You, too, are safe.
Oh come on. What do I have to do?
Okay. You know what? I see where this is going. I am not one of you guys. I am not a scientist. So just…

Penny, Penny, Penny. Everything you are saying is true, but please allow me to continue. Raj, you are out. The good question, while you do provide a certain cultural diversity to an otherwise homogenous group, your responses to the questionnaire were truly disturbing. How could you, for a moment, think that my favourite amino acid is Glutamine?
He had Lysine but changed it.
Yeah. Shoulda, woulda coulda, Raj.
I like to fwoss before I eat, so my gum pockets are open for new food.
Eww.
Hewo. How did I walk past you? I am Bawy.
Penny.
Yeah, it is not a vewy hot name. I am gonna call your Woxanne. Ooh, pot stickers.
Suddenly I am looking pretty good, huh?
So uh, Kripke, I was wondering if there is any chance you could get me some time on the open science grid computer.
No.
No? But we are friends!
I am sowy. No, my fwiend?
I am confused. I was given an understanding that you allow your friends time on the machine?
No, that is wong. There is an official schedule. I have no contwol over it.
Oh. This entire endeavour seems to have been an exercise in futility. Raj, you are back in. He likes monkeys.
The climbing centre.
You gotta give him credit for sticking with it.
I did not think he had it in him.
He almost made it to the top this time.
The apartment. The guys are studying a complex chart on the whiteboard.
Hmmm.
The problem appears to be unsolvable.
Maybe you could run some computer simulations.
There are too many variables. It would take forever.
We have got to be missing something. Let’s start again. The movie is playing here at 7:20, here at 7:40, here at 8:10 and here at 8:45.
Right, these theatres have to be eliminated.
Why? They are state-of-the-art digital projection, 20-channel surround sound.
Yes, but they have no Icee machines. Despite my aggressive letter-writing campaign, I might add.
What about the multiplex here? The seats are terrific.
They have Twizzlers instead of Red Vines. No amount of lumbar support can compensate for that.
Well, it is gonna take at least an hour to eat, and I do not see a Sheldon-approved restaurant proximate to a Sheldon-approved theatre.
We could eat after the movie.
Unacceptable, the delay would result in tomorrow morning’s bowel movement occurring at work.
Hang on, hang on. There is a 7-Eleven here. We smuggle Slurpies, which are essentially Icees, in under our coats, after having a pleasant meal either here, here or here.
Wow. I do not see how we missed that.
Excuse me, in what universe are Slurpies Icees?
That is how we missed it.
Sheldon, would you be prepared, on a non-precedential basis, to create an emergency ad-hoc Slurpie-Icee equivalency?
Oh, Leonard, you know I cannot do that.
Okay, I guess we only have one option.
Yep, I do not see any way around it.
Bye, Sheldon.
See ya.
Later, dude.
They are right, it was the only option.
The hallway. Sheldon is opening the apartment door. Penny comes running up stairs.
Ooh, ooh, shut the door, shut the door.
Why?
Just do it! Get inside and shut the door.
Well, you did not specify.
Is Leonard around?
He went to the movies without me. It was the only option. I am sorry, I do not understand which social situation this is. Could you give me some guidance as to how to proceed?
The building manager’s showing an apartment downstairs, and I have not paid my rent.
Oh, I see. Penny, I am not sure I am comfortable harbouring a fugitive from the 2311 North Los Robles Corporation.
It is no big deal. I am just a little behind on my bills because they cut back my hours at the restaurant and my car broke down.
If you recall, I pointed out the “check engine” light to you several months ago.
Well the “check engine” light is fine. It is still blinking away. It is the stupid engine that stopped working. It cost me like twelve hundred dollars to fix it.
You know, it occurs to me you could solve all your problems by obtaining more money.
Yes, it occurs to me, too.
Hang on a moment. Here. Take some. Pay me back when you can.
Wow, you got a lot of money in there.
That is why it is guarded by snakes. Take some.
Do not be silly.
I am never silly. Here.
No, I cannot.
Do not you need money?
Well, yeah, but…
This is money I am not using.
But what if you need it?

My expenses account for 46.9% of my after-tax income. The rest is divvied up between a small savings account, this deceptive container of peanut brittle and the hollowed-out buttocks of a superhero action figure who shall remain nameless for his own protection. Or her own protection. Take some.
Really? I mean, are you sure?
I see no large upcoming expenditures unless they develop an affordable technology to fuse my skeleton with adamantium like Wolverine.
Are they working on that?
I sincerely hope so.
Okay. Well, thank you. Oh, God, no, I cannot. Sheldon honey, I do not want things to be weird between us.
Will not it also be weird if I have to say hello to you every morning on my way to work and you are living in a refrigerator box and washing your hair with rain water?
I will pay you back as soon as I can.
Of course you will. It is impossible to pay me back sooner than you can. Assuming you subscribe to a linear understanding of time and causality.
I am regretting this already.
Entering the lobby of the building.
You know, I have given the matter some thought, and I think I’d be willing to be a house pet to a race of super-intelligent aliens.
Interesting.
Ask me why.
Do I have to?
Of course. That is how you move a conversation forward.
Why?
The learning opportunities would be abundant. Additionally, I like having my belly scratched.
Hey, Penny. How was work?
Great. I hope I am a waitress at the Cheesecake Factory for my whole life.
Was that sarcasm?
No.
Was that sarcasm?
Yes.
Was that sarca..
Stop it!
Penny, you appear to have a package here.
Oh, thanks. This must be the beret I ordered. A couple of months ago. It was back-ordered.
Did you know the beret is an example of piece of women’s fashion adapted from male military uniforms? Another fascinating example is the epaulet.
He is not lying, he does find that fascinating.
Okay, whatever. It is not like I am running up and down the streets just buying myself berets. I bought one, like, a month ago, and it was back-ordered, look, it finally arrived, all right?
All right.
Oh, my God, would you just get off my case?
Weird.
Oh, good, that was an unusual interaction. I was not sure.
Did you guys have an argument?
No.
Well, you clearly did something to aggravate her.
I am at a loss. If you like, you can review my daily log of social interactions and see if there is a blunder I overlooked.
The apartment.
Here you go. Oh, you owe me another two dollars. The price of mu-shu pork went up.
It is getting tougher and tougher to be a bad Jew.
Here you go, Penny. Shrimp with lobster sauce.
Thank you, Leonard. What is my share?
Do not worry about it. It is my treat.
No, really, how much?
It is, whatever. Ten, eleven dollars.
Well, which is it, ten or eleven?
Fourteen fifty, but it is no biggie, you will get the next one.
What?
He was just wondering if he wore skintight jeans and a tank top if he’d get his shrimp lo mein for free.
What are you saying? That I am using my body to get dinner? That I am some kind of Chinese food prostitute?
Yeah, Raj, what are you saying?
‘Cause let me tell you something, buddy, I pay my own way in this world, okay? I do not rely on anybody! What was that about?
He has a nervous bladder when he is stressed out. Kind of like a puppy.
Here, Leonard, ten, eleven, twelve, uh, fourteen dollars.
It was fourteen fifty, but it is okay.
Oh, good. Dinner’s here.
Yes, dinner’s here, and I am having some. I am having takeout food.
Okay.
You are damn right it is okay. I have been having leftovers at the restaurant for like four days, and I wanted something different. So sue me.
Forgive me, Penny, but that would be the very definition of a frivolous lawsuit.
Sheldon, look, I will pay you back as soon as I can. You just have to give me more time.
Oh, wait, you lent her money?
She needed money. You seem under pressure. Did I not lend you a sufficient amount? Because I can give you more.
Oh, you know, you would just love that, would not you? Yeah. You would just love to open up your little snake can and throw some money at the girl who cannot pay her bills.
Where are you going?
Going home, where I will not be interrogated like a criminal. I forgot my fortune cookie.
In case either of you have larceny in your heart, you should know that I have moved my money out of the snake can.
But if you are ever short, there is always a couple of fifties in Green Lantern’s ass.
Penny’s apartment.
Hey.
Hey.
A little mood lighting, huh?
Yeah. When I did not pay my bill, the Department of Water and Power thought I would enjoy the ambience.
Yeah, they are very considerate that way.
I used Sheldon’s money to pay my rent, then I had like fourteen dollars left over.
Fourteen dollars, huh?
Put it back in your pocket, or I will find some other place to put it.

Back in the pocket it goes. Look, you do understand that Sheldon really does not care when he gets the money back. It is actually one of the few idiosyncrasies that does not make you want to, you know, kill him.
Yeah, well, that is not really my big problem.
So you are a little behind on your bills. Everybody gets behind on their bills.
Yeah, I know, it is just, this was not the plan, it was not supposed to go this way.
Well, what was the plan?
Um, waitress for six months and then become a movie star.
Was there a plan B?
TV star.

It is probably not as bad as you think. Let’s take a look. Maybe we can find some corners to cut. Oh, here’s something, if you do not have electricity, then you probably do not need cable. Just a suggestion. 170 dollars for acting classes?
Oh, no, I cannot give up my acting classes. I am a professional actress.
You have had an acting job where you got paid?
That is not the definition of professional.
Actually, it kind of… let’s keep looking. Whoa, what is eighteen hundred dollars to the Los Angeles County Superior Court?
Oh, that is nothing.
Nothing? It sounds like you got caught speeding going 4,000 miles an hour.
Well, remember Kurt?
Your ex-boyfriend?
Yeah. He got arrested for taking a whiz on a cop car.
What?
He was drunk.
I would hope so.
Anyway, he had a bunch of outstanding tickets and a bench warrant, so I, you know, I paid his fines.
Did he pay you back?
No, but he will.
And that is based on the inherent credit-worthiness of people who get drunk and urinate on police vehicles?
Leonard, I am not gonna call up Kurt and ask him for money.
Well what are you gonna do?
I do not know, but I may have to find a cheaper place to live.
Oh, no. Oh, you do not want to do that.
Why not?

Well, moving is a big deal. You have to go to the supermarket and get boxes, and if they are not clean, then your books smell like melons, and it is just, like… Why do not you just get a roommate and stay here?
Well, do you know anybody?
Well, I am sure the guy living with Sheldon would not mind moving in with you.
Oh, Leonard, honey, if we started living together, I would not be able to keep my hands off you.
Really?
And you thought my acting lessons were a waste of money.
The apartment.
Ugh. This mu-shu pork’s burning a hole through my duodenum.
Leviticus 11:3: “Only that which parteth the hoof and cheweth the cud among the beasts shall ye eat.”
Hey, do I mock you with the Bhagavad-Gita every time you scarf down a Whopper?
Hey, what is going on?
We are on a quest through the Valley of Fire to acquire the sacred crown.
You want the Valley of Fire? It is right here.
Hey, you guys want to go on a real live quest?
Outside? I just made cocoa.
– Come on. It will be fun.
What is it?
Do you guys remember Penny’s ex-boyfriend Kurt? Yeah, that is him. It turns out he owes Penny a lot of money, and I am gonna go get it from him.
Ooh, double sixes.
Really? You are just gonna let me go by myself?
Oh, cool, I got a sword.
I could use some help.
Here.
You guys are unbelievable, you play a game to simulate adventure, but when there is real adventure out there in the real world, you just wimp out.
Leonard, do you not recall the last time we visited this gentleman, we returned home without pants?
I do.
Are you sure? Because your proposal suggests that you do not.
I am not afraid of him.

All right. Leonard fairly calls the question, who is in favour of abandoning our game and confronting Penny’s steroid-infused ex-boyfriend in a suicidal mission to extract money from him? Say hi to Kurt for us.
Excuse me. When Frodo left the Shire to take the one ring to Mordor, did not Samwise, Pippin and Merry go with him?
They did.
Well?
They had a terrible time of it, Leonard.
Plus, no one stole their pants.
Fine. Just enjoy your little game. I will make this quest on my own.
Leonard, wait. Take a jacket, it is spritzing a little.
You guys suck. Come on, please? He is so big.
Outside Kurt’s door.
Okay, is everyone clear on the plan?
Yes. Koothrappali’s going to wet himself, I am gonna throw up, Sheldon’s gonna run away, and you are going to die. Shall we synchronize our watches?
Guys, there are four of us and one of him.
Which means his triumph will be even larger. Minstrels will write songs about him.
Okay, how about this? I will do the talking, you just stand behind me and try to look formidable.
I should have peed before we left.
Yeah?
Hi, Kurt.
Lenny, right?
I do not really go by Lenny, but that is okay. Um, you remember Sheldon, Howard and Raj.
No. What do you want?
You do not remember me? How could he not remember me?
Sheldon, not now.
I remember him.
Okay, here it is. Penny’s in kind of a financial jam, and the money that you owe her would go a long way to solving her problems.
And she sent you to get it from me?
No, no, she is too proud to ask for the money. I, on the other hand, feel you should honour your debt.
You do?
Feel is a kind of a… it is a strong word. Um, I just think it would be a nice gesture on your part.
She will get it when she gets it.
Well, there you go. Problem solved.
A successful quest. Now let’s go find a gas station with a clean bathroom.
No, the problem is not solved. He just blew us off.
I have got it. He did not remember me because the last time we met I was in a Halloween costume.
Come on, Leonard, let’s go
No. You can leave if you want to. I am gonna see this through.
Okay.
I guess, technically, that was my fault. I am not leaving here without Penny’s money.
What happened to your backup?
I do not need backup. I have right on my side. And I am wearing cargo shorts under my pants.
Leonard’s car.
Congratulations. You may not have succeeded in getting cash, but you did secure a formal acknowledgment of the debt.
Maybe we should have your head notarized.
If anybody cares, I still have to pee.
Outside the apartment. Penny knocks.
Hey.
Hey, is Sheldon here?
Yeah. Hang on. Sheldon!
Nice hat.
It is kind of a fashionable look these days.
Maybe if you are working on a tuna boat.
Hello, Penny.
Sheldon, here is your money. Thank you very much. It helped a lot.
Sarcasm?
No.
Darn. I cannot seem to get the hang of that.
Hey, I know it is none of my business, but where did the money come from?
Well, I cut back my expenses like you said and picked up a few more hours at the restaurant, but the biggest thing was, out of the blue, Kurt shows up and gives me the money he owes me.
Really? Did he say why?
Yes, he said he was feeling guilty and wanted to do what was right.
That is it? Did he give any reason as to why he came to this moral epiphany?
Nope. I just think he is really changed. We are having dinner tomorrow night, and I get to wear my new beret. Bye, guys.
Bye.
Well done, Leonard. The true hero does not seek adulation, he fights for right and justice simply because it is his nature.
Penny’s hooking up with her jerk of an ex-boyfriend and I have indelible ink on my forehead!
That is your badge of honour, your warrior’s wound, if you will. I was wrong, minstrels will write songs about you.
Great.
There once was a brave lad named Leonard, with a fi-fi-fiddle-dee-dee. He faced a fearsome giant, while Raj just wanted to pee.

The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
Fellas, please.
Penny, come on, we were just finding our sound.
You found it. It is the sound of a cat being run over by a lawn mower.
I am really very busy. Is there any way that we can put this off until I have more time to prepare? Of course. But, uh, you understand my trepidation.
What is that about?
Not a clue.
Cannot we just postpone it till the spring? Maybe next summer?

This should be fairly easy to deduce. He is holding the phone to his left ear. Ears do not cross hemispheres, so he is using the analytical rather than the emotional side of the brain, suggesting that he has no personal relationship with the caller.
No, I did not realize it had been so long. Sure, I guess there is no other choice but to just go ahead and do it.
He is referring to an activity he has done before. It is unpleasant and needs to be repeated. This suggests some sort of invasive medical test, like perhaps a colonoscopy.
Are not there any other options? There is not a lot of room, it is gonna be uncomfortable.
Yes, yes. Yeah, I am definitely going with colonoscopy.
Okay, bye. My mother’s coming to visit.
How about that, you were right.
The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
It is out of order.
Yes, I can read the sign, I am just pondering the implications.
I think it implies that the elevator does not work.

Again, I can read the sign. But the sign and the tape are covered with a layer of dust, which indicates that the elevator has been non-functional for a significant amount of time. Which suggests either a remarkable passivity among the, I assume, 24 to 36 residents of this building based on the number of mailboxes and given typical urban population density or a shared delusion of functionality.
You must be Leonard’s mother.
Oh, I do not know if I must be, but yes.
Uh, I am Penny. I am his neighbour.
Oh, Dr. Beverley Hofstadter.
Oh, nice to meet you.
Oh, you are a hand shaker. Interesting.
Uh, why do not you come with me. I will walk you to the apartment.
Oh, all right. Would you like to exchange pleasantries on the way?
Yeah, sure, I guess.
All right, you start.
Okay. You know, I have always been curious. What was Leonard like when he was little?
Oh, I think you mean young. He is always been little.
Right, okay. What was he like when he was young?
You will have to be more specific.
Oh, um, okay, like, five or six. Five.

Oh, well, at that age he was well enmeshed in what Freud would call the phallic stage of psychosexual development. An outmoded theory, of course, but the boy did spend most of his waking hours with a tight grasp on his penis.
Yeah, Leonard mentioned you were a psychiatrist.
Well, that is one of my degrees. My primary field is neuroscience.
Oh, well, I am an actress.
Why?
What do you mean why?
Well, there are studies that suggest that many who go into the performing arts suffer from an external locus of identity.
Yeah, I do not know what that means.
Well, it means you value yourself only as others value you, which is often the result of unmet childhood emotional needs.
Oh, well, I had a wonderful childhood.
Tell me about it.
I know my dad wanted a boy. I just, I tried being good at sports, but I hated getting dirty!
And then, I am assuming, you entered adolescence.
Uh-huh, he called me Slugger until I got my first training bra, and then he just stopped playing catch with me. I was not Slugger anymore. Your mother’s here!
If you want to have intercourse with that girl, find out what kind of cologne her father wore.
Good to see you, Mother.
The apartment.
Here’s your tea, Mother.
Oolong?
Yes.
Loose, not bagged?
Yes.
Steeped three minutes?
Yes.
Two-percent milk?
Yes.
Warmed separately?
Yes.
One teaspoon sugar?
Yes.
Raw sugar?
Yes.
It is cold.
I will start again.
I have the same problem with him. My theory is that his lack of focus stems from an over-developed sex drive.
Oh, I do not know where he would have gotten that. Aside from a pro forma consummation of our marriage, his father and I only had intercourse for the purposes of reproduction.
That seems a fairly efficient arrangement.
Yes, we think so. We have both done papers on it. Mine from the neuroscientific point of view and his from an anthropological. Mine, of course, was the only one worth reading.
Of course. I would very much like to read about your sex life.
Well, it is all online or you can order it from the Princeton University Press.
Here’s your tea, Mother. So, what are you guys talking about?
The frequency with which your parents had intercourse.
Swell. If you are lucky, maybe she will show you the PowerPoint presentation.
I am sorry, it is on my other laptop.
Aw…
So, Mother, what is new?
You will have to be more specific.
All right. Uh, what is new with you?
Oh, well, I have been having some fascinating menopausal symptoms recently.
Maybe something less personal.
Oh. Your Uncle Floyd died.
Oh, my God. What happened?
His heart stopped beating. I have to urinate.
What a remarkable woman.
Yeah I, I thought you guys might hit it off.
I envy you your childhood.
I hate to tell you, but the only warm memories I have of my childhood are of my Uncle Floyd.
You are clearly misremembering. Your mother is brilliant, analytical, insightful, and I am betting she never hit you with a Bible because you would not eat your Brussels sprouts.
Sheldon, you do not give your mother enough credit. She is warm, she is loving, she does not glue electrodes to your head to measure your brain waves while potty training.
You were lucky. When I was a kid, if I wanted an EEG, I had to attach my own electrodes.
The university cafeteria.
So, Dr. Hofstadter, Leonard rarely talks about his incredibly successful brother and sister.
Please, do not go there, Howard.
I understand that unlike Leonard, they are at the top of their respective fields.
Boy, you suck.
Well, Leonard’s younger brother, Michael, is a tenured law professor at Harvard, and his sister just successfully grew a human pancreas in an adolescent gibbon.
So, she is close to curing diabetes?
Why else would you grow a pancreas in a teenaged gibbon?
Wow, you must be very proud.
Why? They are not my accomplishments. I have to urinate.
Why are you doing this?
You know the rules. You brought your mom to work, you must suffer.
Leonard, I had no idea your siblings were so much more successful than you.
Yeah, you are like the Jar Jar Binks of the Hofstadter family.
Oh, meesa think yousa lookin’ so so sad.
You know, rather than mock me, my friends might realize that this is difficult and try to help me through it.
Nope, I think mocking you is more fun.
Next time, do not yousa bring mama to work. Okee-day?
That was fast.
Oh, the middle stall was occupied. I will have to try again later.
It is totally understandable. In bladder voiding, as in real estate, it is location, location, location.
So, where were we?
Howard lives with his mother and Raj cannot speak to women unless he is drunk. Go.
That is fascinating. Selective mutism is quite rare. On the other hand, an adult Jewish male living with his mother is so common it borders on sociological cliché.
It is just temporary, I pay rent.
He lives in the same room where his bassinet was.

You know, both selective mutism and an inability to separate from one’s mother can stem from a pathological fear of women. It might explain why the two of you have created an ersatz homosexual marriage to satisfy your need for intimacy.
Say what? That is basically what I just said.
You brought your husband to work, you know the rules. Meesa thinking yousa looking pretty sad now too, betcha, betcha.
Leonard, it is one o’clock, were not you going to show me your laboratory at one o’clock?
There is no hurry, Mother, tell them more about their secret love for each other.
But it is one o’clock, you were going to show me your laboratory at one o’clock.
Her reasoning is unassailable. It is one o’clock.
Fine. Let’s go. I think you will find my work pretty interesting. I am attempting to replicate the dark matter signal found in sodium iodide crystals by the Italians.
So, no original research?
No.
Well, what is the point of my seeing it? I could just read the paper the Italians wrote.
Just for the record, we are not in an ersatz homosexual relationship.

Why is it always my responsibility?

I cannot believe you are bringing that up.
I did not bring it up. You did.
We will talk about this later.
You always say that, but we never do.
You went to the comic book store without me.7
Outside Penny’s door.
Hey.
You got alcohol?
Your mom still here?
Yep.
Come on in. Wait, wait, she is not gonna come here looking for you, is she?
Oh, relax. She took Sheldon to the hospital to get a brain scan.
Oh, my God. What happened?
Nothing. Mother likes looking at brains and Sheldon likes getting his brain scanned.
Geez, what a fun couple.
She is only been here a day and a half and I am seriously considering alcoholism as a new career path.
Hey, I talked to her for five minutes yesterday and I have been half bombed ever since.
You cannot let her get into your head.
My head, what about yours?
It is too late for me. My head is her summer house.
She was right, you know. The locus of my identity is totally exterior to me.
Oh, yeah, there she is. Hi, Mom.
I mean, do you know where I was all morning? Auditioning with 50 other blondes for some stupid antidepressant commercial. And for what? So I will finally get my daddy’s approval?
Did you get the part?
No, they said I was too perky.
Hey, you want to talk about not getting love from a parent. You know what I used to do when I was little to have some sensation of human contact?
Yeah, you grabbed your penis and would not let go. Your mother told me.
Of course she did. Anyway, that is not what I was gonna say. When I was ten years old, I built a hugging machine.
A hugging machine?
Yeah. I got a dressmaker’s mannequin, I stuffed it with an electric blanket so it would be warm, and built two radio-controlled arms that would hug me and pat my back.
Oh, that is so sad.
You know what the saddest part was?
What?
My father used to borrow it.
The stairwell.
Your scan data will be very elpful to my research. You have a remarkable brain.
I know. Although I have always hated how my right frontal lobe looks in pictures.
Common complaint among men. Nothing’s ever big enough, except when they get a tumour. Then you never hear the end of it.
I’d love to see a scan of your brain sometime.
Oh, I will send you a link, but its physiology is fairly unimpressive.
Oh, I cannot believe that.
Your unwillingness to accept empirical evidence suggests an attempt at flattery.

Understandable.
Can I make you a cup of tea?

I feel very comfortable around you.
I feel very comfortable around you, too.
It is surprising because I generally do not feel comfortable around, well, anyone.
Nor I.
What are the odds that two individuals as unique as ourselves would be connected by someone as comparatively workaday as your son?
Is that a rhetorical point or would you like to do the math?
I’d like to do the math.
I’d like that, too.
Penny’s apartment. Penny and Leonard are doing tequila shots.

The apartment.

You shush, I am happy, I want to talk about it. You know what my mother would say about this? She would say because you were not loved by your father and I was not loved by my mother, that having sex is our way of making up for the intimacy we did not get as children.

The paintball range.

I told you my mom has spider veins, I had to take her to the laser clinic.
And I told you I wanted to see a doctor’s note.

I forget. Which one is Hammer of the Gods?

No go. The Dumpsters are deep in Astronomy Department territory.

All right, what we need now is a tactical retreat. Did you see the episode of Stargate where they found themselves on a planet with a culture based loosely on Earth’s Athens and Sparta? Not important. Leonard, Raj and I are going to burst out the door and run away, Howard will cover us.
Why do not I run away and you cover me?
Because you chose your mother’s veins over victory. On three. One, two, three, go!
I had to take her! It is almost bathing suit weather!
Howard, I am on your team.

Where’s the rest of your squad?
Ah, they left me here to die. What about yours?
Dead, all of them.
Sorry.
Do not be. It was friendly fire. They just would not listen.
Well, we are surrounded, so I guess there is nothing for us to do but wait to be captured or killed.

All the while knowing that there is a paint pellet out there with your name on it.
Yeah, the big wet ball of death. Kind of makes you feel more alive, does not it?
It kind of does.
I say we make every moment count.
I agree. How exactly do we do that?
Howard, why are not you covering us? We are getting slaughtered out here!
War is hell.
The university cafeteria.

Unacceptable. It baffles me why they do not simply let some of you go so that there is money available for my research.

Based on your academic record, any number of things, I would imagine.
Hey, guys.
Hey, Leslie.
Hey.

You scratch my back, I scratch yours. Rawr.

Thank you.
The mrow, that sounded to me like an African civet cat.

In the paintball shed! Twice!

Court-martial, schmort-martial, Leslie Winkle is the fifth girl I have ever had sex with. I mean, for free.

And the rest of us have had our budgets cut to the bone.

Okay, one way to look at this is that I am getting new equipment, and you are not, and that is unfair. But a better way to look at this is that I am getting sex and you are not, and that is delightful.
The apartment. Leonard is looking at Penny’s laptop.

Sexy.

Satisfactory?

The paint ball range.

Okay. Now, we all run out. Sheldon and I will cut to the left behind these trees. Raj, Howard and Leslie flank to the right behind the rocks. Then we will all have a great view as Penny runs out and kills everyone else in sight.

But once you open the box, you have voided the warranty. The warranty is a sacred covenant we have entered into with the manufacturer. For taking daffodils to your unicorn.

I understand your envy. This is a cannot-miss symposium. There are going to be discussions on bioorganic cellular computer devices, the advancements in multi-threaded task completion, plus a roundtable on the nonequilibrium Green’s function approach to the photoionization process in atoms.
When I go, I usually just get hammered and ride the cable cars.
This conference is kind of a big thing. The keynote address is being delivered by George Smoot.
Oh, my God, the George Smoot?
You have heard of him?

George Smoot is a Nobel Prize-winning physicist, one of the great minds of our time. His work in black body form and anisotropy of the cosmic microwave background radiation cemented our understanding of the origin of the universe.
It is kind of a funny name, though, Smoot.
It is like talking to a chimp.
Okay, now that I have been completely insulted, have a good flight.

Oh, cool.

Do not say it like that, Leonard, say it like: we are taking the train!
Sheldon’s bedroom.
Hey, we are all going over to the Apple store to make fun of the guys at the Genius Bar. You want to come?
Oh, I always enjoy that, but I am a little busy.
What are you doing?

I am simplifying the task of packing for our trip. See, by attaching RFID tags to my clothing, it will enable my laptop to read and identify the items with this wand. I will then cross-reference them against destination, anticipated activity spectrum, weather conditions, duration of trip, et cetera.
Well, that does sound much simpler. How long is this going to take?
Assuming I can keep up this pace, three hours, 11 minutes, and plus however long it takes to conclude this fairly pointless conversation.

Socks, one pair, cotton, argyle, blue. Socks, one pair, cotton, argyle, blue.
On the train.

Gentlemen, this is the Coast Starlight, one of the great American trains operating on one of the classic American routes. On this side, you will see panoramic ocean vistas inaccessible to any other form of transportation, while on your side, you will be treated to 350 miles of CostCos, Jiffy Lubes, and cinderblock homes with above-ground pools.
Come on, Raj.
What is wrong with Jiffy Lubes?
No.
Why not?
That is over the wheelbase. Are you completely unfamiliar with the suspension characteristics of a pre-1980 Pullman-built Superliner Deluxe passenger coach?
Sheldon, we have been on this train 90 seconds, and you have already said a thousand words. Just tell us where to sit and shut up.
Here. I am hoping once you reap the endorphic rewards of the steady clickety-clack of steel wheels on polished rails, your sour disposition will abate.
Yeah, maybe. Meanwhile back in the 21st century, people are raising their tray tables and putting their seat-backs in an upright position ’cause it is time to land in San Francisco.
It is not so bad, really. At least these trains have modern plumbing. In India, you squat over a hole in the train and expose your naked buttocks to the chilly air of Rajasthan.
He is referring, of course, to third class on Indian Railways’ magnificent Ranakpur Express and its twelve hundred kilometer journey from Maharashtra to the Bikaner Junction.
Oh, look, now he is boring on an international scale.
Holy crap! Look!
Is that who I think it is?
It cannot be. What would Summer Glau be doing riding the train?
Maybe John Connor’s aboard and she is protecting him from an evil Terminator.
Unlikely. That is a television show, Leonard.

Of course, if SkyNet actually did exist in the future, a perfect way to infiltrate and destroy mankind would be to send Terminators back posing as actors who have played Terminators in popular films and television series, lulling us into a false sense of security, i.e., that is Summer Glau from The Sarah Connor Chronicles. No, Summer, do not kill me! I am pro-robot! Ahh!

Whee!
Sheldon, I owe you an apology. Taking the train was a stroke of brilliance! I have actually got a shot at a Terminator.
Oh, please.When it comes to Terminators, you have got a better shot of scoring with Arnold Schwarzenegger.

You are overlooking something. I have 11 hours with her in a confined space. Unless she is willing to jump off a moving train, tuck and roll down the side of a hill, she will eventually succumb to the acquired taste that is Howard Wolowitz.

Yes.

You know, I have already got a gorgeous blonde back home at I cannot score with. I think I will let you two take this one.
Sheldon, is there a place on this train to get alcohol?

and the upper level is a bar that offers wine tastings if you are going as far as Portland.

You forgot your flash drive, You forgot your flash drive

Okay, I have found the perfect solution. We get off the train at the next stop in Oxnard. We then take the 1:13 train back to Union Station. The year was 1995, the place, Jackson, Mississippi. Hey, at least I can talk to women without being drunk.
Excuse me, I have selective mutism, a recognized medical disorder. You are just a douche.
No. You know what? Maybe that is what this whole thing’s about. You are not mad at me, you are mad at yourself.
No, I am mad at you. I hate myself, but I am mad at you.
Fine. You are mad at me. I get it. Now, how about we go spend the day together? Just the two of us. We will go anywhere you want.
I do not know.
Come on. Let me take you someplace nice.
I… I do enjoy the La Brea Tar Pits.
Really, now? With the traffic and the parking, it is… okay, fine. The Tar Pits. Let’s go.
Oh, why cannot I stay mad at you?
Penny’s apartment. Everyone is watching football.
Go! Go! Go! Go-Go-Go-Go! Yes! Are you people watching this? Is this amazing or what?
Sweetie, that is a highlight from the ’98 championship game.
Oh. Did not know that.
How much beer have you had?
None, why?
Oh. I was just kind of hoping you were drunk. Now we are back live.
Okay, yeah. I can see the difference.
Oh, where’s the flag, that is intentional grounding.
Totally.

That completely was a forward pass, which they threw intentionally incomplete to avoid loss of yardage or to conserve time. I cannot believe they are not being penalized with the loss of a down and by having to move the line of scrimmage back to the spot of the foul.
Here, have some pizza, sweetie.
Penny, you know I am lactose intolerant.
I know. I just need you stop talking.
Penny.
Sheldon, come in.
Thank you. I’d like to make a sandwich, but I am out of bread.
There is some in the fridge.
You should not keep your bread in the refrigerator. Staleness is caused by crystallization of the starch molecules, which occurs faster at cool temperatures.
On Earth, we say thank you.
So Leonard, how goes the mimesis?
Mimesis?
You know. Mimesis. An action in which the mimic takes on the properties of a specific object or organism. Mimesis.
What the hell are you talking about?

I am attempting to communicate with you without my meaning becoming apparent to those around you. Let me try again. Have the indigenous fauna accepted you as one of their own? Nudge, nudge, wink, wink.
Oh, I guess so.
Good. Oh, FYI. After I eat my sandwich, I am taking Koothrappali’s Patang kite out for a test run. Would you like to get your delta-wing raptor and join me?
I do not want to fly kites, Sheldon. We are watching football here.
I can see that. I was providing you with an alternative. A courtesy I was never offered in similar circumstances.

Oh, look at that. The Oklahoma coach has thrown down a red flag indicating he is challenging the ruling on the field. I hope he is right, ’cause if he is not, it will cost him one of his three time-Outs.
You know, Leonard, honey, I would not mind if you wanted to go fly kites with Sheldon.
No, I will watch the end of the game. Besides, there is only three minutes left.
Until half time.
This is just half? We have been here for hours.
And you are gonna be here for a couple more.
Oh, you are kidding me.
No.
Nice meeting all of you.
So, yeah, anyway, that is my boyfriend. He is really smart.
The Le Brea Tar Pits.
I really like my saber-toothed cat. Thank you.
My pleasure. Maybe after lunch, we can go to Marie Callender’s and have some pie.
I’d like that. This is turning out to be a perfect Saturday.
Good. I am glad. Oh, man. Did you see the way she smiled at me?
Fine. Go ahead.
No. This is our day.
If you want to chase after her, chase after her.
Ah, who am I kidding? I would not have a shot with a girl like that.
Do not put yourself down. You are a very attractive man.
You think so?
Yeah. Absolutely. It would not kill you to take a Pilates class with me now and then, but you have a certain wiry appeal.
Yeah, well, it does not matter ‘cause she was not really smiling at me.
Actually, in this case, I think she was.
Really?
Yeah.
Bye.
What a douche.
The apartment.
Wow, Sheldon, I cannot believe you made up your own game.
Oh, Research Lab is more than a game. It is like the slogan says, the physics is theoretical, but the fun is real.
We must not be playing it right.
All right, five. One, two, three, four, five. Oh, wow, look at that, my Department of Defence research grant is renewed.
Oh! Great roll! Now you can demolish your Soviet-style cyclotron and build the large Hadron Collider.
Yay.
You are a natural at this, Penny. And as the first beta testers, you two will have quite the edge when we play with Wolowitz and Koothrappali on Sunday.
Oh, gee, Sheldon, I do not think we can play on Sunday.
Why not?
Because of the reasons that Penny will now tell you. Penny?
Actually, I have to pick up my friend Justin from the airport.
There you go, she has to pick up her friend Justin at the airport, aAnd I cannot play ’cause I am going with her, right?
Um, yeah, if you want. I mean, there may not be room. He is got a lot of stuff, like guitars and amplifiers.
Wait. What are you talking about?
My friend, Justin.
Pay attention, Leonard. That is why she cannot play on Sunday.
Who is this Justin?
Your turn, Leonard.
I told you about him.
No, you did not.
Roll the dice, Leonard.
Yeah, my friend from Omaha, plays the guitar. Anyway, he is coming to L.A. looking for some session work, so I told him he could just crash on my couch for a few weeks.
Come on, Leonard, if you roll a six, Penny dies horribly in a nuclear meltdown. See what I mean when I say the fun is real?
Hang on. Some guy is going to be sleeping on your couch?
He is not some guy. He is my friend.
So by friend, do you mean friend friend, gay friend, or ex boyfriend who you are now platonic with but still might have a thing for you friend”?
Well, he is definitely not gay.
Oh, a definitely not gay musician sleeping on my girlfriend’s couch. Yippee.
Okay, we went out a little bit, a long time ago, but we were never like going out.
Okay, not to be pedantic, but the last I checked went out was in fact the past tense of going out, which I think we all know is a popular euphemism for saw each other naked.
I will just roll for you.
Do you have a problem with Justin staying with me?
What was your first clue?
Uh-oh! Industrial accident.
You know what? Do not talk to me like I am an idiot.
I am not talking to you like you are an idiot! I am saying the whole idea is idiotic!
You accidentally stare at a helium-argon laser. Lose one turn and a retina.
How is that not talking to me like I am an idiot? It is my friend, it is my couch, and it is my freakin’ life!
It is also your roll.
You know what? It is your life. If you want to have some stupid guitarist stay on your couch, then fine. Why do not you just rent some bunk beds and invite The Black Eyed Peas?
Hey, if I want to invite the entire line up of Lollapalooza to sleep in my apartment, I will, and it is none of your business!
Are you listening to yourself? Do you know how childish you sound right now?
Oh, now I am a child? Well, at least I am not an idiot anymore!
The two are not mutually exclusive!
Oh, you are such a… What the hell is he doing?
He is drowning us out. He does not like fighting.
Sheldon, just stop, look, the fight is over. Oh, and FYI, you never even heard of The Black Eyed Peas until you met me!
I heard of ’em. Did not know they were a band. Sheldon, she is gone. You can turn off the blender.
Has your relationship reached its inevitable ugly end?
No, we just had a little spat.
Look on the bright side. As the result of Penny’s forfeit, you have become the world’s first winner of Research Lab. Would you like a commemorative snow cone?
Leonard’s car.
I do not get how she can just announce that an old boyfriend is going to be sleeping on her couch.
Hey, I thought of a game we can play in the car.
I do not want to play a game, Sheldon.

It is called Scientists. Now, I will name three scientists, then you will put them in order of the size of their contribution to their respective fields. To make this game even more compelling, you must consider only the contribution of the man to the field, not the validity of the field itself. For example, Abu Musa Jabir ibn Hayn made a greater contribution to the discredited field of alchemy than Halbert Vanderplatt made to neurobiology. Okay, ready to have some fun?
An old boyfriend who’s definitely not gay. That is what a guy likes to hear, definitely.
All right, I will start with an easy one, um, Isaac Newton, Madame Curie and Niels Bohr.
And then I say one little thing and I end up being the bad guy!
Hint, Madame Curie had her husband to help her.

What am I supposed to say? Sure, Penny, I am cool with your old boyfriend sleeping in your apartment. Well, Leonard, it does not matter if you are cool or not because I am Penny and I am pretty and I can do whatever the hell I want! Oh, I get it! You think you are doing me a favour just by being in a relationship with me! No, no, Leonard! I am doing you a favour just by being in the same room as you!
Leonard! Stop the car!
What?
I cannot listen to the two of you fight anymore.
Leaving the apartment.
Come on, come on, we are late.
Calm down, we will make the movie.

I believe my alarm is appropriate, given the situation. The movie starts in 17 minutes, which means we will need to make all the lights on Colorado Boulevard, plus skip the concession stand, and preshow urination.
Oh, dude, I wish you had said something before I pounded that last Red Bull.
Go, go, Power Rangers, go!
Hey.
Hey. We are, uh, going to the movies.
No, we are not. We are standing in the hallway, suffering through an awkward encounter.
Hang on. They are showing a new digital print of Time Bandits, you would not want to come, would you?
Not really, no.
All right, invitation pointlessly offered, invitation declined as expected, everyone’s civil, nobody’s fighting. Have a nice evening.
Just give us a minute.
Oh, take all the time you need.
So, are we going to talk about last night?
Are you ready to apologize?
No.
E-e-e-e-eh! Wrong answer, but thank you for playing.
Oh, come on. This is stupid.
Oh, there it is again! You think I am stupid!
No, there is a difference between being stupid and acting stupid.
Oh, yeah? well, there is a difference between being a jerk and being an ass!
No, there is not! They are synonyms!
Well, that was rather unpleasant.
Yeah, I do not think I need my preshow urination anymore.
Leonard, when that woman moved in three years ago I told you not to talk to her, and now look, we are going to be late for the movies.
The comic book store.
Hey! Look! Amazing Spider-Man 183.
Got it.
Remember this one? Spider-Man loses a big fight and then his girlfriend breaks up with him. Want me to get it for you? It will help take your mind off things.
Hey, guys. What is going on?
Oh, we need to kill a couple hours till the next showing of Time Bandits.
Oh, well, no problem. I was thinking of closing early and going home, but let’s face it, that is just a slightly smaller lonely room filled with comic books.
