Thanks, Stuart. Let me ask you something. Do you think it is okay for Penny to have an ex-boyfriend sleep on her couch?
No, I mean, she is obviously way out of line.
Thank you!
But if she dumps you, she will have a new boyfriend by tomorrow morning and you will have a new girlfriend when you figure out how to build one. So the only question is, how long until you fold?
I am not going to fold.
Well, excuse me, I do not think Penny’s out of line at all. You do not own her. It is like my girl, Beyonce says, if you like it, you shoulda put a ring on it.”
Come on. At the very least, when she found out Leonard was upset about it, she should have backed off.
You mean like when a guy’s upset because his friend agreed to take a cooking class with him and then does not show up because he is doing a juice fast with his mother?
I did not know you were upset about that.
Really! Did you miss all the subtle indicators, like me saying, Howard, I am upset.
Okay, sorry.
Maybe it means something different in this country. Back in India, it means you are upset with a guy named Howard!
I said I am sorry.
Sorry does not make up for the fact that I had to make chicken and rice with this vegan guy. Do you know what vegan chicken and rice is? Rice!
Yeah, well, you think I was having fun, sitting around all night listening to my mother say “Have you ever peed so much in your life?”
Oh, my God, you are such a mama’s boy.
Hey, do not bring my mother into this!
You brought your mother into this!

Stop it, both of you. All this fighting, I might as well be back with my parents! Damn it, George, I told you if you did not quit drinkin’ I’d leave you! Well, I guess that makes you a liar, ’cause I am drunk as hell and you are still here! Stop yelling! You are making Sheldon cry! I will tell you what is making Sheldon cry! That I let you name him Sheldon.
Boy, what got him so upset?
Oh, sure, you can tell when Sheldon’s upset.
The Cheesecake Factory.
Oh, thank you very much. Come back soon. With the other half of my tip. Hey, Sheldon, what are you doing here?
This is a restaurant. It is lunchtime. I would think, as a waitress, you’d be familiar with the paradigm.
Is Leonard coming?
No, I believe Leonard is waiting for you to come crawling back to him and apologize.
Well, that is not gonna happen.
I assumed that would be your attitude. Hence, my true purpose in coming here.
Which is?
I want you to crawl back to him and apologize.
I am busy.
Excuse me, miss. I’d like to order lunch.
Fine. What do you want?
I have a few questions. First, I notice that you offer soup and a half-sandwich?
Yes.
Where exactly does the half-sandwich come from? Are you giving me half of someone else’s sandwich, or do I have to wait for someone else in the restaurant to order the other half?
No, no, Sheldon, they just make a half-sandwich.
You cannot make a half-sandwich. If it is not half of a whole sandwich, it is just a small sandwich.
Okay, fine, it is soup and a small sandwich. Is that what you want?
Of course not. I will have my usual.
Great.
Are not you going to ask me if I want a beverage?
Do not you usually get lemonade?
Yes.
Do you want lemonade?
Yes.
Anything else?
Yes, I want you to apologize to Leonard.
I am not going to apologize. I have done nothing wrong. He is completely overreacting.
Irrelevant. The disruption in your relationship is making my life intolerable.
Well, I am sorry, Sheldon, but this really is not about you.
I do not follow.
Yeah, yeah, I will be right there. Look, Sheldon, I have to go.
All right, let’s assume, ad argumentum, that in this case, Leonard is wrong.
Leonard is wrong.
Considering the number of transgressions you have committed that he is overlooked, do not you think that, just this once, you could return the favour?
I am coming. Goodbye, Sheldon. What do you mean, transgressions I have committed?
Were you under the impression that Leonard has no complaints about you?
Like what? Yeah, yeah, I see you, you are making a little cheque sign in the air, I got it, just hold your horses. What does Leonard complain about?
Your driving, the plethora of stuffed animals on your bed that stare at him during your amorous activities, your constant tardiness, your singing.
My singing?
That is actually from my list, but Leonard would be a fool if he did not agree with it.
Okay, if Leonard has so many problems with me, why has not he just said so?
Because, according to him, you are oversensitive and have a temper.
Oh, really? Well, then, do me a favour and tell Leonard that he can drop dead!
And she wonders why she is constantly undertipped.
The apartment.
Hey.
Oh, good, you are home. I need you to do me a favour.
Sure.
Go apologize to Penny.
What?
Right now would be good.
Leonard!
Although, a few minutes ago would have been better.
I hear you do not like my stuffed animals, my driving or my punctuality.
What? Who would tell you something like that? Why would you tell her something like that?
It does not matter why he told me. It is true, is not it?
Okay, yeah, it is true, but I can live with that stuff. What I cannot live with is you casually informing me that some guy’s going to be staying in your apartment without even asking me first!
That is not even your problem, the problem is you do not trust me!
Oh, come on. Sheldon, have you ever once heard me say that I do not trust Penny? Sheldon? Where did he go?
Oh, your yelling must have freaked him out again.
Where are you going? You just walk away in the middle of an argument?!
No, I am going to go find your damn roommate before he hurts himself trying to cross the street or something!
Why did not you say so?
Oh, now I need your permission for that, too?!
Well, I cannot read your mind, Penny!
Really? Why not? You are so smart, and I am so dumb!
Raj’s apartment.
Raj.
Stop knocking! It is open! Please tell my parents that our dark matter research is at a critical juncture, and I cannot come home for my cousin Sanjay’s wedding.
Sheldon, ask our son what we are supposed to say to Mr. and Mrs. Choudhry, whose daughter, Lakshmi is flying in from London, for the sole purpose of meeting him.
I did not ask you to set me up with Lakshmi.
You should be thanking us!
Yes, Lakshmi just got her stomach stapled. You have an opportunity to get in good with her before she loses weight, and her self-esteem goes up.
I do not care! And why do not you think I can find a woman for myself?
Because you are 27, and the closest thing we have to a daughter-in-law is that Jewish boy Howard.
Oh, that is completely below the belt. Sheldon, tell my parents that Howard and I are just friends. Sheldon? Howard and I are just friends! Fine. I will come home for Sanjay’s wedding.
Penny’s car.
Sheldon!
What are you doing? He is not a lost dog.
Hey, why do not you just let me find him while you sit there hitting your imaginary brake?
The brake might be imaginary, but that stop sign you just ran was not.
What stop sign?
Eyes on the road. Eyes on the road!
Outside Howard’s house. Sheldon rings the doorbell.
Howard, answer the door! I am busy!
I am busy too, you answer it.
I cannot! I am on the toilet!
For God’s sake, I do not need to hear that! Cannot you just say, I am busy?
I said I am busy, but that was not good enough for you!
You know what? I hope it is one of those home invasion deals, and they shoot me in the head.
Well, if it is a home invader, do not tell them I am on the toilet!
There is no one there. You are hearing things, you crazy old lady!
The comic book store.
Hey, Stuart, have you seen Sheldon?
Yeah, he is, uh, over in the graphic novel section. Built himself a little nest.
Thank you.
Uh, Penny?
Yeah?
Is everything okay?
What do you mean?
Uh, Sheldon told me you and Leonard were having a fight?
Oh, yeah, kind of. It is, it is no big thing.
Oh, good, good. I love you.
I am not leaving until you talk to me.
All right, what is going on?
It is a little hard to explain. He does this thing where he pretends he is in an alternate dimension that occupies the same physical space we are in, but he cannot perceive us.
Do not flatter yourself. I am just ignoring you.
Come on, Sheldon, let’s go home. Look, we are done fighting.

I have heard that before, but then, the next thing you know I am hiding in my bedroom, blaring a Richard Feinman lecture while my mom is shouting that Jesus would forgive her if she put ground glass in my dad’s meatloaf, and my dad’s on the roof skeet-shooting her Franklin Mint collectible plates.
Okay, there is going to no more shouting and no skeet-shooting.
Really? Where’s your friend Justin going to sleep?
Yeah, where’s he gonna sleep?
Oh, my God, would you let this go?!
I’d let it go.
Why should I let it go? Why do not you just tell the guy to find another place to sleep?
Leonard, will you just let me handle this, please? Look, let’s just… Sheldon, please,
Always is a long time. Sure. Always.
You know, how about we buy you this robot, and then we all go home?
I want that one.
Okay, you can have that one.
Oh, come on, he is just going to play with it twice, and then it will end up in his closet with all the other junk.
Buy him the robot, Leonard.
Can I get this comic book, too?
Yes, you can.
We meet again.
Penny’s bed.
So what did Justin say when you told him he could not sleep on your couch?
He is a musician. He will sleep in his own vomit, if he has to.
The apartment. Sheldon is in his spot. Beside him, a long haired bearded person is asleep. There is a guitar propped up on the arm of the sofa.
I should have asked for much more than a comic book and a robot.
A camp site.
How much time do we have?
Uh, t-minus five hours, 37 minutes to onset of meteor shower.
Okay, our position is 34.48 degrees north, 118.31 west. That means the azimuth should be 168.22 degrees relative to magnetic north with an elevation of 49.93.
Anything yet?
Uh, we have a signal, but there is no frame lock.
Hang on, how about now?
We did it. We have the west coast feed of HBO.
Ooh, Real Sex.
Big deal. Every time I watch that show it is old women putting condoms on cucumbers.
Alright, let’s see what is on the east coast feed.
Oh, hey. Dune.
Not a great movie, but look at that beautiful desert.
Too bad Sheldon could not come with us.
Yes, it is not the same without him.
Oh, this sucks, I am switching back to Real Sex.
The apartment.

Sheldon’s log, stardate 63345.3. While my colleagues are off observing the Leonid meteor shower, I have remained behind to complete my paper on the decays of highly excited massive string states. Although my research is going well I do miss the warmth of human companionship.
The apartment.

And good evening to you, Siam Palace. This is Sheldon Cooper. Yeah, I am going to be dining alone this evening, so I will be reducing my usual order. I’d like to start with one quarter of the assorted appetizers plate and, uh, one half of the golden treasure for two. Oh, for heaven’s sake, in the mid-18th century, King Rama IV of Siam divided a huge empire amongst the colonial powers of Europe in order to preserve his throne. Surely, you, his cultural descendant, can handle pad thai and dumplings.
Sheldon help!
I need to go, but you keep in mind that my sharply worded comments on yelp.com recently took down a local muffin store. Penny..
Come in! Hurry!
Penny?
I am back here.
Penny..
Oh, for god’s sakes, I am in the bathroom!
Shall I come back at a better time?
Get in here! Hurry! Do not you dare knock.
Hello.
I slipped in the shower, and I think I dislocated my shoulder.
Not surprising. You have no safety mat or adhesive stickers to allow for purchase on a surface with a low coefficient of static friction.
What?
Tubs are slippery.
I know. I slipped.
I have a series of whimsical duck stickers on the bottom of my tub.
Yeah, okay, whatever. Will you just turn the water off and help me up?
They are holding umbrellas.
What?
The ducks in my tub.
Uh-huh.
They are whimsical because ducks have neither the need for, nor the ability to use umbrellas.
Oh, my god. I got to go to the emergency room.
Well, assuming you are correct that your right humerus is no longer seated in the glenoid socket, I would certainly think so.
Okay, can you drive me?
I do not drive.
Well, I cannot drive!
Well, it seems we have reached an impasse.
Ow.
But I could call you a cab or an ambulance.
No, no, no, I cannot wait that long, you got to help me, please.
All right. Let it never be said that Sheldon Lee Cooper ignored the pleas of a damsel in distress.
No one’s saying that. Let’s go.
Well, it does seem rather ironic that for want of 99-cent adhesive ducks, we both might die in a fiery car crash.
The camp site.
I wish Penny did not have to work, she loves camping.
Yeah, that would have been great. You and Penny having sex in the tent while I sit out here and watch Howard hump a cactus.
Okay, the best I can tell, there are eight other campsites nearby. Mostly science nerds like us, but just over yon ridge are two not unattractive middle school teachers who reek of desperation.
Wow. Wonderful. How old are they?
Oh I do not know, 50, 55.
Oh, menopause, nature’s birth control.
Come on, you guys cannot be that hard up.
I am.
Yeah, me, too.
Look, they gave me homemade cookies.
Of course, they did. That is what grandmothers do.
So, what are we waiting for?
Relax, I said we’d stop by a little later after they have their nap.
Good idea. They will be refreshed.
Cookie?
Yeah, thank you. Mmmm.
Mmmm, not bad.
Yeah, very tasty. Well, so tell me more about these teachers.
Not much to tell. They had a VW Microbus and were wearing tie-dyed Grateful Dead shirts.
Huh. Mmm. Good cookies.
Penny’s bedroom.
I see no organizational system in here whatsoever. Which panties do you wear on Mondays?
I do not need panties, I just need shorts and a shirt.
My mother always told me one should wear clean underpants in case one is in an accident.
One was already in an accident.
That does not mean one will not be in another, especially if I am driving.
Clothes, Sheldon. I need clothes!
Okay, here.
Seriously? Those shorts with that top?
All right.
No… No… Oh, that is cute.
We should have you checked for a concussion.
Okay, now, you got to help me put these on.
All right.
But do not look.
Do not look?
I do not want you to see me naked.

Oh. Well, that is understandable. You may be interested to know that a prohibition against looking is well established in heroic mythology. Uh, Lot and his wife, Perseus and Medusa, Orpheus and Eurydice.
Yeah, great.
They always look. It never ends well.
Ok, now you gotta help me get my arm into the sleeve.
Ok.
Is that my arm?
It does not feel like an arm.
Then, maybe you should let it go.
All righty.
The camp site.
Stars are pretty, are not they?
Up above the world so high, like little diamonds in the sky.
That is beautiful, dude. You should… You should write that down before someone steals it.
So, when do the meteors get here?
The meteors do not get here, the earth is moving into their path.
I can feel it. I can feel the earth moving. It is moving too fast. Raj, slow it down.
Okay, how’s that?
Better. Thanks.
Stars are pretty, are not they?
What is so funny?
It is your American accent. Everything you say sounds stupid. Stars are pretty, are not they?
Penny’s car.
For the record, I should let you know this is my first time driving an actual motor vehicle.
You have your learner’s permit, right?
Yes, and I have logged a considerable number of hours on a simulator.
Good.
Did not work out well.
All right, can we please go?

One moment. According to my driver’s ed book, a side mirror is properly adjusted when a portion of the is driver’s door handle is visible in the lower right corner. There is the handle. Oh, no, too far, bringing it back. Optimized. Now, where is the switch to adjust the passenger side mirror?
It is right there.
Where is the passenger side mirror?
In a parking lot in Hollywood. Now, can we please go?
Yes. As soon as I adjust my seat. Whee! Oh, dear. I am going to have to start again.
The camp site.
If I could speak the language of rabbits, they would be amazed, and I would be their king.
I hate my name. It has nerd in it. Len nerd.
I lost my virginity to my cousin Jeanie.
I would be kind to my rabbit subjects. At first.
You know what is a cool name? Angelo. That has angel and jell-o in it.
It was my Uncle Murray’s funeral. We were all back at my Aunt Barbara’s house. Our eyes locked over the pickled herring. We never meant for it to happen.
One day, I hold a great ball for the President of France, but the rabbits, they hate me and do not come. I am embarrassed, so I eat all the lettuce in the world and make them watch.
People could call me Angie. Yo, Angie, how’s it goin’?
To this day, I cannot look at pickled herring without being aroused and ashamed. Oh, cousin Jeanie.
Penny’s car.
Could you please drive a little faster?
Oh, I think we are going sufficiently fast. What is that?
Nothing. The engine does that sometimes.
That cannot be nothing, the check engine light is on. We need to find a service station.
No. The light has been on since I bought the car.
All the more reason to consult with a mechanic before it explodes.
It is not going to explode, just keep driving. Warp speed ahead, Mr. Spock.
Mr. Spock did not pilot the Enterprise. He was the science officer, and I guarantee you that if he ever saw the Enterprise’s check engine light blinking, he would pull the ship over immediately.
Oh, god, I am gonna lose the arm.
Oh, oh, red light, release accelerator and slowly apply the brake. Nailed it. While we have a moment, may I ask you a question?
What?
Why do you have the Chinese character for soup tattooed on your right buttock?
It is not soup, it is courage.
No, it is not. But I suppose it does take courage to demonstrate that kind of commitment to soup.
How did you see it? You said you would not look.
Sorry. As I told you, the hero always peeks.
The camp site.
Anything?
No. That was the last pudding cup.
No! What about Slim Jims?
That is what he used to eat his pudding, remember?
Right! That was so good! Sweety and meaty at the same time.
Wait. Wait, wait. So you are saying we are out of food?
The only thing in here are blue ice packs.
I know they are poison, but they look like big, yummy otter pops.
Oh, god, I am so hungry.
Me too. Check and see if we have any more pudding.
Okay.
The hospital waiting room.

All right, there is no need to bark at me. According to the inexplicably irritable nurse behind the desk, you will be seen after the man who claims to be having a heart attack, but appears to be well enough to play Doodle Jump on his iPhone. We have to fill these out. Describe illness or injury.
I dislocated my shoulder.
All right. And how did the accident occur?
You ready know that.
Cause of accident, lack of adhesive ducks. Okay, medical history. Have you ever been diagnosed with diabetes?
No.
Kidney disease?
No.
Migraines?
Getting one.
Are you currently pregnant?
No.
Are you sure? You look a bit puffy.
Change migraine to yes.
When was your last menstrual period?
Oh, next question.
I will put, in progress. Okay, moving to psychiatric disorders, list all major behavioural diagnoses, e.g. depression, anxiety, etcetera.
Oh, my god, what the hell does this have to do with my stupid shoulder?
Episodes of sub psychotic rage.
Ass.
Possible Tourette’s. All right, moles, lesions or other skin conditions. Soup tattoo on right buttock.
Hey, Sheldon, Sheldon, look, I am scared and in a lot of pain. Could you please just take a break from being you for just a minute and try being, I do not know, comforting?
I am sorry. There, there. Everything’s going to be fine. Sheldon’s here.
Thanks. That is much better.
The camp site.
Oh, I am so hungry!
Will you shut up? We are all hungry.
Okay, our objective is the boy scout campsite to the east. Easy target. Big doughy scout master, couple of cubs, most webelos.
What kind of score are we looking at?
Hot dogs, buns, s’mores, I mean, it is a freaking 7-11.
All right, everyone grab flashlights.
Oh, my god, could it be? Yes! My mother put an I love you brisket in my backpack.
Quick, get forks.
You do not need forks. It is so tender, it falls apart in your hands.
He is right.
I feel like we are forgetting something important.
Me, too. But what?
Maybe a tupperware bowl of roasted potatoes and carrots?
Yes! Yes!
Penny’s apartment.
Now remember, you were given powerful pain medication and a muscle relaxer, so, uh, do not operate heavy machinery. Try not to choke on your own drool.
Wait. You have to help me get into bed. Sheldon has to get me into bed. Bet you never thought I’d say that.
Yes. The charm of your drug addled candour knows no bounds.

You know, people think you are this weird robot man who’s so annoying all the time, and you totally are, but then it is like that movie Wall-E at the end. You are so full of love, and you can save a plant and get fat people out of the floaty chairs.
That is a fairly laboured metaphor, but I appreciate the sentiment behind it.
Sing “Soft Kitty” to me.
“Soft Kitty” is for when you are sick. You are not sick.
Injured and drugged is a kind of sick.
Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur…

Wait, wait. Let’s sing it as a round. I will start. Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur… See that is where you come in. I will start over. Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur… I have got all night, Sheldon. Soft kitty, warm kitty… little ball of fur, happy kitty, sleepy kitty, purr, purr, purr.
The camp site. Raj is telling a ghost story with the torch on his face.
…And the next morning when he woke up, he rolled over and realized… duh-duh-duh! …she was his cousin.
That is still not funny.
That is still not funny.
And she was my second cousin.
And she was my second cousin.
You are a real douche.
Who cares? You slept with your cousin.
Outside an apartment building.
So two years later, there is a knock on the door, guy opens it, and there on his porch is the snail, who says, “What the heck was all that about?”
I do not really get it.
Well, see, it took two years for the snail to… not important.
Can I ask you a question?
Sure.
Where do you think this is going?
To be honest, I was hoping at least second base.
You are so funny. You are like a stand-up comedian.
A Jewish stand-up comedian, that’d be new.
Actually, I think a lot of them are Jewish.
No, I was just… never mind.
Look, Howard, this is our third date and we both know what that means.
We do?
Sex.
You are kidding.
But I need to know whether you are looking for a relationship or a one-night stand.
Okay, just to be clear, there is only one correct answer, right? It is not like chicken or fish on an airplane?
Maybe you need to think about it a little.
You know, it is not unheard of for a one-night stand to turn into a relationship.
Call me when you figure it out.
Three dates means sex? Who knew?
The apartment.
Greetings, homies, homette.
Why are you back from your date so early?
In romance, as in show business, always leave them wanting more.
What exactly does that mean?
He struck out.
The university cafeteria.
Hey, did either of you guys know that three dates with the same woman is the threshold for sex?
Actually, I have never had three dates with the same woman.
With Penny and me, it took two years. Now that I think about it, that was three dates.
Okay, well, before you and Penny hooked up, did she ask for any kind of commitment?
No, she was pretty clear about wanting to keep her options open.
I have something to announce, but out of respect for convention, I will wait for you to finish your current conversation. What are you talking about?
The cultural paradigm in which people have sex after three dates.
I see. Now, are we talking date, the social interaction, or date, the dried fruit?
Never mind, what is your announcement?
Oh, good, my turn. Well, this is very exciting and I wanted you to be among the first to know…
Hey, Cooper, I hear you are going to be on the wadio with Ira Fwatow from Science Fwiday next week.
Thank you, Kripke, for depriving me of the opportunity to share my news with my friends.
My pweasure.
My thank you was not sincere.
But my pweasure is. Let me ask you a question, at what point did National Public Wadio have to start scwaping the bottom of the bawwel for its guests? Eh, do not answer, it is wetowical.
Why are you such a stupid head? That is also rhetorical. I am sorry you had to hear that.
Are you really going to be on NPR?

Yes, they are interviewing me by phone from my office, regarding the recent so-called discovery of magnetic monopoles in spin-ices. It is pledge week and they are trying to goose the ratings with a little controversy.
Very cool, congratulations.
Thank you. My mother is very excited. She is convening her Bible study group to listen in, and then pray for my soul.

I was on the radio once. I called in to Fever 104 FM New Delhi and was the fourth person to say the phrase that pays, “Fever 104, आज के नये अच्छे संगीत का घर.” That means: “Fever 104, home of the really good current music.” It is much catchier in Hindi.
The apartment.

All right. These are the talking points for my NPR interview tomorrow. I need to make sure that they are simple enough for the less educated in the audience to understand. Howard, look this over and tell me what is unclear to you.
Excuse me, I have a master’s degree in engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. It required the completion of 144 units of grad work and an original thesis.
Yes. Look this over and tell me what is unclear to you.
You know, when Sheldon gives you homework, you do not have to do it.
In fact, it is better if you do not, otherwise it makes the rest of us look bad.
Hi, guys.
Hey.
Hello.
Yo, Raj, talk to me. I am sorry, just screwing with you. Hey, Howard, why have not you called Bernadette?
Did she say something?
Yeah, she said she has not heard from you in a week. I thought you liked her?
I do, yeah, but she wants a commitment and I am not sure she is my type.
She agreed to go out with you for free. What more do you need?
Look, Bernadette is really nice. I just always thought when I finally settle down into a relationship, it would be with someone, you know, different.
Different how?
Well, you know, more like Megan Fox from Transformers, or Katee Sackhoff from Battlestar Galactica.
Are you high?
You’d have a better shot with the three-breasted Martian hooker from Total Recall.
Okay, now you are just being unrealistic. Anyway, that movie was like 20 years ago, imagine how saggy those things would be.
Howard, you are going to throw away a great girl like Bernadette because you are holding out for some ridiculous fantasy?
Hey, just because you settled does not mean I have to.
Excuse me, I am sitting here.
Hey, I did not settle for Leonard. I mean, obviously, he is not the kind of guy I usually go out with, you know, physically.
Again, I am right here.
My point is, I do not judge a book by its cover. I am interested in the person underneath.
I am here, right? You see me.
Hey, I am interested in what is inside people, too, but why is it wrong to want those insides wrapped up in, say, the delicious caramel that is Halle Berry? Yes, you are delicious caramel, too.
All right, you know what, I will tell you why it is wrong…
Excuse me, may I interject?
What?
Biologically speaking, Howard is perfectly justified in seeking out the optimum mate for the propagation of his genetic line.
Thank you, Sheldon.
Now, whether that propagation is in the interest of humanity is, of course, an entirely different question.
Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
This is Ira Flatow and you are listening to NPR’s Science Friday. Joining us today by phone from his office in Pasadena, California is Dr. Sheldon Cooper.
Oh, this is going to be a wiot.
Thanks for being with us today, Dr. Cooper.
My pleasure, Ira.
Now, let’s talk about magnetic monopoles. Can you explain to our audience just what a monopole is?
Of course. First, consider an ordinary magnet which has, a north and south pole. If you cut that in half, you have two smaller magnets, each with its own north and south pole.
Uh, Dr. Cooper, I think there might be something wrong with our connection.
No, I hear you fine. As I was saying, an ordinary magnet has two poles. The primary characteristic of a monopole is that it has only one pole, hence, monopole.

A requirement for string theory, or M-theory, if you will, is the existence of such monopoles. I, myself, led an expedition to the Arctic Circle in search of said particles. Kripke, I found the nozzle! I am going to kill you!
Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
So nice you could join me this evening. You are looking lovely as always.
Thanks, Howard. Always nice to be part of your masturbatory fantasies.
Come on, Katee, do not make it sound so cheap.
I am sorry, fiddling with yourself in the bathtub is a real class act.
Thank you. So, shall we get started?
Sure. But can I ask you a question first?
You want to play Cylon and colonist?
No. I want to know why you are playing make-believe with me when you could be out with a real woman tonight.
You mean, Bernadette?
No, I mean Princess Leia. Of course I mean Bernadette. She is a wonderful girl and she really likes you.
I know, but she is not you.
I am not me. The real me is in Beverly Hills going out with a tall, handsome, rich guy.
Really? Tall?
Six-four.
Ouch.
The point is, you have got a wonderful girl in your life, and you are ignoring her in order to spend your nights in the bathtub with a mental image and a wash cloth.
Howard! What are you doing in there?
I am taking a bath!
I hope that is all you are doing! We share that tub!
Do not remind me! Oh, man. All soaped up and no place to go.
Sheldon’s bedroom.
How ya doin’, buddy?
I was humiliated on national radio. How do you think I am doing?
Come on, it was not that bad.
What do you want?
We represent the Lollipop Guild, and we want you.
Okay, so Kripke played a joke on you.
It was not funny.
I thought it was funny.
Raj.
You laughed.
Did you laugh?
I fell on the floor. All right, he got you, you can get him back.
I refuse to sink to his level.
You cannot sink. With all that helium in you, you are lucky you do not float away.
Are you really admitting defeat?
I never admit defeat.
Good.
However, on an unrelated topic, I am never getting out of this bed again.
What if you could make Kripke look even sillier than he made you look?
I do not think that is possible, dude.
You are not helping.
I did not come to help, I came to mock.
Sheldon, what you need to do is figure out a way to exact vengeance on Kripke, like, uh, like, how the Joker got back at Batman for putting him in the Arkham Asylum for the Criminally Insane.
That is true. He did not just stay there and talk about his feelings with the other psychotic villains. He, he broke out and poisoned Gotham’s water supply.
Well, I suppose I could poison Kripke.
No, no.
It is a simple matter. There are several toxic chemicals that’d be untraceable in an autopsy.
Okay, uh, that is the spirit, but, um, let’s dial it back to a non-lethal form of vengeance.
Oh! How about we put awhoopee cushion on his office chair? He will sit down, it will sound like he is flatulent, even though he is not.
Let’s keep thinking.
The Cheesecake Factory. Howard enters.
Oh, gee, you are too late. Scarlett Johansson and Wonder Woman were just in here trolling around for neurotic, little weasels.
Yeah, I came to talk to Bernadette. She is working today, right?
Yes, but I do not think she wants to see you.
Why not?
Come on, Howard. You hurt her feelings by not calling her all week. Plus, I have kind of been talkin’ some smack about ya.
Hello, Howard.
Wait, Bernadette, I need to talk to you.
I cannot now, I am working.
This will only take a second. You asked me to think about where our relationship was going, and I did. Bernadette? Will you marry me?
Is this more comedy that I do not understand?
No. I am serious. I am never going to find another girl like you who likes me and is, you know, real.
So, this is not a joke?
No.
Then you are insane.
I prefer to think of myself as quirky.
Howard, we have only been on three dates. We have not even had sex yet.
Fair enough. When’s your break?
Wow.
Do not you just hate when this happens?
Wow.
The apartment kitchen.
All right, how’s this for revenge? A solution of hydrogen peroxide, and one of saturated potassium iodide.
What is this?
Mountain Dew. Ah, refreshing. Now, we are going to combine these chemicals with ordinary dish soap, creating a little exothermic release of oxygen.
Foamy vengeance.
Yes, exactly.
This is brilliant, Sheldon. How are we going to deploy it in Kripke’s office?

Already taken care of. Observe. This is a live shot of Kripke’s lab via a mini webcam I was able to install, thanks to a dollar bill discreetly placed in the night janitor’s shirt pocket. At the same time, I also secured large quantities of these chemicals above the tiles in the drop ceiling.
Oh, Sheldon, you remind me of a young Lex Luthor.
You flatter me, sir.
Let me guess, motion sensors?
The reaction will be triggered when Kripke reaches the center of the room. Mwah, ha, ha.
I gotta say, I am really impressed. This is truly the Sheldon Cooper way to get even.
It may be low-tech, but I still maintain the whoopee cushion has comic validity.
Here comes Kripke!
Who is that with him?
I believe that is the president of the university.
And the board of directors. Abort! Abort!
There is no abort.
Well, how could you not put in an abort?
I made a boo-boo, all right?
I think the board will weally appweciate how well we are using that NSA gwant, Pwesident Seibert. Wight here we have a micwo-contwolled pwasma…
Wow. Looks like the Ganges on laundry day.
At least they do not know it was you.

Hello, Kripke. This classic prank comes to you from the malevolent mind of Sheldon Cooper. If you’d like to see the look on your stupid face, this video is being instantly uploaded to YouTube. Oh, and a hat tip to Leonard Hofstadter and Raj Koothrappali for their support and encouragement in this enterprise.
Well, I am going back to India. What is your plan?
The Cheesecake Factory.
Hey, here’s your tip from table seven.
Oh, thanks.
Mm-hmm.
Testing. Check. Check two.
Oh, now what?
You want me to throw him out?
No, that is okay.
Are you sure? He is small. I bet I can get a nice, tight spiral on him.

I want to dedicate this number to a great gal who I have done wrong. Bernadette, I am so sorry for trying to propose to you, Bernadette, you found it creepy but that is just the kind of thing I do. I know now it was too soon to talk of love. It was just a crazy idea that came to me in my tub. But, Bernadette, give me one more chance, sweet Bernadette, I will get the hang of this thing they call romance, sweet Bernadette, I dream to once again kiss your lips, sweet Bernadette. Sincerely yours, Howard Wolowitz, Bernadette…
Oh, I am so sorry.
Are you kidding? That is the most romantic thing anyone’s ever done for me.
…Bernadette! Thank you, Cheesecake Factory!
The apartment
Hey, Leonard, check this out.
Leonard, she is doing it again.
I think it upsets Sheldon when you play with the food.
No. It upsets Sheldon when she willy-nilly takes it from the containers without regard for its equitable distribution. This is essentially why you have famine in India.
You want me to put it back?
Leonard.
It upsets Sheldon when you play with the Sheldon.
What is up, my nerdizzles? Raj, Sheldon, I want you to meet my girlfriend Bernadette.
Hello.
Leonard, Penny, you know my girlfriend Bernadette.
Yeah. Hey.
Bernadette, say fo’shizzle to my nerdizzles.
I do not think I can. I do not have Howard’s street cred.
I hope it is all right, I told my girlfriend Bernadette she could join us for dinner.
Sure. The more, the merrier.
Wait, no, that is a false equivalency. More does not equal merry. If there were 2,000 people in this apartment right now, would we be celebrating? No, we’d be suffocating.
Sheldon…
Do not Sheldon me. We ordered for five people, not six.
Oh, come on, it is fine. We will just put it all on the table, you know, family style.
Oh, sure. And while we are at it, why do not we put our hands behind our backs, have an old-fashioned eating contest?
Relax, it will be fine, sit down, you guys.
NO!
What?
Oh, yeah, you cannot sit there.
Why not?
That is where Sheldon sits.
He cannot sit somewhere else?

Oh no, no, you see, in the winter, that seat is close enough to the radiator so that he is warm, yet not so close that he sweats. In the summer, it is directly in the path of a cross-breeze created by opening windows there and there. It faces the television at an angle that is not direct, so he can still talk to everybody, yet not so wide that the picture looks distorted.
Perhaps there is hope for you after all.
A few moments later.
Ooh, I love your shoes.
Oh, thanks. They are cute, are not they?
Where’d you get them?
Shoes for Less.
I have been meaning to go over there.
Oh, great selection, great prices.
My mother was right. Hell is real.
Come on, Sheldon. let the womenfolk chat.
Womenfolk?
Gals? Chicks? Utero-Americans?
Just eat your dinner.
Do not take him too seriously, a lot of what he says is intended as humour.
Yeah, well, I do not think it is very funny.
Me neither, but he just lights up when I laugh.
Howard, never let her go.
So, Leonard, Howard says you are working on fundamental tests of quantum mechanics.
I am. Are you interested in physics?
Oh, I find it fascinating. If I had not gone into microbiology, I probably would have gone into physics. Or ice dancing.
Actually, my tests of the Aharonov-Bohm quantum interference effect have reached an interesting point. Right now, we are testing the phase shift due to an electric potential.
That is amazing.
Yes. Leonard’s work is nearly as amazing as third graders growing lima beans in wet paper towels. While I appreciate the oh, snap, I am uncomfortable having your moist breath in my ear.
Are you going to try to set up the voltages using tunnel junctions?
Yes, I am. You want to see a simulation on my laptop?
Oh, yeah, show me. In microbiology, the most exciting thing I get to work with is yeast.
Howard?
Yeah?
Your shoes are delightful. Where did you get them?
What?
Bazinga. I do not care.
The apartment. Sheldon and Raj are playing a racing game on the Wii.
Ha! Eat my dust, racially stereotypical plumber.
That is not fair. I got stuck behind a tree.
And a cow and a penguin. Face it dude, whether it is a real car or a virtual cartoon car, you cannot drive.
Just need a little more practice.
What you need is cheat codes, motor skills and a magic genie who grants wishes to little boys who suck at Mario Kart.
Hey, Sheldon, can I talk to you for a second?
It is not about shoes, is it? I do not think I could go through that again.
It is not about shoes.
Then speak.
Um, actually, can we do it in private?
All right. Go away. I agree, it is rude, but she asked for privacy.
Thanks, Raj. Okay, so here’s the thing, I was wondering if you could maybe teach me a little physics?
A little physics? There is no such thing. Physics encompasses the entire universe, from quantum particles to supernovas, from spinning electrons to spinning galaxies.
Yeah, okay, cool. I do not need the PBS special, I just want to know enough so I can talk to Leonard about his job. You know, like Bernadette does.
Why cannot Leonard teach you?
‘Cause I want to surprise him.
Cannot you surprise him in some other way? For example, I am sure he’d be delightfully taken aback if you cleaned your apartment.
Come on, Sheldon, this is important to me.
Penny, this would be a massive undertaking, and my time is both limited and valuable.
You are sitting here playing video games all day.
Okay, point. What sort of foundation do you have? Did you take any science classes in school?
Sure. I did the one with the frogs.
The one with the frogs.
Yeah, actually, it was pretty cool. A lot of the girls threw up, but I gutted that thing like a deer.
I am sorry, Penny, I do not think so.
Oh, come on! A smart guy like you, it will be a challenge. You can make it like an experiment.
Interesting. I suppose if someone could teach sign language to KoKo the gorilla, I could teach you some rudimentary physics.
Great! It is a little insulting, but great. I will be KoKo.
Not likely. KoKo learned to understand over 2,000 words, not one of which had anything to do with shoes.
The university cafeteria.
Hey, fellas. This is my girlfriend Bernadette. My girlfriend Bernadette.
Who are all those people?
Have no idea. Hey, Leonard.
Hi.
Hey, look, it is Howard and his girlfriend Bernadette.
Thought I’d give the little woman a tour of the old salt mines.
He does not mean salt mines. He means where he works.
Yeah, no, I got it.
So, how’s your experiment going?
Ah, terrific. We are getting the electron accelerator set up. We should be ready to go day after tomorrow.
Boy, I’d love to see that.
You are welcome to come.
Really? Oh, that’d be great. How exciting is that?
Like Hanukkah in July.
Do they have that?
No.
Oh. You got me again. This is not non-fat yogurt, this is fatty fat fat. Excuse me.
Could you grab me another napkin, sweetie?
Sure.
Thanks, honey. All right, what is your deal?
Excuse me?
Inviting my girlfriend to come see your electron accelerator?
Yeah? So?
Wow! You really are a piece of work. It is not enough you get the prom queen, you have to get the head of the decorating committee, too?
What are you talking about?
Do not play innocent with me. I practically invented using fancy lab equipment to seduce women.
Has it ever worked?
Not so far, but that is not the point!
Howard, relax, I am not interested in your girlfriend.
I hope not, because you do not want to mess with me. I am crazy.
I believe you.
The apartment.
Research journal, entry one. I am about to embark on one of the great challenges of my scientific career, teaching Penny physics. I am calling it Project Gorilla.
Hey, Sheldon.
Come in. Take a seat. Subject has arrived. I have extended a friendly casual greeting.
Ready to get started?
One moment. Subject appears well-rested and enthusiastic. Apparently, ignorance is bliss. All right, let us begin. Where’s your notebook?
Um, I do not have one.
How are you going to take notes without a notebook?
I have to take notes?
How else are you gonna study for the tests?
There is gonna be a test?
Tests. Here. It is college-ruled. I hope that is not too intimidating.
Thank you.

You are welcome. Now, Introduction to Physics. What is physics? Physics comes from the ancient Greek word physika. It is at this point that you will want to start taking notes. Physika means the science of natural things. And it is there, in ancient Greece, that our story begins.
Ancient Greece?

Hush. If you have questions, raise your hand. It is a warm summer evening, circa 600 BC, you have finished your shopping at the local market, or agora, and you look up at the night sky. There you notice some of the stars seem to move, so you name them planetes, or wanderer. Yes, Penny?
Um, does this have anything to do with Leonard’s work?

This is the beginning of a twenty six hundred year journey we are going to take together from the ancient Greeks through Isaac Newton to Niels Bohr to Erwin Schrodinger to the Dutch researchers that Leonard is currently ripping off.
Twenty six hundred years?
Yeah, give or take. As I was saying, it is a warm summer evening in ancient Greece… Yes, Penny?
I have to go to the bathroom.
Cannot you hold it?
Not for twenty six hundred years.
Project Gorilla, entry two. I am exhausted.
Howard’s bedroom.
Howard?
Huh?
It unhooks in the front.
Oh, that explains a lot.
Howard, I am home!
Of course.
Senior fitness was cancelled. It turns out you can forget how to ride a bike. I am fine, but, oy, did Sam Harpootian eat gravel.
That is great, Ma!
What is great about an 80-year-old Armenian man with half his chin scraped off?
I guess I should go.
No, no, do not move. Hey, Ma, can I have lamb stew for dinner?
Lamb stew? I’d have to go to the supermarket.
Please? I got a real hankering.
Oh, I cannot say no to my little tushy face. I will be back soon.
Thanks, Ma.
Do you want the regular peas or the Le Seur?
Always Le Seur peas with lamb stew!
You are right! When you are right, you are right! What if they are out of the Le Seur?
Then get the regular!
All right! You do not have to yell!
Sorry about that.
Let me just put that on vibrate.
I am already on vibrate.
You know, that one I got. Howard, did you say something to Leonard about me?
Uh, what do you mean?
He says if I go see his experiment tomorrow it might weird you out.
Really? He said that?
You are not jealous of Leonard, are you?
Me? No. I may have mentioned that it is a little inappropriate to be asking another man’s girlfriend to his experiment without first discussing it with said man.
Are you saying I need to ask your permission to hang out with Leonard?
I did not say anything like that. I said Leonard has to ask my permission. Come on, I do not want to eat lamb stew with my mother. Damn, I was this close on the bra.
The apartment.

Now, remember, Newton realized that Aristotle was wrong and force was not necessary to maintain motion. So let’s plug in our 9.8 meters per second squared as A and we get force, Earth gravity, equals mass times 9.8 meters per second per second. So we can see that MA equals MG and what do we know from this?
Uh, we know that… Newton was a really smart cookie. Oh! Is that where Fig Newtons come from?
No, Fig Newtons are named after a small town in Massachusetts. Do not write that down!
Sorry.
Now, if MA equals MG what does that imply?
I do not know.
How can you not know? I just told you. Have you suffered a recent blow to the head?
Hey! You do not have to be so mean!
I am sorry. Have you suffered a recent blow to the head?
No, you just suck at teaching.
Really? Of those two explanations, which one seems the most likely?
Oh, God, Sheldon, look I am trying to understand, but you are going too fast. Can you just back up a little bit?
All right. It is a warm summer evening in ancient Greece…
Not that far back!
Okay! At what point did you begin to feel lost?
I do not know. Where were we looking up at the night sky?
Greece.
Damn it!
There is no need to get frustrated, people learn at different rates. Unlike objects falling in a vacuum, which…? MA equals MG?
Squared?
No.
Aristotle?
No.
Five?
Oh!
Then I do not know.
Why are you crying?
Because I am stupid!
That is no reason to cry. One cries because one is sad. For example, I cry because others are stupid and it makes me sad.
Okay, look, can we just please forget about all this extra stuff and can you just tell me what Leonard does?
All right. Leonard is attempting to learn why sub-atomic particles move the way they do.
Really? That is it? Well, that does not sound so complicated.
It is not. That is why Leonard does it.
Okay, I just have one question. What exactly are sub-atomic particles?
A good question.
Thank you.
And to answer it, we first must ask ourselves, what is physics?
Oh, balls.
It is a warm summer evening in ancient Greece…
Leonard’s lab.
Okay, I got a bone to pick with you.
What did I do now?
I was in bed with Bernadette, and you text-blocked me.
What?
We were completely naked, about to devour each other when, you text her that I have a problem with her hanging out with you.
You do have a problem with her hanging out with me.
Yeah, but that is not what you tell her.
What was I supposed to tell her?
I do not know, something that does not make me come off as a petty, jealous douche.
And what would that be?
Come on, do I have to think of everything?
Hey, Leonard. Am I too late to see the experiment? Oh, hi.
Hi.
What are you doing here?
Same thing you are doing here. I came to see Leonard’s experiment.
No, you did not. You said Leonard’s experiment was stupid.
You told her my experiment was stupid?
I was just repeating what Sheldon said. Let’s not get off topic, Bernadette, I need to apologize. I was wrong to tell you who you should be friends with.
Should I, um, leave you two alone?
No, Leonard, you should hear this.
Okay, good, ’cause I was not really gonna go.
Look, I know I come off as confident and worldly, but the truth is I am not.
We are shocked.
Which is why I tend to feel threatened by other guys.
Or loud noises, clowns and nuns.
But I now realize how foolish that is.
He had a panic attack once when he got his head stuck in a sweater.
It was a full turtleneck. Why are not you helping me?
I do not know. Maybe because I am crazy?
Bernadette, please, I am asking you to give me another chance.
What do you think, Leonard? Should I give him another chance?
It is up to you. He did not call your experiment stupid.
Come here, tushy face.
Tushy face, that is going on Twitter right now.
The apartment.
Raj, you should have seen Leonard’s experiment. The interference pattern was so cool when the electron beam was on.
I am glad you enjoyed it. Most people are not that interested in what I do.

Actually, that is not true, Leonard. In fact, recently I have been thinking that given the parameters of your experiment, the transport of electrons through the aperture the nano-fabricated metal rings is qualitatively no different than the experiment already conducted in the Netherlands. Their observed phase shift in the diffusing electrons inside the metal ring already conclusively demonstrated the electric analogue of the Aharonov-Bohm quantum-interference effect. That is it. That is all I know. Oh, wait! Fig Newtons were named after a town in Massachusetts, not the scientist.
The apartment.
Oh, I always tear up when the Grinch’s heart grows three sizes.
Tears seem appropriate. Enlargement of the heart muscle, or hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, is a serious disease which could lead to congestive heart failure.
Fa-la-la, la-la-la, la-la-la.
You really did not like it, Sheldon?

No, on the contrary. I found the Grinch to be a relatable, engaging character, and I was really with him right up to the point that he succumbed to social convention and returned the presents and saved Christmas. What a buzz kill that was.
When we watch Frosty the Snowman, he roots for the sun.
Excuse me, but the sun is essential for all life on Earth. Frosty is merely a bit of frozen supernatural ephemera in a stolen hat. A crime, by the way, for which he is never brought to account.
Fa-la-la-la-la, la-la-la-la.
The apartment.
I just love decorating the Christmas tree. It makes me feel like a little girl again.
We did not have a tree when I was growing up.
Really? Why not?
Mmm, in my family, holidays were not so much celebrated as studied for their anthropological and psychological implications on human society.
Oh, sounds festive. Did you at least give presents?
Mmm, in a way. We presented papers, and then broke off into focus groups and critiqued each other.
Sheldon, what about you? Did you have a Christmas tree?

Oh, yes. We had a tree, we had a manger, we had an inflatable Santa Claus with plastic reindeer on the front lawn. And to make things even more jolly, there were so many blinking lights on the house they induced neighbourhood-wide seizures.
So I take it you do not want to help us trim the tree.
I do not. But if you insist on decorating a spider-infested fire hazard in my home I would request that you add this.
What is it?
You are kidding, right? It is a bust of Sir Isaac Newton.
Oh, sure, sure, yeah. Very Christmassy.
Wait, excuse me, but it is much more Christmassy than anything you have put on the tree.
Here we go.

December 25, 1642, Julian calendar, Sir Isaac Newton is born. Jesus, on the other hand, was actually born in the summer. His birthday was moved to coincide with a traditional pagan holiday that celebrated the winter solstice with lit fires and slaughtered goats. Which, frankly, sounds like more fun than 12 hours of church with my mother followed by a fruitcake.
Merry Newton-mas, everyone.
I sense that is not sincere, although I have no idea why.
No, it is fine. Look, Sir Isaac can go right next to this little candy cane.
No. Isaac goes at the top of the tree.
No, he does not.
I understand. You dispute Newton’s claim that he invented calculus and you want to put Gottfried Leibniz on the top.
Yeah, you got me. I am a Leibniz man.
Well, perhaps when your mother gets here, she will talk some sense into you.
What? Your… your mother’s coming? When?
Tomorrow.
When were you going to tell me?
Um, tomorrow?
Why were you keeping this a secret?
Well, I just, I thought…
If I can interject here, obviously Leonard is concerned that his mother will not approve of you as his mate.
Why would not she approve of me? I am adorable.
You are, it is just…

If I can interject again. Leonard comes from a remarkably high-achieving family, who have all chosen high-achieving partners. He probably feels that it is doubtful that his mother will be overly impressed with his dating a woman whose most significant achievement is memorizing the Cheesecake Factory menu.
Hey, it is a big menu. There is two pages just for desserts.
I know. And those specials, they change every day.
Okay, you know what? It is lame when I say it, it is just ridiculous when you pile on.
Okay, sorry.
So what did she say when you told her we were going out?
Um…
You did not tell her we were going out, did you?
Um…
Why not?
Um…
Leonard, I am no expert on meditation, but if you are trying to calm yourself down, I believe the word is Om.
Leonard’s car.
It was so nice of you to come all the way down to the airport to pick me up.
No trouble at all.
I drove, Mother. I am driving now.
Yes, dear. Mommy’s proud. I have been meaning to thank you for your notes on my paper disproving quantum brain dynamic theory.
My pleasure. For a non-physicist, you have a remarkable grasp of how electric dipoles in the brain’s water molecules could not possibly form a Bose condensate.
Wait, wait, wait. When did you send my mom notes on a paper?
August 16th. Right after her carpal tunnel surgery.
Oh, did I thank you for the flowers?
You did.
I do not really like flowers.
Neither do I, but it is the social convention.
It is, is not it?
Wait, wait, wait. You had surgery?
Yes, and Sheldon sent me flowers.
No, I heard that.
Then what was all that wait, wait, wait about?
I just do not understand why he knows more about your life than I do.
Well, I would assume it is because Sheldon and I stay in touch due to mutual interest and respect, while you avoid me, due to unresolved childhood issues.
It is what we think caused your narcissistic personality disorder. We discussed it at length during our last video chat. Although how we got onto the subject of you is baffling.
Yes, but we are on the subject, so I am obliged to ask, Leonard, how are you?
Fine, Mom. How are you?
Mmm, menopausal.
Now I am less fine.
Have you heard your brother has gotten engaged?
No. Sheldon, why did not you tell me?
My bad. I did send a gift from both of us.
She is a remarkable girl. The youngest appeals court judge in New Jersey and a two-time Olympic bronze medallist.
You must be very happy.
Why? I am not marrying her. So, how about you? Are you seeing anyone interesting?
Well, I am not sure about interesting, but…
Not the time, Sheldon.
Very well. Shall we switch topics to Isaac Newton v. Gottfried Leibniz?

It is all right, Sheldon. I will just pretend that Leonard’s not withholding information. Although, I will point out, Leonard, that I am a trained psychiatrist and you are exhibiting the same secretive behavioural tics that accompanied your learning to masturbate.
Is not she brilliant, Leonard? How I envy you.
The apartment.
So, Howard, have you and Rajesh finally summoned the courage to express your latent homosexual feelings toward one another?
What? No.
Why not?
Because we do not have latent homosexual feelings toward one another.
I see.
No, really. I have a girlfriend now.
And where is she this evening?
She had to go out of town. Her grandmother died.
I see. Her grandmother died.
Honest to God. Leonard, tell her I have a girlfriend.
I do not know what you are talking about.
What do you mean you do not know what I am talking about? Tell her I have a girlfriend!
All right. He “has” a “girlfriend.”
Her name is Bernadette, she is working as a waitress, but she is going to school to be a microbiologist.
Howard, keep in mind that the more passionately you stick to this construct, the more you are hurting your partner.
Do you really think your lips in my ear is helping?
Hi. Sorry I am late.
Oh, glad you are here, uh, sit down, I will get you a plate. Mom, you remember Penny.
Oh, yes, the waitress slash actress with the unresolved father issues. Has he finally come to terms with his little slugger growing breasts?
Well, he sent me a football and a catcher’s mitt for Christmas, so I am going to say no.
If it helps, we are all good with your breasts.
Classic overcompensation. Oh, speaking of fathers, Leonard, that reminds me, I am divorcing yours.
What?
Yes. He was cheating on me.
No!
Yes, with some waitress from the university cafeteria. Can you believe it? A waitress? Oh, no offense, dear.
No, it sounded like a compliment.
When did this happen?
Mmm, well, let’s see. Sheldon, when did I leave Leonard’s father?
September 22nd.
Oh, yes, that is right. The weekend after Leonard’s dog died.
Mitzy’s dead?
She was old and blind, Leonard. What choice did we have?
I do not believe this. Why am I the last to know?
Excuse me, Leonard, I am the one who’s getting a divorce, Mitzy is the one who is dead. Why are you the one making a fuss?
You are right. I am-I am-I am-I am sorry, I am way out of line!
So, Penny, what is new in your life?
Nothing. Not a damn thing.
Penny’s car.
Thank you for driving me back to my hotel.
Oh, it is not a problem.
I was going to ask Leonard to do it, but he seemed a bit emotionally unstable and you do not want someone like that operating heavy machinery.
No, you do not.
Your check engine light is on.
Yeah, I gotta put a sticker over that. So, uh, you must be devastated about your divorce.
Oh, not at all. But I am a bit distressed to be in a vehicle that is not subjected to regular maintenance.
Come on, I mean, you are not upset that your marriage is over?
Well, initially I felt something akin to grief and perhaps anger, but that is the natural reaction of the limbic system to being betrayed by a loathsome son of a bitch.
Sure, sure.
Thankfully, my shock was somewhat mitigated by the fact that I have not had intercourse with him in eight years.
Eight years?
Oh, that is nothing. I have been responsible for my own orgasms since 1982.
Yikes. What is so funny?
That is exactly what I say during orgasms. Yikes.
You know what? I could use a drink. Do you want to stop for a drink?
Oh, I do not drink.
I do, I will teach you.
Leonard’s bedroom.
Leonard?
What is it? Sheldon: I made tea.
I do not want tea.
I did not make tea for you. This is my tea.
Then why are you telling me?
It is a conversation starter.
That is a lousy conversation starter.
Oh, is it? We are conversing. Checkmate.
What do you want, Sheldon?
What I want is to be departing the Starship Enterprise in a one-man shuttle craft headed to the planetoid I rule known as Sheldon Alpha Five.
I want that too. Why are you here?

To comfort you, of course. No, that is not going to work at all, I will comfort you from over here. Leonard, what you are experiencing is a classic Jungian crisis in which the aging individual mourns the loss of the never-to-be realized ideal family unit.
Thank you, that is very comforting.
That is not the comforting part.
It is not?

No, no. The comforting part is that the Germans have a term for what you are feeling. Weltschmerz. It means the depression that arises from comparing the world as it is to a hypothetical, idealized world.
You are right, I do feel better.
Well, the Germans have always been a comforting people. Just remember, Leonard, where your biological family has failed you, you always have me, your surrogate family.
You are my surrogate family?
If it is any consolation, I am not happy about it either. Good night.
A bar.
Okay, now this time try drinking it all at once.
Yikes.
I have been responsible for my own buzz since 2003. Another round for me and my homegirl.
I feel a spreading warmth through my extremities.
As long as you do not feel it running down your pants, you are fine.

Oh, that is fascinating. I am noticing an immediate lowering of my inhibitions. For example, I am seriously considering asking that busboy to ravish me in the alleyway while I eat cheesecake. What do you think?
Well, we are known for our cheesecake. Hit us again.
Yes. If a little is good, more must be better.
Hey, Bev, guess what?
What?
I am sleeping with your son.
Really? Which one?
The one from whom I live across the hall from.
Well, that is convenient. How did his penis turn out?
Oh, Beverly, I cannot talk to my boyfriend’s mother about his penis.
Oh, fair enough. What can you tell me, if anything, about that busboy’s penis?
Actually, I have only had the cheesecake. One more time. You know, Leonard did not want to tell you we were dating.
Really? Well, that means he is either embarrassed about the relationship or he does not care enough about his mother to tell her he is in one. Either way, one of us should be insulted.
Well, let’s go find out who.
You go get a taxi. I am gonna slip my business card into that busboy’s back pocket, cupping his firm, right buttock as I do so.
The apartment.
Leonard?
Sonny boy!
Get out here! Your mommy wants to talk to you!
What the hell is going on?
You are in trouble.
Why did not you tell me you were tapping my homegirl? Did I say that right?
Yeah, not bad, not bad.
Are you guys drunk?
Well, I hope so. Otherwise, why would we have stopped at Del Taco? Now, how could you not tell me you were in a relationship with this lovely, charming young woman?
Oh, thank you.
You are welcome. Is it because she is uneducated, trapped in a menial service position?
What the hell happened to lovely and charming?
How come you did not tell me that you and Father were getting a divorce? How come you did not tell me you had surgery? How come you did not tell me my dog died?
Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait. What I hear you saying is that you want a more intimate mother-son relationship.
I do.
There. It is late. Now, go to bed. I am getting a warm feeling spreading through my heart.
That is the Del Taco.
Why is Leonard softly banging his head against his bedroom door?
Speaking of warm feelings, come here. No, I’d rather have the busboy.
Leonard’s car.
Thank you for taking me to the airport.
You are very welcome.
Once again, I am driving. I am right here.
Please, I am very hungover and in no mood to satisfy your need for approval. Sheldon, I do hope you will forgive me for my inappropriate behaviour last night.
I do not blame you. You were intoxicated.
Thank you.
I blame Penny.
I blame Penny, too. Bad Penny.
Wait a minute, what are you talking about? What inappropriate behaviour?
I think it is best that you not know.
Agreed.
Agreed.
What the hell, agreed.
And I want you to take very good care of this young woman.
Oh, thank you, Beverly.
You are welcome. She does not have much in the way of career prospects, do not make her responsible for her own orgasms as well.
Mother, remember when I was complaining that you do not communicate with me enough?
Yes, dear.
I am over it.
Fa-la-la-la-la, la-la la-la.
The apartment.
Look at us. Getting ready for a double date with actual women who publicly acknowledge they are our girlfriends.
Yes, actual women are the best.
I do not understand. What other kind of women are there?
Howard, artificial women are your department. You want to take this?
No, it would just freak him out. Listen, before we leave, I should warn you, I am a passionate man and I tend towards public displays of affection.
What are you trying to tell me, Howard?
There might be some making out in the car or the restaurant, and I do not want Bernadette to feel uncomfortable, so it would help if you and Penny made out, too.
Do not worry. We are planning to have sex right on the salad bar.
Namaste, white people. Good news! I rented us the four-hour edition of Watchmen.
Got it.
Seen it.
Detailed analysis posted online.
Well, then what are we going to do tonight?
Uh, sorry, Raj. Howard and I are going out to dinner with Penny and Bernadette.
Yeah, no more carefree bachelor nights for me and Leonard. These broncos have been saddled.
How did we get actual women?
Great. They get girlfriends, and they just abandon us?
It is great, is not it? We have a wonderful evening ahead of us.
We do?
Oh, yes. I just discovered I do not have enough room on my hard drive for a Linux partition, so you and I are going to perform a full backup, reinitialize and then reinstall all my operating systems.
I do not want to do that.
All right. Well, I am going to perform full backup, reinitialize and then reinstall all my operating systems.
What about me?
Well, I understand there are several types of artificial women. Maybe you should look into that.
A little later.

Dude, there is so many cool things we could be doing tonight. Look. At the Glendale Galleria, put on your best zoot suit, it is a salute to Swing music in the center court near Macy’s. 5pm to 9pm, huh, huh? A salute to zoot. Sounds like a hoot.
I am sorry, Raj, I have no desire to salute any article of clothing tonight. Much less one that is linked to race riots in the 1940s.
Race riots?
The zoot suit riots.
Oh. I always thought that was some sort of after-Christmas sale. Well, then why do not we just go to the galleria and walk around?
I do not need anything at the Galleria. Do you need anything at the Galleria?
No. We would just walk around and see what is what.
That is a semantically null sentence.

Okay, well, how about this? From the university Web site, 7pm to 10pm, Norton Hall Multipurpose Room, mixer for grad students and faculty of the science and humanities departments. Whether you split atoms or infinitives, this is the place to be.
Well, that is certainly amusing, but I have no interest.
Come on, Sheldon, the world is filled with people doing things outside. Let’s go outside. Outside is good.
If outside is so good, why has mankind spent thousands of years trying to perfect inside?
I do not know, it is a marketing scheme. Please, Sheldon, I am a young, virile visitor from a foreign land and I need to strut my stuff.
Let me offer you a compromise. Sometimes when I feel stifled and want a change of scenery, I use my imagination.
Oh, boy.
One of my favourite places to visit is the two-dimensional world described in Edwin Abbott’s mathematical fantasy, Flatland.
I do not want to go to Flatland.
You are only saying that because you have not been there. I am now a hexagon in two-dimensional space and can only perceive the edges of other objects.
Oy.
Is that you, Raj? I do not recognize your edge.
Sheldon, I am begging you. I want to go to this mixer, and I do not want to go alone.
Well, you are in luck, there is a mixer here in Flatland. Oh, look, there is a sexually attractive line segment, you should chat her up.
What?
Tell her you are a circle, Flatland gals are all hot for circles.
Leonard’s car.
I hope you are hungry, Bernadette, we are going to a terrific restaurant.
Oh, yeah, I am starved. When you spend all day in a bio-lab, watching flesh-eating bacteria skeletonize small rodents it really works up an appetite.
Flesh-eating bacteria. And yet, I still want to kiss this woman, what does that tell you?
That you’d be willing to die a horrible death on the off-chance you’d get to second base?
Oh, we are way past second base. Right, Howard?
Well, we kind of disagree about what the bases are.
How’s your work going, Penny? Any acting jobs?
Well, the last big thing I did was this production of Diary of Anne Frank above a bowling alley. But I think things might be turning around pretty soon.
Great. How come?
Well, promise you will not make fun of me.
Of course, I would never make fun of you.
Okay. Well, I went to this psychic who told me that if I cut my hair, I am going to get a national commercial.
Seriously? You are getting career advice from a psychic?
Good job not making fun of her.
She is not one of those phonies, okay. She wrote a book and has her own Web site.
Oh, gee, why did not you say so? They do not let just anyone have a Web site.
Why are you being such a jerk?
You are surprised? Your psychic did not tell you I was going to be a jerk?
Ha-ha, bite me.
Come on, Penny.
Why do not you kids go ahead and chat? We are gonna make out back here.
I am sliding into third.
The university mixer.
Thanks for coming with me.
Thanks for giving me your limited edition Green Lantern lantern.
Did you really have to bring it in with you?
What if evil strikes and my power ring runs low?
Come on, let’s get a drink.
I do not drink.
Yeah, well I do. And when my wingman is carrying a Green Lantern lantern, I drink a lot. I will have a screwdriver, please. Do not be chintzy with the screw.
I would like a root beer float.
Sheldon, they do not have ice cream.
They do not? Well, apparently, these people and I differ greatly on the definition of party.
He will have a Shirley Temple.
And do not be chintzy with the Shirley.
Okay, let’s check out the females.
All right. There is a female.
That is Professor Wilkinson’s wife, she is like 80 years old.
But she is female. Is not that the game?
No. I am looking for a hookup.
Oh, yes. So, the point of this exercise is for you to find someone to copulate with?
Not so loud, but ideally, yes. Thanks.
Thank you. And what is my function as wingman?
You help me run my game.
Okay. What is your game?
When I lie through my teeth to a woman, you nod and agree.
Hey, that is pretty cool. What is it?
It is a limited edition Green Lantern lantern. My friend is looking for someone to copulate with.
You are very funny. I am Abby.
I am Sheldon. How do you do?
How do you do? Rajesh Ramayan Koothrappali. Call me Raj.
Hi, Raj. Where are you from?
The mysterious subcontinent of India.
Ooh, India.
You know India?
I saw Slumdog Millionaire.
Well, I am a slumdog astrophysicist.
I thought your father was a gynaecologist. I am sorry.
Martha, come here. Meet Raj and Sheldon. This is my friend, Martha.
Hi.
Hello.
Hello.
Is that the limited edition Green Lantern lantern?
In brightest day, in darkest night, no evil shall escape my sight.
Oh, that is so awesome.
Thank you. Have you chosen one to copulate with?
A restaurant.
So, what should we talk about?
Well, we could always learn more about why people who believe in psychics are idiots. Leonard?
Oh, we do not need to talk about that anymore. Leonard covered it pretty well in the car.
I am sorry, but facts are facts.
Right, and if you cannot understand it, it is not a fact.
No, if it is not a fact, it is not a fact.
Oh, got it. Thank you for educating me.
You are welcome. How’s your fish?
Amazing. Would you like to try some?
Yeah, sure.
Well, the fact is, you cannot.
Come on, Howard, Bernadette, you are both scientists. Help me out here.
What do you think? Want to jump right into the middle of another couple’s argument?
No, thank you.
Sorry.
Maybe we should just stop talking about this.
Maybe some of us should stop talking altogether.
How is everything tonight?
Really uncomfortable.
The stairwell.

You know, the best thing about being in a committed, monogamous, mutually supportive relationship is that even if you have different ideas, you can have a spirited debate, yet still care for, even make love with…
What is going on?
We scored. I am the wingman.
Leonard’s lab.
Hey.
Laser.
Had a great night last night. I do not like to kiss and tell, but somebody made it to eighth base.
What the hell is eighth base?
Seventh base with shirt off. Well, my shirt. How’d things go with Penny?
Oh, could not be better.
Are we taking our relationship frustrations out on innocent Cylons?
It is not just Cylons. Superman’s next.
All right, I was going to try to squeeze in a little more mocking before lunch, but I can come back later when you do not have a high-powered weapon.
How can I go out with a woman who believes in psychics?
Hey, I once dated a girl who believed she was abducted by aliens.
And that did not bother you?
Au contraire. It meant she was gullible and open to a little probing.
What am I supposed to do, pretend I believe something I do not whenever I am with Penny?
Hey, I am sure Penny fakes all kinds of things when she is with you.
Do me a favour, lean over, put your head right here.

Let me show you another way to look at this. Here we have the universe of all women. These are the ones you want to sleep with. These are the women who believe exactly what you believe. These are the women who would be willing to sleep with you. And right there in the

What is your point? In order to keep having a sexual relationship with Penny, I have to give up everything I believe in, my intellectual integrity, the very nature of who I am? I cannot do that, Howard.
I respect that.
What is that?
Your new girlfriend. Have fun tonight.
The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
The dog… koira. The roof… katto. Grapes… ryp leet. One minute. Sis n.
What was that?
It means come in. It is taking forever to load the new operating system on my computer. I disinfected the kitchen and the bathroom, and now I thought I’d learn Finnish.
जो भी तुम्हारे नाव मंगाई. That is Hindi for whatever floats your boat. Uh, listen, I got a text from that girl Abby, and she and her friend Martha want to hang out with us again. What do you say?
I do not say anything. I merely offer you a facial expression that suggests you have gone insane.
I do not get it. You had a great time.
Yes, exactly, I had a great time. That is done, I have moved on to other things. For example, after I learn Finnish, I am not going to learn Finnish again.

Oh, man!
