Well, if it is not cholera, then based on a quick Internet search, the other explanations in decreasing order of likelihood are Hirschsprung’s Disease, botulism, a 30-foot tapeworm or accidental ingestion of chrysanthemum blossoms.
When would you have accidentally eaten chrysanthemum blossoms?
It is part of an unlikely scenario that involves sleepwalking and a 24-hour flower mart with a less-than-vigilant proprietor. Oh, Lord, my belly!
Have you had your appendix out?
I have not. I have been meaning to, but who has the time?
Let’s get you to the hospital.

So this is how it ends, with cruel irony. Just as I make the commitment to preserving my body, I am betrayed by my appendix, a vestigial organ. Do you know the original purpose of the appendix, Leonard?
No.
I do. And yet I am doomed while you live on.
Funny how things work out, is not it?
Oh, Lord, I think it is about to burst! On the other hand, it might have been the Brussels sprouts.
Good night.
Good night. Appendicitis. What a nervous Nelly.
The hallway.
Penny.
Coming, coming. Hey, nice knees.
Thank you. They are my mother’s.
Oh. And the Flash shirt is what? Because you are gonna run really fast?
No, the Flash shirt is because it is Friday, but it is nice when things work out. Where’s your heart rate monitor?
I do not have one.
What about your pedometer?
Do not have one.
Do you have telematics in your shoes connected to an iPod?
Uh, no.
What do you do, you just go out there and gambol about like a bunny?
No. I just run till I am hungry, then I stop for a bear claw.
Why are you doing that?
It is good to stretch your muscles before you run.
All right.
All right, let’s start with a toe touch. Okay, you do it.
I am doing it.
Oh. Wow. Good job. Okay, um, can you do this?
We will never know.
Okay, let’s just warm up on the run.
Okay.
Okay, let’s go.
Yeah, I have been reading up on biomechanics. I think you will be surprised at my… Wah! Oh!
Oh, my God, are you okay?
I think so.
Oh, let me help you up.
Thank you.
Oh, Sheldon!
If it makes you feel any better, Thursday is no longer Cruciferous Vegetable Night.
The apartment.
Here’s my chicken curry. Howard, your shrimp biryani.
Thank you, sir.
Palak paneer, that is Penny.
Thanks.
And for Rajesh Koothrappali, from whose homeland these tasty dishes originate, one large order of chicken McNuggets.
Hey, what is my share?
Uh, 12 bucks.
Okay, can I get you after Friday when I get paid?
Sure.
What am I up to now?
Well, okay, with the Indian food, the pizza, the Thai food, the tank of gas, the frozen yogurt and your rent, uh, a little over fourteen hundred dollars.
What now?
He is just expressing his admiration that you do not even have to put out to get free stuff.
It is not free, I am gonna pay him back. Shut up!
Sheldon, are you gonna join us?
Coming! . Greetings, friends.
Greetings, whatever the hell you are.

I am a mobile virtual presence device. Recent events have demonstrated to me that my body is too fragile to endure the vicissitudes of the world. Until such time as I am able to transfer my consciousness, I shall remain in a secure location and interact with the world in this manner.
Really? That is your question? When did he put a ramp in?
You are in my spot. This may seem a little odd at first, but over time you will grow accustomed to dealing with me in this configuration.
Yeah, to be honest, I do not see much difference.

Thank you. That is what I was going for. Now, Leonard, tomorrow, when we go to work, you will need to allow some extra time to get me down the stairs. For your convenience, I disassemble into four pieces.
This is ridiculous. I am coming to talk to you.
You do not know where I am. My physical body is safely ensconced in a secure, undisclosed location.
You are in your bedroom.
No, I am not.
I can hear your voice coming from your bedroom.
No, you cannot. Wait. Come back. Halt. Authorized personnel only!
So, either one of you weirdos want to buy my underwear? Only fourteen hundred bucks.
Sheldon’s bedroom.
Sheldon, this is ridiculous.
I am behind you. Please look at me when you are talking to me.
I am looking at you.
No, you are not. Pay no attention to that man in the bed.
You cannot exist as a virtual presence. Not here and certainly not at work. Oh, good God.
At my age, do you know how I am statistically most likely to die?
At the hands of your roommate?
An accident.
That is how I am going to make it look.
Until I can transfer my intellect to a more durable container, my body will remain safely ensconced in my bed.
Fine, but do not expect my help.
You have to help, it is in the roommate agreement.
No, it is not.
Section 74.C. The various obligations and duties of the parties in the event one of them becomes a robot.
I will be damned.
Leonard’s car
This is delightful.
Uh-huh.
It is much easier to enjoy the picturesque route we travel to work when you remove the spectre of fiery vehicular death.
Refresh my memory. Why did not I just put you in the trunk?
Because I called shotgun. Remember?
Right.
You seem tense. Perhaps this will relax you.
I do not want to listen to music, Sheldon.
Very well. I do not understand why you are not enjoying this. Together, in this car, with my enhanced capabilities, we are like Knight Rider.
Except in Knight Rider, the car is not a yammering sphincter.
You mock the sphincter, but the sphincter is a class of muscle without which human beings could not survive. There are over 50 different sphincters in the human body. How many can you name?
I was wrong, this is exactly like Knight Rider.
Perhaps you’d be interested in a different game.
No.

This is a photograph of the 1911 Solvay Conference on the theory of radiation and quanta. Using Photoshop, I have introduced a few anachronisms. See if you can spot all 24. I will give you the first one. Madame Curie should not be wearing a digital watch. And go.
That is it. Bye-bye.
Bazinga.
Whoa!
I have an override switch.
I almost died!
And I am safe and sound in bed. Who’s crazy now?
I am still going to go with you.
A corridor at the university.
Hello, Professor Hoskins. Nice to see you, Mindy. Konichi-wa Dr. Nakamora. Sorry the Swedes disproved your theory. Leonard, my door.
What about it?
Be a lamb and open it for me.
Why? What is the problem?
You think you have me stymied, do not you?
No, I think a doorknob has you stymied.
Oh, look, it is Leonard and R2-D-Bag.
That is my joke. I told it last night. You cannot just use it.
Raj, be a lamb and open the door for me.
Oh, sure.
He is a lamb. You are not.
I am a lamb.
The Cheesecake Factory
Is not this nice? The pleasures of fellowship and camaraderie without having to tolerate your germy breath on my skin.
I say we just take him to Tatooine and sell him to some Jawas.
That is two, dude. Write your own jokes.
Oh, great. Hi, I am Penny, I will be your waitress.
Why are you introducing yourself?
I’d rather people not know I have any prior connection to you whatsoever.
Can you tell me the specials this evening?
Sheldon, I am not waiting on you.
Obviously. I do not even have water yet.
Because you are not here.
That is discrimination against the otherwise located. I am going to have to go over your head. Manager, manager. Oh, Lord, look who it is.
Is that Steve Wozniak?
I think it is.
The Great and Powerful Woz.
Penny, Steve Wozniak was one of the cofounders of Apple Computer. He and Steve Jobs started it…
Yeah, I know who he is. I watch Dancing with the Stars.
I must speak to him.
Of course you must.
You know, there is an Olive Garden down the street. You guys should try it sometime.
Excuse me, Mr. Wozniak?
Oh, hey. Nice virtual presence device.
Thank you. I just want to say I am a big fan. You are my fifteenth favourite technological visionary.
Only fifteenth?
It is still six spots above Steve Jobs. I care neither for turtlenecks nor showmanship.
Yeah, I never got that turtleneck thing.
One of my proudest possessions is a vintage 1977 Apple Two. Despite the file system limitations of Apple DOS 3.3, it was a pretty nifty little achievement.
Thanks, we were shooting for nifty. You know, if you had it here, I’d autograph it for you.
Do not move for 15 to 30 minutes, depending on how the buses are running.
Nerds.
The hallway. Sheldon exits carrying the Apple 2.
I am coming, Woz, I am coming. Ow! Aw.
The hallway. Sheldon-bot approaches Penny’s door and starts bashing into it.
Penny.
What up, Shel-Bot?
I cannot get out of bed. I hurt my ankle.
What do you want me to do?
Sing me Soft Kitty.
Really, you want me to sing Soft Kitty to a computer monitor?
Would you rather come over and sing it to me in person?
Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur.
Closer to the microphone.
Happy kitty, sleepy…
No. You have to start over.
Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur. Happy kitty, sleepy kitty, purr, purr, purr.
The apartment.
All right, I am ready for my next question.
In a world where rhinoceroses are domesticated pets, who wins the Second World War?
Uganda.
Defend.

Kenya rises to power on the export of rhinoceroses. A Central African power block is formed, colonizing North Africa and Europe. When war breaks out, no one can afford the luxury of a rhino. Kenya withers, Uganda triumphs.
Correct. My turn.
In a world where a piano is a weapon, not a musical instrument, on what does Scott Joplin play The Maple Leaf Rag?
Tuned bayonets.
Defend.
Is not it obvious?
You are right. My apologies.
What the hell are you guys playing?
It is a game we invented. It is called Counterfactuals.
We postulate an alternate world that differs from ours in one key aspect and then pose questions to each other.
It is fun for ages eight to eighty. Join us.
All right. I like a good brainteaser. Give it a whirl.
You are in luck, this is an easy one. In a world where mankind is ruled by a giant intelligent beaver, what food is no longer consumed?
Uh, a BLT where the B stands for beaver? I do not know.
Leonard, be serious. We are playing a game here.
I can figure this out, let’s see. Um, well, beavers eat tree bark. The only tree bark I know that humans consume is cinnamon. So, I will say cinnamon.
Incorrect. Obviously, the answer is cheese Danish.
What?

In a world ruled by a giant beaver, mankind builds many dams to please the beaver overlord. The low-lying city of Copenhagen is flooded. Thousands die. Devastated, the Danes never invent their namesake pastry. How does one miss that?
This is ridiculous. You are just making stuff up.
Is he always like this when he loses?
Oh, yes. You should have been here for the great Jenga tantrum of 2008.
You bumped the table and you know it.
Perhaps it would be kinder to play a game more suited to his abilities. We will close our eyes and count to ten while you hide.
I am going to my room.
Very good, Leonard. But next time, do not tell us where you are hiding.
The Cheesecake Factory
Did you guys see the paper in The American Physics Journal on supersolids? It is pretty interesting. This guy’s working from a hypothesis where…
Spoiler alert! Spoiler alert.
What?
Do not ruin it for me, man. I printed out a PDF to read on the potty.
On the potty? What are you, five?
It is a potty. What do you call it?
Toilet.
That is a little vulgar for the dinner table, do not you think?
Oh, and potty is okay?
Potty is innocent. Potty is adorable.
What do you do in the potty, wee-wee?
If I do not have to boom-boom.
Greetings. You all remember Amy Farrah Fowler.
Sure.
Nice to see you.
Hello.
Sorry we are late.
I must take responsibility. I had to stop for feminine hygiene supplies.
Ah, ah.
Okay.
I believe she is experiencing her menses.
Actually, I am not. In order to avoid surprises, I wear them all the time.
Ah, ah.
Okay. Toilet’s sounding pretty good now, huh?
Hey, look, it is Shamy.
Shamy?
A juvenile amalgamation of our names. Sheldon and Amy, Shamy.
Oh. I do not like that. Do not do that.
All righty. What is new?
Well, just recently, I learned that you refer to us as Shamy, and I do not like that.
I got it. But what I was going for was, you know, how’s your life?
Like everybody else’s. Subject to entropy, decay and eventual death. Thank you for asking. Why is she not taking our order?
I should have warned you, one has to navigate a labyrinth of social nonsense before one can be fed here.
Really? I assumed an establishment called the Cheesecake Factory would function more efficiently.
It is how they lure you in. I believe it is called bait and switch.
Okay, I am just gonna walk away, ’cause I do not want to be here.
So, this is nice. First time we have all gotten together to eat.
You are right, he is a festival of humdrum chitchat.
Okay, that is all I got. Howard, you are up.
Um, tell us about your work, Amy.
I doubt you’d understand. Sheldon tells me you only have a master’s degree.
Raj, do you have any questions for Amy?
I am curious as to why we are not eating alone.
They cannot function without me. I am the social glue that holds this little group together. You are welcome.
The stairwell.
Listen, can I talk to you about your girlfriend?
She is not my girlfriend. She is a girl and she is my friend, but there is no touching or unsanitary exchange of saliva.
Got it.
Although, for the record, on one occasion, she licked her thumb to remove raspberry jelly from the corner of my mouth. It is an action we both regret to this day.
Uh-huh. Anyway, I am not sure she is the best fit for our little, how should we call it, rebel alliance.
Oh, I never identified with the rebel alliance. Despite their tendency to build Death Stars, I have always been more of an empire man.
Yeah, not my point.
I know what your point is. You are intimidated by Amy’s intellect. To that I say, buck up.
Okay, let me just get right to it. Amy is judgmental, sanctimonious and frankly just obnoxious.
So?
So we already have you for all that.
Are you suggesting I terminate my relationship with Amy?
No, no, of course not. Just have your relationship someplace else.

May I point out that for eight long months, I suffered in silence as your female companion filled our apartment with her off-key country music caterwauling, the unappetizing spectacle of her grinding a pumice stone against her calloused feet in our living room, and night after night of uninformative TV documentaries about the Jersey Shore.
Suffered in silence?
Yes. And I’d thank you to do the same.
Really? Silence?
Penny’s apartment.
Ah. Nothing makes beer taste better than cool clear Rocky Mountain spring water. Where are the Rocky Mountains, anyway?
Philadelphia.
Really? I thought they were out West someplace.
Think about it, Raj. Where did the movie Rocky take place?
Philadelphia. Okay, now I get it.
So this is the plan? From now on, we are just gonna hide out in here to avoid the Shamy?
I am very comfortable here. Penny, dear, why do not you shoot another silver bullet my way?
Get one yourself.
Ooh, somebody’s been taking bitchy pills.
God, he is an ass when he drinks.
Oh, he is an ass when he does not. You just do not hear it.
I think we need to start entertaining the possibility that the Shamy could go on for years.
Well, if that is the case, Penny will have to get satellite TV and maybe once a week run a vacuum through this place.
I thought you were going to talk to Sheldon.
I did.
Well, what’d he say?
Well, he pointed out that he kinda, sorta had to put up with you.
Kinda, sorta had to?
I did not agree with him.
Well, you defended me, right?
I tried, but he made a fairly well-reasoned argument.
You are not doing that right.
What?
Gimme.
No.
Trust me.
No!
I do this for my mom all the time. See? With the grain.
Wow, that is better.
And someday, when you have varicose veins, I will show you how to massage them.
The University Cafeteria.
Oh, God, never again.
I assume by never again, you mean never again will you drink all of Penny’s beer, then run down to the gas station for a couple of 40s, a box of Slim Jims and the latest issue of Bombay Badonkadonks.
I was homesick.
The highlight of the evening was when you showed us your Bollywood break dancing skills.
That is very offensive.
Yeah, we all thought so.
Oh, no.
What?
John and Yoko.
More like Yoko and Yoko.
Greetings.
Hey.
I brought Amy here to show her some of the work I am doing.
It is very impressive, for theoretical work.
Do I detect a hint of condescension?
I am sorry, was I being too subtle? I meant compared to the real-world applications of neurobiology, theoretical physics is, what is the word I am looking for? Hmm, cute.
Oooh!
Are you suggesting the work of a neurobiologist like Babinski could ever rise to the significance of a physicist like Clarke-Maxwell or Dirac?
I am stating it outright. Babinski eats Dirac for breakfast and defecates Clarke-Maxwell.
You take that back.

Absolutely not. My colleagues and I are mapping the neurological substrates that subserve global information processing, which is required for all cognitive reasoning, including scientific inquiry, making my research ipso facto prior in the ordo cognoscendi. That means it is better than his research, and by extension, of course, yours.
I am sorry, I am-I am still trying to work on the defecating Clark Maxwell, so…
Excuse me, but a grand unified theory, insofar as it explains everything, will ipso facto explain neurobiology.
Yes, but if I am successful, I will be able to map and reproduce your thought processes in deriving a grand unified theory, and therefore, subsume your conclusions under my paradigm.
That is the rankest psychologism, and was conclusively revealed as hogwash by Gottlob Frege in the 1890s!
We appear to have reached an impasse.
I agree. I move our relationship terminate immediately.
Seconded.
There being no objections…
No, uh-uh.
The motion carries. Good day, Amy Farrah Fowler.
Good day, Sheldon Cooper.
Women, huh? Cannot live with them, cannot successfully refute their hypotheses.
Amen to that.
The laundry room.
Hey, Sheldon.
Hello.
I hear you broke up with Amy.
A breakup would imply she was my girlfriend. She was a girl who was my friend who is now a girl who is not my friend.
Wow. That is like the worst country song ever. So, how are you doing?
Regarding what?
Amy.
I do not follow.
Well, breakups, or whatever the hell this is, can be tough.

Penny, I assure you, I am fine. My relationship with Amy was purely intellectual. There were no emotional bonds, the severing of which would cause me any discomfort. The relationship simply outlived its utility, and I am continuing on with my life as before.
Okay. Good.
Now, if you will excuse me, I am off to buy a pussycat.
The cafeteria.
I gotta tell you guys, I am a little worried about Sheldon.
We are all a little worried about Sheldon.
No, I mean since the Shamy hit a reef.
Oh, I thought you were just making a generalization, you know, I am worried about Sheldon someday setting off a low-yield nuclear device because the cafeteria ran out of lime Jell-O.
What does hit a reef mean?
Uh, went splitsville.
Pardon?
Turned to boom-boom.
Ah.
I think Sheldon really misses Amy.
You should lend him your copy of Bombay Badonkadonks.
He got a cat to keep him company.
You are kidding.
He takes it everywhere, to bed, to the bathroom.
He takes the kitty to the potty?
I thought we discussed the P-word.
Do not try to change me, dude. I am what I am.
Oh, gentlemen.
Hey. Are not you going to introduce us to your little friend?
My apologies. Raj, Howard, I’d like you to meet Dr. Robert Oppenheimer.
Hello.
Hi.
Now, if you will excuse me, the father of the atomic bomb wants a saucer of milk.
Okay, I get it. We are worried about Sheldon.
Yeah.
The apartment. Leonard arrives.
Hey. Oh, no.
Robert Oppenheimer was lonely.
So you decided to get the whole Manhattan Project?
Yes. This is Enrico Fermi, Richard Feynman, Edward Teller, Otto Frisch, and Zazzles.
Zazzles?
I was going to name him Herman von Helmholtz, but he is so zazzy.
Okay, we need to talk.
About what?
Cats, Sheldon. You are clearly upset about Amy being gone, and you are trying to replace her with a bunch of cats.
Clowder.
What?
A group of cats is a clowder. Or a glaring.
Okay, yeah, fine.
It is the kind of thing you ought to know now that we have one.
Terrific. My-my point is you need to face up to what you are feeling with this breakup.
It was not a breakup. A breakup would imply that Amy was my girlfriend.

Okay, I got it, I got it, she is not your girlfriend. Now listen to me. I know about loneliness. I know about trying to replace someone with other stuff. When I broke up with Penny, I got back into my cello, I built a bunch of model rockets, I got those weightlifting gloves and that five-pound dumbbell.
You did not break up, she dumped you.
She did not dump me. It was mutual!
I was there. She dumped you.
Okay, fine. Live with cats. Be like my Aunt Nancy. She had dozens of them. And do you know what happened after she died? They ate her.
You do not have to sell me on cats, Leonard. I am already a fan. All right, fellas, who’s in the mood for Fancy Feast? Well, that is not fancy at all.
The apartment.
Hi, Mrs. Cooper. Thanks for coming.
Where is he?
He is in his bedroom.
Now, when you said on the phone he broke up with a girl, you meant an actual girl, not something you kids whipped up in a lab?
No, she is real.
Did they sin?
No, no, it is not like that. It is, uh, I do not know what it is like. But there is something I should prepare you for.
Oh, relax, Leonard, I have raised that boy. I have seen him at his best, I have seen him at his worst. There is nothing he can do that will surprise me.
Hold on to that thought.
Come in.
Surprise.
Mom, what an unexpected pleasure.
My, my, that is a powerful smell.
I’d like you to meet Oppenheimer, Frisch, Panofsky, Feynman, Weisskopf…
Yeah, I get it. You got a lot of cats and you gave ’em cute Jewish names.
What are you doing here?
Leonard called, and he said that you were pining for a young lady.
Oh, that is preposterous. I am not pining over anyone.
Oh, lambchop, we can quibble what to call it, but I think we can both agree it is creepy.
I do not agree. Cats make wonderful companions. They do not argue or question my intellectual authority, and this little guy here, I think you will find to be quite zazzy.
You should have called sooner.
The kitchen.
Shelly! Dinner’s ready!
Coming!
No cats!
Aw. What is she doing here?
I called her.
Your mother thinks you might be losing your mind over me. As a neurobiologist, I was curious.
Well, rest assured, I am in full possession of my faculties.
25 cats!
Oh, God bless you, dear. Sheldon, sit down. Let’s talk.
All right, but you are not fooling me. Whenever you say we have to talk, it means you want me to listen.
Then stop talking.
Yes, ma’am.

Now, the reason I called Amy over was to find out what type of person she is. And after chatting a bit, I have to say that while she is a perfectly unique young woman, you two are definitely not suited for each other.
That is a peculiar conclusion. By any standard, Amy is more similar to me than anyone I have ever met.
Oh, I am sorry, Shelly, I cannot see it.
Well, whether you see it or not is irrelevant. I cannot see subatomic particles, but nevertheless, they are there.
Excellent point.
A physics point.
Touche.
Well, putting aside the pig Latin, it is a good thing that you two decided to end the relationship so I did not have to end it for you.
Amy, after consideration, I believe we may have acted rashly. I propose we resume our relationship and attempt to resolve our differences.
I will agree to that only if you will stipulate that 80% of our difficulties were caused by you.
I will go as high as 40.
Sixty-five.
Done. You understand that moving forward, we deal with the fact that my mother does not approve of you?
I do. I find being cast in the role of bad girl oddly titillating.
Would you like to see my cats?
I would. I love cats. They are the epitome of indifference.
Ah, then you may find Zazzles a little cloying.
I saw what you did there.

He thinks he is such a smarty pants. He is no different from any man. You tell ’em not to do something, that is all they want to do. If I had not told my brother Stumpy not to clear out the wood chipper by hand, we’d still be calling him Edward. Now, do not you move. I will bring over all the food.
No, no, no, I can do it.
Well, is not that sweet?
Outside. Sheldon is sitting at a table with a sign reading “Cats $20”)
Thank you, Amy. Here’s your cat. And here’s your $20.
Next!
Thank you, Amy. Here’s your cat. And here’s your $20.
Next!
The Cheesecake Factory.
I am telling you, if xenon emits ultraviolet light, then those dark matter discoveries must be wrong.

Yes, well, if we lived in a world where slow-moving xenon produced light, then you’d be correct. Also, pigs would fly, my derriere would produce cotton candy, and The Phantom Menace would be a timeless classic.
Oh, you are so arrogant. If you were a superhero, your name would be Captain Arrogant. And you know what your superpower would be? Arrogance.
You are wrong again. If my superpower were arrogance, my name would be Dr. Arroganto.
I love watching Raj and Sheldon try to work together.
Yeah, it is like if Alien and Predator decided to go partners in a Jamba Juice.
Has it occurred to you you are missing the big picture? If you look at neutron scattering data…
Oh, Penny? Penny?
What is up?
Nothing. I just wanted to make Raj stop talking.
No, no, no. He won. Suck it up.

Well, I’d ask you guys if you want dessert, but I know Sheldon does not eat dessert on Tuesdays. And even if Raj wanted something, he could not tell me. Howard will not order anything, but he will come up with some sort of skeevy comment involving the words pie or cheesecake. And Leonard’s lactose intolerant, so he cannot eat anything here without his intestines blowing up like a balloon animal.
Hang on a second. I could have the fruit platter.
You want the fruit platter?
Does it have melon on it?
Yeah.
No, I cannot eat melon.
Oh, Howard, heads up. Your ex-girlfriend just came in for her shift.
When was the last time you saw her?
Oh, not since we broke up. Wow. How am I going to play this? Sophisticated and relaxed? Friendly, noncommittal? Cold and distant? .
Hi, guys.
Hey.
Hello. I see you decided to go with pathetic and frightened.
It is one of his best moves.
Howard’s bedroom. Howard enters in a silk dressing gown, puts on romantic music and sets up mood lighting. Gets onto bed.
So, my dear, we meet again.
Hello, Howard. I have missed you.
I have missed you, Katee Sackhoff.
One question.
Anything.
Why am I wearing my Battlestar Galactica flight suit in bed?
Why are you in bed with me? If we start to question this, it all falls apart.
Sorry. Oh, ravish me, Howard. My loins ache for you.
Okay, if you insist.
Howard, have you seen my girdle?!
No, Ma!
I cannot find it, and I am late for my Weight Watchers meeting!
Maybe it committed suicide! Leave me alone! Now, where were we?
I believe you were about to rip off my uniform with your teeth.
Bernadette? What are you doing here?
Well, if I had to guess, I’d say I am here because you saw me earlier this evening, and you are still hung up on me.
No, I am not.
Clearly you are. Otherwise, based on past experience, we’d be done by now.
Okay, I am a little confused here.
Oh, my. Can I help?
Not that kind of confused.
What is George Takei doing here?
Howard, do you have latent homosexual tendencies?
No, of course not.
So you say. Yet, here I am.
George, let me ask you something. How did you deal with being typecast as a science fiction icon?
It is difficult. You try and stretch as an actor, do Strindberg, O’Neill, but all they want is, Course laid in, Captain.
Tell me about it. It is frackin’ frustrating.

You might as well just wait at the airport for your flight.
The apartment. Sheldon is on his laptop.
You are in a forest. There is quicksand to the west, a path leads to the east. Go east. An iron gate blocks your way. Open gate. It is locked. Hmm, well, so much for that.
It is getting pretty late, how come you are still up?
I have found an emulator online that lets you play classic text based computer games from the 1980s.
That is pretty cool.
Oh yes. It runs on the world’s most powerful graphics chip, imagination.
You have really got to get out more.

Go north. You cannot go that way. Go west. A troll blocks your passage. Okay, fasten your seatbelts, kill troll. With what? With sword. You do not have the sword. Good golly, it is as if it is actually happening to me.
Raj finally went to bed.
Yeah, well, Sheldon’s still up.
You said he goes to bed at nine.
Yeah, he does but he got caught up in a computer game and…
Hit troll with axe. Hit troll with axe. Hit troll with axe. Oh my, this is one tough troll.
Cannot you get rid of him?
If the past is any indication, no.
Leonard, I am trapped in quicksand, the axe is dragging me down.
Drop axe.
Drop axe. Brilliant.
Give me a minute. Sheldon,
Hold on. I have to figure out how to get the bucket, so I can carry the mud past the dragon.
Sheldon, you need to work in the morning.
I know.
Well then, bed mister.
Five more minutes.
Really? You are going to risk getting sleepy in the middle of your thermodynamic fluctuations seminar? You know what happens when you yawn in public.
Everyone will see my oddly shaped uvula.
You do not want that, do you?
No. But it is a shame our society mocks the differently uvulated. Who was at the door?
Oh, uh, building manager. They have to fix a pipe so the water will be off tomorrow from noon to two.
That is unacceptable. We are supposed to be given written notice.
No, no, it does not matter, we will be at work.
Well, what if I spill tomato soup on my shirt and have to come home to change, only to find there is no water for an enzyme soak.
Bifurcated uvula, Sheldon!
I will have the chicken noodle. Goodnight.
We are going to have to be very quiet.

I know how to get the bucket! I can turn the axe around and use the handle to reach it. Let’s see. Go north. You are in a forest. Go north. You are in a forest. Go north. You are in a forest. Oh dear, I believe I am lost. Well, I will just have to get a fresh start tomorrow.
No, no, no, no, no. You just need, you just need, you just need to map it out. Come on, I will help you. So, uh, you stopped at the stream and you turned north three times?
Yes.
You are right, you are lost, good luck.
Leonard’s bedroom. Morning.
Oh! Leonard, wake up.
Huh! Sorry!
For what?
I do not know. When I am in bed with a girl, it is just, it is my go to response.
It is six o’ clock, I have to get back to Raj’s before he wakes up and realises I am gone.
Oh, right, sure. I wish you could stay in LA a while longer.
Mmm. Me too.
You know, I was thinking, there are some great research facilities in India.
Where are you going with this, Leonard?
Well, I am just saying, I do not have any real ties here, so if I were to move to New Delhi we could, you know, go out.
Leonard, did not we have this conversation five years ago.
Well, yes, but, things have changed, you know, you are older, I am older. Look, no more superhero bedsheets.
Sweetheart, just because we have fun when I come to town does not mean I want to have a serious relationship.
It does not?
Mm-mm. And besides, I could never bring a white boy home to my parents. They’d have a cow. Which is a much bigger deal in India.
I am not that white. My great-great grandmother was half Cherokee. I know that is not the right kind of Indian but it is something.
Aha, you are funny.
Leonard.
What?
I heard a woman laughing.
Oh, uh, yeah, I was trying to see if I could laugh as a woman.
Oh. Well, good job, quite convincing. I smell perfume.
Air freshener.
And is that lipstick on your cheek and neck.
Uh, rash, that is a bad rash.
My sympathies. I am no stranger to the crimson scourge that is dermatitis. Can I interest you in a topical steroid from my lotion and unguent collection?
Uh, yeah, yeah, that sounds great.
Very well, I am sure I can find something that will help you ditch that itch.
Okay, he is in the bathroom, let’s go.
Do you prefer ointment or cream?
Uh, cream.
With or without a numbing agent?
Without.
Really? Leonard, there are no heroes when it comes to dermatitis.
Fine. With.
Prescription or non-prescription strength.
Use your best judgement.
Well, I think I have a nice 2009 AnaMantle HC. It is usually indicated for acutely inflamed haemorrhoids, but it also goes nicely with non mucosal body parts.
Sounds great.
Excellent choice.
Right, right, alright.
Priya?
Good morning, Sheldon.
For shame, Leonard. For shame. And to think I was ready to waste the last of my good haemorrhoid cream on you.
Leonard’s car.
Making pretty good time, huh?
Is that really what you want to talk about, Leonard?
No.
What do you want to talk about?
Please do not tell anyone I spent the night with Raj’s sister.
There it is. What if someone asks?
No-one’s going to ask if I spent the night with Raj’s sister.
Perhaps. But they might ask me something else.
Like what?
Like, has Leonard betrayed any of his friends recently?
Priya and I are both adults. We did not betray Raj.
In fact, you did, but I was referring to Howard.
What are you talking about?

April 12, 2005, Bob’s Big Boy, Toluca Lake. Raj had just introduced us to Priya for the first time, and she was enjoying the sweet taste of Hindu rebellion in the form of a Bob’s Super Big Boy hamburger. In order to preserve your friendship, you and Howard made a pinky swear that neither of you would attempt to woo her. I had a patty melt.
Okay, fine, I betrayed Howard.
And Raj.
Alright, and Raj.
And me.
You?
Violation of the roommate agreement, overnight guest notification clause.
Okay fine, I am, I am a horrible human being, I am the Darth Vader of Pasadena.
You are far too short to be Darth Vader. At best you might be a turncoat Ewok.
My point is, Priya’s gone. And it would be much better if no-one else found out about this.
You mean, you want me to keep a secret.
Yes.
You know I cannot keep a secret.
You can if you try. Think about it this way, if I were Batman and you were Alfred, you’d keep that secret. Right?
Why do you get to be Batman?
Because, well, Batman has the secret.
Well Alfred has secrets too.
Like what?
Alfred knows that Barbara Gordon is Batgirl. Which I have now just told to Batman. See, I cannot keep a secret.
Leonard’s lab.
Ta-da!
What.
Ta-da. It is short for da-da-da-da!
Kind of busy here, Sheldon.
I know, that is why I shortened it.
What do you want.
I came to go over your alibi for last night.
What alibi?

You have asked me to lie on your behalf, and as you know, I am deeply uncomfortable with impromptu dishonest, so I have provided you with an iron clad alibi. You could not have spent last night with Priya, because you were with another woman.
Oh, I am so sure I am going to regret this, but, who was I with?
The fun loving, and morally loose, Miss Maggie McGeary.
Oh, God.
You met her at Pasadena’s most popular Irish watering hole, Lucky Baldwin’s, where Maggie spends her nights tending bar, with a head full of curls and a heart full of dreams.
Leonard, call me if you are interested in coitus. Sincerely, Maggie McGeary.
And if anyone were to actually call that number they will hear this.
Top of the morning to you. You have reached Maggie McGeary. Leave a message after the wee little beep.
It is pretty convincing, huh? And it was not even a real person. And here is the clincher. A lock of Maggie’s flaming auburn hair.
Where did you get that?
From an orang-u-tan in the primate lab.
An orang-u-tan?
Well, no-one’s going to run a DNA test on it, Leonard, honestly you over-think everything.

Sheldon, I do not need an alibi. Nobody’s going to ask about last night as long as you just zip your lip. Thankyou. Now do not worry, everything is going to be fine. (Sheldon writes “I doubt it” on Leonard’s whiteboard.
The cafeteria.
Hey.
Hey, Leonard, will you please tell Howard my sister’s never been attracted to him.
C’mon Raj, how am I supposed to know who she is attracted to. Or was attracted to. Or who she might be attracted to. In the future.
And I have nothing to contribute to this conversation. Because I too know absolutely nothing about Priya’s preferences in male companionship. And with that, I will re-zip my lip.
Hey, so what did you guys think of the new episode of Caprica last night?
I did not see it.
Did not see it? What were you doing?
Uh, I was out.
On Caprica night?
Yeah, I, uh, went for a drink.
Really, you, and where, where did you go?
To, uh, Lucky Baldwin’s.
Oh, I have heard of that place, is not that Pasadena’s favourite Irish watering hole.
Yes.
Did you meet anyone interesting there, perhaps a promiscuous redheaded barmaid?
As a matter of fact I.. I… I cannot… I cannot… I cannot do it.
Sure you can, you are doing fine, it is very believable.
Look, I am sorry Raj, but the truth is I was with Priya last night.
Do not listen to him, he is still light headed from all the Irish whiskey and pickled eggs in his system.
What were you doing with Priya?
I believe they engaged in coitus but, more importantly, if Leonard had not abandoned his story, would you have found it plausible?
What? You slept with my sister?
Yeah.
How could you? We had a pact!
Excuse me, I think how could you she is my sister takes precedence over a five year old pinky swear!
May I point out, in a parallel universe, your friends are saying Maggie McGeary, she sounds lovely.
Look, I admit it, I may have crossed a line here, but come on, Raj, your sister is a grown woman. To her, I am a forbidden piece of white chocolate.
I… I do not believe it, this is a terrible betrayal of my trust.
No, no, no, would it help if I told you that I offered her my heart and she kind of stomped on it.
How hard did she stomp?
Very hard.
Okay, I am good.
Yeah, well, Raj, I just want to say that I’d never betray your trust. Unlike Leonard, I respect you.
Really?
Mmm.
Was it out of respect that you did not tell Raj about the time you dropped his iPhone in a urinal?
Dude! I put that thing on my face!
I think a more amusing violation of Raj’s trust is when Howard convinced him that foreigners give presents to Americans on Thanksgiving.
Hey, I did not see you giving back your Snoopy snowcone maker.
That was all a lie? This year’s gifts are already wrapped!
And as long as we are talking about betraying our friends, how about the month Sheldon spent grinding up insects and mixing them into Leonard’s food.
Well, excuse me. That was not a betrayal, that was an experiment to determine at what concentration food starts tasting mothy.
You put moths in my food?
For science.
I cannot believe you kissed my sister with moth mouth.
Well, uh, I cannot believe you used Sheldon’s toothbrush.
You used my toothbrush?
Not the brush part, just the little rubber thing to pick food from my teeth and massage my gums.

Okay, I, I, I think it is safe to say that we have all done some things we are not particularly proud of. But come on, we are friends. Friends overlook each other’s minor lapses. For the record, Howard, I am sorry that I broke our pact.
Thankyou, and I am sorry about your phone. And Thanksgiving. And while we are at it, you do not have to wash our clothes on the fourth of July.
As long as we are apologising, Sheldon, I, I am sorry I used your toothbrush.
And I am sorry. But that behaviour is beyond the pale and cannot be tolerated. We are no longer friends.
I got you a talking Thomas the Tank Engine for Thanksgiving.
With real puffing smoke?
Yes.
Alright. But I am watching you.
The apartment. Sheldon is making snowcones.
Hey, you got Snoopy out. Can I have a snowcone?
Well, sure.
These are pretty god, what flavour is this?
Guess.
Papaya?
No.
Guava?
You are so close.
I give up.
Mango, caterpillar. What are you doing? You said you liked it!
The University Cafeteria.
No, seriously, I think I have finally figured out my problem with women.
The capybara is the largest member of the rodent family.
What does that have to do with me and women?
Nothing. It was a desperate attempt to introduce an alternate topic of conversation.

My problem is, I do not project confidence. So I decided that the next time I meet a woman I think is attractive, rather than holding back and being cautious, I am going to assume the mantle of self-assurance.
Oh, yeah? What is that look like?
Hi. I am Leonard. And you are beautiful. You pop, sparkle and buzz electric. I am going to pick you up at eight, show you a night you will never forget.
Where are we going?
Good news. I made it onto the team for the new Defence Department laser-equipped surveillance satellite.
Excuse me. If we are changing topics, I believe I have first dibs with capybara, a rodent the size of a baby hippo.
Congratulations Howard.
Thanks. Listen, I have to get a security clearance, so you guys might be hearing from the FBI.
Whoa, whoa, whoa! I do not want to speak to the FBI.
Why not?
I am brown and I talk funny.
They are just doing a background check on me.
It does not matter. They will find a reason to give me a one-way ticket back to Gandhi-ville. By the way, when I say that, it is not offensive.
Do not be ridiculous, Raj. You are here legally.
Nobody cares. Do you know how long it is been since I got through airport security without being given a colonoscopy?
You know, I try very hard to make our lunch hours educational and informative, but your insistence on talking about your own lives stymies me at every turn.
Fine, Sheldon, tell us about your giant rodents.
No, you squandered your time with me, and the moment has now passed. Feast on your disappointment, much as the capybara feasts on its own waste.
Raj’s apartment. Raj is reading New Moon.
Oh, Bella, do not you see? Edward’s only pushing you away because he loves you. Coming.
Dr. Koothrappali? Oh, thank you. All right. Well, how long have you known Mr. Wolowitz?
Rum cake?
No, thanks. Now, about Mr. Wolowitz.
Seven years.
I see.
I am in this country legally, you know.
I am sure you are. Now, to your knowledge, has Mr. Wolowitz ever committed a crime?
Of course not. I am here on an H-1B visa, which means I cannot be associated in any way with crime or criminal activity. And I am not.
Good. To your knowledge, does Mr. Wolowitz have any foreign contacts?
No, just me. Oh, there it is. Here comes a cavity search.
Excuse me?
Please do not send me back to India, it is so crowded. It is like the whole country is one endless Comic-Con, except everybody’s wearing the same costume, Indian Guy.
Dr. Koothrappali, I am not…
I love this country! The-the baseball, the freedom, the rampant morbid obesity! From California to the New York Island, I am a real Yankee Doodle boy!
Dr. Koothrappali, please.
My country ’tis of thee, duh duh duh liberty, It is really great.
Leonard’s lab.
So, when Howard said the FBI would be contacting me, I was expecting Mulder. Glad to see I got Scully.
Who?
Mulder and Scully. X-Files. The truth is out there. Never mind. Uh, so, what would you like to know?
You work with Mr. Wolowitz here at the university, correct?

Yes. Of course, we are in different departments. He is an engineer and I am an experimental physicist. You know, one of those guys who examines the building blocks of creation and says, Hello, maker of the universe, I see what you did there. Good one.
Right. Now, how would you characterize your relationship with Mr. Wolowitz?
Good. It is a good relationship. Of course, most of my relationships are good. Probably because I exude confidence. People are drawn to that, you know? Confidence, not exuding.
Do you know of any groups Mr. Wolowitz is a member of?
You are beautiful, you know that? You pop, sparkle and buzz electric. I am going to pick you up at eight, show you a night you will never forget.
Sounds great.
Really?
Yeah. Can my six-foot-two Navy SEAL husband come with us?
Is that, oh, my, I did not see the ring with my glasses off, so, look at that, I am starting to exude.
The apartment. There is a knock on the door.
Want to get that?
Not particularly.
Could you get that?
I suppose I could if I were asked.
Would you please get that?
Of course. Why do you have to make things so complicated?
Dr. Cooper?
Yes.
I am Special Agent Page, FBI.
You say you are Special Agent Page, FBI.
Here’s my I.D.
And here is my Justice League membership card. But that does not prove I know Batman.
I just want to ask you a few questions about Howard Wolowitz.
Oh. All right. I doubt anyone would risk the stiff penalties for impersonating a federal officer just to ask questions about a minor league engineer with an unresolved Oedipal complex.
Thank you.
For the record, I truly support the FBI in the mission which is expressed through their motto?
Fidelity, bravery, integrity?

Correct. Now to business. 18 years ago, I sent the FBI Crime Lab samples from a bag of excrement that had been lit on fire on my front porch for fingerprinting and DNA analysis. Why have not I heard back yet?
Well, the FBI Crime Lab does have a lot on its plate.
That is of little comfort to a nation attempting to scrape burning feces off its shoes.
Would you mind if we talked about Mr. Wolowitz now?
A little, but go on.
Thank you. Would you characterize him as responsible?

I am going to answer that with a visual aid. This is my nine-disc complete Lord of the Rings trilogy blu-ray set. Mr. Wolowitz borrowed it, damaged plastic retention hub number three, and then returned it to me, hoping I would not notice. Would you characterize that as responsible?
That is really not the sort of thing we are interested in.
You heard me say blu-ray, right?
I did.
Very well. Would you be interested in knowing that Mr. Wolowitz once snuck onto my World of Warcraft account and changed the name of a certain level-80 warlock from Sheldor to Smeldor?
I am afraid not. Is there anything else?

Is there anything else? Where would you like to start? He refuses to pay fines when he is overdue with books I lend him. He crashed the Mars Rover while attempting to impress a woman. He recommended that I go see the third Matrix movie because it was, and I quote, just as good as the first one. If that is not irresponsible, I do not know what is.
The Mars Rover?
Did I say Mars Rover?
You did.
That was actually a poorly chosen example, as it had nothing to do with me.
Yes, well, let’s talk about it anyway.

I do not want to. Not that my disinclination to discuss the topic should be interpreted as evidence of Howard Wolowitz’s culpability in the destruction of government property worth millions of dollars.
Thank you, Dr. Cooper. I think I have all I need.
Oh, good. I was afraid you were going to fixate on that Mars Rover incident.
The cafeteria.
Hey, buddies. Guess who did not get security clearance to work on the giant space laser?
What happened?
Apparently, the background interviews did not go well. You guys would not know anything about that, would you?
Well, actually, I may have gotten a little tipsy when I talked to her.
And I may have hit on her a little bit.
I may have thrown up rum cake on her shoes.
I see. Well, it is good to know, when I need you guys, I can always count on you to step up and ruin everything.
I feel awful.
Ah, me, too.
To tell you the truth, I thought if anyone was going to screw things up for Howard, it’d be Sheldon.
Well, your expectations have been subverted. Aha.
The apartment.
What are you doing up?
Sleep eludes me, Leonard.
Really? Maybe sleep has met you before.
Mockery? That is all you have to offer?
I am sorry. Why cannot you sleep?

Who knows? I have not watched any scary movies recently. I am no longer obsessing over why the predicted mass of the quantum vacuum has little effect on the expansion of the universe. And it is been weeks since I took that accidental sip of Red Bull.
Did something happen today that is bothering you?
Well, I did mention the Mars Rover incident to that FBI agent and probably cost Howard his security clearance.
What?
But why should that keep me up?
Because you feel guilty?
Interesting. So you are saying my insomnia is caused by a guilty conscience.
Actually, you do not have insomnia. You are sleeping now.
Excuse me?
You are having a guilt-ridden dream.
Do you have any evidence to support that hypothesis?
How about that Gorn sitting on the couch?
That seems fairly conclusive. No, Gorn, no. That is where I sit.
Agent Page’s Office.
Thank you for agreeing to see me, Agent Page.
Thank you for filing a complaint with my superior, Dr. Cooper. I understand you want to recant your statement about Howard Wolowitz.
Yes.
Was your statement untrue?
No.
Then I am afraid you cannot withdraw it.
I am sorry. I do not recall you saying no backsies.
Is there anything else?

Yes. I’d like to offer a laudatory statement about Howard’s many excellent qualities that I believe will tip the scales back in his favour. Howard Joel Wolowitz. H is for honesty, of which he has much. O’s for outstanding, which he is such. W’s for witty, he is quick with a joke. A’s for artistic, his ability…
I am sorry, Dr. Cooper, this matter is already closed.
But I still have rd Joel Wolowitz left to go.
It is closed.

I do not understand why you people are picking on my friend, Howard, when there are much more serious security threats to pursue. For instance, when I first met Leonard, he was on the verge of giving away rocket secrets to a North Korean spy, and not one agent ever investigated that.
This is Leonard Hofstadter?
No, it is a different Leonard. He is Chinese, red hair, six fingers. Good-bye.
A corridor at the university.
Raj. Have you seen Howard?
I think he is eating lunch. Uh, Sheldon, I want you to meet Neil deGrasse Tyson from the Hayden Planetarium in New York.
I am quite familiar with Dr. Tyson. He is responsible for the demotion of Pluto from planetary status. I liked Pluto. Ergo I do not like you.
But I actually did not demote Pluto. That was a vote of the International Astronomical Union.
If ifs and buts were candy and nuts, we’d all have a merry Christmas. Think about that, Dr. Tyson.
Is that the guy you were telling me about?
Oh, yeah.
The cafeteria.
Howard. The person at fault for you not getting a security clearance is me.
You?
Yes, but before you get upset, I want you to know I went to the FBI and retracted my statement.
And they were okay with that?
No. If anything, I made it worse. In any case, I have been riddled with guilt, which is causing Gorn-infested REM sleep. So, I am here now to say I am sorry.
Are you kidding me? You have set my career back at least two years, and you think you can make it right with I am sorry?

Yes. I followed the social protocol. I attempted to right the wrong, and when I failed to do so I delivered a heartfelt apology. Now you say apology accepted, and I will offer you a one-time-only high five.
Your apology is not accepted.
You are tricking me. It really is, is not it?
Leave me alone, Sheldon.
Dr. Cooper, I just wanted you to know I am sorry for the role I played in the Pluto matter.
Oh, shut up.
The bar of the Cheesecake Factory.
Sheldon?
Hello.
What are you doing here?
I have troubles, Penny. I have come to pour them out to the sympathetic ear of the local barkeep.
You know, they have a really nice bar over at the Olive Garden.
I do not like the Olive Garden. They treat me like family.
Okay, Sheldon. What can I get you?
Alcohol.
Could you be a little more specific?
Ethyl alcohol. 40 millilitres.
I am sorry, honey, I do not know millilitres.
Ah. Blame President James “Jimmy” Carter. He started America on a path to the metric system but then just gave up. He wonders why he was a one-term president.
Would you say that is about 40 milliliters?
More or less.
Great. Now, where were we?

I believe you were about to ask me to choose a cocktail. Fortunately, thanks to computer-savvy alcoholics, there is an app for that. Let’s see. Harvey Wallbanger. Eh. Sex on the Beach. I hardly think so. Rob Roy, Silk Slipper, Mad Hatter. Ooh! I will have a Rosewater Ricky.
A what?

You will need pitted, brandied cherries, gin, rosewater, angostura bitters and overproofed rum. Now, first, dust the cherries with sugar, then spray them with a mixture of rum and bitters. Then ignite the rum, caramel…
Here you go, one Rosewater Ricky.
That is not how it looks in the picture.
Oh, yeah, you know, every bartender makes it differently. Why do not you give it a try.
All right. To the metric system. I cannot taste the cherries.
All right. Sheldon, what is on your mind?
I wronged Howard, and he will not accept my apology.
Oh, right, that. Yes, Leonard told me. Sorry, honey.
Penny, you face failure on a daily basis. How do you cope?
I drink.
To drinking. Nope. Oh, if only there were some way to force Howard to accept my apology so I could escape this miasma of guilt.

You know, sometimes stuff just happens, and there is nothing you can do about it. For example, Lisa Peterson has not talked to me since the 11th grade, because no matter how much you apologize, you cannot go back and un-dry-hump someone’s boyfriend.
I see. You are saying I am facing Starfleet Academy’s unwinnable command scenario, the Kobayashi Maru.
Exactly. Sometimes you cannot win.
Captain Kirk won.
Kirk cheated.
Impressive that you know that. It is hard to believe I am actually having this conversation with you.
Right there with you.
Kirk beat the Kobayashi Maru by reprogramming the simulator. That is it.
What?
I will reprogram Howard.
What? Sheldon, you cannot reprogram people.
No, you cannot reprogram people. To James Tiberius Kirk.
The cafeteria.
Hello, all.
Hello.
Hey.
Howard, you are feeling better about me today, are not you?
Not really.
Yes, you are. I am using neurolinguistic programming to modify your thought patterns.
Oh. Go away, Sheldon.
There is a nine ninety five e-book down the drain.
What is in the bag?
It is for Howard.
Oh. Sheldon, you cannot fix this with gifts.
Nevertheless, I have hurt you, and whether you forgive me or not, I want you to have this.
You are giving me a couch cushion?
No. The cushion is merely symbolic. I am giving you my spot on the couch.
But you love that spot.
No. I love my mother. My feelings for my spot are much greater. It is the singular location in space around which revolves my entire universe. And now it is yours.
Oh, my God, dude. Now you have to forgive him.
All right. Apology accepted.
High five. Not too hard. Thank you.
I have not cried like this since Toy Story 3.
The apartment.
I got to tell you, Sheldon, I understand why you chose this spot. I mean, the temperature is good, but there is no draft. I can see the television, but I can still talk to…
I changed my mind. Get out of my spot.
How long?
94 seconds.
The apartment.
Okay, help me out here. How does an archaeology professor get that good with a whip?
Maybe he took a class at the adult bookstore. That is how I learned.
I cannot believe you have never seen Raiders of the Lost Ark.
And I cannot believe you have never read Eat, Pray, Love.
When she comes out with Eat, Pray, Run Away From A Giant Boulder, I will read it.
I do not care if Eat, Pray, Love changed your life, I am not reading it.
You know, I could totally rock a hat like that.

That is the work of noted Hollywood costume designer Deborah Nadoolman. She also designed the iconic red and black jacket in Michael Jackson’s Thriller video, which I have never viewed in its entirety, as I find zombies dancing in choreographed synchronicity implausible. And also, it is really scary.
Would someone please turn off the Sheldon commentary track?
There is no switch. Just listen and learn.
Penny, if you think this is good, you should come with us Friday to see it on the big screen at the Colonial.
Well, I am watching it now. Why would I want to see it again on Friday?
Because the print they are showing on Friday has an additional 21 seconds of previously unseen footage.
What, 21 seconds? That will be like seeing a whole new movie!
Exactly. They say it finally solves the submarine controversy.
Did Leonard? I am no expert, but I believe what we just heard from Penny was sarcasm. Oh, good. I am eight for 26 this month.
Yeah, I think I will pass. But you guys enjoy your extra 21 seconds.
Bet if I could make you understand why this is such a cool thing, we’d still be together.
Mm, yeah, no, we would not.
Uh-huh. I am guessing 21 seconds had something to do with that, too.
The Cheesecake Factory.
May I point out to you all that the screening is first come, first served?
