Howard, have you ever considered us living together?
Boy, I do not know. You, me, Ma living under the same roof?
No, I mean just you and me. You can move in here, or we can find a place.
I have got a better solution.
What?
We wait for my mom’s heart to explode from all the salt she eats. Then we just stick her in the ground, flip her mattress and move into the big bedroom.
Great.
Look at us planning a future together.
Outside Howard’s house.
Who’s there? Are you a sex criminal?
Sex criminals do not have keys, Ma.
Where were you so late?
I was out with Bernadette.
I know what that means, I watch Dr. Phil. I hope to God you used a condom!
I am not having this conversation with you, Ma!
God forbid you get one of those new fancy sex diseases!
Nobody has a disease!
I hope not. I share a toilet with you. Is that what you want? To give your mother herpes?
That is it. I do not have to take this. Good luck with your eyebrows in the morning!
Who’s there? Are you a sex criminal?
I am still leaving! I just forgot my Claritin.
The apartment.
Hey, what is up?
I need a place to crash.
Uh, sure. Why?
Big fight with my mother.
Still arguing over which CSI is the best?
No, we agreed they all have their merits. This was about Bernadette.
What is going on?
Howard’s gonna sleep here tonight. He had a fight with his mother.
Did you offer him a hot beverage?
No.
Leonard, social protocol states when a friend is upset, you offer them a hot beverage, such as tea.
Tea does sound nice.

You heard the man, Leonard. And while you are at it, I am upset that we have an unannounced houseguest, so make me cocoa. Point of inquiry, given that Leonard is your secondary friend and Koothrappali is your primary friend, why did not you seek refuge under his roof?
There is no room. His sister is staying with him.
Wait, wait. What?
Cocoa, Leonard. Focus. I am down in the dumps here.
Priya’s in town?
Yeah, some work thing. Anyway, my mother seems to think that Bernadette…
Hold on. When did Priya get here?
I do not know. A couple of days ago. The thing is, Bernadette does not like that I have to take care of my mother, and my mother does not trust Bernadette.
Yeah, that is a real pickle. Bye.
Do not worry. As your tertiary friend, I am prepared to step in and comfort you.
That is not really necessary.
No, no. I will finish making the tea, while you narcissistically ramble on about whatever’s troubling you.
Thanks.
That is what tertiary friends are for.
Raj’s Apartment. Leonard knocks on the door.
Who is it?
It is Leonard.
You cannot come in.
I just want to talk to her.
I forbid it.
Open the door, Rajesh.
You heard me. I forbidded it.
Forbidded it?
Forbaded it?
Get out of the way. What are you doing here?
What are you doing here?
I have business in Los Angeles.
Why did not you call?
Clearly, she was sending you a message to take a hike, Mike.
I am sorry. I thought about calling, but I just was not sure if seeing you was such a good idea.
I know. Last time I came on too strong. Can we talk in private?
No!
Sure.

It is completely inappropriate for a single woman to entertain a man in private. If you insist on talking, you must do it on the couch! All right, you may talk in the bedroom, but I want this door to remain open! All right, just this once you may close the door. But keep in mind I will be right out here monitoring the situation! Priya, this is your brother. When you get this, tell Leonard to check his voicemail.
The Cheesecake Factory.
Would you be sleeping over again this evening? Because you are welcome to.
That is very nice of you, but I made other plans.
Well, just keep in mind that should you ever need a slightly apathetic tertiary friend, I stand at the ready.
Hi, Howard. Hi, Sheldon.
Hey.
Hello.
Why are you holding hands? I forbid you to hold hands.
Rajesh, you know Leonard and I spent the night together.
Yeah, but you were just sleeping, because I forboded you to have sex.
The word is forbade.
Are you sure? That does not sound right.
Listen, Rajesh, Leonard and I have decided to see each other again, and you do not get to tell me who I can and cannot have a relationship with.

Actually, he can. The Hindu Code of Manu is very clear in these matters. If a woman’s father is not around, the duty of controlling her base desires falls to the closest male member of her family, in this case, Raj. The code also states that if she disobeys, she will be reborn in the womb of a jackal and tormented by diseases. If true, that seems like an awfully large gamble given that the prize is Leonard.
There it is, Priya. We are Indian. We believe this stuff.
I think it also says that if you eat beef, you need to live with cows for three months and drink their urine.
Some of it makes sense, some of it is crazy. My point is, you cannot go out with Leonard.
Who cannot go out with Leonard?
My sister.
Penny, this is Raj’s sister, Priya.
It is very nice to meet you.
Oh, yeah, you, too.
Priya, if you are experiencing any tension or awkwardness, it may stem from the fact that Leonard and Penny used to, if I may quote Howard, do the dance with no pants.
Sheldon!
Really?
Hey, Bernadette, can I talk to you for a second?
Sure.
Penny, you became disenchanted with Leonard as a lover. Would you please tell my sister why?

Listen, my mom’s going to Palm Springs to visit her sister. That is two whole nights in a row I can sleep over with you all the way to morning. Unless the desert air dries out her sinuses, in which case I will have to schlep out there with the big humidifier.
That is it? That is your big solution to all of our problems? If your mom’s nose holds up, we get two nights together?
Is not that great?
No, it is not great. You need to make a choice. Me or your mother.
Oh, uh…
Wrong answer.
No, wait. You did not let me finish.
I am listening.
Uh…
Agh!
Penny’s apartment.
I came as quickly as I could.
Okay. Why?
To comfort you, of course. Sheldon told me about Leonard dating Rajesh’s sister. So I high-tailed it over here to pick up the pieces of your broken heart.
Amy, I am fine.
You do not have to be strong for me. Now let’s talk about Priya, that man-stealing bitch.
What?
In situations like this, best girlfriends are often catty about the other woman. Rawr.
Really, I am not upset about Leonard and Priya.
Oh. Then perhaps you do not understand what is going on. Your former boyfriend has replaced you with what appears to be a very suitable mate. Arguably much more suitable than you.
Oh. Well, good for him. Hey, what do you mean, more suitable?

Well, granted, Penny, your secondary sexual characteristics are reasonably bodacious. But Priya is highly educated, she is an accomplished professional, and she comes from the culture that literally wrote the book on neat ways to have sex. Whereas you, on the other hand, are a community college dropout who comes from the culture that wrote the book on tipping cows.
Yeah. Okay, I got it. I got it. So, what is all that stuff?

This is a portable electroencephalogram. I am doing research on emotions and brain activity. So when you start crying, I can see which region of the brain is activated. Then I am going to stimulate the analogous area in the brain of a rhesus monkey and see if he cries. Cool, huh?
Bernadette’s apartment. Howard knocks on door.
I choose you.
Really?
Yep. I moved out of my mother’s house. Cord is cut. I am all yours.
What did she say when you told her?
I do not know. She has not responded to my email yet.
This is so great. I love you, Howard.
I love you, too. So what is for dinner?
Well, I do not really have much of anything in the house.
That is fine. Why do not we go fool around in our bedroom? And then you can go shopping.
The apartment.
I thought maybe after we eat, we could see an early movie.
I’d love that.
I love the way you say, I’d love that.
She says it the same way I do. I’d love that. Everybody in India says it that way. It is not a big deal.
Rajesh, do not be a child.
I am not being a child. Leonard, I swear to God, if your sister ever comes to town, I shall have my way with her.
My sister’s 38 and married.
All the more shame that will fall upon the house of Hofstadter.
Ooh, I thought I smelled pizza.
That is remarkable. If pepperoni were an explosive substance, you could replace German shepherds at our nation’s airports.
Hi. Penny, right?
Oh, yes. Hi, hi. I am sorry. I did not know you had company. I do not want to impose.

No, no. It is not an imposition. At this point, in our ecosystem, you are akin to the plover, a small scavenging bird that eats extra food from between the teeth of crocodiles. Please, fly into our open maw, and have at it.
If I had more than a box of baking soda in my refrigerator, I would not have to take that.
Hi, bestie.
Hi. So, um, Priya, you are a lawyer, right?
I know. Pretty boring, huh?

Oh, come on. It is not boring at all. She is currently helping set up a secondary derivative market which would allow overseas car firms to hedge their investments against potential advancements in battery technology. Hmm?
Thank you, Leonard. That does not make it sound boring at all.
So, how you holding up?
I am fine.
Oh, who are you kidding? She is breathtaking.
So, Penny, Leonard tells me you are an actress. That must be pretty exciting.
Oh, yeah, yeah. It is real great. Today I drove to Van Nuys for an audition I thought was going to be for a cat food commercial. Turned out to be porn.
Did you get the part?
I did not do the audition.
Given the state of your career, can you really afford to be picky?
I took acting classes when I was at Cambridge. I loved it. We did Taming of the Shrew.
Oh, wow. I love Taming of the Shrew. I did a paper on it in high school. Who knows not where a wasp does wear his sting? In his tail.
In his tongue.
Whose tongue?
Yours, if you talk of tails, and so farewell.
What, with my tongue in your tail?
I am regretting my earlier cattiness. She is an absolute delight.
Bernadette’s bedroom.
Wow.
Wow, indeed.
I cannot believe we are finally living together.
Yeah. You know what would make this moment perfect?
What?
A little snack. You got any string cheese?
No. I, I might have some cheddar.
Not as good. You cannot make strings with it. Remind me to put it on your shopping list.
Okay.
You have hypo-allergenic detergent?
No.
Better put it on the list. If you wash my underwear with regular soap, I get little red bumps on my tuchus.
Wait a second. I am doing your laundry?
Well, honey, it is not gonna do itself. Oh, before I forget, tomorrow morning, you are driving me to the dentist.
I have to take you?
You do not have to take me. You get to take me.
Wait a minute. Are you telling me your mother usually takes you to the dentist?
It is not weird. There is lots of kids there with their moms.
I cannot believe this.
What? It is fun. If I have no cavities, afterwards, we go out for a treat.
All right, Howard, let’s get something straight right now. I am not going to be your mother.
Whoa, whoa, whoa! Where did that come from?
Howard’s house.
Who’s that? Is it a sex criminal?
Nobody wants to do that to you, Ma.
Where were you?
Did not you read my email?
You know I cannot turn on that ferkakta computer. I left you some brisket on the kitchen counter.
Thank you.
Remember to floss after. We have the dentist in the morning!
Penny’s apartment.
Oh, hey. What is up?
I just wanted to check in on you.
Why?
It seems like the appropriate thing to do when one’s best friend finds herself replaced by a smart, beautiful woman with the smouldering sexuality of a crouched Bengal tiger.
I already told you, I am okay with it. I mean, if anything, I am quite pleased that makes him so happy.
It is okay, it is okay.
Thank you.
Now, let’s get these electrodes attached and see what is going on in that pretty little noggin of yours.
Okay.
The apartment.
I smell Chinese food.
It is actually Thai. You are slipping.
Are Leonard and Priya here?
They went to Catalina for the weekend.
Oh. Where’s Raj?
At home, forbidding it.
How about Howard?
I am given to understand his mother grounded him for running away.
Oh, okay. Well, I guess it is just the two of us, huh?
Actually, it is the three of us.
What up, bestie? Good news. Thanks to you, I was able to make a rhesus monkey cry like a disgraced televangelist.
Great.
So, you feeling better?
Not really.
Sheldon, you have a guest who’s upset.
Right. I will make tea.
Oh, sweetie, it is okay. I do not want tea.
I am sorry. It is not optional.
The apartment. Sheldon is on the phone.
Buona sera, Luigi’s Pizza. Buona sera. It means good evening in Italian. May I say, having to explain that to you calls into question the authenticity of your ristorante?
Okay, I am out of here.
Un momento. Oh, for heaven’s sake, now you are being deliberately stupid. Where are you going?
I am having dinner with Priya at Raj’s. I think Howard’s going to be there. You want to join us?
But tonight’s Thursday. On Thursdays, everybody comes over here and has pizza. Or a reasonable facsimile prepared by someone claiming to be Luigi, but who sounds suspiciously like Jackie Chan.
Cannot we make a one-time exception for tonight?
We could. We could also stop using the letter M, but I think that idea is isguided and oronic.
Just come with me to Raj’s.
Well, I do not want to go to a party.
It is not a party. It is the same group of people who hang out here, hanging out over there.
I am sorry, but five people eating and chatting is a party.
How come it is not a party when we do it here?
Because we do not throw parties.
I do not know what to tell you, Sheldon. I am going to see Priya. Everyone’s over there. You coming or not?

Well, no, sir, and do you know why? In a word, tradition. Every Thursday night for the last eight years, you and I and our friends have gathered here in this very spot to break bread covered with cheese and sauce, discuss the issues of the day, and yes, share a laugh or two. But I guess our rich heritage means nothing to you.
I guess you are right. See you later.
Wait! Leonard! Wait! What am I going to do for dinner?
Come with me to Raj’s and eat there.
I cannot do that. What if he serves haggis and blood pudding?
I really doubt that is what he will serve.
But what if he does? I will be obliged to dine on liver and lungs stuffed in a sheep’s stomach. And frankly, blood pudding is essentially the same thing. I do not know why he is serving both.
What do you want to do? You want to come with me, or do you want to sit here alone?
No, I will go to your haggis party. But I am telling you, this is adness. This is utter and coplete adness.
Oh, dear!
What?
Raj’s television. I just realized we are about to spend an evening watching a plasma screen with a cluster of dead pixels in the upper left-hand corner.
So do not watch TV. Read a book.
And be a social pariah? Oh, you know that is not my style.
Ugh!
The audible sigh is a show of exasperation, right?
Right.
Is it about me or the dead pixels?
Hey, you are just in time. We made Tex-Mex.
Oh, sounds great.
Oh, Indians making Tex-Mex. Might as well have had the Chinese pizza.
Hey, you.
Hi.
That is got to be fun for you, huh? Watching Hofstadter suck the saliva out of your sister’s mouth?
Excuse me. Before this evening goes any further, we need to decide where everyone is going to sit.
There is no assigned seats, Sheldon. Just sit anywhere. Make yourself comfortable.
Oh, what fun. We are like hippies at a love-in.
Just sit here.
Yeah, right on, man. Right on. Oh, look, it is Harry Potter and 98% of The Sorcerer’s Stone.
Okay, we have got fajitas with all the fixins, so you make your own.
Wonderful. Dinner, some assembly required.
Do you want a margarita, Sheldon?
A margarita? Where are we? What is happening?
The bar of the Cheesecake Factory
Oh. Hey, Sheldon. What can I get ya?
Water. Neat. With a little umbrella.
Where are all your friends?
Sadly, Penny, this evening, I am the Dark Knight, roaming these mean streets alone. A windbreaker for my cape, and a stern expression for my cowl.
Okay.
Excuse me? Is not this the point where the world-weary barkeep absentmindedly wipes down the bar and coaxes the woes out of the troubled patron?
Well, I was getting your stupid umbrella, but all right. What is troubling you, buddy?
I do not think your heart’s in it, but since you asked. Apparently, because Leonard is dating Raj’s sister, we are all forced to hang out at his apartment.
Oh, the horror.
Indeed. Yeah, at one point, Raj put on reggae music, and his sister took off her shoes. It was like the last days of Caligula. Oh, I have to get this. Umbrella?
Ugh!
Wonder what she is exasperated about. Hello?
Sheldon, are you all right? When last we spoke, you were going to take a taxi home from Raj’s, but according to Facebook, you just checked in at the Cheesecake Factory.
Yes, I was in a taxi, but the driver did not look at all like the photograph on his license, so I leapt out and ran for it.
Wise.
There you go. Just like recovering alcoholics drink in the Caribbean.
Hi, bestie.
Oh. Hi, Amy. How you been?
Fine. From this angle, I can see up your nose.
Yeah, it is a great time to be alive, is not it?
Do not worry. My problems can wait while you two hens finish your clucking.
Look, Sheldon, Leonard is dating Priya. She is staying with Raj. That means you are all probably gonna be hanging out there more.
Penny, I am sorry you got dragged into this. I know you are devastated that your ex-boyfriend has found an exciting new lover with flawless, caramel-coloured skin.
Okay, I am not upset about Leonard and Priya.
Your flaring nostrils indicate otherwise.
Cluck-cluck-cluck.
Sheldon, look at me. I think it is time to face the fact that Leonard is the nucleus of your social group. Where he goes, the group goes.
Leonard the nucleus? That makes no sense. I am the whimsical elf that everyone looks to for a good time.
I am not saying that you are not fun. You are the most fun person I know.
A lot of people think I am fun to be around.

Do not be needy, bestie. That is probably part of what chased Leonard away. What I am saying, Sheldon, is that your group is Leonard-centric. If it were a town, it would be Leonardville. If it were an Islamic nation, Leonardstan. If it were the birthplace of motion pictures, we’d all be singing Hooray for Leonardwood.
Ooh, I got one. If you guys were a band, you’d be called Leonard and the Leonards.
So needy.
The apartment.
What you doing?
I am setting out snacks.
You do realize everyone’s eating at Raj’s again tonight?
I did not say the snacks were for you now, did I, Nosy Rosie?
You are having people over?
Yes. Must be killing you wondering who. Fine, I will tell you. Stuart from the comic bookstore, Barry Kripke from the university, Penny’s ex-boyfriend Zack and TV’s LeVar Burton.
Really? LeVar Burton’s coming here?
Possibly. I Tweeted him.
Okay, well, tell him I loved him on Star Trek.
Please, Leonard, stop trying to horn in on my new friends.
Of course. Good night.
Leonard.
Yeah?
We had a good run, you and I.
Okay.
But change is a part of life.
It certainly is.
Okay. I have guests coming. I am afraid I am going to have to ask you to leave now.
I am leaving.
Do not make this harder than it is, Leonard.
Good-bye, Sheldon.
And good-bye to you, sir. He will be back.
Of course I will be back. I live here!
The apartment, later.

Well, it would appear LeVar Burton will not be joining us so let’s get started. Um, I thought we’d begin by going around the room, introducing ourselves and saying a little bit about why we are here. Okay. I am Sheldon. Uh, for regular readers of The New England Journal of High Energy Physics, I need no introduction. If you are not familiar with that publication, there is a free copy in your goody bag. Stuart?
Um. Hi. I am Stuart. I run a comic bookstore, which for financial reasons, I am currently living in. And I guess what I am hoping for most out of tonight is a hot shower.
That is very nice, Stuart. Zack?
I am Zack, and I am, uh… uh… could you come back to me?
Of course. Barry?
I am Barry Kwipke, and I am here because you told me there was going to be a whaffle. When is the whaffle?
Patience, patience, Barry. The whaffle… the raffle is the grand finale to an evening-long festival of fun and folly.
One more question…
Yes, you must be present to win.
Okay, I am ready. I am Zack, and I am, uh… oh, crap, why is this so hard?
Penny’s apartment.
Oh, hey.
Hi.
Yo, P-dog.
What is up?
We are here to kidnap you for a girls’ night out.
Parenthetical, the term kidnap is being used playfully.
I kind of figured that.
Good. Now put this pillowcase over your head.
No.
She used to be much more fun, until Leonard punched her in the heart.
We just thought you might want to go out and have a good time, maybe go dancing.
Oh. Gee, thanks, but I am not really in the mood.
You do understand that it will distract you from obsessing over the rich variety of sweet loving that your ex-boyfriend is currently receiving from the fiery jewel of Mumbai.
Okay, look, if I agree to go out with you guys, will you promise to stop pestering me about Leonard and Priya?
Yes.
Sure.
All right. I will go change. Come on in.
If you’d have let me bring the chloroform, we would not have had to put up with all this jibber-jabber.
The apartment.

Anyway, after we get done snowboarding, I go back to the lodge and get in the Jacuzzi. There is no one around, so naturally, I am free-balling it. Next thing I know, this beautiful chick shows up, drunk out of her skull, wants to get in with me.
Question. Was it a Jacuzzi or a hot tub?
Weally? That is your question?
What is the difference?
Jacuzzi is a commercial brand. Hot tub is the generic term, i.e., all Jacuzzis are hot tubs, but not all hot tubs are Jacuzzis.
Is that like all thumbs are fingers, but not all fingers are thumbs?
Surprisingly, yes.
Nice. Now, what exactly are toes?
Can you please get back to the drunk girl? I’d like something to think about in the shower.
Oh, yeah. Right. Anyway, she takes off all of her clothes, climbs into the hot tub, and the first thing I notice…
The water level rose.
No.
Of course it did. It is said that Archimedes, the ancient Greek mathematician, discovered the principle of displacement while taking a bath.
Tewwific. Go ahead, Zack. Naked dwunk girl, fwee-balling, continue.
Forgive me, but I think you will find my story is more interesting.
Does yours have wet bweasts in it?

Better. It has a gold crown. You see, the king wondered how much gold was in it and charged Archimedes with coming up with the solution. Because the crown was irregularly shaped, there was no way to mathematically determine its volume. But, while bathing, Archimedes realized he could immerse the crown and measure the amount the water rose.
So, long story short, I nailed her.
When he finished, he shouted Eureka!
No, I always shout, Holy Moly! Do not know why. Just do.

All right, that concludes the getting to know you portion of the evening. Who’s ready to play some vintage video games? And tonight’s selections include ColecoVision’s Smurf Rescue in Gargamel’s Castle, Atari’s Cookie Monster Munch, and for you text adventure aficionados, Zork. Pick me, pick me. I am fun.
That all sucks the big haiwy meatball. How about I go get the kawaoke machine out of my car, get plastered and blow the woof off this place?
Great, I will make a beer run.
And I will take a shower. We will meet back here in fifteen.
Check.
I am unhappy.
Raj’s apartment.
This is delicious. Where’d you learn to make chili?
When I was at university in England, my flatmate was from Texas.
I hope she was not anything like my flatmate from Texas.
Sheldon is a bit quirky, is not he?
Oh, please. That crazy bastard’s looking at quirky in the rearview mirror.
Did you know that, per our roommate agreement, I have to wash my feet before I get in the shower? And not in the sink. We each have special buckets.
Raj, did you ever tell your sister about the time Sheldon got punched by Bill Gates?
Oh, God, you are kidding.

Nope. Gates gave a speech at the university. Sheldon went up to him afterwards and said, maybe if you were not so distracted by sick children in Africa, you could have put a little more thought into Windows Vista.”
Bam. Right in the nose. Made me proud to own a PC.
I’d like to propose a toast to a rare and wonderful Sheldon-free evening.
Hear, hear.
Cheers. You realize that is the first time we have ever done that without having to listen to Sheldon tell us why it is called a toast?
Why is it called a toast?
Oh, the ancient Romans put spiced toast in their punch bowls.
Sheldon tells it better.
He kind of does.
Yeah.
Aw, hell, I miss him.
Penny’s apartment.
So, where do you guys want to go dancing?
We were hoping you’d know a place.
Yes, perhaps somewhere packed tightly with young, beautiful bodies sweating and writhing against each other in a glorious orgy of the flesh.
Oh, yeah, I know that place. What do you think?
That should display enough of your bosom to attract a new mate, or a hungry infant.
Okay, let’s go through this one more time. Just because Leonard has a new girlfriend does not mean I need to go out and hook up with some guy.
But you could if you wanted to, right?
Well, yeah, I guess.
Pick out the hottest guy in the room, take him home, do unspeakable things to him, then kick him to the curb with a smile on his face and teeth marks on his heinie?
More or less.
What is that like?
I do not know. It is fun while you are doing it. And then after, it is mostly embarrassment, self-loathing and regret.
I would take that deal all day long.
Yeah, well, it is not gonna happen tonight. You know, for the first time in my life, I am not in a relationship, and I am totally okay with it.
You know, if being on your own is new to you, I’d be happy to share some tension-relieving techniques for ladies I have perfected over the years. For example, do you have an electric toothbrush?
Um, no.
You should get one.
What is that?
It appears to be something preserved between two pieces of acrylic.
Oh, it is a snowflake from the North Pole. Leonard gave it to me last year.
Oh, God, that is so romantic.
Yeah, it was.
Leonard’s really one of a kind.
Saying that while holding a snowflake is a little bit heavy-handed, do not you think?
Let me see that. Oh, screw it. I can deal with a little self-loathing. Let’s go find me a heinie to bite.
Outstanding. And if we fail, we can always stop at CVS and pick you out a nice toothbrush. I call mine Gerard.
That is kind of creepy.
The apartment. Barry and Zack are singing “Do not Go Breaking My Heart”
Anybody do Walking on Sunshine yet?
No.
Dibs.
Raj’s apartment.
I am sorry, Sheldon bought a loom and learned how to weave?
He actually got pretty good. He made us all matching serapes.
I still wear mine when there is a nip in the air.
Now, was this before or after he adopted the 25 cats?
Long before the cats. I think it was around the time he tried to declare our apartment a sovereign nation. I still have some of the currency.
All my friends.
I think it is like Beetlejuice. We said his name too many times.
Come on in.
Thank you.
Hey. I thought you were with your new buddies.
I had to leave. They were having fun wrong.
Come here, Sheldon. Sit here with me.
Thank you.
Would you like some homemade chili?
Are there beans in it?
Yes.
Then it is not chili. Real chili has no beans in it, but you are from a foreign land, so your ignorance is forgiven.
Sheldon, do you want some or not?
Yes, please. Your girlfriend’s a little short-tempered.
I’d like to propose a toast to friends, no matter how quirky.
Cheers.
Priya, do you know why this is called a toast?
Actually, I do. I believe the Romans used to put spiced toast in their punch bowls.
She is also a bit of a know-it-all. Mmm. This is good. Whatever it is.
The apartment. Stuart is singing “Walking on Sunshine”. Barry and Zack are doing backing vocals.
Hello? I… Oh, I do not think so. I am so done with Twitter.

Okay.

I thought you had more important things to think about.

Not knowing is part of the fun. Was that the motto of your community college?

Leonard’s bedroom

I do not care. This is a woman you have slept with. If you want her around, then I have to wonder if maybe you are not ready to move on.

You need to cut the cord with Penny.

Sure. Oh, god, you smell so good. Of course, that could just be my other senses getting stronger. Hypothetically, if I had access To a Lieutenant Uhura uniform, would you wear it?

You are right.

The laundry room.

All right, well, anyway, Darwin observed that when two groups of finches competed over the same food source, eventually one of them would evolve a different beak shape so they could feed on something else.
Okay.
So what do you think we can learn from that behaviour that we can apply to our own lives?

Sure, that has birds in it.
It is fun talking to you, Leonard, I always learn stuff.
I am sorry, but I am gonna count that.
Leonard’s bedroom

And?
She completely understood everything I said. Case closed.

I hope you were not cruel to her.
Is the autumn cruel for letting the flowers die, or is that just nature’s way?
Leonard?
What?
I think I figured out Wolowitz’s magic trick, and I need you to pick a card.

As you wish. Did you pick one?
Yep.
Is this your card?
Nope.
Drat. Is this your card?
No.

The apartment. Sheldon is alone.

Pick a card, Sheldon. Now look at it, and put it back in the deck. Now do you remember your card? Of course I do, I have an eidetic memory. My apologies. Now shuffle the cards. Shuffling. Wait here. Processing image, cross-referencing.
Whatcha doin’?
I am reverse engineering Wolowitz’s magic trick.
What is up with the infrared cameras?

I am measuring residual heat levels on the playing cards to determine which one’s been touched. By the way, if you hope to have children, I suggest you switch from briefs to boxers. Your testicles look a tad warm.
Holy crap, are you connected to the Oak Ridge National Laboratory?
Yes. I am using their Cray Supercomputer to analyze shuffling patterns.
Sheldon, that computer is used for National defence. Hacking into it is a Federal crime.
Relax, we are not under attack right now.
Okay, I am leaving before the black helicopters get here.
And is this my card? Rats! I wonder if Howard used a radioactive tracer. Where am I going to find Uranium-235 this time of night? Come on, Craigslist.
A restaurant
Is it racist that I took you to an Indian restaurant?
It is okay, I like Indian food.
Or as you probably call it back home, food.
Why did not you wear your contacts? Do not you like them?
No, no, I do. It is just I knew I was having curry tonight and I only want one part of my body to burn at a time.
You know, my company offered me a position here in Los Angeles.
Does that mean you’d relocate here permanently?
Maybe. What do you think?
Oh, I love it. Oh, that is great!
Hi! Hi! Just hang on.
Small world.
You did talk to her, did not you?
Of course, I did. I talked and talked and talked.
Hey! Look at Leonard in his fancy-ass grownup clothes. Way to go, Priya. For once, he does not look like a mannequin in the boys’ department. Hey, did he tell you I saved the silk shirt?
No, he did not.
He was gonna throw it in the washing machine with his Spiderman underwear. That is our Lenny, huh?
Yes, that is our Lenny.
So, how’s the food here? Oh, wow, that is really, really good. Oh, I am sorry. You guys are on a date. We can hang out anytime. Have fun.
Bye.
Good night.
Oh, that is, hot, hot, hot, hot! Whoo! It really sneaks up on ya, huh? All right, I gotta go.
It is pretty spicy.
The cafeteria.

Okay.
Bippity-boppity-boo.

The wand is called showmanship, and the beep is none of your business. Oh! Excuse me, I am getting a text message completely unrelated to this magic trick. Oh, look, my dry cleaning’s ready. And your card was the five of spades. Ta-da.
These cards have barcodes on them. The wand is a reader. It is transmitting to your phone.
I said, ta-da. Show’s over.
That is pathetic. Let me show you how a real magician does it. Raj, take a card. Do not let me see it.
Okay.
Three of clubs.
Son of a gun, you are blowing my mind!
Bippity-boppity-boo-yah!
That does it. I am getting uranium.
You ever gonna tell him?
Maybe. When it stops being fun.
So never.
Penny’s door.
Oh, hey, I was just on my way to work.

No, it is all right. Walk me down. So, what is up?
Uh, I kind of have a problem I was hoping you could help me with.
Sure, anything.
Move out.

Well, uh, not far. Hey, if you ever wanna start a family, La Cañada has some great schools.

Why does it have to be about anything? Cannot a fella ask his buddy to relocate, no questions asked?

Are you really that kind of guy?

Good-bye, Leonard.

This may be the alcohol talking, but I believe there is. Are you familiar with the recent study of Tanzanian chimpanzees by Nishida and Hosaka out of Kyoto University?
No, but I can name all the Kardashians.
Primates, such as ourselves, have a natural instinct to ostracize ill-mannered members of the troop. Bernadette’s urge to shun, scowl or fling her waste at Priya is hard-wired into her DNA.
I do not have an urge to fling my waste.
Believe me, it is there, we all have it. Hit me with some more booze, and I will show you.
The apartment
All right, here we are, this is the tavern where all the black-market weapon trades go down.
I do not think my character should be in a place like this. Everyone’s undressing her with their eyes.
Maybe if you stop dropping your sword and bending over to pick it up.

Redheaded troll, goes by the name of Glumly. According to the message boards, if you want to move stolen goods and it is after school hours, he is your guy.

Leonard, you are busy, let’s talk tomorrow.

No, no, I think it is sexy to date a boy trapped in a man’s body.
Good, good. I will tell you what happens.
And people think I do not get sarcasm.
The hallway.
Well, well, well. Look who it is.
Okay, be nice.
Hello.
Hi. We are just heading out for a drink.
Because I do that now.
Count your blessings you are not a Tanzanian chimp.
What?
Do not listen to her, she is had a lot of ice cream. Do you want to join us?
Oh, thank you, but I have work to do.
Four women walk down the stairs, how many reach the lobby?
The cafeteria.
Did your sister say anything when you got home last night?
Oh, no, do not put me in the middle of this. I am not going to be your go-between.
Come on, help me out. Am I in trouble?
There is no reason to worry.
That is a relief.
I am sure many women in happy relationships spend their nights skyping with their ex-boyfriend Sanjay.
Good news, gentlemen, I found our hacker.
What?
Really?
Yeah. No one can hide from me, not Waldo, not Carmen San Diego, not even topless Natalie Portman.
I have never said these words before, but good job, Howard!
Thanks. Our culprit is one Mr. Todd Zarnecki, 2711 Ocean View Road, Carlsbad, California.
The name and the address drip with evil.
What else do we know about him?
Well, quite a bit, actually.
I will bet he is some loser who lives with his parents.
Yes, he does live with his parents. Here’s a Google Earth shot of their house.
Excellent! It is in a cul-de-sac. We can box him in.
Hold on, you are thinking of going there?
Carlsbad is only a couple of hours away.

Of course you did. It was a fun and practical way of organizing your school work. But the bullies took it from us. Well, no more. Tonight, we take back our dignity, our birthright and our pride. What do you say? Who’s with me?
I have a hip-hop aerobics class at five, could we go after?
Sure.
Also, tonight’s the Sabbath and my mother and I have a tradition of lighting the candles and

Aw, screw it. I am in.
Me, too.
And me.

Howard’s house
I am sorry, I thought this delay was so you could watch Wheel of Fortune with your mother.
I am. She is just bleaching her moustache. Check it out. Hey, Ma! Before and After! Four words, 17 letters, two N’s, one V.

Very nice. You lie to my sister.
That is the nicest thing he does to your sister.
Oh, guess who.
Cover for me.

Hello, Priya. What is up? How would I know if Leonard’s at work or not? Do not be suspicious. You owe me.
New puzzle, Ma. Same name. One N, two D’s, three O’s.
Whoopi and Rube Goldberg!
That is uncanny.
I know. It is her superpower. Well, that and jiggling her arm fat.
Leonard’s car.
I cannot believe we are going all the way to San Diego to confront this guy.
Yeah, we are kind of bad-asses, are not we?
Totally.
Hey, how about we stay the night and hit Legoland in the morning?
Sea World is better. It has Shamu, who is literally tons of fun. But for the moment, let’s stay focused on Todd Zarnecki.
Yeah, we are coming for you, Todd Zarnecki. And for the record, Legoland is more interactive.

I almost feel sorry for the poor fool, sitting in his split-level suburban ranch, unaware that a vengeful horde is barrelling down the San Diego Freeway at 71 miles an hour. Ease up there, lead foot. You trying to get us killed?
I took the liberty of burning us a mix of heroic questing music.
This says Beyonce Bootylicious Dance Mix.

Beyonce? Really?
She is curvy and she owns it. I like that.

I always prefer the train.
Outside Todd Zarnecki’s house.
Sheldon, let’s go.
Coming.

So my blade shall not taste blood tonight?
No.

Can I at least kick down the door?
You are welcome to try, but the other day, it took you 15 minutes to get into a FedEx box.

Your doom!

Are you Todd Zarnecki?

I am Sheldor of Azeroth. I want my things back.

Well, he is even more cunning than we thought.
Leonard’s car.

Legoland seems like a hollow dream now.

Of course.
Very basic.
19th-century technology.
Does anybody know how to fix an internal combustion engine?
No.

Well, we’d better call somebody to come pick us up.

Penny’s car.

No problem. So, Leonard, I think it is interesting you did not call your girlfriend to come get you.
Uh, I kind of told her I was working.

Todd Zarnecki’s house. Todd answers the door.

Give my friend his stuff back.
I do not know what you are talking about.
Well, then, good news. Today’s the day a girl’s finally going to touch you in your little special place. Now give him his stuff back.
Okay.
We did it! I said, we.
The lobby.
Oh, hold the door.
Oh, hi.
Hi.
Going to see Leonard?
Yes. How have you been?
Fine. You?
Very well, thank you.
Alright, well great seeing you.
Yeah, you too.
Amy’s right. I do want to fling my poop at her.
A bookstore.

My new book, The Hidden Reality, takes on a grand question. Is our universe the only universe? You see, there is a growing belief among scientists like me that ours may only be one among many universes populating a gigantic cosmos. In The Hidden Reality, I explore this possibility without presuming any knowledge of mathematics or physics on the part of the reader.
Hysterical.

You can think about Heisenberg’s Uncertainty Principle much like the special order menu that you find in certain Chinese restaurants, where you have dishes in column A and other dishes in column B, and if you order the first dish in column A, you cannot order the corresponding dish in column B. That is sort of like the Uncertainly Principle.

Meme theory suggests that items of gossip are like living things that seek to reproduce using humans as their host.
I am no stranger to memetic epidemiology. At Johnson Elementary School, the phrase Shelly Cooper’s a smelly pooper spread like wildfire.
I should think so. That is gold.

We need to fabricate a tantalizing piece of gossip.
And a second non-tantalizing piece to use as a control.
Then we will track its progress through our social group and interpret the results through the competing academic prisms of memetic theory, algebraic gossip and epidemiology.

Very well. Count the first, on or about the 28th day of April, the accused did knowingly and with malice aforethought deny access to the shared bathroom in a time of emergency, to wit, my back teeth were floating. Can I see the roommate agreement?

Top of her class, Cambridge University. Licensed to practice law in three countries. And your face.

Irrelevant. Leonard does not trim his nose hair. He thinks because he is short nobody can see up there.

is he deliberately blowing smoke at me?

Yeah, just a heads-up on the car window deal. It helps, but everything is not peachy.
Raj’s apartment.
Oh, if there was a problem, you cannot solve it, check out the hook while my DJ revolves it. Ice, Ice, baby. Ice, Ice, baby. .
Oh, God, I feel ridiculous in this dress.
You look beautiful, Lieutenant Uhura. Now prepare for inspection.
Shh, my brother’s going to hear you.
Relax, he is got headphones on. And we are ten miles above Earth in a starship.
Really, ten miles? You are orbiting inside the atmosphere? Moron.
I cannot believe I am wearing my brother’s Halloween costume.
I cannot believe you think he only wears it on Halloween. Open the landing bay doors, shuttle craft approaching.
Okay, gotta go.
Howard’s house.
Hey, what is up?
Is that my future daughter-in-law, the doctor?
No, Ma! It is Raj!
He is a doctor too, right?
Yes!
Like Leonard and the skinny weirdo!
Sheldon, yes! Everybody’s a doctor but me!
Well, whose fault is that?
What is up?
Leonard’s putting disgusting memories in my memory foam mattress. Can I stay here tonight?
Sure, but I am going out with Bernadette. It will just be you and my mother.
I guess that is okay.
Ma, can Rajesh sleep over?!
Of course, he and I can play doctor!
She is kidding, right?
I do not know, she is pretty feisty since they put her on hormone-replacement therapy.
Paging Dr. Cutie Pie!
The apartment. Sheldon is talking to Amy on webcam.
I must say, Amy, I was very impressed to see that Bernadette got her PhD.
It is indeed admirable. Although, it is microbiology.
Your doctorate is in neurobiology. I fail to see the distinction.

I will make it simple for you. I study the brain, the organ responsible for Beethoven’s Fifth Symphony. Bernadette studies yeast, the organism responsible for Michelob Lite. Is there something wrong with your neck?
It is a little stiff. What a remarkably fragile structure to support such a valuable payload. Not unlike balancing a Faberge egg on a Pixie Stick.
Have you considered massage?
I’d like to respond to that sarcastically. Yes, I relish the thought of a stranger covering my body with oil and rubbing it.
I was proposing you massage your muscles with your own hands.
Still sounds like a lot of unnecessary touching.
Trust me. With your right hand, locate the spot where the scapula meets the acromion process.
All right.
Now push your third finger along the ridge of the shoulder blade, making a small rotation as you do so.
Rotating.
You should feel a small node-like object rolling back and forth along the bone.
You mean the myofascial point?
Obviously. Now bear down on it like the seventh grade noogies we all know too well.
Oh, dear Lord, yes, yes, oh, yes! Amy, I have never been touched like this before! Oh! Oh, my hands are magic!
Do not flatter yourself. Your hands are blunt tools guided by my knowledge of the nervous system. I could just as easily have paralyzed you.
There is someone at my door.
That does not interest me. Goodbye.
Can I sleep here tonight?
Why?
Leonard’s having astronomically inaccurate Star Trek sex with my sister.
I can see how that would be upsetting. Come in. I will get the sheets and blankets for the couch.
Oh, do not bother. I will just sleep in Leonard’s room.
No, I cannot authorize that.
Well, he is in my bed. Why cannot I be in his?
The Hammurabic Code is an eye for an eye, not a bed for a bed.
Come on, dude, I am exhausted, and Tyra Banks says the most important item in your makeup bag is a good night’s sleep.
All right. This is a form indemnifying me from your use of Leonard’s bedroom. Sign here, indicating that I tried to stop you and did so using a stern facial expression.
Good night, Sheldon.

Wait. Not yet. We still have to go over safety procedures. Now, the apartment has three emergency exits located here, here, and here. In the event of a power outage, luminous paint will guide you to the nearest exit.
You are kidding.
I never kid about safety.
Leonard’s bedroom. Leonard enters, and accidentally sits on Raj. Both exclaim.
What are you doing here?
I was sleeping.
In my bed?
Well, I would have slept in my own bed, but it was being used to bring shame to my family. And the memory of Gene Roddenberry.
Oh, you heard?
Scotty, I need more power.
Sorry. Does Sheldon know you are sleeping in here?
Are you kidding? He made me sign a waiver, participate in an emergency fire drill and take a refresher course in CPR. Thank God he had a dummy.
Oh, yeah. Mouth-to-Mouth Mona. You know, she used to date Howard?
Oh, my God, she is that Mona? Why cannot you and my sister spend your nights here?
We tried. She does not get along with Sheldon.
Sheldon does not get along with Sheldon. It is still no reason for me to have to listen to you arm your photon torpedoes every night.
Okay, well, how about this. Until Priya gets her own place, you stay here and I will stay at your apartment.
Can I bring girls here?
You? Sure. Bring as many as you want.
Okay, deal.
Just not against their will.
The cafeteria.
Do you really think you should be eating that cake?
Why?
If you are gonna be a trophy husband for a rich wife, you might want to watch your waistline.
He is right. A minute on the lips, a lifetime on the hips.
Yeah, ha-ha. First of all, I am not threatened by my fiancée’s success. I am proud of her. And secondly, I have my own career.
Until you have kids.
Good news, Raj. I got the blood work back from the lab. You are okay to stay for a while.
When did you take my blood?
Not important. Your sugar was a little high. I’d follow up with your regular physician. In the meantime, I have some paperwork here for you to go over.
What the hell is this?
Boilerplate stuff. A modified roommate agreement for a temporary house guest. And a living will and durable power of attorney.
This says you can make end of life decisions for me.
As your friend, let’s hope it does not come to that. Please sign.
Did you sign this?
There is a reciprocity clause. You get to pull the plug on him, too.
Well, that seems fair.

Congratulations and welcome temporarily aboard. Here’s your I.D. Card, your key and your lapel pin. Which Leonard was too cool to wear. FYI, part of your responsibilities as roommate pro tem will be to drive me to and from work, the comic book store, the barbershop and the park for one hour every other Sunday for fresh air.
Bring a ball or a Frisbee, you know, something he can chase.

Also, you are tasked with bringing home all takeout dinners. Tonight is Thai food. You will find the standard order in appendix B or downloadable from my FTP server. If you have any questions, here’s the FAQ sheet, or if you prefer the human touch, I do a live web chat called Apartment Talk on Tuesday nights.
No backsies.
The apartment.
Sheldon, dinner!
What is this?
This is the difference between eating and dining.
Remarkable. I am just realizing how much Leonard’s been skating by all these years.
It is not a big thing. Just think of me as a brown Martha Stewart.
Hey, Sheldon, did you change your Wi-Fi password again?
Yes, it is “Penny, get your own Wi-Fi.” No spaces.
Thanks. Wow! What is with the fancy spread?
My new roommate is bending over backwards to ingratiate himself to me. Uh, nice touch, by the way.
What do you mean, new roommate? What happened to Leonard?
The same thing that happened to Homo Erectus. He was replaced by a superior species.
I am the new Homo in town. That came out wrong.
All right, let me try this again. Where’s Leonard?
He is living at my place, so I am living here.
You are living here provisionally. But I must say it is looking good.
Woah, Leonard and Priya are living together? That is big.
No. Origami napkin swans, that is the headline.
It is a good thing.
Bernadette’s bedroom.
So do you know what kind of research you will be doing at this pharmaceutical company?

Well, there are a couple of opportunities available, but I volunteered for the premature ejaculation project. I mean, it is not like either one of us has heart disease. Oh, I almost forgot. I got you a little present.
Oh, Bernie, no. You did not have to.
I wanted to. Come on, open it.
You bought me a Rolex? How much did this cost?
Oh, you let me worry about the money. I just want my baby to have pretty things.
The apartment.
More wine?
Oh, no, no, no. I have had way too much already.
Here’s an interesting fact about alcohol.
Hit me.
Man is not the only species that ferments fruit in order to become intoxicated. Can you guess what the other is? Hint, sometimes they pack the alcohol in their trunks.
Monkeys.
When does a monkey have a trunk?
When a suitcase just will not do.

Mmm, all right. It would appear as if alcohol is playing keep-away with your intelligence. Good night. Please note, it is now past ten p.m. Per our roommate agreement, kindly refrain from raucous laughter, clinking of glasses, and celebratory gunfire.
Okay, explain something to me. You watch Leonard put up with that guy for years and years. What has to break inside your brain for you to think, Oh, Krishna, I have got to get me some of that?
Well, it is a lot better than having to wear noise-cancelling headphones in my own apartment.
What? Oh, God, yeah. Yeah. Leonard’s a noisy little dude in the sack.
Every night.
Really? Even during allergy season, when he has to alternate between kissing and breathing?
It is my sister. Can we not talk about this any more?
Yeah. Sorry, sorry. Can I tell you a secret?
Yeah.
I screwed up. Leonard’s a great guy. Never should have broken up with him.
Well, uh, to paraphrase Shakespeare, It is better to have loved and lost than to stay home every night and download increasingly shameful pornography.
Oh, you poor baby.
What is wrong with me, Penny?
Nothing, nothing. You know, if we were not friends, and you had not brought up that creepy pornography story, I’d be on you like the speed of light squared on matter to make energy.
Hey, you totally got that right! E equals M C squared.
I listen. I have no idea what it means, but I listen. To friendship.
To friendship.
Would you booze hounds please stop that infernal clinking? And the answer was elephant!
Raj’s apartment. Leonard and Priya are kissing.
Mmm. Mmm.
Leonard, sweetheart, we are kissing, not eating hot soup.
Sorry.
That is my parents on video chat. Go hide in the bedroom.
Oh, come on! Why do not we just tell them that we are dating?
Oh, we have been through this. It is not the time.
When is the time?
I have got five brothers and sisters. One of them is bound to screw up real big, and then I will tell my parents about you. Now, shoo.
Fine.
Hello, Mummy. Hello, Daddy.
We heard there was a tornado in Kansas City. Is that close to you?
No.
Where is your brother?
Out with friends.
I do not like it, a young girl alone in an apartment.
I will sleep so much better when you move back here next month.
You are moving back to India?
Who’s that?
Oh, my God! There is someone in your apartment. Call the police in America!
When were you going to tell me about this?
Oh, hello, Leonard. What a pleasant surprise! Mummy, Daddy, you remember Rajesh’s friend Leonard.
I thought you said Rajesh was out with his friends.
He has many friends.
Rajesh has many friends?
Why are you lying to us?
She is lying because she does not want you to know we are dating.
Leonard!
Well, what difference does it make? If you are moving back to India, we are obviously breaking up.
You know what? I do not want to deal with this right now.
So. Hot in India?
Of course it is. It always is. It is India. Now, what do you have to say for yourself?
Uh. That is a beautiful tapestry.
Leonard’s bedroom. Raj and Penny are in bed.
Oh, God. Oh, God! Oh. Okay, look. This never happened. Do you understand me? Really? Still cannot talk to me?
The living room. Leonard is asleep on the couch.
What are you doing here?
What?
I said, what are you doing here?
I live here.
I have paperwork that says differently.
Priya’s going back to India.
Irrelevant. Rajesh and I have a good thing going and you are not going to ruin it. What are you doing here?
I have been up all night. I had a fight with Bernadette.
Why?
She gave me a beautiful watch.
Leonard, do you understand this?
Yes.
Talk to him.
Damn.
What is going on?
Oh. It is, it is not what it looks like.
What does it look like?
The Cafeteria
It is not what it looks like. It is not what it looks like.
What are you grinding about?
Penny’s brain teaser this morning. She and Koothrappali emerge from your bedroom. She is dishevelled, and Raj is dressed only in a sheet. The sole clue, it is not what it looks like.
Just let it go, Sheldon.

If I could, I would, but I cannot, so I sha not. Now, knowing Penny, the obvious answer is, they engaged in coitus. But, since that is what it looked like, we can rule that out. Let’s put on our thinking cap, shall we? Yes, just like that. Penny could have been inspecting Raj’s anal region for parasites. Oh, boy. That is a true blue friend.
They slept together, Sherlock.
No, you were not listening. She said, it is not what it looks like.
She lied.
Oh. Well do not I look silly sitting here wearing this?
The Cafeteria
Hey.
Hey.
Hey.
Hey. Leonard, is it awkward for you knowing that one of your dear friends had sexual intercourse with a woman you used to love in the very place you lay your head?
No, I am fine with it.

That sounds like sarcasm, but I am going to disregard it, because I have an agenda. Paintball. Specifically, the interdepartmental tournament this weekend. Now, in order to function better as a fighting unit, I thought we should establish a chain of command. Now, it goes without saying that I would outrank the three of you, but the question remains, by how much? Now, I do not see me as some four-star general, back at HQ riding a desk and playing golf with the Secretary of Defence. But I also cannot be Sergeant Cooper, because that might lead you to think of me as just a regular Joe. This might take some thought. As you were.
What the hell is wrong with you?
Yeah, how could you do that?
What is it to you?
I got his back.
Yeah, right. You are just jealous because it turns out I am Penny’s number two choice after Leonard.
Hey, if I was not engaged to Bernadette, that totally could have been me.
Please. Sheldon would have been before you, and he might not even have genitals.
Why do you care so much? You are dating my sister, and Penny and I are in love.
What?
Gentlemen, if I may interject, I have decided my rank will be captain. If it is good enough for Kirk, Crunch and Kangaroo, it is good enough for me.
You are not in love with Penny.
Yes, I am. The god Kamadeva has shot us with his flowery arrows of love.
Who?
He is the Hindu version of Cupid, but way better, because he rides a giant parrot.
Raj, come on. You fall in love with any girl who smiles at you. A month ago, you were writing poems about his fiancee.
I am sorry. What?
Rubbish. He is talking rubbish.
Oh, Bernadette, please play my clarinet.
That could have been about anyone. Besides, you have nothing to worry about, because now I am the dusky half of Koothrapenny.
For the record, I do have genitals. They are functional and aesthetically pleasing.
Penny’s apartment. Penny has a bottle of wine. She cannot find a glass. Finds a measuring jug and uses that instead. There is a knock on the door.
Coming. Yup, that is good. Wine glasses should have handles.
Keeping accurate track of your alcohol intake. Smart idea considering how trampy you get when you have had a few.
You heard what I did?
Well, I heard who you did.
Oh, my God, I screwed up everything. I hurt Leonard, I hurt Raj, I mean, what is wrong with me? I feel like two totally different people, Dr. Jekyll and Mrs. Whore.
Do not be so hard on yourself. Do you know the story of Catherine the Great?
No.
She ruled Russia in the late seventeen hundreds, and one night, when she was feeling particularly randy, she used an intricate system of pulleys to have intimate relations with a horse.
I am… I am sorry. What does this have to do with me?
She engaged in interspecies hanky-panky, and people still call her great. I am sure your reputation can survive you shagging a little Indian boy.
Raj’s apartment. There is a knock on the door. He opens it.
You jerk face! What did you tell Howard? Did you say there was something going on between us? Because he thinks there is. He is completely freaking out!
Please, come in.
What the hell is wrong with you?
Well, you were always so nice to me, I thought maybe you liked me.
I am nice to everyone.
I am sorry.
Damn right, you are sorry. And you tell Howard there is never been anything between us.
I will. Hey, Bernadette?
What?!
Do you think I have a shot with Penny?
Of course you do. You are a cutie pie. Any girl would be lucky to have you.
Penny’s apartment.

You know, I have done this before. In kindergarten, I was supposed to marry Jason Sorensen at recess, but by the time my class got out there, he was already engaged to Chelsea Himmelfarb. So what did I do? Hung upside down from the monkey bars, let all the boys see my underpants.
You cannot blame yourself. When your prefrontal cortex fails to make you happy, promiscuity rewards you with the needed flood of dopamine. We neurobiologists refer to this as the skank reflex.
You know what? Let’s get out of here.
Where are we going?
Somewhere where no one’s seen me naked. We may have to drive awhile.
Subtlety is not her strong suit, is it?
Can I stay at your place for a few nights?
Really? A best friend sleepover? Yay.
Yeah, sure. Yay!
We will make popcorn, stay up all night and I will teach you my secret language, Op.
Sounds great.
Nope. Sounds Gop Rop E A Top.
Yeah, I am gonna go pack a bag.
No, you are not. You are gonna Pop A Cop Kop A Bop A Gop.
The apartment.
Do we really have to wear this camouflage crap to play paintball?
Who said that? Leonard, I can hear your voice, but I cannot see you.
I am not in the mood, Sheldon.
Oh, there you are. Leonard, I know you are upset about recent events, and I have someone here to help.
I do not want to talk to Amy.
No, it is not Amy.
Hello, dear.
You called my mother?
Oh, Leonard, is it really necessary to caption the obvious?
He is been like that since he was a toddler. Look, Mommy, a butterfly. Maddening.
What is going on? What do you want?
Sheldon informed me that you are experiencing an emotional upheaval, and I am here to help.
That is so nice.
And we are back to the obvious. Now, what is up?

Well, uh, okay, um, I do not want to get back together with Penny. We tried it, it was crazy, it did not work, but I cannot deal with the fact that she slept with my friend Raj. And then I find out that Raj’s sister Priya, who I have been going out with for eight months, is moving back to India. So I am just completely confused and alone.
I understand.
Got any advice?
Yes. Buck up.
Excuse me. You are a world-renowned expert in parenting and child development, and all you have got is buck up?
Sorry. Buck up, sissy pants.
Thanks, Mother. I feel much better.
If you need any more help from me, my books are available on Amazon. Logging off.
Amy’s apartment. Amy is brushing Penny’s hair.
Ninety-nine, one hundred. It is like a waterfall of liquid gold. My turn.

You know, I do not even know what the point of me staying in L.A. is. I have not gotten a single acting job since I moved out here. The closest I came was last month, I got a callback for a hemorrhoid commercial.
Oh, I could so see you being the face of haemorrhoids.
I know, right? Maybe I should just move back to Nebraska.
No, I cannot let you do that.
Why not?
For the first time ever, I have a thriving social life. And no pressure, but it kind of lives and dies with you.
Hi, Amy. Can I talk to Penny?
A guest in my trundle bed and a boy at my door? I wish I could tell 13-year-old me it does get better.
How did you know I was here?
It is all over her Facebook page.
I will take your stuff to the bedroom and clear out a drawer.
Thanks.
No problem. Try and keep it in your pants, okay?
So, hi. What is up?
I was wondering if you are free Friday. They are having a Totally ’80s Night at the Greek. Hall & Oates, Katrina and the Waves and three-fifths of Kajagoogoo.
Oh. Gee, that is really sweet, but the thing is…
Aw, there is a thing.
Look, honey, I was really drunk and made a huge mistake last night. We should have never slept together. It is what ruins friendships.
You cannot ruin a friendship with sex. That is like trying to ruin ice cream with chocolate sprinkles.
Come here. Just listen to me. I want to go back to the way we were before. You know, friends. No sprinkles.
Oh. All right.
Thank you.
Well, uh, as your friend, you might like to know that, um, we did not have sex in the conventional sense.
Oh, God. Did you pull some weird Indian crap on me?
No, no. After we got undressed and jumped in bed, you, you asked if I had protection.
Oh, you did, did not you?
Of course. I am always packing. Anyway, um, I had trouble putting it on and you tried to help and, that was all she wrote.
So, we did not actually…
I did. It was beautiful.
Oh!
Penny, please, please promise me you will not tell anybody about this.
Of course I will not. No, I will not.
Oh, good. Um, can I tell people that our love burned too bright and too quickly? Kind of a Candle in the Wind deal?
Sure.
Cool. Can I say it fell apart because you were all, I want to have your babies, and I was like, I am too rock and roll to be tied down?
No.
Can I say I ruined you for white men?
Also no.
Okay, just the candle thing.
Yeah.
Cool. All right friend.
Hmm.
I will see you around.
Okay. Raj, wait. Thank you for being my friend.
Penny?
Mm-hmm?
It is getting beautiful again.
A shed on the paintball range.
All right, this is a Google Earth view of the field of battle.
I do not see anything.

Give it a second to load. Whenever you are ready, AT&T! Okay, here we go. This is us here. To the south is Professor Loomis and the Geology Department. According to their Twitter feed, they are out of sunblock, which means they will have to hug the tree line or risk melanoma. That is our edge. All we have to do is move quickly over this ridge, the rock-worshipping pasty-faced bastards will not know what hit them. All right, let’s move out.
Hang on, Sheldon. How could you not tell me your sister was moving back to India?
Maybe he was too busy writing clumsy penis metaphors about my fiancee.
Screw you. That was a beautifully written penis metaphor.
You know what, guys, I am not in the mood for paintball. What do you say we just bag it?
Fine with me.
Sure, whatever.
You cannot quit. That is a court-martial offence. That is punishable by… You cannot quit.
Sorry, Sheldon, it is just not a good time for playing games.
This is a game to you? Uh, was the Battle of Antietam a game? Huh? Was the sack of Rome a game?
Yes, no and no.

Wait. I just want you all to know that I forgive you. This mutiny is not your fault, it is mine. I have not earned these bars. Although what I lack in leadership, apparently I more than make up for in sewing.
Let it go, Sheldon. I will get you a Jamba Juice on the way home.
No. Jamba Juice is for heroes. And that is what we are going to be.
What are you doing?
Following in the footsteps of Kirk, Crunch and Kangaroo.
Damn those sons of bitches!
Let’s get ’em!
If there is ever a Church of Sheldon, this will be when it started. Ow!
The apartment.
I’d like to propose a toast to the man whose noble sacrifice inspired our victory, Captain Sheldon Cooper.
Here, here.
Excuse me. It is Major Sheldon Cooper. With my last breath, I awarded myself a battlefield promotion. It is kind of a big deal.
Hi. You guys have a minute?
Uh, yeah, sure.
Okay. Um. Well, I already talked to Raj, but I wanted to apologize to the rest of you for, you know, everything.
Please, Penny, let me. We have decided to let our crazy, wonderful night together be just one of those memories you have and can call to mind when you are feeling blue or you are in the shower.
Hey, what you doing, Quick Draw?
Sorry. Go on.

Anyways, I wanted you guys all to know that I have been taking a really hard look at things and come to the conclusion I have to stop kidding myself. I suck at acting. It is time for me to move back to Nebraska.
You are leaving?
Yeah.
What are you going to do in Nebraska?
I do not know, maybe teach acting. Oh, sorry. Hold on. Hello?
Penny, Penny, listen, I hope you are not doing this ’cause of you and me, because I have a girlfriend, and you are a single woman.

Shh! It is my agent, it is my agent. You are kidding. Oh, my gosh. I cannot believe it! Really? Oh, I am so excited, thank you, thank you so much. Okay, bye. I got the haemorrhoid commercial! I start Monday.
What about Nebraska?
Oh, hell with Nebraska. I am gonna be a star!
Have you ever thought of teaching physics?
The apartment. Penny’s ad is on the television. She is at a stables.
Ready to ride?
I do not think so, Mom. Not today.
Oh, sweetie. Haemorrhoids acting up again?
You do not know the half of it.
Oh, yes, I do. Try a dab of this.
Rose-scented Preparation-H for women?
Now, the H is for Her.
I am proud of you.
Shh! Here comes my joke.
How are you doing?
Sittin’ pretty.
The apartment. Leonard is laying out wine and napkins in front of his laptop.
What are you doing?
Oh, uh, Priya’s calling in a few minutes on Skype, and we are gonna have a dinner date.
It is eight o’clock in the morning in Mumbai. How can she have dinner?
Fine, whatever. Priya will be having breakfast.

All right, so technically it is not a dinner date. I suppose you could call it a, uh, dinfast date. But if you did, you’d open yourself to peer-based mocking, such as, Hey, Leonard, how was your dinfast with Priya last night?
That does not sound like mocking.
You did not let me finish. Dinfast . Are those soy-based candles?
I do not know. Why?
Paraffin candles may contain carcinogens. Unless lung cancer is the ambiance you were going for at your dinfast. Dinfast .
Listen, I do not want to be rude, but Priya’s gonna be calling any minute, so…
Oh, yes, Priya. Leonard, you know I make a point of never interfering in your personal affairs.
Yes, I have always admired that about you.
As well you should. But I am going to make an exception here.
Oh, good.
Priya has moved back to India to pursue her law career. Instead of desperately trying to keep this intercontinental relationship alive, you could use that time to take up a hobby.
A hobby?
Yes. I read recently about a fellow in Kansas with an enormous ball of twine. I bet you could give him a run for his money.
You know, some people might say that it is great that we are trying to make things work long distance. They’d say things like, love is stronger than the miles between you.
When I rise to power, those people will be sterilized.
You video-chat with Amy all the time. How is this different?
Do not you like Amy?
Of course I like Amy.
Well, there is the difference.
Excuse me, that is Priya.
Hi, Leonard.
Hey, honey.
I miss you.
Oh, I miss you, too.
I miss the old days when your romantic partners could be returned to the video store.
Penny’s apartment.
Thanks for letting me stay here while Leonard Skypes with his girlfriend.
Oh, it is no problem. It is actually kind of nice. You reading, me reading. We are like an old married couple.
If we were an old married couple, the wife would serve iced tea and snickerdoodles.
I do not have iced tea and snickerdoodles.
A good wife would go to the store.
I want a divorce.
Good. On the way to see the lawyer, pick up some tea and cookies. I must say, I am enjoying your new chair.
It is great, is not it?
It is. Aligns the lumbar, cradles the coccyx, balances the buttocks. This is a chair worthy of the name.
What name?
Chair.
Oh, all right, well, I am glad you like it. I mean, I still cannot get over the fact someone just threw it away.
What?
Yeah, it was just sitting on the street. I paid a homeless guy ten bucks to help me get it up here.
Oh, dear. Oh, dear. Oh, dear.
What is wrong?
I have been sitting in garbage!
Sheldon, take it easy.
You take it easy! I need to use your shower.
I went into this marriage with so much hope.
There is a wet Band-Aid on the shower floor. .
Howard’s workshop.
This is fun. I have never used a hydraulic thermoforming press before.
Pretty sweet, huh? This little baby set the university back 175 grand.
That is three minutes. Should we see what we got?
Hang on.
Oh, yeah. This is one good-looking panini.
