Good, good. Oh, boy, help me out here. Does she want me to kiss her or not?
I speak sign language, I do not read minds.
If you were me, would you kiss her?
Yeah, but I am a make out king.
I was so smooth on that date.
You? I made you smooth. You were an idiot.
Whatever, dude. She kissed me.
It might have been on your lips, but it was my kiss.
Oh, fine. Let’s agree she kissed both of us.
Okay.
The apartment.
Mustache is looking good there, Sheldon.
Do not thank me. Thank the dice. They told me what percentage of my face to shave.
Why are you still doing this?

Because it is working. In the past few weeks, unburdened by trivial decisions, I have co-authored two papers in notable peer-reviewed journals, and I am close to figuring out why the Large Hadron Collider has yet to isolate the Higgs boson particle.
You left out, got chafed testicles because you no longer wear underpants.
The dice giveth and the dice taketh away.
Is Raj out with Emily again?
Yeah, every night for the last month.
Wow, cannot believe he has a girlfriend.
Me neither.
Here’s some other fun news on the Raj/Emily front. He gave her a pair of diamond earrings and leased her a car.
You are kidding.
You think she is taking advantage of him?
Oh, of course not. She would not do something like that. She is deaf.
Deaf women cannot be gold diggers?
Handicapped people are nice, Leonard. Everyone knows that.
Yeah, I actually have information about Raj that would be helpful with this discussion.
Could you tell us?
Let’s see. Snake eyes. Sorry, bud.
Wait, hang on. Doubles. Roll again.
Okay, get this. It does not matter if he is showering her with gifts, because the Koothrappalis are vastly wealthy.
What do you mean, vastly wealthy?
Well, wealthy means a lot of money, and vastly means even more. I am not sure what is tripping you up.
Look, I know they have money. I do not think it is that much.

No, you are wrong. See, as you know, a few years ago, I achieved one of my lesser dreams and became a notary public. Well, from time to time, I notarize banking documents for Raj. The Koothrappalis are not just rich, they are Richie Rich rich.
Well, so how much is that?
About halfway between Bruce Wayne and Scrooge McDuck.
What the hell? The last time we went to the zoo, that son of a bitch made me buy him a churro.
Listen, guys, I am sorry, I do not mean to be rude, but I need to go call Raj’s sister, who I love so much. So vastly much.
Okay, so he is got money, and it is a few gifts and a car.
And she got him to pay off all her credit cards.
What? He paid off her credit cards? Damn it, I could have dated Raj for a couple months. But I, I would not have, because I am not that kind of girl. We should really talk to Raj.
He is not going to listen, he is in love.
Cannot figure out what to do? I remember those days. Now, if you will excuse me, I have to… stay right here.
The gym.
Yeah, this is a bad idea. We should go.
No. I am the one that introduced him to her. I have got to say something.
Wow.
You are engaged to my friend.
Hey, Bernadette does not mind where I get my motor running, as long as I park in the right garage.
I cannot believe you are engaged to my friend. Oh, here she comes.
Smart. Whisper so the deaf chick cannot hear you.
Hi.
Oh, hey, hi. Nice to see you.
Um, can we talk to you about Raj?
She says, sure, what about him?

Okay, um, gosh, how do I start? Um, see, Raj is kind of naive. I mean, he has not dated a whole lot of women. And I am concerned that, without meaning to, you might be taking advantage of him. You know, by letting him buy you a bunch of expensive things.And I.. I… Howard, focus. Tell her what I am saying.
Right. Are you a gold digger or not? Oh, uh, something, something, who the something do you think you are? Mind your own something business and go something yourself. Oh, wait, I got this now.
Penny’s apartment. She answers the door.
I am so mad at you!
Okay, wait…
How dare you ambush my girlfriend at the gym!
We did not mean for it to be an ambush. Just, it is kind of impossible not to sneak up on deaf people. And hey, since when are you so chatty?
I am hammered.
Raj, come here. This girl is trouble. I mean, what kind of relationship is it where you buy her gifts and she gives you sex?
The best one I ever had!
Okay, come on. You know you can do better.
Aha. I see what is going on here. You and I had our crazy night together, and now you cannot stand to see me with another woman.
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa!
It is okay. I cannot get mad at your feelings.
I do not have feelings.
Yeah, that is good. Keep telling yourself that.
He is cuter now that I know he is rich.
Raj’s apartment.

I have a surprise for you. Cover your eyes. Open them. It is a real ruby. It was a little expensive, but no one can put a price on love. Although, the people at Cartier took a pretty good shot at it. Oh, Mummy, Daddy. What a nice surprise.
No, it is not a nice surprise, it is a bad surprise.
Penny called us.
Penny?
She told us you are spending all our money on your new girlfriend.
I just got her a couple of things. She gives me things, too.
Yeah, yeah, I am a gynaecologist. I know exactly what she gives you.
You need to find a nice Indian girl from a good family. If you keep seeing this woman, you are cut off.
What? You are going to make me choose between the woman I love and the money I have very strong feelings for?
It is up to you.
Well, I choose love.
Hah. You are an idiot. Love does not last. Well, he is going to find out eventually. Think about it.
My parents are making me choose between money and you. I choose you. And that necklace, yeah, that, too. But none of those things matter, because we have something better. We have love.
Penny’s apartment.
Oh, Penny, I hurt so bad.
I know, I know.
Sometimes I put the TV on mute just to pretend she is still with me. But I cannot watch the closed captioning without crying.
Oh, I am so sorry. I wish I could make you feel better.
Seriously? I am heartbroken and you are hitting on me?
What? No!
Look, Penny, you are great, but I had a long talk with my parents, and they said if I date an Indian girl, I get a Maserati.
The Cheesecake Factory.
Mmm. Oh, cheesecake, you are just as good as a woman, even though I cannot have sex with you.
Try throwing it in the microwave for a few seconds.
Should I use the rest room or wait until we get home? Come on, papa needs to void his bladder. Oh, that is not what you want to see after three buttermilks.
Here you go, boys. I will pick it up when you are ready.
Thanks for dinner, buddy.
Yeah, real big of you.
Hurry, hurry, hurry.
Oh, and do not cheap out on the tip. We all know you are loaded now.
The comic book store.
It is from Game of Thrones. What do you think?
I do not know. If we are going to start a fantasy sword collection, and I have long thought we should, is this really the sword to start with?
What did you have in mind?
Well, off the top of my head, I’d have to go with Excalibur. It gives you the right to rule England.
It would be a replica of a movie prop.
Fair enough. It’d give you the right to rule a replica of England.
Well, they do not have an Excalibur here, so what do you want to do?
Mm. Tough decision. There is no weaponry from Lord of the Rings, forged in a Chinese sweatshop?
Just Bilbo Baggins’ sword over there.
Two grown men with a hobbit is dagger; would not we look silly? Okay, let’s go for it.
Oh, I see you guys have found my little treasure.
Yeah. It is okay, I guess.
Okay? It is magnificent.
Buh-buh-buh-buh! What do you want for it?
Oh, it is hard to put a price on something that is a copy of something that was on pay cable. But for my friends, let’s say 250?
Oh, that is pretty steep.
Well, it is a limited edition. They only made 8,000 of these bad boys.
Only 8,000? We are wasting precious time. Buy it.
Hang on. Can you do any better?
Are you kidding? I am already giving you the friends and family discount.
Oh, did you hear that? We are getting the friends and family discount. We are honoured and we will take it.
Slow down. Two hundred.
What are you doing? Two fifty is already the discounted price.
Will you shut up?
Tell you what, I will go two thirty-five.
Nope. Maybe another time.
Okay, two twenty five, my final offer.
Take it, take it.
Two hundred.
Man, you are killing me!
Killing you? I cannot breathe.
Two ten, and I am losing money.
Oh, now, we cannot let him lose money, Leonard. I am so sorry.
Two ten and you throw in the Iron Man helmet.
Are you crazy? That helmet’s signed by Robert Downey Jr.
So?
Okay, if you are going to question the importance of an actor’s signature on a plastic helmet from a movie based on a comic book, then all of our lives have no meaning!
Okay, fine. Just the sword, two ten.
Thank you. I can eat meat this week.
See that? I just saved us forty bucks.
I have long said, what you lack in academic knowledge you make up for in street smarts.
You want me to wrap it?
No, it is okay. I am gonna stab my friend in the chest.
Hey, Stuart.
Ah, hey, Wil.
Hello, Wil Wheaton.
Hi, Sheldon. Nice sword.
It is part of my sword collection. Do you have a sword collection?
No.
I am not surprised.
Here’s the Batman 612 with the Jim Lee alternate cover that you wanted.
Awesome. What do I owe you?
Forty bucks.
Good deal.
Sucker. Did not even ask for the friends and family discount.
Hey, I am having a party at my house on Friday, and I was hoping you would stop by.
Will there be girls there?
Yeah, of course.
‘Cause there was not last time.
There will be girls. You guys are invited if you want to come by.
Thank you.
All right, great. Later.
I see what you are doing. You accept an invitation to a party at the home of my sworn enemy, he tells everyone we are going to be there, and when we do not show, he looks the fool. Fiendishly clever.
I was actually thinking about going.
And then declaring the party a fiasco and storming out, leaving him humiliated in front of his guests. Love it.
No, I was gonna grab Raj and Howard and have a good time.
Oh, great, more guys. It is gonna be another Wil Wheaton sausage-fest.
The apartment.
Sheldon, can you grab me a water?
Possibly.
Can you or cannot you?
It is not that simple, Leonard.
It never is, is it?

At this moment, our relationship exists in two mutually contradictory states. Until you either do not go or go to Wil Wheaton’s party, you are simultaneously my friend and not my friend. I am characterizing this phenomenon as Schrodinger’s Friendship.
Got it. Can I have my water?
Of course. Now get it yourself, you traitor.
Wait, what is going on?
In case you have forgotten, Schrodinger’s cat is a thought experiment…

No, no, no, no, I did not forget. Um, there is this cat in a box and until you open it, it is either dead or alive or both. Although, back in Nebraska, our cat got stuck in my brother’s camp trunk, and we did not need to open it to know there was all kinds of dead cat in there.
Homespun stories, knowledge of physics and a bosom that defies it. You are the whole package, are not you?
Sorry I am late. Uh, I got great news. NASA picked my team’s design for the deep field space telescope that is going on the International Space Station this spring.
Wow.
Howie, that is wonderful! Congratulations!
It gets better. Someone has to go up with the telescope as a payload specialist, and guess who that someone is.
Mohammed Lee.
Who’s Mohammed Lee?
Mohammed is the most common first name in the world, Lee, the most common surname. As I did not know the answer, I thought that gave me a mathematical edge.
It is me, Sheldon. It is me. I am going up in space! Technically, I am an astronaut.
Wow, that is amazing!
Hang on a second. NASA does not have a shuttle any more. How are you going to get up there?

Oh, well, it is really cool. You fly to Moscow, they take you out to Kazakhstan, and then you get into a Russian Soyuz rocket which shoots you into a low earth orbit. Or just sits there on the launch pad because the Kazakhi mafia sold the rocket fuel on the black market.
Are those Russian rockets safe?
Well, I mean, safe as it can be when it was built by the good folks who brought you Chernobyl.
I’d like to propose a toast. The dream to go up into space is one we all share, and Howard’s making that a reality. We are all very proud of you.
Cheers.
That was a lovely toast. Kudos.
Thank you.
Simultaneously, a festival of cloying clichs. You sicken me.
Bernadette’s car.
You are really quiet. Is everything okay?
Fine. Just a little tired.
I hope not too tired, because I am feeling particularly masculine right now. All systems go, if you catch my drift.
I always catch your drift.
All right, well, something’s obviously bugging you. What is it?
I just cannot believe you signed up for the space program without even talking to me.
Oh, I get it. You are worried about me. That is so sweet. You know, there is a saying we have at NASA. What makes the right stuff so right is that it always comes home.
Just stop talking, Howard.
This is not the reaction I expected when I told you I was gonna be an astronaut.
What did you think was going to happen?
Honestly? Sex.
Howard.
Do you realize what a big deal this is? What an honour it is to be chosen to go into space?
Yeah, I get it. I just wish you included me in the decision. We are supposed to be partners. We are supposed to be a team.
I am sorry. You are right. Okay, let’s try this again. Bernadette, an opportunity has come up that impacts both of us, and I’d like to discuss it.
Okay.
I have been offered a chance to go up to the International Space Station for three weeks. What are your thoughts on that?
Well, first of all, thank you for including me in the decision-making process.
Hey, we are a team. So, what do you think?
No.
No?
No.
Well why not?
Howard, my father was a police officer. We never knew from one night to the next if he was going to come home alive. It was horrible. And I do not want to live that way with you.
Hey, my father abandoned me and my mother when I was 11. We never saw him again.
Oh, boo-hoo, you are not going to space!
The apartment.
Pretty cool about Howard, huh?
Do not talk to me as if nothing’s happened between us. And yes, it sure is, buddy.
For God’s sake, will you stop with the Schrodinger stuff.
Would you prefer a simpler application of Heisenberg’s uncertainty principle, in which I could either know where you are or whether I like you, but not both?
You never stop talking, do you?
I do not understand. What differences does it make if Leonard goes to Wil Wheaton’s party?
Wil Wheaton is Sheldon’s mortal enemy.
Mortal enemy?
Mm-hmm.
Sheldon, I know you are a bit of a left-handed monkey wrench, but, you really have a mortal enemy?
In fact, I have 61 of them. Would you like to see the list?
Oh, say no, say no, say no, say no.
You just got off the list. Would you like back on it? This will just take a moment. It is on a five and a quarter inch floppy.
A floppy disk?
Well, I started the list when I was nine.
How did Wil Wheaton get on the list?
Oh! Oh, God!

As a child, I loved Wesley Crusher, Wil Wheaton’s character on Star Trek. So, I drove for hours by bus to a Star Trek convention at which Wil Wheaton was scheduled to appear, so that I could get my Wesley Crusher action figure signed. But he never showed, because apparently, it was cooler for him to be the lower-left corner on Hollywood Squares. Oh, damn! The floppy failed. Well, whoever was in charge of quality control at the Verbatim Corporation in 1989, congratulations, you just made the list.
Howard’s bedroom.
Howard?
Change your mind about sex? I am still mad, but I will do it.
No, I have just been thinking. It does not matter if I am afraid for your safety. I do not want to be the person who stands between you and your dreams.
Really?
Really. If going into space means that much to you, I will never say another word about it.
Thank you.
I love you.
I love you, too. So, sex now?
Okay. I just forgot to brush my teeth. I will be right back.
Over my dead body my son goes into outer space!
I am ready.
The cafeteria.
Wait, let me see if I got this right. You actually asked Bernadette to leave your house in the middle of the night?
What choice did I have? She went behind my back and turned my own mother against me.
Wow. You are not only our first astronaut. You are also the first one of us to kick a girl out of bed. You are like a rock star.
Little bit.
I hate to say it, but she did kind of betray you.
Interesting. You see betrayal in others, but not yourself.
Going to Wheaton’s party is not betraying you.
Oh, of course you would have to believe that. Evil always thinks it is doing right. Excuse me, Stormtrooper. These are the droids you are looking for.
I am going to a party. I am not turning R2-D2 and C-3PO over to the empire!
Not yet.
So, what is gonna happen next? Are you and Bernadette going to break up?
I do not know. If we are going to get back together, she is going to have to apologize and accept that I am a grown man who can make his own decisions.
Then she is going to have to convince your mother to let you go into space.
Obviously.
Penny’s apartment.
I had no choice. I had to tell his mother. He cannot go to space. He is like a baby bird. Do you know he once got an asthma attack from reading an old library book?
You are kidding.
No, I was there that day. Sheldon threw his back out handing him that book.
I do not know what I am going to do. I do not want to break up over this.
Okay, why do not you just tell him you made a mistake?
Do you guys think it was a mistake? Am I the bad guy in this?
It is not for us to judge. We are just here to provide comfort and support while you come to grips with what a despicable thing you have done.
Oh, God, you are right. I took our love and threw it under his bus-sized mother. I need to apologize.
Well, that, that is good. I am glad you came to that. But before you do, let me just ask you a big picture question.
What?
Are you a hundred percent positive you love and want to marry Howard Wolowitz?
I do, with all my heart.
Got it. Just had to check.
He is great.
The apartment.
All right, Sheldon, we are going to Wil’s. This is your last chance.

No, Leonard, this is your last chance. One day, a historian is going to come to you and say, is it true you were friends with Dr. Sheldon Cooper? And you are going to have to choke back a hot sob of regret and humiliation as you mumble, I was, but I chose to go to a party thrown by the one kid from Stand By Me that no one remembers.
You want to drive?
Sure.
Hey, Sheldon?
Oh, good. You picked me, you picked me.
No, I just got a text from Stuart. Brent Spiner is at the party.
Brent Spiner?
Yes.
I do not care.
Really? Brent Spiner, Mr. Data himself. You love him.
I did, but I think I have kind of outgrown Star Trek. You know, stock characters, ludicrous plots, beam me up. What a load of hooey.
I am going. Live long and prosper, Sheldon.
Yeah, even that. You look like a dork.
Howard’s bedroom.
Howard, Bernadette’s here!
Tell her I am not home!
What kind of a schmuck play is that? She can hear you shouting!
Can we talk?
You can. I have nothing to say.
All right. I just wanted to tell you I am sorry I said something to your mother.
I was gonna tell her eventually, but you went behind my back.
I know. I am sorry. I got scared.
If you are gonna love me, you are gonna have to love the whole package, the tenderhearted poet and the crazy daredevil.
I know.

Well, do not say it if you are not gonna mean it, ’cause I am not just gonna stop with the space station. Yeah, I want to go to the Moon, I want to go to Mars. I want to take a one-man sub to the lowest depths of the ocean.
Really? You got seasick on Pirates of the Caribbean.
Well, those big kids were rocking it.
I just did what I did because I love you so much, and the thought of losing you is more than I can handle.
Really?
You are my soul mate. This is where you kiss me.
Right, right.
Make up all you want! Your tuchus is not leaving this planet!
Wil Wheaton’s party.
Hey, you know that beautiful actress who plays the Borg Queen in First Contact?
Yeah.
Well, I just met her gynaecologist!
What are you doing here?

Fighting for our friendship. As peculiar and annoying as you can be, you are still my little buddy. I am not going to let that end here tonight. Now put down that drink, let’s meet Brent Spiner and go home.
Hey, Sheldon, I am so glad you made it. I found something I think you might like.
What I’d like is for him to have a more depressing home. This is quite lovely.
This is for you.
An original mint-in-package Wesley Crusher action figure.
I remembered your story about the time you went to a convention when you were a kid to get one signed, and I did not show up.
Look at what I wrote.
To Sheldon, sorry this took so long. Your friend, Wil Wheaton.
It is my last one. I want you to have it.
Look, everyone. Wil Wheaton is my friend!
Oh, wow. I have not seen one of these in years. Remember how we used to make these things look like they were masturbating?
Brent Spiner, what have you done? That was an original mint-in-package Wesley Crusher action figure signed by my close personal friend, Wil Wheaton.
Sorry, Slim. I have got some Mr. Data dolls in the trunk of my car. You want me to sign one for you?
You have already signed something, Brent Spiner. Your name on my list. From this moment on, you are my mortal enemy.
Do not worry. It does not take up a whole lot of your time.
Come on, buddy. Let’s not waste another second on this loser. Love your house.
Can we get autographed dolls?
Sure. Twenty bucks.
Ten.
Eighteen.
Twelve.
Sixteen.
Two for thirty. And you come to my birthday party.
Done.
The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
So what kind of cruise is this you are going on?
It is called the Born Again Boat Ride. Christian Quarterly gave it their highest rating, five thorny crowns. I do wish you’d come with me, Sheldon.
Well, Mom, if I did, it would be conclusive proof that your God can work miracles.
You are missing out. It is gonna be wall-to-wall fun. It is all themed. There is Jonah and the Whale Watching, all-you-can-eat Last Supper Buffet, and my personal favourite, Gunning with God.
What is Gunning with God? I am afraid to ask.
Oh, it is a hoot and a half. You write your sins on a clay pigeon, they fire ’em up in the air, and you pulverize them with a 12-gauge shotgun full of our Lord’s forgiveness.
Frankly, Mom, I am encouraged to see how advanced your group has become, willing to sail out into the ocean without fear of falling off the edge.
For example, if Shelly was aboard, he’d write “smart mouth” on his pigeon, and then bam!
The Lord giveth and the Lord bloweth away. Well, Mom, according to my itinerary for our weekend together, the fun begins with fried chicken.
Sounds delicious.
Good, ’cause I got you everything you need to make it. You are in for a treat. My mother’s fried chicken is why we had to buy my dad the extra large coffin.
Sheldon, she just got off the plane. She does not want to cook.
Of course she does. Making me food is her way of saying I love you. Making me food when she is too tired to cook is her way of saying I really love you.
Actually, I would not mind going out for a bite, Sheldon.
Will not that spoil our appetites for the chicken you are going to make me?
All right, that settles it, we are going out. Do you like sushi? There is a great little place down the street.
I have never had it, but there is no harm in trying something new.
There is a lot of harm in trying something new. That is why we test out drugs and cosmetics on bunny rabbits.
Sheldon, you are talking like a crazy person.
Actually, I had him tested as a child. Doctor says he is fine.
Told you.
Although, I do regret not following up with that specialist in Houston.
A sushi bar.
Irasshaimase!
Stop yelling! I am not happy about this.
What is the last thing you were ever happy about?
The prospect of fried chicken.

This is exciting. Back home, the diner on Route Four serves sushi, but it is just cut up fish sticks and a side of Uncle Ben’s. They put it on the menu in those kung fu letters, but that do not make it sushi.
Uh, kung fu letters might not be politically correct.
Oh, I thought the one we could not say was ching chong.
Yeah, yeah, that, too.
So, Shelly, what is up with you and your friend Amy, if you do not mind a mother prying a bit?
Well, there is actually big news on the Amy front. She is been studying the neurobiology of addiction in lower animals. She is this close to getting a starfish hooked on cocaine.
Do you have any idea what is going on with those two?
It is kind of like the Loch Ness monster. Maybe there is something there, maybe there is not. We will probably never know. But sometimes it is fun to creep yourself out thinking about it.
How are you doing on the young lady front? I hear you are in some sort of a long distance situation?
Uh, yeah, it is Raj’s sister. It is kind of tough. She is in India. Also, her parents are not happy she is dating someone white.

Oh, that is a funny turn, is not it? You never think about it going the other way. Well, you cannot force things. You need to figure out if you are in a relationship or if you are just calling it one. It is like they say, a cat can have kittens in the oven but that do not make ’em biscuits.
And that reminds me of another saying. You can lead a chicken to Crisco, but you cannotmake your mother fry it.
Sheldon, you pester me one more time about chicken, I will put you over my knee right here in this restaurant.
Please pester her. Please, for me.
The stairwell.
So, Mrs. Cooper, what did you think of the sushi?
It was good. The only thing that would have made it better is if it was cooked and if it was beef. Sheldon, when is your landlord going to fix the elevator?
I do not know. Lately we have been talking about converting it into a missile silo.
Your son seems to think we need to launch a pre-emptive strike on Burbank.
Get them before they get us.
Hey, look who decided to show up.
Raj, what are you doing?
I could not find you guys so I bought six new friends. Three, sadly, are dead.
Mom, you remember Rajesh? Rajesh, my mother.
Of course. Mrs. Cooper. So nice to see you again.
Well, it is so nice to see you, too. I thought it was our Indians that had the occasional alcohol problem.
We do not say that, either. I will make you a list.
Oh, that would be mighty white of you. So, Raj, what pain are you trying to cover up with alcohol?
Nothing, I am fine.
Are ya?
No.
That is better. Now tell me what is bothering you.
I am so lonely.

Oh, yes, born alone, die alone. It is a tragic human condition. Now, Raj, if you will excuse my mother, she is about to make a pecan pie that will be so good I will almost forget how she blew it with the fried chicken.
Sheldon, your friend is hurtin’. What do we do when someone’s hurtin’?
Offer them a hot beverage.
And when they are drunk as a skunk, what beverage do we offer?
Coffee.

And what do we do it with? Now you listen to me. I know you feel like you cannot find someone, but there is a lock for every key. Back home, there is a girl works at the Wal-Mart. Tall, tall girl. Woman could hunt geese with a rake. Thought she’d never find a man, then one day, would not ya know, Harlem Globetrotters come to town. Long story short, today that woman travels the world with a semi-professional basketball player and two beautiful mixed-race babies.
I did not get a lot of that because of your accent, but the general tone was soothing and somehow I feel better.
I am not going to get my pecan pie, am I?
You want some Oreos?
Double Stuf?
No, regular.
Nice. Kick a man when he is down.
The laundry room.
I am glad we are finally getting to do something together, just the two of us.
Sure. One thing you really miss when you are on vacation is laundry.
Careful, you are using too much Downey. You know if my clothes get too soft it makes me sleepy.
Well, this takes me back. Me doing your laundry, you next to me criticizing.
It is nice, is not it?
Mrs. Cooper. Hi!
Oh, hello, darlin’.
Sheldon, you did not tell me your mom was coming.
It was in my weekly e-mail blast. Right between beet season is finally here, and uh-oh, red stool from beets leads to cancer scare.
So, how have you been?
Good, good.
I hear that Leonard has a new girlfriend. How are you doing with all that?
Oh, fine. You know, it is been a while. I am getting back out there.
Let me ask you, when you get back out there, are you wearing this?
Well, it is super cute on. That top has paid for itself in free drinks like ten times what it cost.
Yes, Penny has a lot of her money tied up in promiscuity futures.
Hon, you think maybe the reason why you are having trouble finding a guy to settle down with is because you are letting them ride the roller coaster without buying a ticket?
Oh, they do not always get to ride the roller coaster. Sometimes they only get to spin the teacups. Now I am going out tonight. Would it be crazy to ask you to look at the outfit I am going to wear?
Oh, not crazy at all. And do not beat yourself up. When I was your age, you could have me for a car ride and a bottle of strawberry wine.
Now that will not be in this week’s e-mail blast.
The apartment.
So, this spring, I get to go to the International Space Station.
Oh, my word, a trip to the heavens. If you ever want to live there eternally, I have got a good book you could read.
Thanks, but I watch the Charlie Brown Christmas special every year, so I get the gist.
I bet your mom is really proud of you.
Nope. She says if I do not back out she is going to go on a hunger strike. It would take years before she’d be in any kind of danger, but still.

I have got a treat for us tomorrow, Mom. I am taking you to see Saul Perlmutter give a lecture about his Nobel Prize-winning work in cosmology. And the best part is, at the Q and A afterward, I have worked up a couple of Q’s that will stump his sorry A.
I do not know, Shelly. I thought we could do a little sightseeing.
What sight is better than your little boy embarrassing a Nobel laureate?
Come on, Sheldon, we will take your mom to see the Hollywood sign, the wax museum, the Walk of Fame.
Ooh, maybe a little Rodeo Drive.
Well, I cannot spend twelve thousand dollars on a handbag, but it is free to look upon those who do with righteous condemnation.
What do you say?
What do I say? I say you people need to stop ruining my mom’s visit with your sushi, and your sadness and your slutty shirts. Stop it.
He is not talking about your shirt. Your shirt is fine.
The kitchen.
These are delicious.
The trick to pancakes is bacon grease. I cook everything in it.
Everything? Are not you worried about your health?
Oh, doctors are always changing their mind. One week bacon grease is bad for you. The next week we are not getting enough of it. Good morning, Shelly.
Mom, I want to apologize for my behaviour last night.
Apology accepted.

Great. Now, you are going to love the Perlmutter lecture. Look, he will be stating that the universe is older than 6,000 years, but I thought you could stick your fingers in your ears and hum Amazing Grace during those parts.
I am still going out with your friends.
But I apologized. And that was hard for me because I did not do anything wrong.
Shelly, I hung out with you in enough dusty lecture halls while you were growing up. I want to go sightseeing. So why do not you have some pancakes, get dressed and come with us.
I am not going, and you cannot make me.
You are right, I cannot. Have a nice day.
Well, I am going to stand here until you change your mind.
Well, then you are going to stand there all day.
I am just gonna take my bacon grease and slide over there.
I cannot believe my own mother is abandoning me.
I am not abandoning you. Sheldon, abandoning you is leaving you in a basket on a church doorstep. I am going to Hollywood and thank a wax Ronald Reagan for his service to our country.
We appear to be at a crossroads in our relationship, Mother.
Well, I guess we are.
Sorry. Syrup.

All right, Mom. When you are at the Ripley’s Believe It Or Not Museum, if they have an exhibit about a mother who threw away a chance to spend the day with the world’s most wonderful son, believe it, because it is true.
I had not…
Amy’s apartment.
That lecture was a waste of time. I made more accurate diagrams of the expansion of the early universe on the nursery wall with the contents of my diaper.
Are you getting sick?
No, I am just allergic to people who get Nobel Prizes for no good reason.
Sheldon, is it possible that your foul mood, or, to use the clinical term, bitchiness, is because your mother is not making you a priority?
No. Or to use the clinical term, nuh-uh.
Are you sure? The infant-mother pair-bond is the building block of primate psychology.
Oh, there it is. It always comes back to monkeys with you. Just monkeys, monkeys, monkeys.
Sheldon, we are all animals. And granted, there are aspects of you that are extraordinary, but when it comes to emotions and relationships, you are just like everybody else.
Are you trying to suggest that my emotional problems are no different than those of a stupid person?
Actually, some research indicates that by not over-thinking, the less intelligent handle emotions better. Sure you are not coming down with a cold?
Oh, yes, the common cold. Just like everyone else. You’d love that, would not you?
A church.
Oh, this one’s sweet. You know, for your rosary rattlers.
Mrs. Cooper, we say Catholics, not rosary rattlers.
My goodness, it is a wonder you people in California can talk at all.
This is like the worst Hollywood tour ever.
What are you gonna do? She wanted to see churches.
Hey, they have wine here, do not they?
Hey, none of our gods have abs like that.
Yep, that is the last Jew who did sit-ups. And look where it got him.
Hey, while we are here, why do not we all do some praying? Let’s put a little church in this church.
Oh, I am not sure we should.

It is easy. I will show you how. Lord, Mary Cooper here. Coming to you from Gomorrah, California. I want to thank you for the blessing that is my little Shelly. I also want to thank you for the continued strength not to coldcock him with my Bible. All right, Penny, your turn.
Okay, um, hey, God. What is up? Um, I am good, but, uh, it would be a big help to my family if you could get my brother to stop cooking meth. But no cops. Be cool.
She also goes a little overboard on the love thy neighbour. Could probably use that chat you had with Mary Magdalene. Leonard, you are up. Wasserman, you are on deck.
Okay. I do not know, it is probably a little late to ask you to make me taller. Oh, um, if you could help out with me and my girlfriend. She is all the way in India. That would be great.
Hear that? Girl trouble. Turns out we were both wrong on that front. How about you?
Oh, me? No. Thanks, I am good. I am really just trying not to burst into flames.
Rajesh?
He says he is having trouble dropping those last five pounds.
Huh, I might have gone with the talking-to-girls thing.
No, you only get one wish.
A park bench. Sheldon is sitting. A stranger sits next to him.

Look at the two of us. Me, a highly regarded physicist. The kind of mind that comes along once, maybe twice in a generation. You, the common man, tired from your labours as a stockbroker, or vacuum cleaner salesman, or bootblack. But deep down inside, apparently we are just two peas in a pod. A regular pea, and the kind of pea that comes along once, maybe twice in a generation. Rain. Another great equalizer. Falling on the head of the brilliant and the unremarkable alike. Smarty-pants.
The kitchen.
Oh, Mrs. Cooper, it smells so good.
You take notes, darlin’. The real way to get a man is with melted cheese and cream of mushroom soup. He will die at 50 but his love will be true.
I need a tissue.This one got wet.
Here.
Thank you. Yeah, I have learned something today. You and I, in so many ways, other than intelligence and what counts, we are the same.
Sweetheart, are you sick?
I hope so, because if this is well, life is not worth living.
Oh, sugarpie, you are burning up. We have got to get you to bed.
Okay.
Do not worry. Mama’s here to take care of her baby.
And just to be clear, only her baby and not these other people.
Of course.
Can I have tea with honey and toast with the crust cut off?
You can have whatever you want.
Thanks, Mom.You are the best.
Sheldon’s bedroom.
Boy, last time I put VapoRub on you, you did not have hair on your chest.
I know, it filled in last year. I did not get to spend a lot of time with you on this visit.
And whose fault was that?
Yours.
Shelly, you are not eight years old any more. We have to have a different relationship.
No, we do not. The one we have works great.
Sweetheart, you are a grown man.
Or maybe I am part of a new species, that lives for hundreds of years, which means I am still basically a toddler.
Oh, I so should have taken you to Houston.
Does this mean you are not going to sing Soft Kitty?
No, I will always sing you Soft Kitty. Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur…
Mrs. Cooper, were we supposed to take that pie out of the oven?
Get out!
Well, that was rude.
Well, I know, but he means well. Sing.
Happy kitty, sleepy kitty…
What are you trying to pull, Mom? From the top.
This is what I am talking about. Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur…
Sheldon’s office.

And reverse the spin on the antiproton, and gamma becomes alpha, multiplied by a matrix of negative I comma zero, and there we have it. Conclusive proof that I am absolutely worthless after nine o’clock.
Sheldon, Sheldon.

Hmm. All right, all right. I see what is going on. A little pre-Halloween hijinkery. A ghostly moan, a rattling of chains, a witch’s cackle. The trifecta of haunted house clichés. Instead of eek, I say yawn.
Sheldon.

Oh, the walls are dripping blood, which looks nothing like a phenolphthalein indicator exposed to a sodium carbonate solution. Ah. Okay, all right. That one was clever. Skeleton with phosphorous on a zip line. Come on out, merry pranksters. Take a bow.
You should have seen your face.
Yes, there is nothing quite like the slightly widened eyes of mildly startled.
Come on, admit it. We got you, Sheldon.

Please, fright depends on an element of surprise. The simple fact is, because I am much smarter than you, and able to anticipate your actions, it is highly unlikely that you two rubes could ever surprise me.
He is probably right.
We cannot beat him. He is just too smart.
Gentlemen. .
Who had money on faints?
I had pee his pants.
Hang on. Looks like everyone’s a winner.
The comic book store.
Oh. Watch out, Sheldon. This little boy Casper is a g-g-g-ghost!
Droll.
Not as droll as a grown man passed out in a puddle of his own urine.
That was pretty droll. With a hint of ammonia.

Yes, enjoy your japes, gentlemen. You think you have poked fun at a milquetoast academic. Well, you have forgotten one thing. I am also a son of the Lone Star state. I am Texas through and through. And we know how to settle scores down there. If you doubt me, ask Mexico.
Hot girl, nine o’clock. Do not everybody look at once!
What is she doing in a comic book store?
I do not know, she might be lost. Does not matter. Watch and learn. Hi.
Hi.
Um… it-it-it… Shut up.
Are you getting this Next Men?
Uh, yeah. It is issue number 21. First appearance of Hellboy.
I know. I have been looking for it for years.
Sorry.
Hey, if I pretended to hit on you, could I distract you enough to sneak it away?
Yes, but you’d be using your superpowers for evil.
Damn, I am forbidden by my Kryptonian father to do so. I am Alice.
Leonard.
You are very cute, Leonard.
Thanks. You, too. You know, go ahead and take it.
No, no. No, no, I, I, I did evil. Would you be open to a trade?
Uh, yeah, yeah, sure, I guess.
Okay. Here. This is my number, call me.
Sorry, palm’s a little sweaty. What is that word?
Alice.
Oh, right, your name. That makes more sense than penis.
Later.
Did we just see you pick up a girl in a comic book store?
‘Cause if you did, you get your picture up there on the Wall of Heroes.
No, I do not think I picked her up. Besides, I have a girlfriend.
Does not matter. This is the closest anyone’s ever come. You are going on the wall, my friend.
Entering the apartment building.
Be sure to check the mail.
How many times are you gonna tell me? What is with you?
Nothing. It is not suspicious that I am fixating. It is consistent with my personality.
Right.
Hey, guys.
More Halloween candy? Did not you just buy a bunch of it yesterday?
Oh. Yeah. That is gone. It is a rough month when Halloween and PMS hit at the same time.
Leonard does not have time to chat, he has to get the mail.
Will you relax? I will get it in a minute. Hey, how was work?
Open the mail!
Excuse me. A couple of circulars, nothing important.
What is with him?
Hang on. You might be from Texas, but I am from New Jersey.
The apartment. Leonard is with Alice.
Check it out. Jim Lee drew this of me two years ago at Comic Con.
What are you wearing?
Well, you know, it is Comic Con. I am Lion-O from ThunderCats.
Wow, you must have gotten so laid.
No. But Jessica Alba did rub my furry belly.
Want to see a comic I draw?
You are kidding. You have your own book?
Yeah. It is kinda based on my life.
Cool. Oh, look. That is you having sex with a guy in the top half of a Chewbacca costume. Comic Con?
You’d think, but no.
You are very talented. This is really good. Did you do…
So, can I trade you my comic for the Hellboy?
You can have my car.
Sheldon’s office.
Oh, dear. Oh, dear, oh, dear. Oh, dear, oh, dear. Oh, dear. Oh, dear. Purell, Purell, Purell, Purell.
Good morning, Sheldon.
It is, is not it? Oh, bother. Is not that just always the way? You go to staple something, and you are out of staples. Gosh, I wish I’d known that earlier today when I was at Staples.
You have a thing of paper clips right there.
well, no, no, I need something more permanent to join these papers. Say, do not you keep staples in your top desk drawer?
I do not know. Maybe.
Be a lamb and check.
All right. Who do we have here?
It is a snake. A terrifying snake.
Oh, did some bad man put us in a drawer?
Stop talking like that. You have been rendered speechless by fear.
Let’s go to the biology lab and find you some nice yummy mice.
I tried to scare an Indian with a snake. Come on, Cooper. You are better than this.
Penny’s apartment. There is a knock.
It is open.
Hey, you got a minute?
Yeah, sure, come on in.
Thanks.
Want some mac and cheese?
No. Lactose. Gas.
Glass of wine?
No. Sulfites. Migraines.
Okay, well, I’d offer you Halloween candy, but that is gone. So, what is up?
Okay, we used to go out, right?
Oh, my God, that is where I know you from.
I am dealing with a situation and it is kind of about my love life, so I know that might be weird for us to talk about, but in this area, as you know, all my other friends are just so stupid.
All right, what is going on?
So, you are okay talking about this?
Yes.
You are sure it is not weird.
It is okay.
You know what, if you ever want to talk to me about a problem in your life with a guy, then I would be fine with that.
Okay, good, because there is this one guy I used to date who’s about to be force-fed wine and cheese if he does not get to the point.
Okay, uh, here it is. Is it cheating if a guy has a girlfriend…
Yeah, probably.
Come on.
I am sorry, go ahead.
I met this girl, and she is great. We have a lot in common.
Did you guys do it?
No. We just made out a little.
Oh, look at you, you bad boy. Did you tell her about Priya?
Well, I was gonna, but there were too many tongues in my mouth.
That is gross.
Here’s the thing, I, I am not one of those guys who sneaks around and sleeps with more than one woman.
Well, good for you.
The problem is, I want to be one of those guys.
So sleep with the new girl and lie to Priya.
Oh, that is not who I am.
All right, then break it off with the new girl.
Now, let’s not do anything rash. She is really hot.
If you like this girl so much, why do not you just end things with Priya?
Priya and I are in love. I think we could get married someday.
Leonard, you are looking for a way to sleep with both women and have everybody be happy about it.
Now we are getting somewhere.
What does your gut tell you?
Go ask Penny; she will know what to do.
The apartment. Sheldon is adjusting a device on his arm.
Hello, Howard. I have realized that you scaring me was all in jest. Allow me to say, job well done. Perfect.
What are you doing?
Science. You would not understand.
Hey, well, see you. I am going out.
I thought you were leaving the apartment.
Yeah, me, too. I cannot make up my mind.
Are you concerned because the world is filled with big dogs and bullies?
No. I am having a moral crisis.
Well, if it is of any help, I have read all the great moral philosophers, including Dr. Seuss.
Oh, what the hell. I am supposed to go see that girl from the comic book store, Alice, but I do not know if I should, because I am going out with Priya, but she is in India.
All right. So the topic at hand is sexual fidelity. Probably will not be relying on Seuss here. Although One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish might be surprisingly applicable. Go on.
Well, they say at the end of your life, you regret the stuff you did not do more than the stuff that you did, and I am pretty sure Alice is the stuff I want to do.
You know, the German philosopher, Friedrich Nietzsche, believed that morality is just a fiction used by the herd of inferior human beings to hold back the few superior men.
That actually does help.
It is worth noting that he died of syphilis.
Screw it, I am going.
On your way home, will you pick up some orange juice?
Do you mind? I am questioning a lot of things in my life right now.
Is one of those things your fondness for orange juice?
No.
Great. Tropicana, no pulp.
Howard’s house. Sheldon rings the doorbell.
Hey, Sheldon.
Who is it?
It is me, Sheldon, Mrs. Wolowitz.
That is not my mom, it is Bernadette.
Really? That is very unsettling.
Hi, Sheldon.
Hi.
What is up?
It just occurred to me that I never formally congratulated you on your pending nuptials. So I hopped on the first bus and hightailed it down here to shake your hand. Put ‘er there, you old so-and-so.
Well, I, I am gonna see you at work in 12 hours, do not you think it could have waited until then?
Holy smoke, why did not I think of that? You are a better man than I, Howard Wolowitz. You put ‘er there, you son of a gun!
Whatever.
Oh, my God, Howard! What did you do?
It was a harmless Halloween prank. Look.
Howard has a heart condition! You know that!
Well, I thought he made that up. Is not hypochondria a common idiosyncrasy of Jewish people?
This is adrenaline, we are gonna have to inject it into his heart.
We are?
You are. I am not strong enough to get it through his chest plate, and we have only got one shot.
Oh, no! I cannot!
Hurry! We are running out of time!
Okay.
Just do it!
Oh, God! One, two, three!
Trick or treat, bubbeleh.
What? No. You mean this was all a ruse? Oh, how could I be so stu… .
Alice’s apartment. Alice and Leonard are kissing.
Damn it, I cannot. I cannot, I cannot do this.
Uh, is it my tongue stud? ‘Cause if that freaks you out, you are in for a real surprise later on.
No, no, no. I, I cannot do this. Believe me, I really want to.
But?
But I kind of have a girlfriend.
Are you kidding?
You are cool with you and me just being friends, right?
I do not believe this.
Wait, I do not, which part?
I am so stupid. I thought for once I’d met a good guy, but you are just another jackass.

Oh, no, no, you have it wrong. No. I, I was going to be a jackass, but I stopped myself. I stayed a good guy, so, I am gonna pass on the sex. But you should know, that is not a comment on your hotness but on my goodness. That is kind of my superpower. I am, like, Captain Good Guy.
Leonard being ejected into the corridor.
It is okay. Did the right thing. You idiot!
The apartment. Leonard is on skype.
Hey, Priya.
Hey, sweetheart. How’s it going?
Uh, not so good. We have to talk.
Oh, sounds serious. What is up?
Okay, uh, here it is. I met this girl and I kissed her, and I feel terrible about it. But it is done, it is never gonna happen again. And I am so, so sorry.
Leonard, relax. It is okay.
It is?
Yeah, these things happen. They happen to everybody.
Oh, my God, you are amazing. I mean, I do not deserve you. Wh, what do, what do you mean everybody?
Leonard, I did not know if I should tell you, but I kind of cheated on you, too.
Uh, kind of?
A couple of weeks ago, I slept with my ex-boyfriend. So, I guess we both messed up a little.
No, no, I messed up a little. You messed up a lot.
Well, it is not a competition.
Oh yeah, it is, and you won. I, I, I am, I am sorry, I have to go. I do not believe this.
Bazinga, punk. Now we are even.
The apartment.
So, Bernadette, how goes the hunt for bridesmaid dresses?
Well, if you do not mind looking like an orange traffic cone, great.
Girlfriends, I have the answer to our dress problems.
Really?
Twelve years ago, my cousin Irene and her entire family died in a horrific carbon monoxide accident the night before her wedding.
That is horrible.

Yes and no. All those bridesmaids dresses remain unused and available to us for free. So it seems that cloud of odourless deadly gas had a silver lining after all. Check it out, still in the bags. The gowns, not the bridesmaids.
I do not know. Dead people’s dresses?
Yeah, and cap sleeves? U-u-uh.
Uh, I was hoping you would not notice. Irene was always a slave to a good bargain when it came to clothes, and sadly as it turned out, space heaters.

Ladies, please. These four walls once housed an intellectual salon where the mind received nourishment as well as the stomach. But through no one’s fault, Penny, the quality of dinner conversation in this apartment has declined. And again, I am looking at no one in particular, Penny.
Fine. What would you like to talk about, Sheldon?
What would you like to talk about, Sheldon? Why do you hate us?
I have prepared a number of topics that should appeal to both the advanced and novice conversationalists.
Okay, that time you looked at me.
Who did not? Your skin is like alabaster. Do you even have pores?
Topic one. Faster-than-light particles at CERN, paradigm-shifting discovery or another Swiss export as full of holes as their cheese? And converse.
All right, who wants to go to my apartment and look at bridal magazines?
Oh, me.
Through no one’s fault, Sheldon, we are leaving.
Wait for moi.
You are leaving?
Sheldon, sometimes you forget, I am a lady. And with that comes an oestrogen fuelled need to page through thick glossy magazines that make me hate my body.
Ah. New topic. Women, delightfully mysterious or bat-crap crazy?
Totally. What is wrong with cap sleeves? If you have the right figure for it, they are adorable.
The cafeteria.
Hey, Amy, what brings you to our neck of the woods?
Your neurology department loaned me a culture of prions for my research on bovine spongiform encephalopathy.
She popped by to borrow a cup of mad cow disease.
It is hard to make degenerative brain maladies hilarious, and yet somehow you do it.
That is fun to have in a lunchroom.
The real fun starts when you get to pick the rat you are going to feed it to, and maybe you choose the beady-eyed little mother who’s been biting you all week.
Please, we are eating. Can we get that off the table and change the subject?
Can we? Stand back while I turn this conversation into a conver-sensation.
This time, it is your fault.
I have 100 alphabetized topics from artichoke, come on, people, it is just a giant thistle, to zzz, the onamona-poetry of sleep.
Amy, how long would it take for that mad cow disease to kill me?
I do not know, four or five years.
No, it is not gonna do it.
Oy. Bernadette keeps texting me pictures of Penny in bridesmaid dresses.
They are out shopping right now?
Yeah.
Just the two of them?
I guess.
That is cool, that is cool.
Why are they asking me about this stuff? What guy knows what a sweetheart neckline is?
The apartment. Leonard is horseracing on a Kinnect game.

Leonard’s coming down the home stretch! Come on, horsey, you can do this! Damn. Come on, thigh muscles, you can do this! Yes! First place. I would have been a great jockey if I were not too tall. And scared of horses. Sheldon, you are up.
What?
Come on, it is your turn. We said we’d get more fresh air.
Sorry. I am a little distracted. I cannot seem to get in touch with Amy. I tried e-mail, video chat, tweeting her, posting on her Facebook wall, texting her, nothing.
Did you try calling her on the telephone?
The telephone. You know, Leonard, in your own simple way, you may be the wisest of us all. Voice mail. Curiouser and curiouser.
If you are worried, we can go over there and see if she is all right.
Okay. You know, I heard in the news a bobcat has been spotted in her neighbourhood.
I do not think Amy was eaten by a bobcat.
Who thinks Amy was eaten by a bobcat?
You do?
Leonard, I was just mentioning an interesting local news item. Now, thanks to you, I am worried Amy’s been eaten by a bobcat.
Forget about the bobcat.
How can I? You will not stop talking about it.
Amy’s apartment. Amy is playing the harp.
Everybody hurts, sometimes everybody cries. Everybody hurts, sometimes.
She sounds weepy. I do not like weepy. Let’s go.
Uh, she is your friend. Step up.
Amy. Bye.
Where are you going?
I am single, I do not need this crap.
Sheldon, what are you doing here?
You did not respond to any of my electronic communications.
I wanted to be alone.
Would you like to talk about it? And keep in mind that no is a perfectly viable answer.
Sheldon, my world is crumbling around me.

Point of order. As you are in distress, it would be customary for me to offer you a hot beverage. But I am a guest in your home, so it would be customary for you to offer me a beverage. How do you want to proceed vis-a-vis beverages?
It does not matter. Nothing matters.
If you’d like to take your mind off what is troubling you, uh, word on the street is a bobcat has been spotted.
Penny and Bernadette went shopping for bridesmaids dresses without me.
And that made you feel sad?
Yes.
I knew it. Just keep going, I guess I am good at this.
It is just, I thought they liked hanging out with me, but I guess I was fooling myself.
When they were over here, did you fail to offer them a beverage? ‘Cause I can see how that could stick in someone’s craw.
Sheldon, I am going to ask you something, and I’d like you to keep an open mind.
Always.
At this moment, I find myself craving human intimacy and physical contact.
Oh, boy. You know ours is a relationship of the mind.
Proposal. One wild night of torrid lovemaking that soothes my soul and inflames my loins.
Counterproposal. I will gently stroke your head and repeat, aw, who’s a good Amy.
How about this? French kissing, seven minutes in heaven culminating in second base.
Neck massage, then you get me that beverage.
We cuddle. Final offer.
Very well. Oh, boy.
I am just saying, second base is right there.
The cafeteria.
Mm, I am thinking about adopting some quirky affectation, like a pipe or a monocle or a handlebar moustache.
For all those girls out there looking for the Indian Monopoly man?
This is not a safe place. You cannot share anything here.
The two of you need to get your women in line!
What?

Last night I was strong-armed into an evening of harp music and spooning with an emotional Amy Farrah Fowler. This on a night that I had originally designated for solving the space-time geometry in higher-spin gravity and building my Lego Death Star. And why? Your gal pals, Penny and Bernadette, went out shopping for some wedding nonsense without Amy, an action they took with no thought or regard as to how it would affect me, the future of string theory or my Lego fun time.
What do you want us to do about it?
You clearly were not listening to my topic sentence, get your women in line! You make them apologize to Amy and set things right. I am a man of science, not someone’s snuggle bunny!
Why do I have to talk to Penny? She is not my girlfriend.
You invited her to lunch four years ago. Everything about her is on you, you make it so!
The apartment.
Moo-shu is Penny.
Thank you. Where’s Sheldon?
Oh, he was up late last night, so I gave him an early dinner and put him to bed.
That is so sweet.
