Uh-huh.

Can I pour you some wine? I think you will enjoy it. The traditional choice with Peking duck is a Sauvignon Blanc, but Siri suggested an off-dry Riesling. I was not sure, but I did not want to have an argument with her in the middle of Trader Joe’s. Now, what should we put Siri in for dinner? Leopard, sparkles, or to paraphrase Coco Chanel, you can never go wrong with a little black case. Siri, play some smooth jazz.
Playing smooth jazz.
Oh, my God, Kenny G? This woman can read me like a book. I cannot believe I bought my soul mate at Glendale Galleria.
I do not know if I want to stay.
A shooting range.
This is amazing. How did you even get this idea?
I called your dad. I asked him what things you liked to do when you were a kid. This seemed easier than getting a cow out here so you could tip it.
Okay, you are kind of really great.
You mean for a person whose neck massages feel like an eagle is trying to carry you to its nest?
Okay, bug report. I just complimented you. You should take it and shut up.
Right. Sorry, sorry.
And stop apologizing all the time.
Right. Sorry.
All right, let’s shoot stuff. You want me to show you what to do?
I play a lot of Grand Theft Auto. I think I know how to handle a gat.
Wow. You are cute when you get all gangsta.
The stairwell.
So, I have got a gunshot wound. That is pretty badass.
No, you have got a Reebok with a gunshot wound and an ouchie on your pinkie toe.
Hello? They gave me a Band-Aid. Hospitals do not issue Band-Aids unless it is medically necessary. That is the law.
Well, thank you for a really cool evening.
Thank you for hiding my Star Wars socks at the emergency room. Is it a good time to evaluate the beta test and see where we stand?
Things are looking good.
So, are we still taking things slow? Because a gunshot wound today, last week, I slammed my thumb in the kitchen drawer. We do not know how much time I have.
Good night, you.
Guten Tag, das YouTube. Ich bin ein Bavarian.
Und ich bin eine pretzel!
Und dis is Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun…
Mit…
Flags.
An office suite.
First door on the left.
Thank you.
Dave, I found six vacuum cleaner repair shops in your area. Four are fairly close to you. I am sorry. I do not understand.
No!
Leonard’s bedroom. Sheldon enters in a hard hat and high-vis jacket. Sounds a klaxon on his phone.
Aaargh. What the hell?
Emergency preparedness drill.
Oh, no, come on!
Yeah, you know how it works. Once a quarter, keep our readiness up. Now, rise and shine, sleepy head. Half the town is probably dead.
I have to get a lock for my door.

I think you will like the drill tonight. I have tried to make it fun. Each of these cards contains a detailed scenario of a possible apocalyptic event. Everything from wild fires to a surprise invasion by Canada. Pick a catastrophe, any catastrophe.
Sheldon, Canada is not going to invade California.
Yeah, really? You think those hippies in Washington and Oregon can stop them?
Fine.

All righty! An 8.2 magnitude earthquake devastates Pasadena, reducing mighty edifices to dust, engulfing the city in flames. The streets flow with blood and echo with the cries of the wounded. Oh, excellent choice. Now, put on your hard hat and safety vest.
Oh, fun. I get to spend another night in front of our apartment dressed like one of the Village People.
You make that joke every three months. I still do not get it. Leonard, wait. What are you doing?
I do not know, what am I doing?
Look around you, there is hypothetical broken glass everywhere. Really? You are going to face Armageddon without your orthotics? All right, your choice. Uh-oh, hypothetical aftershock!
Aah!
And that is why we wear hard hats.
The cafeteria.
Check it out, press release from NASA.

Um, Expedition 31 will launch this spring to the International Space Station. Crew members will include Commander Tom ‘Tombo’ Johnson, astronaut Mike ‘Supernova’ Novacelik and Payload Specialist Howard Wolowitz.
This is going right into my synagogue’s newsletter.
Dude, if you are going to be an astronaut, you need to pick a cool nickname.
I do not get to pick it. The other guys have to give it to me.
Oh. If I had one, it would be Brown Dynamite.
Are you not listening to me? The other astronauts have to give you your nickname.
Are you not looking at me? I am Brown Dynamite. Why do you put six sugars in your coffee?
Because the cafeteria does not offer little packets of methamphetamine.
Emergency drill night last night, huh?
Uh-huh.
How’d you do?

I will tell you exactly how he did. Readiness: unsatisfactory. Follows direction: barely. Attitude: a little too much. Overall: not only will he probably die in a fiery inferno, his incessant whining would most certainly spoil everyone else’s day.
You know what, I am so tired I cannot even think straight. I am going home. Will one of you guys give this nutbag a ride back later?
You cannot go home. You have to take me to the dentist at four o’clock.
Oh, cannot you take the bus to the dentist?

Of course I can. It is coming back under the residual effects of the anaesthesia, that is the problem. Two years ago after a deep gum cleaning, I thought I got on a bus but somehow wound up on a booze cruise to Mexico.
They put you under for a cleaning?
Yeah, they have to, I am a biter.
Whatever, Sheldon. I am exhausted. I am not taking you to the dentist.

Wrong, sir. Wrong. Under section 37B of the roommate agreement, miscellaneous duties, you are obligated to take me to the dentist. See? It is right here after providing a confirmation sniff on questionable dairy products.”

You know what, I am sick of the roommate agreement. It is ridiculous. I am your roommate, not your chauffeur. You know, I had better things to do yesterday than drive you all the way to the good model train store in Garden Grove because the one in Pasadena has gotten too big for its britches.
Well, it has. Ask anybody.
I do not care. I am done.
Hold on. Are you saying that you want to invoke Clause 209?
I do not know what that is, but if it means I can go home and sleep, then yes.

Think carefully here. Clause 209 suspends our friendship, and strips down the roommate agreement to its bare essentials. Our responsibilities toward each other would only be rent, utilities and a perfunctory chin jut of recognition as we pass in the hall. ‘Sup?
Where do I sign?
Right here. Use your finger.
There. Done.
All right. That is it. We are now no longer companions, boon or otherwise. We are now merely acquaintances. To amend the words of Toy Story, you have not got a friend in me.
I am gonna go home and take a nap.
Yeah, well, tell it to someone who cares.
The apartment.
I got pretty exciting NASA news today. Next week I fly to Houston for orientation and zero-gravity elimination drills.
What does that mean?
He is gonna learn to poop in space.
Open the pod bay doors, HAL.
Maybe your nickname should be Brown Dynamite.
Hello, dear friends. And Dr. Hofstadter.
‘Sup?
‘Sup? My apologies. I would have been here sooner, but the bus kept stopping for other people to get on it.
I saved you a dumpling.
Oh, your concern for me is touching. It will serve you well when you take me to the dentist tomorrow.
I am sorry, Sheldon, I am busy. I am right in the middle of my addiction study. I have got a lab full of alcoholic monkeys, and tomorrow’s the day we switch them to O’Doul’s.
You are my girlfriend and you are not going to cater to my every need? Oh, where’d the magic go?
Sheldon, that is not what girlfriends are for. Although, you do not use them for what they are for, so what do I know?
Howard does not make me do his shopping, or take him to the dentist, or pick up his dry cleaning, right?
Absolutely. But when Ma’s hips give out, you are up, kid.

Well, if Amy’s too busy, that gives the rest of you an opportunity to make my life easier, thus assuring yourselves a footnote in my memoirs, tentatively entitled You are Welcome, Mankind. All right, then, just shout when you hear the task you want to undertake. Uh, dentist. Okay, we can circle back to that one. Um, well, who wants to take me Wednesday morning to get new heels put on my dress shoes? Anyone? Oh. That one had hoot written all over it. Um, all right, uh, dermatologist? Allergist? Podiatrist? Supercuts? Okay, okay, here’s a fun one. Um, I need a new picture frame and I have a hankering for Swedish meatballs. Who wants to spend the day with me at IKEA?
Their meatballs are pretty good.
What is that?
Nothing, nothing.
The comic book store.
Hello, Stuart.
Oh, hey, Sheldon. Can I help you find something today?
No, no. I was just sitting at home thinking about how it might be nice to catch up with my ninth favourite person.
Ninth?
You moved up one. My pen pal in Somalia was kidnapped by pirates. So, uh, how are you?
Uh, not so good. My shrink just killed himself and blamed me in the note.
Great. Great. So, what is new with your family? How’s your mother? Is she alive?
Yeah.
And your father? Alive?
Yes.
How about your grandparents, they alive?
No.
Oh, I am so sorry for your loss. On a cheerier note, I have a teeth-cleaning appointment this afternoon. What do you say you take me over there, buddy boy?
I am sorry, you want me to take you to the dentist?
Yes. And now, I cannot make any promises, but that is the sort of thing that gets a fella on the short list for the number eight friend slot.
Sheldon, I am working. I cannot take you to the dentist. Also, and I cannot stress this enough, I do not want to take you to the dentist.
Cannot help a friend out in a time of need, huh? I see where your therapist was coming from.
The apartment.
Ooh, ooh! What about we make your astronaut nickname Howard “Buzz” Wolowitz?
You cannot do Buzz. Buzz is taken.
Buzz Lightyear is not real.
No, that is not what I am talking about.
Well, are you talking about when he thought he was real?
No.
Okay, um, how about Crash”? Howard “Crash” Wolowitz.
Yeah, terrific. The other astronauts would love to go hurtling through space with a guy named Crash.
All right, um, how about, oh, how about Rocket Man?
That is not bad, Howard “Rocket Man” Wolowitz.
Yeah, it is great, but I told you, I do not get to pick my nickname. It has to come from the other astronauts.
Maybe there is a way to get them to come up with it.
Like how?
Once I tried carrying around a Duncan yo-yo, hoping the other kids would start calling me Duncan.
Did it work?
No, they ended up calling me Sock Mouth. Because they took away my yo-yo and stuffed their socks in my mouth.
Okay, uh, what if we make Rocket Man your ringtone, and the next time you talk to those guys, I will call you and they will hear it. Plant the seed.
That is actually not a terrible plan.
They do not call me Brown Dynamite for nothing.
‘Sup?
‘Sup?
Hey, did you ever make it to the dentist?
Not necessary. No. I found a service that will send a van to your house for a teeth cleaning. Mostly they cater to dogs, but the fellow on the phone seemed to have an open mind.
All right, Sheldon, if you need me to take you to the dentist, I will take you to the dentist.
Are you suggesting that you have come to your senses and wish to re-establish the mutual benefits that stem from full participation in the roommate agreement?
Absolutely. If you admit that you are a 30-year-old man who’s incapable of functioning on his own.
Ooh, Sock Mouth’s got him on the ropes.
I will admit nothing of the sort. And now if you will excuse me, I have to call my dentist and see if I can also get my hair shampooed and my nails clipped.
The apartment. Leonard is watching television. All the power goes off.
Oh, good, your power’s out, too.
Why is that good?
Because last month, I sent the electric company a Starbucks gift card, an apology note, and a few snapshots of me in a bra.
Power failure. Implementing power-failure protocol.
What happened to all your glow-in-the-dark-emergency-exit stuff you had painted on the floor?

Oh, that was wildly carcinogenic. Anyway, it is too bad you are no longer entitled to the full benefits of my friendship, because I happen to be extremely prepared for such an emergency. Please try not to see anything by this light. It is not for you.
It is just a blackout, I am sure the power will be back on soon.
And I am sure some fool in the Donner party said the snow would stop any day now. I like to think they ate him first.
You know, I got some candles in my apartment.
But candles? During a blackout? Are you mad? That is a fire hazard. No, Pasadena Water and Power recommends the far safer glow stick.
You call that a glow stick? That is a glow stick. Come on, let’s go.

Before you go, consider this. Not only do I have a deep-cycle marine battery power source which is more than capable of running our entertainment system, I also have all 61 episodes of the BBC series Red Dwarf and Fiddle-Faddle. All yours if you are willing to reinstate the roommate agreement.
I have got wine at my place and some bubble wrap we could pop.
Oh, he will be back. Wine and a girl in the dark, he is gonna be bored out of his mind.
Penny’s apartment.
To wine and bubble wrap. And to not having to watch Sheldon demonstrate his reverse osmosis machine that converts urine into drinking water.
You know, in Girl Scouts, Tammie Dinisha said you could do that with panty hose. Boy, was she wrong. Anyway, you want to make out?
I thought because our relationship’s in a beta test, you wanted to take things slow.
Okay. Do you want to make out slow?
I can go so slow it will be like there is a snail in your mouth.
Ugh. Well, lucky for you, there is nothing else to do right now.
Excuse me, Leonard.
Since when do not you knock? It is like the only good thing about you.
Social niceties have been suspended, Leonard. We are in a state of a emergency. The world has descended into darkened turmoil. Lawlessness and savagery are the order of the day.
Fine, what is it?
I am making s’mores. I wanted to alert you in case you smelled caramelizing marshmallows and thought a nearby candy factory was on fire.
S’mores, huh? Good for you.
Yes, or good for us if you sign here and reinstate the full roommate agreement.
No, thanks. I am good.
Really? Huh! Okay. In that case, I will have a s’more by myself. And then I am gonna have s’more. By myself.
Aw.
No, do not aw him. He brought this all on himself.
But he is sad.
No, he is crazy. Sometimes crazy looks like sad so it will suck you back in.
I think he misses his little buddy.
Fine. But mark my words, this frustrating, bogus teenage make-out session is not over.
The apartment.
I thought you said candles were dangerous.
This is a Bunsen burner. I am a scientist, I know what I am doing. Oh, drat. Aw. It took me a gallon of urine to make that water.

Listen, Sheldon, this is stupid. I do not see why we cannot be friends. And I am willing to drive you around and help you out with stuff. I just do not want to do it because of some silly roommate agreement.
What are you proposing?
That we go back to the way things were. But when I do something for you, you show a little appreciation.
And how would I do that?
You say thank you.
Every time?
It is not crazy.

Counter-proposal. We reinstate the full roommate agreement with the following addendum, in the spirit of Mother’s Day or Father’s Day, once a year, we set aside day to celebrate all your contributions to my life, both actual and imagined by you. We could call it Leonard’s Day.
I kind of like the sound of that.
Of course you do. It is about you, like everything else. Oh, thank goodness. I do not think I had it in me to make another glass of water.
So, do I get breakfast in bed on Leonard’s Day?
No.
Can I sit in your spot?
No.
Can I control the thermostat?
No.
Do I get a card?
Of course you get a card. It is Leonard’s Day.
Hey, guys, the building manager said the reason the power went out is someone went down into the basement and just pulled the main breaker switch.
Really. Who do you think did that, Sheldon?
Oh, I do not know. But whoever that mystery man was, you should be eternally grateful, for without him, there would be no Leonard’s Day.
Leonard’s Day?
Oh, no pressure. Just get him a crummy card, you are good.
Howard’s bedroom.
All right, test my ring tone. That really is a good song.
Oh, yeah. There is a reason he is Sir Elton John. They do not make you a knight for writing Wake Me Up Before You Go Go.
Howard, are you coming down for breakfast?
Ma, I told you I have a video conference with NASA. I said do not bother me!
Oh! Listen to Mr. Big Shot Astronaut.
Yes, please listen to Mr. Big Shot Astronaut. Hey, good morning.
Hey, Howard, thanks for getting up so early.
No problem, Dr. Massimino.
The guys here call me Mass.
Mass. That is a cool nickname. ‘Cause force equals mass times acceleration.
Yeah. It is just short for Massimino. Anyway, the plan for this morning is to go over the…
Sorry. My phone.
What is that? Is that Rocket Man?
Yeah, my ring tone. Kind of my favourite song, Rocket Man.
Howard, your Fruit Loops are getting soggy!
Not now!
Who’s that?
My mom. Sorry.
No problem, Fruit Loops.
The cafeteria.
Gentlemen, I think I have come up with a fun way to get young people interested in science. Physics Mad-Libs. Now, give me a number.
Five.
Uh-huh. And an irrational constant.
E.
And a funny Greek letter.
Gamma.
I said funny.
Upsilon?
Good one. And an electrical charge.
Positive.
Ha. Perfect. Okay. Get this. Professor Jones told the symposium he had a new method for calculating the mass of a muon. Five times the limit of E to the upsilon as in a
I have not seen him laugh that hard since the day Leonard made that multiplication error.
Oh, Oh, Lord, that multiplication error! He thought he carried the one. But he did not.
It is not funny. That mistake got published.
Stop! I am going to wet myself!
Hey, guys, guys, President Siebert is headed this way.
I wonder what he wants.
Does not look happy, so I am guessing he wants to talk to Sheldon.
Dr. Cooper?
Told ya.
Oh, President Siebert, I assume you’d like to respond to one of the suggestions I put in the box by your office.
No, and stop installing suggestion boxes everywhere.

You do not like written suggestions. You do not like when I give them to you while we are urinating in the men’s room. If I did not know any better, I’d say that you are one of those stubborn people who are not open to suggestions.
Dr. Cooper, the physics department chair tells me you are refusing to take your vacation.
I do not need a vacation.

You are obligated to take one. And I’d also like you to know the most-often received suggestion in my suggestion box you installed without asking me is can Dr. Cooper take a vacation? Okay, settled, then. I will see you all on Monday, except for you.
But if I do not come into work, what am I supposed to do with myself?
Read, rest, travel. I hear Afghanistan is nice this time of year.
Sarcasm?
No. You should go.
Leonard’s car. Leonard is singing enthusiastically.

That tonight’s gonna be a good night, and tonight’s gonna be a good night, and tonight’s gonna be a good, good night! Tonight’s the night, uh, uh, let’s live it up, uh, I got my money, let’s spend it up…
Good Lord! Would you stop that caterwauling!
What the hell are you doing?
Bleeding from my ears.
What are you doing hiding back there?
I am sneaking into work. Now, if the guard at the university asks what is under the blanket, you tell him it is some lobster traps.
Lobster traps?
Yes. That is how Velma and Scooby smuggled Shaggy into the old lighthouse.
What are you going to do when you get to the university? People are going to recognize you.
Will they, Leonard?
Fine. Just get back under your blanket, and I will drive you there.
And no more singing.
Fine.
I have GPS on my phone. I know you turned around.
Penny’s apartment.
I am so glad you talked Howard out of having your wedding invitations in Klingon.
Turn it over. I am hoping my relatives think it is Hebrew.
This is really happening. I am gonna be a maid of honour. I am gonna wear a beautiful dress and walk down that aisle and, finally, I will have my special day.
You mean my special day?
They are gonna need an extra-large veil for somebody’s head.
If I ever actually ever get married.
Why would not you?
My dad. Because I make a lot more money than Howie, he is putting a lot of pressure on me to get a pre-nup.
Ouch.
Yeah. Howie’s gonna freak out.
Parental pressure can be daunting. I remember the battle with my mother about shaving my legs. Last year, I finally gave in and let her do it.
I just do not know how I am gonna break it to him.

You know, I am a big believer in breaking bad news to a guy when you are in bed with him. That is how I told my high school boyfriend I slept with his brother. That is how I told his brother the same thing.
I do not know, I do not want to manipulate him with sex.
Oh, sweetie, that is what sex is for.

You know, the connection between marriage and money is nothing new. In fact, the term wed referred to the money and livestock that the groom paid the bride’s father. For example, you are adorable, intelligent and a good earner. I could conservatively see you going for at least two oxen and a goose. You would fetch a unicorn.
The apartment.
Sheldon, there are a million great vacations you could take. What about Hawaii?
Hawaii is a former leper colony on top of an active volcano where the disappointing ending to Lost was filmed. Mahalo for nothing, Hawaii.

How about Florida? They have got Cape Canaveral, they have got Disney, they have got my Aunt Ida and the world’s largest collection of diabetic candy. Plus, if you get sweaty enough, her plastic-covered furniture is like a flume ride.
My family took a trip to Florida when I was a child. A seagull stole a hot dog from me on the beach. I got the message.

You know, if I had a week off, I’d go back to the Two Bunch Palms Resort and Spa in the desert. I tell you, an hour on the massage table with Trevor, and you will feel like you were born without bones.
I do not think I could ever let a guy give me a massage.
Really? What was I doing to your neck last night while you were playing X-Box?
It is like I am living in a dictatorship. You must take a vacation, you must have fun, you must enjoy life.
I do not think you have a good handle on dictatorships.
Sheldon, everybody takes vacations.

One time they tried to make Richard Feynman take a vacation, but he chose instead to expand his mind and learn something new. He went to work in his friend’s biology lab. Richard Feynman was a famous American physicist, part of the Manhattan Project.
Everyone in the world of science knows who Richard Feynman was.
Now you do, too. Oh! I have a brilliant idea. Amy’s a biologist. I will go work in her lab.
Is not that just Feynman’s idea?
Ten seconds ago, you never heard of him. Now you are an expert.
The hallway.
Hey.
Hey, you.
Is that your laundry? You only have, like, six things in there.
Yeah, I did not have any quarters, so I have been sneaking stuff into other people’s loads all day. Hey, if I tell you something, will you promise not to tell anybody?
It does not matter what I say, you are gonna tell me anyway.
What? That is not true. Bernadette wants a pre-nup.
Wow. That is rough.
So you are saying if I became a famous movie star, we got married, you would not sign a pre-nup?
Absolutely not. If I am gonna be stuck at home with the kids while you are on location cheating on me with Ryan Gosling, then Leonard gots to get paid. So, you think about us getting married?

I think about a lot of things. I think about us getting married, I think about us breaking up. Once in a while, I think about how I did not leave a note on that Mercedes I dinged in the parking lot last month, but then I have a glass of wine and it passes.
Joke all you want, but you think about it.
Well, tell you one thing, if I ever do get married, no Klingon invitations.
Good luck catching a man with that attitude.
Amy’s laboratory.

Boy, oh, boy. This vacation is off to a wonderful start. The smell of formaldehyde, the whir of the centrifuge, the distant chatter of lab animals being dispatched for dissection. Mm, I can already feel my cares just melting away.
I am excited to work with my boyfriend. It is gonna be romantic.
Way to kill the mood.

Come on, Sheldon. We can be like Marie Curie and her husband, Pierre, who spent their days working side by side, bathed in the glow of their love and the radium that ultimately killed her. Screw Beauty and the Beast, that is the love story Disney should tell.
Okay, what do we start with? Maybe splicing some genes, clone a sheep, perhaps grow a human ear on a mouse’s back? Ha-ha, I am a freak!
Oh, I am gonna be doing some brain stem histology while you put yourself on the business end of a sponge and wash those beakers.
Wash those bea… Oh, I get it, a little hazing for the new fella. Yeah, I’d better keep and eye out for, what, shoe polish on the microscope, or mad cow disease in my grilled cheese sandwich?
No, I just need those beakers washed. Hippity-hop, quick like a bunny.
What? Excuse me, you have Dr. Sheldon Cooper in your lab. You are gonna make him do the dishes? That is like asking the Incredible Hulk to open a pickle jar.
Sheldon, you have never worked in a lab like this before. You have no experience in the field of biology.
I have plenty of experience in biology. I bought a Tamagotchi in 1998. And it is still alive. Let’s do this.
The cafeteria.
Where’s Howard?
No hi, Raj? No how are you, Raj? Just straight to where’s the other white guy?
I am sorry. So, listen, I heard something about him. Can you keep it between us?

Ooh, gossip. When I first got here, I thought you Americans really gossiped around the water cooler. So I hung out there for, like, a month, but the only gossip I ever heard was about some creepy guy hanging out by the water cooler.
Bernadette wants to get a pre-nup.
Oh, that is a shame, he is gonna be devastated.
I never know what to do in these situations. Should I give him a heads-up?
Hmm. I am gonna give you the same advice I yell at the TV when the Bachelor’s handing out roses. Follow your heart.
Check it out. Look at the size of that Rice Krispie Treat. Same price.
Hey, Howard, I need to tell you something.
I know, it is not on my wedding diet. I do not care.
Uh, listen, I heard that Bernadette’s thinking about asking you for a pre-nup.
A pre-nup? Wow.
What are you gonna do?
I do not know.
Follow your heart.
You know what, it is not a big deal. She makes more money than me. She wants to protect her financial interests. It is completely reasonable.
Yeah, actually, it is good for both of us. I have assets to protect, too.
Like what?
I have got some rare comic books. The Vespa’s almost paid off. And Ma and I have a primo double cemetery plot at Mt. Sinai right near the guy who played Mr. Roper on Three’s Company.
Mr. Roper’s dead? You cannot just spring that on a guy.
Amy’s laboratory.
Here you go. This is now the only lab with glassware washed by a man with two doctorates and a restraining order signed by Carl Sagan.
Soap spots. Wash ’em again.
Y-you are being ridiculous. Those are perfectly clean.
Sheldon, this beaker used to contain cerebral spinal fluid from an elephant that died of syphilis. If it is, in fact, perfectly clean, drink from it.
Biologists are mean.
All right, perhaps this task will be a little bit more up your alley. I need you to count the bacteria spores on these petri dishes.
There was something wrong with that detergent. That was way too bubbly.
I am sure it was.
I intend to write that soap company a strongly worded letter.
Yeah, good for you. Now, start counting.
You know what this place needs? A suggestion box.
How’s it going?
How’s counting going? When I was in kindergarten, I recited pi to a thousand places for the school talent show. I think I got this.
Great.
Aw, nuts! One…
This is preposterous. I think you are giving me these tasks because you are afraid if you give me anything meaningful to do, I will show you up.
Really? Is that what you think?
Yes, that is what I think. And I am super smart, so it is probably true.
Hey, I have been training in the field of neurobiology for 12 years. You have been here for three hours, and you have spent one of them in the bathroom.
I am sorry. It takes me a while to get things going on an unfamiliar toilet.
Sheldon, I have given you the simplest things to do, and you have not done one of them right.
Maybe that is because I am not being challenged. It is the same reason Einstein failed math.
Maybe the math was too bubbly for him.
You think you are doing science by cutting up that brain? They could do the same thing at any Quiznos. And they’d offer to toast it for me, too.
Okay, smart guy. I am about to remove the locus coeruleus, which is incredibly delicate work. Have at it.
All right. I am no stranger to a little gray matter. Locus coeruleus. Locus coeruleus.
You are getting warmer, it is, indeed, in the brain. Hope your hands are steady. It is the width of a single hair. But this is just biology, so I am sure it is no problem for a genius like you.

It is not. I will have you know, in the field of physics, we work with particles so small, they make fat jokes about the locus coeruleus, i.e., when your locus coeruleus sits around the house, it sits around the house.
Oh, are we nervous, Dr. Cooper?
