Oh, Leonard, it is three o’clock in the morning. I do not care if Richard Feynman was a purple leprechaun who lived in my butt.
Penny meant if he were a purple leprechaun. Penny forgot to use the subjunctive.
Sheldon, go to bed. You have work in the morning.
Maybe, maybe not. Maybe tomorrow I start a bongo band and tour the world.
W-w-wuh, no, no, hang on,uh, uh, roommate agreement. No hootenannies, sing-a-longs, or barbershop quartets after ten p.m.
Roommate agreement? Are you kidding? We are living in a world of chaos. Roommate agreement.
Where are you going?
Wherever the music takes me, kitten. I play bongos walking down the stairs. Oh! Oh! Never play bongos walking down the stairs.
Howard’s hotel room. There is a knock on the door.
Surprise.
What are you doing here?
I am here to help you get through this. You cannot do it on your own, you need someone to take care of you.
Oh, I love you so much.
Oh, I love you.
Howard, your bath is getting cold!
Do not worry, once she falls asleep, I will spoon you like an armadillo.
Amy’s apartment.
He showed up in the middle of the night with his bongos. I foolishly thought it was some sort of musical booty call.
Poor guy. He must have been exhausted. Sheldon like to sleep while Leonard play the bongo!
That was kind of uncalled for.
No, it was called for.
What is going on?
All right, Sheldon, this craziness has gone on long enough. Please come home so I can cut your hair.
Penny, you are not trained. You are not licensed. Most importantly, you do not have access to my haircut records.

All right, honey, look, we have known each other for a long time now, right? I have taken you to Disneyland, I kicked a bully in the nuts for you, I sing you Soft Kitty when you are sick, you have even saw me naked once.
I am sorry, duh, what?
It was a long story. Anyway, Sheldon, I promise I know what I am doing. Please let me cut your hair.
Amy, what do you think?
There is not a hair on my body I would not let this woman trim.
Fine, let’s go. Thank you for letting me sleep on your couch.
There is only so many times a woman can say how about the bed?
What is this about Sheldon seeing you naked?
Oh, relax. It was just her bottom and her breasts.
Penny’s apartment. Penny is cutting Sheldon’s hair.
Almost done.
At the end of the haircut, Mr. D’Onofrio would tell me a dirty joke.
Well, sorry, I do not know any dirty jokes.
That is okay, I never understood them anyway.
Okay, what do you think?
Hmm, well, it is a little Hollywood. But I think I can pull it off. Well done, Penny.
Ha, told you. Okay, I am just gonna clean up your neck a little and then you are good to go.
Fun time. Hah. Sorry, sometimes the clippers tickle me.
Okay. Okay, yep, we are all done now. It is just, it is good. Let me just take that away from you. Okay.
Thank you very much.
You are welcome. Yeah, I am gonna have to move.
The stairwell
Hey, want to spend some time playing the new Star Wars game this weekend?
Oh, I do not know. I kind of promised myself I’d get off the computer, be more physically active. Get some exercise.
You are about to walk up three flights of stairs.
Good point, I am in.
You know what would be great? Let’s do it like the old days.
You mean, are you talking gaming marathon?
Yeah. Start Saturday morning, go 48 hours, sleeping bags, junk food.
Turn off our phones so our moms cannot call.
It would be like our World Of Warcraft a few years ago when the neighbours called the cops on us.
They called the cops because of the smell. They thought we were dead.
We were badass back in the day.
All right, let’s do it.
48 hours of Star Wars gaming.
It is on like Alderaan.
Hey, Sheldon, clear your weekend. Starting Saturday morning, Star Wars< marathon
Woo-hoo!
Movies or video games? Or board game? Or trading card games? Or Lego’s? Or dress up? Or comic books? Or dramatic readings of novelizations? Yes to all!
We are going to play the online game.
The online game? Bully!
Gentlemen, as much as I am sure Sheldon would enjoy playing intergalactic make-believe, he and I have other plans. We are attending my Aunt Flora’s 93rd birthday party.
Just tell her I cannot come.
She will be disappointed if we do not show up.
She is 93. She will not be disappointed for very long.

No, hang on. I followed all the protocols set forth by you in the relationship agreement. I made a written record request 72 hours in advance. I checked the tyre pressure on the car. I even contacted the Centres For Disease Control to find out what shots they recommend for travel to Orange County. FYI, it is none.
Amy, the relationship agreement was not designed for either one of us to get our way.
You use it to get your way.
I use it to get the right way. The fact that the right way is also my way is a happy coincidence.
You gave me your word. You are coming with me.
We will miss you, Sheldon.
Yeah, well, who wants to spend the whole weekend, running around a bunch of pretend planets battling made up monsters. That is for babies.
Yeah, but it is got lightsabres.
Yeah, please, Amy! It is got lightsabres!
The comic book store.
Hello Stuart.
Hey Sheldon. Help you with anything?
Yes. I am attending a party this weekend, for a 93-year-old woman. Can you recommend a gift?
Uh, I do not know. Could put a tennis ball on the end of Excalibur. Make a pretty badass cane.
Do you supply the the tennis ball?
No.
Then no. What else?
Hmm. Oh, have this collectors edition Batman utility belt. Maybe she can use it as a wearable pill caddy.
Well, she’d just look silly wearing that without the rest of the costume.
I am sorry Sheldon, that is it. That is all I got.
Oh, it is not your fault. I have been to the model train store. I have been to Radio Shack. This woman is impossible to shop for.
I’d make fun of Sheldon for having girl problems if I was not in shock that Sheldon has girl problems.
No, Leonard, go ahead and mock. Like my daddy always said, Shelly, women are not anything but flippin’ pains in the bottom.
That is what your father used to say?
Well, I took out the bad words and the yeehaw, but you get the gist.

Look, if you do not want to go to the party, just do not go. You are a grown man. Act like one. Tell Amy you want to spend the weekend having a sleepover and playing video games with your friends. Maybe she will dig it. Women like a firm hand on the tiller.
I can never find the tiller. I got a book; it did not help.
Yeah, I always thought if I were ever enslaved, it would be by an advanced species from another planet, not some hotsy-totsy from Glendale.
Now, I downloaded an app that might be helpful in this situation.
You are right. I am smart as a whip. I should be able to figure this out.
Penny’s apartment.

Hey, listen, I kind of made plans with the guys this weekend, but then I wondered, because we are in this relationship-beta-test, if I should have asked you first. Then I thought if I did check with you first, you’d think that I was taking things to seriously. And then, then I got a nosebleed.
You do not have to check with me. Do whatever you want.
Oh. I guess I was hoping for a different reaction, but okay.
Really, what were you hoping for?
I do not know, maybe that you’d be a little upset, and then you’d realize that I am a stallion that has to run free. And that would turn you on a little.
Okay, I am an actress. Ask me again.
Do you mind if I spend the weekend playing video games with the guys?

Whu… the entire weekend? You mean I would not see you at all? But I ju… No, no, I knew what I was getting into. You cannot put a saddle on Leonard Hofstadter. Oh, my, is it getting hot in here? Ay, papi.
Ay papi? What is that?
An acting choice.
Oh. So you chose that when you become turned on, you turn into Speedy Gonzalez?
Choo got a problem with that, papi?
Uh-uh.
Penny!
Sorry, Stallion. Your weird friend Giraffe is here.
Hello, Penny. I just stopped by to bring you this gift.
Gummy bears? Thank you.
Now that you are in my debt, please manipulate Amy into releasing me from my commitment to attend her aunt’s tedious birthday party.
Not a chance.

All right. I thought the candy might not be enough so let me up the ante. These are Cooper Coupons. These are for various things I can do for you. Um, oh, this one is for one free grammar check. Uh, you could use it for emails, letters, tattoos, what have you. Um, oh, this is fun one. This is an afternoon with me at the California Science Center, where I point out their mistakes.
Keep an eye on those expiration dates, I have been burned more than once.
All right, sweetie, I am not going to get involved in your relationship.
Oh, come on. It is just a simple favour. Now, when’s the last time I asked you to do something for me?
Yesterday. You made me look in your ear to see if there was a ladybug in it.
When is the last time I asked you to do something that was not a medical emergency?
Yesterday. You made me look in your ear to see if there was a ladybug in it.
All right, then, I have no choice but to go on to plan B.
What is that?
I am going to run around outside with a wet head and try to catch a cold.
Amy’s car.
Good morning.
Hello.

I think you are really going to enjoy yourself today. Not only do you get to meet my relatives, but since my aunt’s nursing home is catering the party, all of the food is incredibly soft. It is like a vacation for your teeth.
All right.
You sure you are okay with this?
Yes. I decided to find a way that I could have this experience and enjoy it.
Thank you. That means a lot to me.
Oh, do not thank me. Thank wireless technology. I realized, I can go to your aunt’s awful party and still spend the whole day gaming with my friends.
Sheldon, my relatives are going to want to talk to you, and you are going to be sitting there playing a game? Is not that a little rude?
Oh, I got that covered. Headset. I will not hear a word the old geezers are saying.

You know, if playing that game is more important to you than honouring your commitment to me, and you do not mind me showing up at a party all by myself after I have already told everybody I will be bringing somebody, then, fine. Go home and play your game.
Thanks. Ooh, listen, I would not mind a piece of birthday cake, provided the old gal’s candle blow is clean and dry.
The apartment.
Here you go. I have got everything we will need for the big game. Low fat turkey jerky, low-carb beer, 100-calorie snack packs.
You pick up a Y chromosome while you were there? You might be short one.
Hey, I plan on levelling up in the game, not my swimsuit size, thank you very much.
Gentlemen, the game offers us a choice between playing for the Republic and the light side, or the Sith Empire and the dark side.
Well, we are always the good guys. In D&D, we are lawful good, in City Of Heroes, we are the heroes, in Grand Theft Auto, we pay the prostitutes promptly and never hit them with a bat.
Those women are prostitutes? You said they were raising money for stem cell research.
Hey, guys, I got a surprise.
Uh, if it is yoghurt that helps ladies poop, I think Raj beat you to it.
No. Bernadette’s going to be playing with us. So, that is pretty cool, huh? Right? Sure it is, yeah.
What, you invited your girlfriend? This is supposed to be our weekend.

I had no choice. Last night, she said, why do not we go out for brunch tomorrow and then maybe the Arboretum. And I said, well, no, I promised the guys I was going to play a video game with them all weekend. And she said, that sounds like fun, can I come, too? And then I did not answer for a second, and then she said, well, do you not want me to come? And then I bought her a new laptop and the game, and she is parking the car right now.
Is the whip sound app contextually appropriate here?
Uh, it is, but I think you might have waited too long for it to be funny. I was wrong, it is still funny.
Oh, good. Hah-hah!
Penny’s apartment.
Amy, what is wrong?
My boyfriend’s a jerk.
Well, I know he did not cheat on you, so what happened?
I had to go to my aunt’s party all by myself, and everybody was like, where’s this boyfriend you are always talking about? Is he real, or did you make him up like Armin the miniature horse breeder?
Who’s Armin the miniature horse breeder?
The pretend boyfriend I invented to get my family off my back. It unravelled quickly when I could not answer the question how’d you two meet?
I would have thought at a miniature horse show.
Oh, that is good.
Mm.
I panicked and said Woodstock. I just wanted to show Sheldon off to my family.
Sure, I get that. I mean, he is your first boyfriend and all.
Not just my first boyfriend, he is the best boyfriend. I mean, think about it. I am dating Sheldon Cooper.
Yes. On purpose.
He is handsome, he is lanky, he is brilliant, and his skin has that pale, waxy quality.
Well, sickly is the new sexy.
Yeah.
Mm. You know, Amy, sometimes when you are in a relationship with someone you really care about, the sucky part is, it leaves you open to getting hurt.
Do you ever worry about Leonard doing that to you?
That is hilarious. No.
The apartment.
Get that guy! Get that guy! Pew! Pew! Pew! Pew!
Dr. Rostenkowski, it may interest you to know that saying pew, pew, pew is not as effective as pressing your blaster key. In the same way that saying whee does not make the land speeder go.
Pew!
Raj, Imperial Troopers on your tail.
Got him. When Gandhi advocated his philosophy of non-violence, I bet he did not know how much fun it was killing stuff.
All right, I think we got them all. Let’s divide up the loot.
Ooh, look at this pretty purple robe I just got. You should put on yours and then we will match.
But I worked hard to get this armour.
Sorry, I just thought it’d be nice if people knew we were a couple.
Fine, I will change.
Hah-hah!
Penny’s apartment.
I do not think I want to play a game.

Oh, come on. They are playing one across the hall, we should, too. Okay, we are gonna take turns bouncing a quarter off the table, and if it goes into this cup, the other person has to drink. Then you get to go again…
Like that?

Wow. Yeah, b-beginner’s luck. So, now I will drink this entire cup of beer, and you will go again and we can… uh… all right. So, yeah, okay, now I am gonna drink this entire cup and then I am going to drink another one… Okay, seriously, stop. What the hell?
Spent a lot of my childhood throwing coins into wishing wells hoping for friends. At a certain point, you start doing trick shots just to keep things interesting.
Whoa, whoa, give me a second to catch up here. Hold on.
That’d be my boyfriend. Happier playing his dopey Star Trek game with his friends than hanging out with me.
Wars.
What?
Star Wars. They get all cranky when you mix the two up.
What is the difference?
There is absolutely no difference.
How do I get him to treat me better?

All right. Let me give you a little girlfriend 101. Usually the first move out of the gate is you withhold sex, but that will work better after Sheldon hits puberty. So, I’d say give him the silent treatment.
No, he loves that.
Hmm.
Our record for sitting in a room together and not speaking to each other is six-and-a half hours. He said it was a magical evening.
All right, then we are gonna have to go with an oldie but goodie, making a scene.
I do not think I’d be good at that.
That is why you are lucky to have me. Back in Omaha, there are two different restaurants I am not allowed into. Both Chili’s.
The apartment.
Bernadette, remember, your character’s the healer in our group. You are in charge of healing all of us, not just Howard.
I cannot help it. My Howie Wowie has an owie.
That is the most sickeningly sweet thing I have ever experienced. And I am sipping Kool-Aid through a Red Vine.
Sheldon Cooper, I have got a bone to pick with you, and I am about to do it in front of all your friends.
Yeah, you pick that bone. You pick that bone clean!
I am gonna publicly shame you, and then sit back as societal pressure compels you to modify your behaviour.
Ooh, burn!
And if you do not start treating me better, I am leaving you for a miniature horse breeder named Armin.
Armin who?
Armin… damn it.
Sheldon, she wanted to show you off to her family, and you stood her up, okay? Look at this adorable, smushy face. Smush, smush, smush, smush.
You are hurting me.
No, Sheldon hurt you.
Before; now it is you.
Oh.

I think I understand. You are the one person who can say Sheldon Cooper is your boyfriend, but that rings hollow if you cannot lord him over others in the flesh. I forget what I bring to the party and what I take away when I leave. Please accept these valuable Cooper Coupons as restitution.
Sheldon, she does not want your stupid…
Ooh, Science Center. Redeeming. Let’s go.
Well played, Amy Farrah Fowler. Let me get my coat. Oh, grow up, Leonard.

But e-excuse me, I have something to say. None of you may realize it, but I was very much looking forward to this weekend. It was gonna be like the old days, the four of us hanging out playing video games before you guys all got girlfriends. Do you have any idea what it is like to be the only one without a girlfriend? Even if I get one someday, I will still be the guy who got a girl after Sheldon Cooper!
And that is how a girl makes a scene. I am sorry, sweetie. You are right. You deserve your weekend. Come on, Amy, let’s go.
What about the Science Center?
I will let you hold my hair while I throw up.
Rain check.
I am gonna go, too.
I will miss you.
I will miss you.
I will miss you more.
No, I will…
Just leave! Okay, now. This is the way it is supposed to be. Men together, fighting the forces of evil.
Hear! Hear!
I cannot believe this is only 64 calories.
Some time later. The guys are asleep.

Howard Joel Wolowitz! I have been worried sick for two days, and I know you turned off your phone! You open up this door right now because I have had it up to here! I have been to the morgue and the hospital, and I spent the last half hour walking up these ferkakta stairs!
That is my ride, got to go.
The apartment.
Oh my God, I love this chicken.
Oh, you know what they say, the best things in life are free.
Okay, you are right, I eat your food a lot. How about this, you can raid my fridge any time you want.
Oh, that is very kind of you. Next time I have a hankering to wash down a D cell battery with a jar of old pickle juice, I will come a-knocking.
Hey, Raj, you did not send your RSVP in. I am supposed to ask you if you are bringing someone to the wedding.
I will let you know.
Well, can you make it soon. There is a battle royale going on over the seating charts. In one corner, Bernadette’s mom, and the other three, mine.
Yeah, I hate wedding receptions. I wish the bride and groom would take a cue from Bilbo Baggins, slip on the ring, disappear and everyone goes home.
Mmm, you liked Professor Guyster’s wedding.
They had a make your own sundae bar. Ooh, that was a night to remember. Do you know, on the one trip, I just had a bowl of nuts.
Anyway, you gotta let me know if you have a plus one, because if not my mom’s trying to sneak in the doctor who sucked the fat out of her neck.
Alright, uh, fine, I am coming and I am bringing somebody. Uh, Koothrappali plus one.
Who you bringing?
Who are you bringing?
He is bringing me. Who are you bringing?
Wow, what a bunch of Nosey O’Donnells.
Come on, who is it?
I am not telling. I am from Asia. I am mysterious. Deal with it.
Howard, are you having a make your own sundae bar?
No, uh, I do not think so.
Well you should. 50% of marriages end in divorce, but 100% of make your own sundae bars end in happiness.
Raj’s apartment.
Hello Mummy, Daddy, how are you?
Pretty good, cannot complain.
Oh I am sure you can. Just give it a minute.
Listen, uh, there is something I want to talk to you about. I, I was not ready until now, but I think it is time.
It is finally happening. You are coming out of the closet, are not you?
We love you, and we accept your alternate lifestyle. Just keep it to yourself.
No, I am not gay. If anything, I am metrosexual.
What is that?
It means I like women as well as their skincare products.
Well, if you are not coming out, why did you call us during the cricket semi-finals?
‘Cause I, I am tired of trying to meet someone and, I think I’d like you to help me find uh, a wife.
And just to clarify, a female wife?
Yes.
Matchmaking, very smart move son. Much better than marrying for love.
We married for love.
And it is been wonderful.
The apartment.
Quantum physics makes me so happy.
Yeah, I am glad.
It is like looking at the universe naked.
Hi, you guys got a minute?
Sure, what is up?
Well, I was thinking about Sheldon’s little joke the other night about me eating all your food.
Oh, that was no joke. But I understand your confusion as I am our group’s resident cut-up.
I am sorry, you are our resident cut-up?
Yes.
Prove it.
Knock, knock.
Who’s there?
Interrupting physicist.
Interrupting physi…
MUON!
Anyway, I got a little residual cheque from my commercial and I thought, hey, how about I get the guys a little thankyou to pay them back. So, Sheldon, ta-da!
Ah! A vintage, mint in box, 1975 Mego Star Trek transporter with real transporter action. Hot-darn!
Where did you get that?
Uh, from Stuart at the comic-book store.
You went to the comic-book store by yourself?
Yeah, it was fun, I walked in and two different guys got asthma attacks. Felt pretty good.
Well this calls for an expression of gratitude.
Ooh, am I about to get a rare Sheldon Cooper hug?
Not this time. Then they would not be special. Thanks Penny.
You are welcome. Do not worry, I did not forget about you. Leonard, I got you a label maker.
Wow. No, it is great. Also, uh, mint in box.
Mmm. And, I got you a transporter too!
Awesome!
Look, it was actually designed for my vintage Mr Spock action figure.
Oh, that is great. Let’s open it up and put him in there.
Ah!
Oh dear Lord. No!
Why, they are just toys?
They are mint in box.
They are Collectables.
C’mon cannot we just open one up and take a…
No!
Once you open the box it loses its value.
Yeah, yeah, my mom gave me the same lecture about my virginity. Gotta tell you, it was a lot more fun taking it out and playing with it.
A restaurant.
Are you sure you want us here when you meet this woman?
Oh yes. In my culture it is expected to have a chaparone to oversee a first date. Plus I want to make a good impression and, no offence, but with you guys here I look like six two.
The nuns always chaparoned the dances at my high school. They used to make us leave room between us for the holy spirit.
Hindus do the same thing. Except they leave room for a cow.
Listen, I love your charming racist humour, but any chance you could not knock my religion while she is here.
Yesterday you made fun of me for eating lox.
It is different. You are people do not worship lox.
Well clearly you have never been to brunch with my cousins.
So, arranged marriages. The parents just decide, and then you have to get married?
Oh, no, no, I get a say in it. But I am sure whoever shows up will be better company than a threesome I have been having with Aunt Jemima and Mrs Butterworth.
Excuse me, are you Rajesh?
Oh, yes. You must be Lakshmi. Uh, nice to meet you.
Nice to meet you too.
Oh, uh, these are my, my friends. This is Bernadette.
Hello.
And this is Howard.
Nice to meet you.
You too.
Please have a seat. I am thinking double wedding!
The apartment.
Dr Cooper. Dr Cooper?
Is someone there?
Down here, on your desk.
Spock?
I need to speak with you.
Fascinating. The only logical explanation is that this is a dream.
It is not the only logical explanation. For example, you could be hallucinating after being hit on the head by, say, a coconut.
Was I hit on the head by a coconut.
I am not going to dignify that with a response. Now, to the matter at hand. You need to play with the transporter toy.
But it is mint in box.
Yes, and to open it would destroy it is value. But remember, like me, you also have a human half.
Well, I am not going to dignify that with a response.
Consider this. What is the purpose of a toy?
To be played with.
Therefore? To not play with it would be?
Illogical. Oh, damn it Spock, you are right. I will do it.
Sheldon, wait. You have to wake up first.
Oh, of course. Set phasers to dumb, right? It is only logical.
Raj’s apartment.
My goodness, that was delicious.
Well, I hope you saved room for chocolate lava cake.
Impressive. What goes into making something like that.
Well, you start off by trying to make chocolate souffle, and when it falls you panic, quickly change the name, and voila! Lava cake.
I bet our parents are dying to know how things are going here.
Well, let’s see. Yup, three missed calls.
Four missed calls, two text messages, and a failed video chat. I win. So, what are we going to tell them.
I’d like to tell them things are going well.
Me too. But before we get their hopes up we should probably make sure we are on the same page.
Okay, what page are you on?
I am on the one where I am on a lot of pressure from my parents to get married and settle down, and have a family, and I am going to do it so they do not find out I am gay.
Say again.
I am gay.
Like, dude on dude, but with women?
I know a fake marriage is not an honest way to live, but you of all people must know how difficult it is to come out in our culture.
Why me, of all people?
Well, there is a rumour back in New Delhi that you are, how shall we say, comfortable in a sari.
I am not gay.
Really? The chocolate lava cake? The little soaps in the bathroom? And I am sorry, but you are wearing more perfume than I am.
That is Unbreakable by Khloe and Lamar. And for your information, it is unisex.
Fill in the blank. I love the nightlife?
I like to boogie.
Got you.
W-w-with women. I like to boogie with women.
That is disappointing. You were exactly the kind of phoney-baloney husband I was looking for.
Thankyou. And once again, my baloney likes girls. Wait-wait. You do not want to put a bit of that in your mouth without trying my homemade chantilly cream. Yeah, okay, that time I heard it.
Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon writhes in bed, then wakes up on an alien planet.
Oh dear. Two suns and no sunscreen.
Hello again, Sheldon.
What is it now, tiny Spock?
I am very disappointed in you. You broke your toy and switched it with Leonard’s. You should be ashamed of yourself.
You are the one who told me to play with it.
If I told you to jump off the bridge of the Enterprise, would you do it?
No. If I got on the bridge of the Enterprise, I would never, ever leave.
Trust me, it gets old after a while. You must right your wrong, Sheldon.
Why? I got away with it. Leonard has his toy, and he is never going to open it, so he will not know it is broken. And I have a toy that is not broken. Everybody’s happy.
Well I am unhappy.
I thought where you come from they do not have emotions.
I come from a factory in Taiwan. Now do the right thing.
You know what you are? Well, you are a green blooded buzzkill. Perhaps it is time you beam on out of here.
Fine. I will just use the transporter. Oh, right. You broke it.
Very well. Cooper to Enterprise, one to beam up. Energise. Ah. Tiny Spock. Help.
Howard’s laboratory. Howard is soldering something.
Ready for lunch?
Yep, one sec. Ah, good. Ma would have killed me if she’d found out I’d broke my retainer.
Hey, uh, can I run something by you? It is about Lakshmi.
Yeah. Sure. How are things going?
We hit a couple of bumps. She lives over on Manhattan Beach, so it takes over an hour to get there. And she is a lesbian.
What do you mean, she is a lesbian?
Well, you know whenever you and I would try to hit on women in bars, and they’d blow us off, and then we’d tell each other they were probably gay. It is like that. Except this time it is true.
Then why did she even go out with you?
She was looking for a husband so she can appear to be straight. And you know, it sounded crazy to me at first, but I am actually thinking about doing it.
Okay, well, so the reason that might sound crazy, is ’cause it is crazy.
Look, Howard, you are in a relationship. You know you have to make compromises.
Well, yes. But my compromises are about which bedspread to buy, or whose turn it is to do the laundry, Bernadette’s or my mom’s.
It is a great deal. We both get our parents off our backs. I do not have to come home to an empty apartment every night, plus, once I am married, I can finally eat carbs again and let myself go.
Why do not you tell your parents you want to try and find someone else, you know, maybe one who has not slept with more women than you.
Because this one wants to marry me. I might never find another one who does.
So you are seriously thinking about marrying someone you are never going to have sex with.
I cannot believe your attitude. I thought you were in favour of gay people getting married.
Yes, to other gay people.
Do you hear how homophobic you sound?
The apartment. Sheldon is working on his laptop. Spock is looking at him judgementally. He switches the two toys.
Oh, I do not want a broken toy. Nothing!
What?
Nothing. I said nothing.
That was weird.
Really? I do not even notice any more.
I cannot believe you guys are not going to play with these.
Well I told you, you do not, it is mint in box.
I dunno. I just think it is a waste. Relax. I am just looking at the box.
Perhaps you should look with your eyes, and not your muscular Nebraska man-hands.
What is your problem?
My problem is that I do not want you to break Leonard’s toy, which you probably did by shaking it. She shook it. We all saw her.
Leonard, I bought you this because I wanted you to have fun with it. I do not want it to just sit in this box.
You know, you are right. I mean, it is from you, I am never going to sell it. I am opening it.
Yes.
Mmmmm!
It is broken.
What?
Oh, nice job, man-hands.
I did not break it. I, I guess Stuart sold it to me like this.
Yes. Yes, he did, that is a perfectly satisfying and plausible explanation. Yeah, let’s all be mad at Stuart.
You know, I paid a lot for this. Let’s take it over there and show him.
Absolutely.
Wait. It was me. I opened your toy, discovered it was broken and did not tell you.
Why would you open mine?
I did not. That was a lie. I opened my own toy. And it was already broken so I switched them.
Well, you should talk to Stuart.
I cannot because that was a lie. Yours was broken in an earthquake. And that is a lie.
What is the truth?

My Mr Spock doll came to me in a dream and forced me to open it. And when the toy broke I switched it for yours. Later he encouraged me to do the right thing and I defied him. And then I was attacked by a Gorn.
Okay, that I believe.
Mmm.
Leonard, Penny, I just, I want you both to know that I regret my actions toward the two of you. That is a lie.
So, is that one mine.
Yes.
Well, hand it over so I can open it.
Okay. Leonard, even though I do not have one any more, I hope you have fun playing with it.
And that is a lie, right?
Big fat whopper. I hope it breaks.
Raj’s apartment.
This is a treat, what brings you guys by?
Raj, Howie told me what is going on with you and Lakshmi.
What, you told her?
I told everybody.
We believe there is someone out there who will love you for you.
Well, actually we kind of agreed to disagree on that one, but we both think you should not marry this woman.
So, while I am waiting for this mysterious perfect match, who may or may not exist, I am supposed to just be alone.
Not necessarily. I think we have found someone for you to cuddle with.
Oh, my goodness. Are not you the cutest little Yorkie ever? You got him for me?
Her. We thought you two would hit it off.
I think we already have. Thank you guys so much. Let’s see if you fit in my man purse.
Metrosexual my ass.
The cafeteria.
So, I got the craziest e-mail this morning.
I do not mean to burst your bubble, dude, but those penile enlargement pills do not work.
Believe me, I know. The e-mail I got was from the office of Stephen Hawking.
You are kidding.
Why?
He is coming to the university for a couple weeks to lecture, and he is looking for an engineer to help maintain the equipment on his wheelchair.
That is amazing. You will be like his pit crew. A word of caution, I would not do your Stephen Hawking impression in front of him.
You are right. I suppose that could be considered offensive.
Oh, boy, Sheldon’s going to freak out.
Yeah, he worships Hawking.
I was actually thinking about bringing him along when I go over there so he can meet the great man.
That is really nice of you, Howard.
Hm, it is no big deal.
Boy, a restraining order from Stephen Hawking. It will look so nice next to the ones he is already got from Leonard Nimoy, Carl Sagan and Stan Lee.
Leonard, do you recall when I said that I was going to revolutionize humanity’s understanding of the Higgs boson particle, and you said, Sheldon, it is two a.m., get out of my bedroom?
Like it was ten hours ago. What about it?
Well, I believe I have done it. And I am only saying believe to sound modest, because, sweet Sam Houston, I did it.
Really?
That is incredible. Oh, here, break out the math.
Oh, okay, let me see this. All right, so this particle here is the boson moving forward in time. Now, I was thinking… Howard, you go ahead and eat. This is not going to make any sense to you.
Sheldon, I have a working understanding of physics.
Yeah, good for you, and do not stop working on it.
Are you still going to tell him about you-know-who?
Yep.
Still going to introduce him?
Not on your life.
A corridor.
Please, please, please let me meet Hawking.
I told you, no.
But I said I am sorry.
No, you said, would it help if I said I am sorry?
And you never answered me. So who owes whom an apology now?
Sheldon, you are a condescending jerk. Why on earth would I want to do something nice for you?
Um, to go to Jewish heaven?
Jews do not have heaven.
Then to avoid Jewish hell?
Have you met my mother? I live in Jewish hell.
Howard, please. This is Stephen Hawking. Perhaps my only intellectual equal.
Oh, you cannot be serious.
Try to put yourself in my place. Imagine you are the sole human being living on a planet populated with nothing but dogs. And then it turns out there is another human being.
Hang on. Are you saying the rest of us are dogs?
Yeah, okay, I can see you are going to take this the wrong way. Let me try again. Imagine you are the sole human being living on a planet populated with nothing but chimps.
Get out of my lab.
Oh, now they are so much smarter than dogs. Have you seen them on those little bicycles?
Get out.
How about dolphins?
Out!
The apartment.
So, come on, how was the first day with Hawking?
It was great. We talked about movies.
Oh!
I showed him some card tricks.
Oh!
He even let me read a couple pages from his new book.
Oh!
Something got you down there, bunky?
Howard, please, I am begging you.
Raj, you are our group historian. Has Sheldon ever begged before?

Three times. He begged the Fox network not to cancel Firefly. He begged the TNT network to cancel Babylon 5. And when he got food poisoning at the Rose Bowl Parade, he begged a deity he does not believe in to end his life quickly.
Do you understand how important Hawking is to me? When I was six years old, I dressed up as him for Halloween.
You are kidding.

No, sir, no, I took my dad’s desk chair, attached a Speak & Spell to it and made my sister push me up and down the block to trick or treat. Granted most people thought I was R2-D2, but still, I got a lot of candy.
You do not seem to be understanding the English word no. Maybe a different language will help. Russian, nyet. Chinese, bu. Japanese, iie. Klingon, qo. Binary coded Ascii, 0110111001101111.
It is actually 01100111.
No!
I am not asking for me, I am asking for Hawking.
Let me try gansta, hells no.
Okay, look, how about this? Just give him my paper on the Higgs boson. If he sees the incredible breakthrough I have made, he will reach out to me.
What if he does not?
He will, he is really smart.
That is an interesting idea. Why do not you give me a minute to talk it over with my friends?
How do I do that?
You walk away.
Walking away.
You do realize you own his ass right now.
I do.
You can make him do anything you want.
Yeah, I know, I am just trying to figure out how much I want to punish him.
Well, do not be too mean.
Hey, fellas, I am thinking about making some freshly brewed iced tea if anyone would like some.
I would not mind a glass.
I was not talking to you.
Bring him to his bony knees.
Sheldon, come on back.
Yes, yes. What did you decide?
I will give your paper to Professor Hawking.
Great, thank you. Oh, that is terrific.
But in exchange, I’d like you to do a few things for me.
What kinds of things?
Are you familiar with the 12 labours of Hercules?
Of course.
You should be so lucky.
Howard’s bedroom.
All right. What would you like me to do first?
Well, I thought I’d start you off by polishing my belt buckles.

Oh. By all means. When I was a boy, I would polish my Mee-Maw’s silver. And she would entertain me with stories about growing up in Oklahoma. Interesting woman. You know, she once killed a prairie dog with a gravy boat.
That is nice.
That is a lot of belt buckles.

Funny thing is, I only have one belt. Anyway, I will let you get started. Oh, by the way, the little marks, uh, that look like water spots, I tend to stand too close to the urinal, so what you are seeing there is splash back.
You make sissy on your belt buckles? Mee-Maw’s forks never had that.
Here is a black light to check them. And for your own peace of mind, you might not want to shine that around the rest of the room.
Sheldon, these look great. They are like magnificent little crowns to hang over my magnificent little jewels. How’d you get them so shiny?
Oh, I-I buffed them with Turtle Wax. The man down at Pep Boys says from now on, the urine should just bead up and roll right off.
Way to go the extra mile. Your Mee-Maw would be proud.
My Mee-Maw must never know of this. Now will you give Professor Hawking my paper?

Oh, my dear boy, no. Okay. Next, this is a sexy French maid costume I bought for Bernadette. I thought it might spice things up and get her to dust my room at the same time, but I was wrong and really wrong.
And you want me to return it for you?
No, no, no, mon petit cherie.
The cafeteria. Sheldon enters in the French maid costume.
What are you all staring at? Did not you ever see a man try to get a meeting with Stephen Hawking before?
The laundry room.
Hey.
Hello.
It is not Saturday night. Why are you doing your laundry?
This is not my laundry.
Wow, are these Amy’s? Kind of trashy, good for her.
Those are Howard’s.
Ugh. Why are you washing Howard’s man panties?
Because if I do not, he will not give my paper to Stephen Hawking. He is a famous physicist.
Yeah, yeah, I know, he is the wheelchair dude who invented time.
That is close enough.
I do not understand, why does not Howard just introduce you to the guy?
Because he is punishing me for being a, quote, condescending jerk. You do not think I am condescending, do you?
Well…
Oh, I am sorry, condescending means…
I know what it means. And yes, you love correcting people and putting them down.
Au contraire. When I correct people I am raising them up. You should know, I do it for you more than anyone.
Come on, you do it to feel superior. I see that twinkle in your eye when someone says who instead of whom or thinks the moon is a planet.
Or Don Quixote is a book about a donkey named Hotay.
See, there it is, there is that twinkle.
Well, I cannot help it. That is an involuntary twinkle.
What do you want me to tell you, Sheldon?
I want you to tell me that Howard is being mean to me for no reason.
Fine, Howard is being mean to you for no reason.
I knew it.
Howard’s bedroom.
What is the matter?
Every time I spend the night, your mom slaps me on the behind and says, go get ‘im.
It is not her fault. She is getting hormone replacement therapy. Makes her crazy horny. Check this out, I got Sheldon to wear the French maid’s costume.
Oh, my God, that is terrible.
Hey, I gave you first crack at it.
Why are you doing that? You are being mean to him.
He is mean to me all the time. You have heard him tease me about not having a doctorate.
If you do not want to get teased about that, get a doctorate. I have one, they are great.
Oh, come on, the man torments me. I am just letting him have a little taste of his own medicine.
It is not the same thing. Sheldon does not know when he is being mean because the part of his brain that should know is getting a wedgie from the rest of his brain.
Fine, I will just make him do a couple more things, then I will stop.
No, you have to stop now.
Bernadette, I want to remind you, you promised to take me dress shopping tomorrow!
Oh, damn. I am sorry, I cannot make it, but Sheldon’s going to go with you! And that is the last thing you do to him.
A shop changing rooms.
Sheldon! I need your help!
What is it now, Mrs. Wolowitz?
It is this dress. When I put my front in, my back pops out. When I put my back in, my front pops out. It is like trying to keep two dogs in a bathtub!
What do you want me to do?
We are gonna have to work as a team. Get in here, grab a handful, and start stuffing.
I am not sure how to do this.
It is easy, just pretend you are putting away a sleeping bag.
Sleeping bags do not usually sweat this much, but okay.
Now zip me up.
Oh, if we squeeze you any tighter, you may turn into a diamond.
You are right, who am I kidding? You should have seen me when I was young, Sheldon. The fellas used to line up and bring me boxes of candy. Why did I eat it all? Would you hold me?
Oh, no, you know, I am not really the holding kind of… Oh!
The apartment.
Oh, guys, I just remembered. I got you some Hawking souvenirs.
What are these?
Gears and springs from his wheelchair. Pretty cool, huh?
Wow, that is amazing.
Yeah, I made an adjustment on the motor drive and when I was putting it back together I could not for the life of me figure out where they went.
I did it. Had to go to three clothing stores, but we finally found a dress that could envelop your mother.
I should have sent you to the custom car cover place in Altadena. They have her pattern on file.
Humorous. Now will you please present my paper to Professor Hawking?
I do not know.
Oh, for heaven’s sake. I did your laundry, I pee-pee-proofed your belt buckles, I, I even sprained my wrist helping your mother lift her bosom.
All right, Sheldon, there is only one thing left I want you to do. Do not worry, it is an easy one.
Okay.
Give me a compliment.
Fine. You have very tiny hands.
No, about my job. I want you to tell me I am good at what I do.
You are obviously good at what you do.
Well, then why are you always ripping on me?
Oh, I understand the confusion. I have never said that you are not good at what you do. It is just that what you do is not worth doing.
It is nicer than anything he is ever said to me. I’d take it and run.
Thank you, Sheldon.
Now will you give my paper to Hawking?
Sorry, I cannot.
What, why not?
I gave it to him three days ago. He was really impressed. He wants to meet you.
All right, then. Thank you, Howard. Please let Professor Hawking know that I am available at his earliest convenience.
I thought he might be a little more excited.
Give it a second.
Stephen Hawking’s office.
Professor Hawking, it is an honour and a privilege to meet you, sir.
I know.
I want to thank you for taking time to see me.
My pleasure. I enjoyed reading your paper very much. You clearly have a brilliant mind.
I know.
Your thesis that the Higgs boson is a black hole accelerating backwards through time is fascinating.
Thank you. It just, it came to me one morning in the shower.
That is nice. Too bad it is wrong.
What do you mean wrong?
You made an arithmetic mistake on page two. It was quite the boner.
No, no, th-th-th-that cannot be right. I-I do not make arithmetic mistakes.
Are you saying I do?
Oh, no, no, no, of course not. It is just, I was thinking… Oh, gosh, golly, I made a boo-boo, and I gave it to Stephen Hawking.
Great, another fainter.
The cafeteria. Sheldon laughs to himself.

I wish you could all be inside my head. The conversation is sparkling. Fine, I will tell you. A lichen is an organism made up of two separate species, fungi and algae. If you could merge with another species, what species would you pick and why? Hint, there is a right answer. None of you will get it.
Okay, uh, I’d pick swan because, uh, the resulting hybrid would have the advanced industrial civilization of a human and the long graceful neck I have always dreamed of having.
Wrong. Leonard?
Horse, but mostly just for the height. A little bit for the genital girth.
Wrong, and let’s keep it clean, shall we?
Kangaroo, uh, I’d be a Kanga-Jew. The first of my people to dunk a basketball.
Also instead of just living in your mother’s house, you could actually live inside her body.
Clever, but also wrong. No, the best organism for human beings to merge with is the lichen itself. That way, you’d be human, fungus, and algae. Triple threat. Like three-bean salad.
Give me one circumstance in which that would be useful.

All right, picture this, a beautiful outdoor concert. Now, as a human, I appreciate Beethoven. As a fungus, I have a terrific view, growing out of a towering maple tree. And no thank you, expensive concessions. Because as an algae, I will just snack on this sunlight.
He got us again.
No, he did not.
Anyway, if it is okay with you, we should talk about Howard’s bachelor party.
Well, seems like a bit of a let down after our lichen conversation, but, what do you know, you are half swan.
I have been doing some research on strippers. One agency I spoke to, said I could get us a great price if we are flexible on age range and number of limbs.
Sounds like loads of fun, but I promised Bernadette no strippers.
You do not want strippers? You are the king of strippers. The one club in North Hollywood named a pole after you.
What can I tell ya, I am not into that stuff any more.
Good for you, Howard. I am proud of you. And still, you are the first one of us to get married. We have to do something special.
You know Germans have an interesting pre-wedding custom.
Well, it is probably not for me.
Maybe we can go up to Napa Valley. They have got that wine train.
Boo, wine! But yay, trains. I am in.
Anyway, it is a beautiful time of year. Uh, you travel through the vineyards. There is a tasting on board. And all the wild flowers are in bloom. It is magic.
Look at that, in 30 seconds, we went from hiring women to being them.
The stairwell.
So, I hear you and the lost boys are having a bachelor party tonight.
Yeah, just going to a restaurant, get some steaks and scotch. Nothing to worry about.
Why should I worry?
Well, I do not know. It is a bachelor party. There could be strippers. Would not that make you a little jealous?
Oh, come on Leonard, it is you. What is going to happen? I mean, even if there was a stripper, all you’d do is avoid eye-contact and maybe offer to help her kid with his homework.
Hey, I am a young man in his sexual prime. Under the right conditions, I-I-I am capable of just, really crazy stuff.
Really? What is the craziest thing you have ever done with a woman? And the time you and I had sex in the ocean does not count.
Oh, come on, that is got to count. There was a really strong undertow, we could have died.
Well, have fun tonight.
Oh, I will. There is no telling what might happen.
Yeah, there is.
You know, there is nothing wrong helping some woman’s kid get through their S.A.T.’s.
A restaurant.
Hey, I got to hand it to Raj, he found a really nice spot to have a bachelor party.
It is not bad. Unless you compare it to a train; then it stinks.
Are you drinking whisky?
Indeed. If I am to participate in the social convention that is the stag night, then I must embrace all its components, including tobacco, swear words, and yes, alcohol. Jeepers! That is yucky.
Whoa, it is a little early to start dropping J-bombs, do not you think?
Hey, you guys.
Oh, hey, Wil. Nice of you to make it out tonight for Howard.
Well, it was either this or another hot tub party at George Takei’s house.
I am confused. I thought since our reconciliation, I was your friend in this group.
Oh, I am friends with Howard too.
Oh. I guess you are just friends with anybody. Aagh!
Hey, uh, Leonard, things are a little tight at the comic book store. I might need some help covering my share of the check.
Oh, yeah, no worries.
And maybe a few bucks for the valet.
Oh, all right.
And gas money to get home.
Yeah, sure.
Great. You know what? This is my grandfather’s watch.
Oh.
18-carat gold, got it in Europe during the war.
Wow, that is very nice.
Mm-hmm. A hundred bucks and it is yours.
Hey, everybody! The bachelor boy has arrived! For he is a jolly good fellow…
For he is a jolly good fellow, for he is a jolly good fellow, which nobody can deny.
Yes, yes, yes. He is a jowwy good fewwow. What time do the stwippers awwive?
Actually, Barry, we are not going to have strippers tonight.
Ah, then what the fwig did I get two hundwed dowwaws in singles out for?
You want to buy a watch?
Penny’s apartment.

This is Maid of Honour Amy Farrah Fowler, bringing you the wedding activities just weeks out from the big day. Let’s check in with a beautiful, radiant young woman, and her friend who’s about to get married. Ladies, can you tell us what you are doing?

Um, these are gift bags we are going to put in the hotel rooms of our out-of-town guests. This is a map of Pasadena. This is a list of local restaurants. And then, for Howie’s relatives, we have antihistamines, antacids, and medicine for diarrhoea and constipation.
Yeah, we labeled them stop and go.
All right, pivoting to the big question. Bernadette, on your wedding night you will be consummating your marriage. What do you think your first sexual position will be as husband and wife?
Amy, please.
Keeping in mind that whoever’s on top may set the tone for the marriage.
Okay, show’s over.
Hey, they may conceive a child on their wedding night. Do not you think the kid might get a kick out of knowing how it happened?
I do not care. Ask her things like are you going to take Howard’s name? Not who’s going to sit on who?
I have actually been thinking I am going to hyphenate: Bernadette Mary-Ann Rostenkowski-Wolowitz.
Nice. You know, you should totally get BernadetteMaryAnnRostenkowskiWolowitz.com before someone snaps it up.

Howard already took care of it. Plus, he set up our beautiful wedding website with cute little facts about our family histories. Do you know, for a while in Poland, my family and his family were neighbours.
Oh, that is cool.
No, it is not. I will explain it to you later.
The restaurant.
May I have your attention, please? We are hear tonight to celebrate the upcoming nuptials of my best friend Howard Wolowitz.
Hear! Hear!
And, apparently, Wil Wheaton’s best friend.
Sheldon…
Talk to the hand.
Does anyone have any words they’d like to say about our man of the evening?

Yeah, I do. . As is the tradition, I have prepared a series of disrespectful jokes which generate humour at Howard’s expense. Prepare to have your ribs tickled. Howard, I always thought you’d be the last one of us to ever get married, because you are so short and unappealing. Am I right? Let’s see here. Oh, seriously though, Howard, you are actually one of the most intelligent people I know. And that is a zinger, because you are not. I have always thought that you’d make someone a fine husband someday. Assuming you’d be able to get the parts, and develop the engineering skills to assemble them, which I do not see as likely. Hacha! Okay, let me see here. Okay, kidding aside, Howard, you are a good friend. And I wish you nothing but happiness. Bazinga, I do not!
Sheldon…
Doubleazinga! I do! Good luck following that.

So, Howard Wolowitz tying the knot. Leaving his crazy bachelor days behind. He was a wild one. Well, I guess we all kind of were. I remember this one time, I was with this girl at the beach. We were in the ocean and we started making out. I know, it was crazy. I was not even wearing my Aquasocks. Then…
Nobody cares, Hofstadter. Wwap it up.
Right. To Howard.
To Howard.
I totally had sex in the ocean.

Okay, I will go. Howard, when I think about you and Bernadette starting this wonderful life together, I cannot help but get a little choked up. I mean, look at you. You have everything. Look at me. I am 37. I sleep in the back of a comic book store, and I have the bone density of an 80-year-old man. To Howard.
Yeah, to Howard. Um, uh, who’s next?

I will go. Howard, I am gonna say something to you that evewybody’s thinking but no one has the couwage to say out woud. When you invite a man to a bachewor pawty, the impwication is, there will be stwippews. Maybe not compwetewy nude, but at weast pasties and G-stwings. That is not unweasonable.
Hear, hear.
Hear, hear.

Okay, uh, anybody else? Huh? No? Okay, it all comes down to me, the best man. Ooh! This grasshopper is kicking my ass-hopper. Okay, when I first came to this country, I-I did not know how to behave or how to dress, or what was cool, I was pretty lonely. But then I met Howard, and suddenly, my life changed, because we could be lonely together. This man became my whole world.
Yeah, nice speech, Fwancine.

I am not done, but thank you. I think back to all the good times we had, like, uh, when we went camping and spent that night telling each other all our secrets. I told him I am addicted to pedicures and he told me he lost his virginity to his cousin.
She was my second cousin.
And the first woman you ever disappointed sexually. Ba-da-bazinga!

Oh, oh, yeah, and then there was the time when Leonard and I took Howard to Las Vegas and paid a hooker to pretend she was Jewish and that she wanted his little kosher pickle. Of all the Howard humping hookers stories, that one’s my favourite!
Okay, buddy, that is it. Sit down.
Oh, oh, what about that tubby girl in the Sailor Moon costume at Comic-con?
Do not remember. Please sit down.
The only threesome I have ever had in my life, and I am proud to say it was with this man right here.
Oh, please shut up.
Oh, oh, do not get me wrong, nothing happened with me and Howard. There was about 200 pounds of Sailor Moon between us.
Oh, Internet, this is so going all over you.
Jeepers, I am drunk.
Bernadette’s car.
Thank you for picking us up. There is a warning, right there, on the scotch bottle. You cannot be operatin’ heavy machinery after you had a snootful of this, laddie!
Funny. You boys have a nice time?
Yeah, it was great. And low-key, like I promised. No hanky-panky, no strippers. Just the guys telling jokes.
That is nice.
How about you? Did you have a fun night? Yeah, we, uh, made gift bags, had wine, and then went online and saw this.
Of all the Howard humping hookers stories, that one’s my favourite.
You know, we are not that far from my apartment. If you stop the car, I can walk from here.
You ai not goin’ anywhere, Threeway.
Bernadette, listen…
You lied to me. You said you told me about all the girls you have been with, but you never mentioned your cousin, the prostitute or Raj!
Seriously, you do not even have to stop the car. Anything under ten miles an hour and I can combat-roll into the street.
Okay, just to set the record straight, I did not hire the prostitute, she was a gift from him. Shame on you, Raj. That is not how we treat women in this country.
Do not you try and blame this on him.
Thank you, Bernadette.
Zip it, pervert!
Bernadette’s apartment.
I do not know what I am going to do. I am supposed to marry Howard in a couple of weeks and I am not sure I even know who the man is any more.
I am curious what is bothering you most, the borderline incest, the prostitute or group sex with the girl dressed as the children’s cartoon?
Amy, remember when we went over things that would be helpful and things that would not?
Right. And that was…
Not.
When I first met Howard, he seemed so innocent to me, just a sweet little guy who lives with his mother.
Well, if that is what you like, I will take you to the comic book store, the place is full of ’em.
Wait a minute. You set me up with Howard. Did you know about all the creepy stuff he was into?
