Yeah, I am not really clear on what that means.
He takes hypotheses and designs protocols to determine their accuracy.
Yeah, you are really just making it worse.
The apartment.
What kind of tea would you like?
I think I am gonna try green tea mixed with lemon zinger.
Two tea bags in one cup? You are not at a rave.
So, listen, Sheldon, I was thinking, since this is gonna be our first Halloween party as boyfriend and girlfriend, I thought it might be fun for us to go in a couples costume.
I could not agree more.
Really? I find that inconsistent with everything I know about you.

Oh, oh, on the contrary. Couples costumes are one of the few benefits of being in a relationship. Now imagine this, you and I entering Stuart’s party and all eyes turn to see America’s most beloved and glamorous couple.
Yeah?
R2-D2 and C-3PO. Dibs on Threepio.
Sheldon, when I said couples costume, I meant like Romeo and Juliet or Cinderella and Prince Charming, not two robots from some silly movie I do not even like.
Okay, I am gonna let that slide because I know you are hopped up on tea bags.
I make compromises for you all the time. Just this once, cannot we find something that we are both happy with?
Fine. How about one of the most beguiling and influential couples of the 20th century? Hewlett and Packard. Dibs on Hewlett. What? You want to be Hewlett?
Leonard’s laboratory.
Anybody home?
Hey, what are you doing here?
I just thought I’d stop by and say hello.
Oh, what a nice surprise. I do not think you have ever seen my lab before.
No, I know. It is long overdue. So, what ya doing? Better not be building a robot girlfriend.
No. Although Howard was making some real strides in that area until he met Bernadette.
You are kidding.
Nope. Now the Lisatronic 3000 just sits in a box waiting for the phone to ring.
Ooh! What is going on in here?
Oh, no, no, no, do not look in there.
What, is it secret?
No, it is a nitrogen laser. It will cook your eyeball like a soft-boiled egg.
Oh. You might want to put a sign on it.
Sign right there.
Ah. Danger. Sure, sure. Yeah. What is, what is that?
Uh, that is an integrated ion trap and time-of-flight mass spectrometer.
Wow. High-techie-techie. What is this little box?
That is a pencil sharpener.
Ooh, low-techie-techie. So, what are you working on right now?
It is actually pretty neat.
Yeah?
Yeah. It is a front-projected holographic display combined with laser-based finger tracking. Here, I will show you. We will just put this pencil over here.
Sharp. Thanks to the machine we saw earlier.
Very good. And then a laser will map the reflective surface, and voila.
Wow. That is amazing.
You know, there is a foundational idea in string theory that the whole universe may be a hologram.
What do you mean? Oh! Wow!

Uh-huh. Well, the holographic principle suggests that what we all experience every day in three dimensions may really just be information on a surface located at the farthest reaches of our cosmos. So it is possible that our lives are really just acting out a painting on the largest canvas in the universe.
Hmm.
What?
Sometimes I forget how smart you are.
You should visit more often. What are you doing?
Take off your clothes.
What? Here? Now?
Yeah. You got a problem with that?
No, no. It is kind of crazy. I have never fooled around in the lab before.
Really? Never?
No. I did have a shot with the Lisatronic, but the extension cord was not long enough.
The cafeteria.
Before I forget, I’d like your opinion on the menus I have prepared for the Halloween party. The theme is food that goes bump in the night.
Creature from the Black Forest Ham Lagoon.
On Sesame seed Bunzillas.
Night of the Living Garlic Bread?
It is funny because bread sounds like dead.
I am sorry, but these are just ordinary foods with the names bent into tortured puns. The dishes themselves are in no way Halloweenie.
Ooh, Hallow-weenies! That is a good one. They will pair nicely with my Draculoni and Cheese. How do I do it?
That reminds me, I was thinking about wearing my NASA jumpsuit as a costume. But then I realized everyone would be, like, where’s your costume? Why are you wearing your work clothes, you nut?
Hello, boys.
What are you smiling at?
Nothing.
You know where’s there is a lot of nothing.
Space.
Howard and Bernadette’s bedroom.
Boy, it is nice to sleep in a bed with gravity again. Did I tell you about the night my retainer floated out of my mouth and into the air lock?
Yeah, you mentioned it once or twice.

So, here we are, just a couple of young newlyweds. What to do? What to do to you? Astronaut Wolowitz, reporting for booty. Preparing thrusters. We have liftoff. Are we clear to jettison that nightgown?
Okay, we need to talk.
What?
Howie, I know you went to space. I am incredibly proud of you. But you might want to try and not bring it up every minute.
I do not talk about it every minute.
Tonight at dinner you went on bout it for an hour straight.
What was I supposed to talk about? We were eating at Johnny Rockets.
I am just saying, people are getting a little tired of it.
So, I did this amazing thing and I am never allowed to mention it?
Of course you can. But maybe a good rule would be to wait for people to bring it up.
Okay, no problem. It will not happen again.
I love you.
I love you, too. I cannot tell you how many times I dreamed I was in bed here with you when I was… you know. What, I cannot even point?
Leonard’s lab.
So, basically, this is what is called mag-lev technology. It uses very powerful electromagnets to create a force strong enough to overcome gravity. Here, you hold this.
Whoa! That is heavy.
Yeah. Oh, uh, you do not have on any jewellery, do you?
No. Why?
A grad student forgot to take out one of his piercings. Now he is on a transplant list waiting for a nipple his size. Now watch this.
Whoa! That is very cool.
Sometimes I like to turn this on and pretend I am the super villain Magneto.
Getting a little less cool, Leonard.
But what I really am is a very smart scientist who understands the mechanics of the universe and is wearing the sexy black underwear you bought him.
There we go.
The cafeteria.
So, I thought the photo booth for the party could either be creepy like a mummy’s tomb, or they also have the Tardis from Doctor Who.
A Tardis makes no sense. It is a time machine from a science-fiction show. It has nothing to do with Halloween. That being said, if you do not get a Tardis, you stink and your party stinks.
Do you have a preference?
I do not care. Get the Tardis.
Yes! This party just became a major rager.
Oh, by the way, can I borrow your bullwhip and fedora?
Yeah, sure, whatever.
I was thinking of dressing up as Indiana Jones’ mocha-skinned love child. Indian Jones.
Clever.
What is wrong with you?
Nothing.
Oh, Howard, I have got a party to plan. Do not make me pull it out of you.
Okay, here it is. Bernadette said you guys are all sick of me talking about my trip to space. Is that true?
Yes.
No.
We seem to have different approaches here. I was going for helpful honesty. I have no idea what you are doing.
It is called being nice.
Okay. If you think being nice will get him to shut up, I will try it.
You know what, guys? Never mind. I just will not talk about the greatest achievement of my life ever again.
Look at that, the problem solved itself.
Hello, boys.
The apartment.
What if we were to go as dinner table favourites salt and pepper?
You know salt makes me retain water and my cousin William was ground to death in a pepper factory accident. How about Raggedy Ann and Andy? I loved them growing up.
No, I do not think so. Those dolls represent three things I do not care for, clowns, children and raggediness. I think it is a lost cause.
No. There are certain things that say to the world, I have a boyfriend, and he is not made up. Matching costumes, hickeys and sex tapes. Pick one.
What is a hickey?
Howard and Bernadette’s bedroom. Howard and Bernadette are dressed as smurfs.
How do I look?
Fine.
Uh-oh, is someone a little blue? Come on, Howie, that is like the funniest thing I have ever said in my life. What do you say? You ready to go?
To tell you the truth, I am not really in the mood.
What are you talking about? It will be fun. All your friends will be there.
Yeah, some friends. They all think I am boring. Maybe you should go without me.
No, if I am there alone, people might think I am just a really short person from Avatar.
I am sorry. I just do not want to go.
Hey, I just spent the last three hours colouring myself blue. I am gonna be washing paint out of my Smurf for a month.
Fine. Two weeks ago I was an astronaut.
Yeah, well, now you are a Smurf. Keep walking.
The comic book store.
Oh, my God, you guys look adorable.
Thanks, so do you. Slutty cop?
No, sexy cop. Slutty cop only came with a skirt and two badges.
And Albert Einstein?
Ja, und later she is going to arrest me for goink fashter zen da shpeed of light.
I thought we said in the car, no accents?
Sorry, Officer.
Hello. It is a great party.
Thank you.
The monster foods, they are really fun.
Oh, yes, thank you. I like to think of fun things like that because I am fun. I am not clinically depressed at all.
Sheldon, get in here.
I should have picked hickey.
Hey, hey, look at you guys!
I am Raggedy Ann, and he is Raggedy C-3PO.
It was a compromise. I lost.
Can you believe Stuart’s walking around taking credit for this party?
Who cares?
What do you mean who cares? Look at what I pulled off here. The DJ’s on fire, there is a Tardis photo booth in the back room, and, oh, my God, the food. Stuart wanted Kraft Draculoni and cheese.
You are right, the party’s fantastic. Please, tell me more. I have not heard enough about it all week because hearing about that never gets old.
Is this about the space thing again?
Well, I am not allowed to talk about it, but since you brought it up, I went to space! Space, space! Space! Space, space! Space!
Whoa, Drinky Smurf. Can I talk to you for a second?
Great, now I am in trouble. You happy?
You, out! You are being very rude.
No, I am not. They are all being rude. And you are being rude.
Me? What did I do?
Oh, Howie, stop talking about space so much. Nobody likes it.
I do not sound like that.
You are my wife. You are supposed to be on my side.
I am always on your side.
Then why are you trying to take this away from me? Being an astronaut is the coolest thing I am ever gonna do. If I stop talking about it, then I am just…
Just what?
Just plain old Howard Wolowitz again.
Plain old Howard Wolowitz is the best guy I know.
You are just saying that.
No, I am not. I married him. On purpose. Come here.
I love you.
I love you, too.
Nothing to see here. Just sexy police business.
Just explaining the theory of relativity. Twice.
Howard and Bernadette’s bedroom.
Hey, what you watching?
I do not know. Raj sent me some video of Buzz Aldrin.
Here you go. It is a Milky Way. The Milky Way’s a galaxy in space. I have been in space. Here’s a Mars bar. I am an astronaut. And this one’s a Moon Pie. I walked on the Moon. What have you done?
Okay, I get it.
A dance video game where the characters are imperial stormtroopers from Star Wars and Bobba Fett. Opens onto the apartment where Howard and Raj are dancing to the game.
Try to keep up, Howard, I am killing it.
Yeah, I wish we looked as cool dancing in clubs as we do right now.
Do not worry, this is exactly how you look when you are dancing in clubs.
You are welcome, ladies.
Paradigm-shifting news, gentlemen.
Dude! I was about to Bollywood this bitch.
Earlier today, I invited Professor Stephen Hawking to join me in the popular online game Words with Friends. Moments ago, he accepted my request. Do you understand what that means?
That somewhere right now Stephen Hawking is saying, damn it, I meant to click no.”
I will walk you through it. The game is not called Words with Strangers. No, it is not even called Words with Acquaintances. It is called Words with…
I am not finishing your sentence. You pulled the plug on my funk.
Friends! It is Words with Friends! Which Stephen Hawking and I officially are. Now all I need is a bunk bed with a slide, I will have everything I have ever wanted since I was six years old.
That is really nice, Sheldon, I am happy for you.
And I am happy for you, too. You are now friends with someone who is officially friends with Stephen Hawking. Enjoy it, boys. You may have peaked.
Sheldon, I know Stephen Hawking. I worked with him.
And if they ever come out with a game called Words with People You Once Worked With, you will be off to the races.
Sheldon, I do not think this actually means…

Hold that thought! Professor Hawking has made a move. Boy, oh, boy. Oh, it is only a matter of time before we are coming up with fun nicknames for each other. I will be Coop. He will be Wheels. If he is okay with that.
All right. Crank up the AC, boys, it is gonna get hot in here!
Penny’s apartment.

So, I was taking a shower this morning, and when I got out, I started to dry off with what I thought was a towel but turned out to be Howard’s mom’s underwear. I had to take another shower. It was not enough. Nothing will ever be enough.
I once looked in Sheldon’s underwear drawer. He yelled at me. But now I know what it looks like and he can never take that away.
There is a book under here.
Oh, I will get that.
I got it.
No, no, it is…
I got it. Why do you have a history textbook?
No, it is not a big deal. Just taking a class at the Pasadena Community College.
That is great. I did not know you wanted to go back to school.
It is just one history class. Look, I did not finish college, so I thought I would give it a try.
Not to mention, your acting career is going south like Sherman. Read about it in your book.
Why would you be embarrassed to tell us?
No, I am not embarrassed. I just did not want anyone to know because I have not told Leonard yet.
Why would not you tell Leonard?
Because it is me going back to school, and he is gonna be all “you can do it,” and “how can I help?” and “I am so proud of you.” Ugh!
I just cannot believe you could keep something like that from him.
You guys have got to be the weirdest couple I know.
Really? You cannot think of anyone weirder?
I can, but she is sitting right there.
Amy’s laboratory.
Yes. I play the word quiver with a triple letter and a double word score for 72 points. That ought to let the air out of your tyres, Hawking.
Wow, my boyfriend is friends with Stephen Hawking and my new dandruff shampoo does not smell like tar. Everything really is coming up Amy.
It is glorious. One of the greatest intellects of our time has agreed to engage with me in a gentlemanly battle of wits. And I am spanking him so hard his grad students will not be able to sit down.
You know, when one male dominates another, his testosterone level rises.
What is your point?
It is exciting to think you might be getting a testosterone level.
Ooh, my friend Stephen just played the word act for 18 points. That is right, I call him Stephen now, because I checked, and he was not okay with Wheels.
Oh, you could turn his act into extract , and it would be for double points.
Amy. Why would you give me a word? Now, if I play extract it would be cheating.
Sorry.
Although, I could play the completely unrelated and better word extract . Ethical conundrum avoided. Thanks, brain.
Penny’s apartment.
Spaghetti okay?
It is crunchy. Just the way I like it.
Yeah, I do not think the water was really boiling.
It is great. I love it.

Okay, listen, there is something I need to tell you. I have been thinking about going back to school for a while now. So a couple months ago, I started taking a history class at the community college.
Oh. That is great. Great, great, great. Why wait so long to tell me?
I do not want you to make a big deal out of it.

Why do you think I’d be like that? I get it, you are taking one class. It is nice. Maybe if it goes well, you take another, you enrol full-time. Ooh, be sure to keep an eye on which credits transfer to a four-year college.
You are making it a big deal.
Sorry. Whatever. It is all good.
Anyway, that is it. I just thought you should know.
Am I allowed to ask how the class is going?
It is really good. We have been talking about the origins of slavery. Turn in my first paper tomorrow.
Great topic. I can help with that. There are lots of different perspectives you can take, economic, sociological, political.
Hey hey hey, this is my paper. And my perspective is that slavery is bad. Oh, and my professor’s black, so I am pretty sure that is the right answer.
Can I take a look?
No, Leonard, this is my thing.
Okay, I get it.
Thank you.
It is like when I started doing chin-ups, I did not want you to see until I could do one. FYI, really close.
Thank you. Now behave yourself and eat your dinner. Maybe later, if you are lucky, you get to sleep with a college girl.
Really? ‘Cause I went to four years of college and five years of grad school, that never happened once.
The apartment.
I think the next time I have to speak to a call centre in India, I am going to try using an American accent.
Why?
Because when I use my regular voice, I feel like I am making fun of them.
That is ridiculous. Not to mention, your American accent is terrible.
Dude, my accent is brilliant. Hey, my snow-white American friends, let’s put some cow meat on the barbecue and eat it until we are all obese.
This is what you sound like. I think I am talking in an American accent, but it really sounds like I am wearing a set of giant dentures.
Sheldon, do I really sound like that?
Tell him he sounds like that.
Sheldon, you okay?
It is been three days. Why has not Stephen Hawking played a word?
The guy’s a genius. Maybe you were not challenging enough for him.
Not challenging? I was humiliating the man. I was thinking of writing a book called A Brief History of the Time I Made Stephen Hawking Cry Like a Little Girl.
There is the problem. You cannot beat Hawking like that. He hates to lose. Everyone knows the guy’s a big baby. I mean, forget the wheelchair, he should be in a stroller.
Really?

One time when I was working with him, he said that Johnny Depp was in The Matrix. I told him he was wrong, but he kept insisting. So I looked it up online and showed him. Well, the next day, he had a pizza party, and everyone got invited but me. And then he was all, your invitation must have gotten lost in the matrix.
Good Lord, what have I done?
Good Lord, what have I done?
Terrible.
All right, hotshot, let’s hear your Indian.
I cannot sit on that elephant, my ass is on fire from eating all this curry.
Okay, yeah, that is pretty good.
Penny’s bedroom. Leonard sneaks from the bed and opens Penny’s computer.
Please be good. Please be good. Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Okay. She writes like she cooks.
The apartment.
Play. Play. Play. Play. Play.
What are you doing?
Trying to use a Jedi mind trick to control Stephen Hawking. Play. Play. Ugh! He must be wearing a tinfoil hat or something.
I did a bad thing.
Does it affect me?
No.
Then suffer in silence. Play. Play. Play. Stephen Hawking. Stephen Hawking. Stephen Hawking.
Penny started taking a class. She wrote a paper, she did not want me to read it, I went behind her back and I read it anyway.
Stephen Hawking hates me.
I do not know what to do. I mean, the paper’s terrible. But if I tell her, she will know that I read it and she will get really mad.
I was beating him so bad, he does not want to be friends anymore. Why does everyone love me except Stephen Hawking?
Is it possible we are having two different conversations?
How would I know? I am not listening to you.

Hang on. Okay, here’s what we are gonna do. Chess clock. We each get five minutes to talk about our problems. We will take turns. Each turn will consist of a statement and a helpful response from the friend. Begin.
I humiliated Stephen Hawking in a game of Words with Friends. He stopped playing, and now we are not friends anymore.

He is probably busy. You are worried about nothing. Give it a couple more days. I am sure he will play, and you will see that everything’s fine. My turn. I cannot let Penny hand in a bad paper, but how do I tell her it is bad without letting her know that I read it?
Hmm. Beats me. Now, I know Hawking’s not busy because I can see he is playing other people right now.
Maybe since you are so good, he is taking his time to meet the challenge. I want Penny to enjoy school…
Wolowitz told me he is a big baby. But I did not know that, and I played extract for 82 points. It is all Amy’s fault. She told me to play it. I have got to cut her loose.
Sheldon, I was not done talking. She hands in the paper tomorrow. I know I could help her. And she is my girlfriend. I, I should be allowed to help her. Why are not I allowed to help her?
Yeah, I hear you, brother.
No. You need to give me some advice.
Fine. Women, huh?
No, specific to my situation.
Blonde women, huh?
Empathetic.
It sucks to be you.
I quit.
Leonard, wait. No. I listened to your dumb thing. Leonard, come back. Leonard, come back. Leonard, come back.
What?
Oh, of course, it only works on the weak-minded.
Penny’s bedroom.
Good morning, sunshine.
Leonard. It is eight a.m. It is like the middle of the night.
I know, but I have to go to work, and I made you breakfast.
Oh, wow, that is so sweet. Hey, what is this?
Uh, before you open that, um, are you familiar with the story of The Shoemaker and the Elves?
Elves? Come on, Leonard. It is too early for Lord of the Rings.

No, no. Listen, um, once upon a time, there was this shoemaker and when he went to bed at night, elves would sneak in and they would make all these amazing shoes for him. And when the shoemaker woke up in the morning, he, he would be super happy, not mad at the elves at all. Open it.
Okay. An examination of the economic, cultural, and political roots of slavery in the Old South, 1619 to 1865. What the hell is this?
Do not ask me. A little elf did it.
So let me get this straight. You just assumed my paper would be bad so you wrote one for me?
No, I assumed it would be good. Then I read it.
What?
No, I, I mean, it was good. There were just a few things that needed a little polishing.
You changed every word.
That is not true. Uh, slavery. 1619. Your name at the top. That is all you.
You are such an ass. This is exactly why I did not want to tell you I was taking a class in the first place.
Please do not be upset. I just, I did not want you ending up with a bad grade and get discouraged and give up on the idea of going back to school.
Right, because me being in school is so important to you. That way, you would not have to be dating someone who’s only a waitress.
Oh, come on, you know that is not true.
Do I? Listen to me. I need to do this on my own. If I fail, I fail. If I pass, I pass. Do you get it?
I am sorry. I was just trying to help.
Yeah, well, next time do not. Oh, and since you like stories so much, this is not The Shoemaker
The cafeteria.
You ever hear back from Hawking?
No. It would appear as if I have lost him. Stupid brain.
It will be okay.
How can it be okay? Stephen Hawking’s a genius and he talks like a robot. It is everything I have ever wanted in a friend.
Yeah, but if he is a sore loser, maybe you are better off without him.
You are right. I guess I just have to make lemonade out of the two of you. He played! He played! Coop and Rolling Thunder are together again. He was okay with that nickname.
So, now all you have to do is let him win.
Yeah, way ahead of you. I will play the word at for two measly points, throwing the game and thus securing my friendship with the smartest man in the world.
What are you waiting for? Hit send.
I cannot. Losing on purpose is intellectually dishonest.
So do not do it.
Oh, but I want to be Hawking’s friend.
So do it.
Oh, but if I do, I will be a phony, a sellout, a Hollywood poser.
Then do not do it.
I will not. This feels right. My mother always said, to thine own self be true.
Good for you.
‘Course she also told me that every animal in the world got on one boat, so what does she know? And send.
The apartment.
Oh, hey. Have not heard from you in a couple days. You still mad at me?
Nope. I have no reason to… “B” mad at you. Minus.
Wow.
That is right. On my paper. Not yours, mine, you punk-ass elf.
I do not know what to say.
Hmm, how about, gee, Penny, you are smarter than I thought. You may be the one in school, but I am the one who learned a lesson. I am so stupid, Penny. Duh.
She sounds exactly like you.
Penny’s apartment.
How’d it go with Leonard?
I do not think he will be making that mistake again.
Good.
So, I know this goes without saying, but if either of you tell Leonard you helped me rewrite this paper, I will beat you both with a bag of oranges.
Understood.
Got it.
Now, ladies, we got a B-minus on this paper. I think if we put our heads together, on the next one we could get an A.
Uh, but we got you a B-minus on purpose to make it believable.
Believable? You saying I am not smart?
No, no!
You are smart.
That is better.
I feel like I am in high school again.
Yeah, doing the prom queen’s homework so she will like us.
I know. It is finally working.
The apartment. Sheldon’s phone rings.
It is Stephen Hawking.
Well answer it. I want to hear.
Professor Hawking, how nice of you to call.
Hello. I really enjoyed our game, Dr. Cooper.
Oh, me, too.
Or should I say Dr. Loser? Ha, ha, ha.
Yes, congratulations. You won fair and square. Uh, very impressive, sir.
Do you like brain teasers?
Oh, I love brain teasers.
What does Sheldon Cooper and a black hole have in common? They both suck. Neener neener.
The apartment.

Hello, I am Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Welcome to Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. Before we get started, I’d like to announce the winner of our design your own flag competition. But I cannot. The only entry was from GameyGamer75, and I know that was a jpeg of your buttocks. Now this week we have a very special episode where we explore the flags of the popular entertainment franchise, Star Trek. And to help me, I am pleased to introduce Internet personality, former star of Star Trek: The Next Generation, and the only guy I know lucky enough to be immortalized in one sixteenth scale. Set phasers to fun for my friend, Wil Wheaton.
Hi, Sheldon. Thanks for having me. I am happy to be here.
Cut.
What is wrong?
Sorry, Sheldon, you were brilliant as always. Wil, that was a little wooden.
Wooden?
Do not worry, it was not terrible. Just, this time, try to say it the way people sound. And action.
My friend, Wil Wheaton.
Hi, Sheldon. Thanks for having me. I am excited to be here.
So, Wil, what do you have for us first?
Well, this is an exciting one. This is the flag of the United Federation of Planets. Now what is interesting about this flag…
Cut.
What was wrong with that?
It is called Fun with Flags. They are not at half-mast, nobody died. Let’s try and keep it upbeat.
Um, no offence, but I have been acting since I was a kid. I think I can handle a Web show without a lot of direction.
It is true. In 1982, Wil played the voice of Martin the mouse in The Secret of NIMH. You moved me.
You will have to forgive me. This is my first time directing, I just want it to be good.
So do I.
Great. So, this time let’s try more real boy, less Pinocchio. And action.
And cut. You realize that I am doing this for free, right?
Yes. And so far, we are still not getting our money’s worth. Let’s try it again. Everybody’s having fun. And action.
So, Wil, what do you have for us first?
Well, this is an exciting one. This is the flag of the United Federation of Planets.
Cut.
Problem, first-time director?
Oh, none that I could see. I saw a man who loved flags almost as much as I do. I got goose bumps.
He was overacting on purpose.
Really? He reminded me of a young William Shatner.
Listen, Sheldon, I am really happy to do this for you, but not if she is gonna be a huge pain in the ass the whole time.
You gonna let him speak to me like that?
Well, you are my girlfriend and I do not want you to be upset. Then again, Wil Wheaton’s my friend and I do not want him to be upset. Hmm, this is a sticky wicket. What do you think?
Can I speak to you for a second?
I will be right back. Feel free to play with yourself.
I do not care for your friend, he is being rude to me. You need to ask him to leave.
Amy, I cannot just ask Wil Wheaton to leave. He is a minor celebrity. Once you explain who he is, many people recognize him.
Fine. Then maybe I should go.
Could you? That would solve everything. You are the best. I will see you at dinner tonight?
You sure you would not rather have dinner with your friend Wil Wheaton?
Come to think of it, I would! You, little lady, are on fire.
Howard’s bedroom.
Every time we eat dinner here, your mother refuses to let me help with the dishes.
Do not take it personally. She likes doing them by herself so she can lick the plates with no one looking.
You ready to go?
Yeah, let me just grab a couple of fresh turtlenecks.
I do not understand why you keep your stuff here when there is plenty of room at home.

What are you talking about? All I have here is a few sweaters, books, bank stuff, computers, mail, collectibles, medicine and my electric body groomer. Ooh, there is my plaid dickie. Oh, got this at the Goodwill store for 50 cents. Can you believe it?
50 cents sounds right. Let’s go.
You know, it is kinda late. Why do not we just spend the night here?
Because we do not live here.
I know.
Do you? You said when you got back from space you were gonna move into my apartment, but half the time we stay here.
That is not true.
Howard, I am doing laundry. You want me to put anything in for you?
There is some underwear in the hamper.
Oh, good, I got that new stain stick to try out.
Thank you, I only put it on the list two weeks ago. Okay, I see what you are getting at. How about this weekend I will box up all my things and move them to our place.
Thank you.
The lightsabres are gonna look great in the living room.
Or in the closet. We can decide later.
Howard, help, my hand’s stuck in the garbage disposal.
Let go of whatever piece of food you are holding.
Are you kidding? It is a perfectly good chicken leg.
The apartment.
Hey, look who’s out after dark, like a big boy.
I was out raising heck with Mr. Wil Wheaton. Four hours more and we would have closed down the HomeTown Buffet.
I thought you had plans with Amy.

Yeah, I did, but then Wil called Amy a pain in the A-S-S. She got huffy and left, then Wil and I headed out to dinner. That place really did remind me of my hometown. Because there we also have a HomeTown Buffet.
Hold on. Wil and Amy had an argument?
Yes, quite the kerfuffle.
Then Amy got mad and left?
Walked right out the door.
And you?
Enjoyed a delightful dinner at a reasonable price. The manager recognized Wil and let us sit right next to the frozen yoghurt machine. Right next to it. I was closer to it than I am to you right now.
Buddy, I think Amy might be upset.
Why’s that?
Because your friend was rude to her, and then you went to dinner with him.
You are just repeating what I said. It is like living with a lactose-intolerant parrot.
Trust me, call her.
Fine. It is a shame you did not go to dinner with us, because the buffet you are about to enjoy only serves humble pie, a dessert much less tasty than frozen yoghurt. I was this close.
What?
You will appreciate this. Leonard has some ridiculous notion that you are mad at me. Tell him you are not mad at me. Go ahead, set him straight.
I am mad at you, Sheldon.
Hmm. Eat one of your Luna bars. Very often when women think they are angry, they are really just hungry.
I am not hungry. Your friend insulted me, and you did not do anything.
Precisely, I did not do anything. Now does someone feel like checking her emotional math?
Keep going, buddy, you are doing great.
Sheldon, I am your girlfriend, and you should have taken my side. That is it. End of story. Good night.
Wow, Amy’s mad and Leonard was right. What a weird day.
The Cheesecake Factory.
Hey. Sorry this took so long. But you used to work here, you know how it is.
Kitchen slammed again?
No, I am a terrible waitress, remember?
So, is there anything I can do to help you with the move tomorrow?
Now that you mention it, I was thinking tomorrow might not be great.
What is your excuse this time?
No excuse. It is just, you know, I am Jewish, and technically, we are not supposed to drive or carry anything on the Sabbath. So this one’s on God.
That might be a little more convincing if you did not have a mouthful of bacon cheeseburger.
My religion’s kinda loosey-goosey. Basically, as long as you got your schmekel clipped and do not wear a cross, you are good.
Howie, you promised you’d move.
And I will.
Yeah, right.
I will. I am obviously not going to live in my mother’s house for the rest of my life. I am not a child.
I have seen her burp you.
She did not burp me. She was patting me on the back, and I happened to burp. Do not you have other tables you should be waiting on?
Yeah, but I told you, I am not good at my job. Bernadette, listen to me. He is never gonna leave.
I am starting to think you are right.

All right, I have had enough of this. I am a grown man, I have a successful career, for the love of God, I have been to space. I will move out when I am ready, and I do not need anyone badgering me into it.
Wow, excuse me.
That was just for her benefit. I will move tomorrow. I love you. Do not leave me.
Amy’s apartment.
Amy. Amy. Angry Amy.
What?
I have been thinking about what happened, and I hope this gift will make things better.
Star Trek DVDs? Why would I want this?

First of all, you are welcome. And furthermore, not being familiar with Wil Wheaton’s body of work, there was no way for you to know you were being rude to a national treasure. Get ready for 130 hours of I told you so. Fine. I will just tell you what happens. Episode one, Encounter at Farpoint. Fade in. The new Enterprise heads out on its maiden voyage to contact the Bandi people of Deneb IV. Enter Wesley Crusher, played by my buddy… She is hooked.
Howard’s bedroom.
Wow. An end of an era.
Boy, if these walls could talk.
They’d say, why does he touch himself so much?
Yeah. I cannot believe I am not going to live here anymore. This has always been my bedroom. Right here is where my mom used to mark my height.
Oh, yeah. Fifth grade. Sixth grade. Seventh grade. Eighth grade. Ninth grade.

I remember when I was five, hiding under this desk with all my Halloween candy. Had some Peanut M&M’S, went into my first anaphylactic shock and had to be rushed to the hospital. Came home, celebrated with a Snickers, went into my second anaphylactic shock.
When did you figure out you were allergic to nuts?
Sometime around the third Almond Joy.
Okay. You want to start loading this stuff into the truck?
Yeah, I guess. Hey, would you do me a favour? Go on ahead. I just want one last moment alone in my old room.
We are not standing outside by the U-Haul while you fondle yourself.
Fine, let’s go.
The Cheesecake Factory Bar.
Hey. What brings you in?
Penny, if you would not mind, I’d like to have a conversation about girls.
I had a feeling we’d have a talk like this sooner or later. Are you finally getting fuzz in weird places?
Penny, please, I am on the horns of a relationship dilemma. And for the record, I had a full pubis of hair by the time I was 19.
And for the record, bleugh. So what are you drinking?
Well, it is been a rough day. I usually go chamomile tea, but I do not think that is going to cut it.
You could have a Long Island Iced Tea.
Will that calm my nerves?
It is calmed the pants off me a couple of times.
Sold.
Oh. So, the heart you got from the wizard giving you trouble?
The trouble is not with me, Penny, it is with your gender. Someday, scientists will discover that second X chromosome contains nothing but nonsense and twaddle.
Yeah, Amy told me what happened. Look, just apologize. It will warm her twaddle.

It is a Band-Aid at best. See, the core problem is that Amy and Wil do not like each other. Which is baffling because they are both crazy about me. And I like them, which indicates they are bright and interesting and/or were on Star Trek.
Honey, you cannot make people like each other.

Not true. Leonard made me like you. And let me tell you, that was a hard row to hoe. Cheers, pal. Ooh. Boy, that is a treat that is hard to beat. Get the Mad Hatter on the horn, I am having a tea party.
You might want to pace yourself.
I drink tea all the time. I think I know what I am doing.
Far be it from me to criticize a man with a full pubis. Look, Sheldon, your problem is not Wil Wheaton, okay? Your problem is the way you treated Amy.
My problem is I am out of tea.
Come on, someone insulted your girlfriend and you just let him do it. I thought you Texas guys stood up for your womenfolk.
Penny, please, I think I have evolved beyond my simple rustic upbringing.
Sorry.
On the other hand, that low-down polecat done wronged my woman.
Welcome to Long Island, Tex.
Amy deserves better. You know, when we buy the Planter’s deluxe mix, she eats all the Brazil nuts so I do not have to look at them. She is a unique blend of saint and squirrel.
Yeah, that she is. Here you go.
I am a callous egomaniac. She is gonna leave me.
No, she will not.
No, she will not. I am great.
Howard and Bernadette’s apartment.
Okay, I have now officially moved out of my mother’s house. You are now the only woman in my life who I will see naked in the bathroom.
I know this was not easy. You doing okay?
Oh, I am fine. It is just her I am worried about.
Aw, she will be okay. She is a grown woman.
I know. It is just ever since my dad left, I have felt responsible for her.
That is a lot for a kid to deal with.
She was just so sad all the time. I was the only person who could cheer her up. Well, me and Ben and Jerry.
She is lucky you were there.

You know, she is why I first got into magic. I would do little shows for her, hang up a bedsheet like it was a curtain, put on a top hat and cape. And part way through the act, I would say I needed a volunteer from the audience to be my beautiful assistant and invite her up on stage. I can still remember the way she’d smile. For a few minutes, she’d forget how lonely she was.
Aw, crap. Let’s go.
Where we going?
Grab a box. We will sleep at your mother’s place tonight.
No, but I want to live here.
Well, you should have thought of that before you told me the stupid magic trick story.
Cannot we talk about this?
No husband of mine is gonna break his mother’s heart!
Wil Wheaton’s house.
Wil Wheaton! Wil Wheaton! Wait, how many was that?
Hey, Sheldon, what is up?
Would not you like to know?
Have you been drinking?
Just tea. S’the best tea I have ever had.
Why are you here?
I will tell you. I am from Texas. Need I say more?
Yeah, actually, a little more would be helpful.
You insulted my woman. I am here to defend her honour. Two! It was two. Wil Wheaton! Now prepare yourself for what may come.
Oh, Sheldon, do you really think we are gonna fight?
My fists are not up here because I am milking a giant invisible cow. They are up to beat an apology out of you.
Okay, I am sorry.
Well, that was a long bus ride for not very much.
Are you okay?

You are asking a lot of questions, Wil Wheaton. As a matter of idle curiosity, which of your shrubberies do you feel would benefit from a thorough vomiting? Never mind, I will choose. You were so good in Stand by Me.
The apartment.

Hello, I am Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Welcome to Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. Get ready for a very special episode where we explore the flags of the popular entertainment franchise, Star Trek. And to help us, I am pleased to introduce a special guest, surprisingly, it only took gas money and the promise of free food to get him here, Mr. LeVar Burton.
Hey, Sheldon, it is a pleasure to be here. Well, we have got some interesting flags for…
Cut. Yikes, this guy is worse than Wil Wheaton.
I do not know what she is talking about, but I am obligated to agree with her. She is my girlfriend.
Ah, I hear you, brother. I still get lunch, right?
The cafeteria. Sheldon is drawing on a napkin.
What are you drawing over there?
It is a hypothetical containment field for a Frisbee-sized wormhole that could serve as a portal to a parallel universe.
Oh, you silly doodlebug.
You know, a lot of scientists believe that making contact with other life-forms would probably not end well for us.
It is a Frisbee-sized wormhole, Leonard. You can block it with a Frisbee. Calm down.
Do you expect me to build this?
I expect you to wipe the pudding off your chin. Gentlemen.
Have you guys ever noticed that Sheldon always disappears every day at two forty-five?
Really?
He probably just goes to the bathroom.
Actually, no, he goes to the bathroom at eight a.m. with optional follow-ups at one forty-five and seven ten high-fibre Fridays.
It is sad that you know that.
Oh, that is just the tip of the sadness iceberg.

I am looking at his public calendar. Two forty-five to three-oh-five, nothing. Yesterday, two forty-five to three-oh-five, nothing, last week, nothing, last month, nothing. He never has anything booked during that time.
Twenty minutes a day, completely unaccounted for.
We should figure out where he goes.
Ooh, this is exciting. Like one of my classic murder mystery dinner parties.
Right, the case of who murdered three Saturday nights of my life?
Colonel Koothrapali in the kitchen with the olive spread.
It was tapenade and you guys suck.
Penny’s apartment. Penny is texting.
So, how was work today?
Well, I spent most of the afternoon growing isotopically pure crystals for neutrino detection.
That sounds like fun.
Yeah, it was.
Oh, good, I guessed right.
Who you talking to?
Oh, just this guy I met at school.
Oh, great. We are still dating, right?
Relax. He is just a friend. We are doing an oral report together. He is really nice.
I am sorry, what was that? I had a little stroke after oral.
Would you stop? Look, he just moved here from London, okay? He does not really know anybody.
Oh, good, an English accent, the sexiest accent you can have.
No. That is not true. There is French, there is Italian. No, you are right, it is the best.
Did you tell him you have a boyfriend?
It did not come up.
Well, maybe you should tell him.
What am I supposed to say?
Say, cannot talk right now, hanging with my boyfriend. England sucks, you suck, USA number one.
Fine. Hanging with my boyfriend. Talk to you later. Happy?
Yes. Thank you.
Mm-hmm. Hmm.
What did he say?
Nothing.
What?
Did your boyfriend make you type that?
I hate this guy.
Do not be like that.
Come on, trust me, he is hitting on you.
No, he is not. We are just friends. Look, is this gonna be a problem? Because he is supposed to come over tomorrow to work.
Really? Here?
If it makes you uncomfortable, I will switch partners, even though the thing’s due next week and everyone already has a partner and I will probably end up failing the class.
That’d be great. Thank you.
The corridor outside Sheldon’s office.
Two forty-four, Right on schedule. Hey, Sheldon.
Oh, hello.
Raj and I are heading over to the genetics lab to pet the glow-in-the-dark bunny. Want to come with us?
No, thank you.
Are you sure? They turn off the lights, and it is like a cute little laser show that poops all over the place.
I am quite sure. Good day.
Well, where are you going?
Where are you going?
We just told you.
I just told you.
No, you did not.
Well, it is your word against mine; see you in court.
Should we follow him?
I do not know, I am torn. I want to know where he is going, but now I kind of want to play with the bunny.
Hi, guys.
Hey, Alex, do you know where your boss just went?
No.
Do not you know his schedule?
All I know is corduroy makes too much noise and I have to go find quieter pants.
Come on.
Boy, what I would not give to get her out of those pants and into something a little more stylish.
A corridor in the basement. Sheldon takes out a key, unlocks a door and enters.
This is where he goes? What is in there?
I think it is an old storage room.
What could he be doing in there every day for twenty minutes?
Well, he is not doing twenty-minute abs, because if he were, he would have way better abs. Can you hear anything?
Not yet. What are you doing?
I am listening.
Cannot you face the other way and listen?
I cannot do anything right for you, can I?
What the hell is he up to?
He is kind of a weirdo. Maybe he is got Leonard Nimoy chained up in there. Or Bill Gates. Or Stephen Hawking.
Why would he chain up Stephen Hawking?
Howard, please, you cannot treat the man differently just because he is disabled. That is not okay.
The apartment.
If you are wondering why I have been staring through the peephole, I am trying to get a look at this guy who’s coming over to Penny’s.
To be honest, I did not know you were here.
It is not a big deal. He is just in her history class. They are working on a project together. I do not even know why I care. You know what, I do not care.
You think you do not care?
This is silly. I have nothing to worry about.
Oh, I do not know. I mean, statistically speaking, I am sure you have something to worry about.
What do you mean?

Well, if we assume your looks are average, yeah, right off the bat, fifty percent of men on Earth are more attractive than you. That is one point five billion handsome lads standing by, waiting to rain on your parade.
Well, yeah, but this is not just about looks. I am, I am way above average in a lot of other things.
Not height, vision, athleticism, or ability to digest dairy products.
I am talking about important things like emotional maturity.
You were just spying on your girlfriend through a peephole.
I liked it better when you thought I was not here.

I am not saying you do not have attractive qualities. Your choice of friends is impeccable, you are a good sleeper, and last but not least, you buy the grapes I like. You are a real catch compared to some snoring guy with a fridge full of lousy grapes.
None of this matters. I trust that Penny cares about me, and nothing’s gonna happen with this guy.
Well, unless of course he is a skilled hypnotist.
What?
While unlikely, it is still a statistical possibility. She might be performing sexual acts with him and not even know it.
Now you are just being ridiculous.
Am I? The mind’s a mysterious thing, Leonard. He could be having the time of his life while she thinks she is a chicken pecking for corn.
The university basement.
Look at us, sneaking around in the middle of the night like a couple of cat burglars.
I think we are more like ninjas.
I do not want to be a ninja, I want to be a cat burglar.
Fine, I will be a ninja, you be a cat burglar.
No, we both have to be the same thing. Okay, we are ninjas.
Thank you.
But next time, we will be cat burglars.
It is locked.
Are you sure?
Yes, I am sure. Now, you stand guard, I am going to…
It is locked.
Just keep an eye out. I will have this open in a minute.
When did you learn how to pick locks?
When I was starting to do magic in junior high, I thought I could be an escape artist like Harry Houdini.
How did that work out?
Pretty good. I managed to escape friends, popularity, and every party thrown in a twelve mile radius. There. Ready?
Hold on, hold on.
What?
Sheldon is a very smart man, and he obviously wants to keep this a secret.
Yeah, so?
What if it is booby-trapped?
Do not worry, I am one step ahead of him.
Great, what is your pl…
Are we good?
Yeah. Huh. Forty-three? What the hell does that mean?
I do not know. The solution to an equation?
Maybe. It is a prime number. Encryption systems are built on prime numbers.
What kind of secret does Sheldon have to encrypt?
He is always been very cagey about what he puts in his egg salad to make it so tasty.
It is paprika.
Really? Well, oh, okay, one mystery solved.
The apartment.
Okay, good night.
Thanks, Cole. See you at school.
I will be right back.
I thought you left a long time ago.
‘sup?
Hey.
You, uh, moving into the apartment on the fifth floor?
No, I was just visiting a friend.
Oh, cool. That cute blonde on four?
Yeah. You know her?
I, well, I see her around. I like to keep my distance because her boyfriend is a pretty scary dude.
Really?
Yeah. He is ganged up.
She told me he is a scientist.
That is the name of his gang. The Scientists. They are crazy.
Well, thanks for the tip.
No problem, brother. Stay frosty. We are still dating, right?
The cafeteria.
Oh, hello, Dr. Hofstadter.
Hey, Alex, and call me Leonard. Dr. Hofstadter is my father. And my mother. And my sister. And our cat. Although, I am pretty sure Dr. Boots Hofstadter’s degree was honorary.
May I join you, Leonard?
Sure.
Thanks.
Hey, Alex, let me ask you something. My girlfriend knows this guy at school. He is got an English accent.
Ooh, I love English accents.
Yeah, you all do. Anyway, I feel like he is hitting on her. She says he is just being nice and that I should trust her.
It is probably harmless. You know how it is. I am sure you get hit on all the time.
Right. Because girls are always like, ooh, that guy owns two Star Trek uniforms and gets a lot of ear infections. I got to get me some of that.
I do not know, I bet it happens more than you realize.
Trust me, it does not.
You sure? You are cute, you are funny. Maybe you are getting hit on, and you do not even know it.
Really?
Yep, pretty sure.
Okay, I got to get back to work. Thanks for listening.
No problem.
Hope-hope no girls rip my clothes off on the way.
Raj’s office.
Come on, we are smart guys. We can figure this out.
Forty-three. What is forty-three? Besides my mom’s neck size.
It is the atomic number for technetium.
That stuff’s radioactive.
Do you think he is building a bomb?
Ah, it took him two years to put together that Lego Death Star, I am not worried.
Ooh, this could be something. forty-three is the number of calories in half a cup of fat-free yoghurt.
Why would you know that?
I am sorry. We cannot all eat whatever we want and still stay thin. Wait, in the Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy, is not forty-three the answer to the question of life, the universe,and everything?
That is forty-two, dumb-ass.
Hey, hey. Feelings.
We should stop. I am exhausted.
Yeah, me, too. We have got more important things to do. Who cares what stupid forty-three means?
Not me.
Let’s go home. You want to get something to eat?
Sounds good.
What the balls is forty-three?
I have to know!
The stairwell.
Hi.
Hey, should not you be out with your gang, spray painting equations on the side of buildings?
Come on, I am sorry.
I just cannot believe you do not trust me.
I do, of course I do.
Then why did you embarrass me in front of my friend, who, by the way, knew exactly who you were?
Really?
Your picture’s on my refrigerator.
Oh. You know, I am really starting to not like this guy.
What is your problem? Do you use up all your thinking at work and then have none left over for when you get home?

I do not know. It-it-it is hard sometimes. Everywhere you go, guys hit on you, even if I am standing right there. And they are all taller than me. Why is everyone taller than me? You know what, this is all in my head. It is my problem, not yours.
Leonard, why do you always do this? Listen to me, you are the one I am with. You know I love you, so will you please relax because you are driving me crazy.
You know that is the first time you ever said that you love me.
Yeah.
We are just supposed to pretend it is not a big deal?
That is exactly what we are gonna do because you are about to make me cry, and we both know if I start crying, you are gonna start crying.
You are right, you should go.
All right.
She loves me. Hey, it is Alex. Nice having coffee with you. If you want to talk more, I am always available. Smiley face, smiley face. What a friendly girl.
The cafeteria.
Okay, picture’s up. Looks like the camera’s working.
That is good quality video.
It better be. It is the spare camera for the Mars rover.
How did you get your hands on that?
Million dollar camera, ten dollar lock.
Oh, my God, here he comes. This is it.
What the hell is that thing?
I do not know.
This is Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Experimental log. Wormhole generator test forty-four.
Wormhole generator test?
The first forty-three parallel universes I have checked proved to be empty. I see no reason to suspect universe number forty-four will be any different.
Oh, my God!
Holy crap!
Oh! It is eating my face!
Aah! It is eating his face!
I found your webcam and replaced the video feed. You two should be ashamed of yourselves.
Sheldon, we are really sorry.
Yeah, really sorry.

Sorry? You may not realize it, but I have difficulty navigating certain aspects of daily life. You know, understanding sarcasm, feigning interest in others, not talking about trains as much as I want to. It is exhausting. Which is why, for twenty minutes a day, I like to go down to that room, turn my mind off and do what I need to do to recharge.
But what are you doing in there?
And what does forty-three mean?
You do not need to know, you do not deserve to know, and you will never know.
Yeah, well, I know how to make your egg salad now.
The room in the basement. Sheldon enters, takes out a box, takes a beanbag from the box, then starts playing keepie-uppie,
One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight… Drat. I am never going to get to forty-three again. One, two, three, four… Rats.
The cafeteria.
They are not.
They are, too.
Your hypothesis is completely disconfirmed by all the data. You are just clinging to it out of intellectual stubbornness.
No, you are displaying a shocking ignorance of the subject matter. Mummies and zombies are the exact same thing.
Oh, yeah? Mummies are wrapped in bandages.
That is called a fashion choice.
All right, you brought this on yourself. Sheldon, get him.

If a zombie bites you, you turn into a zombie. However, if a mummy bites you, all you turn into is some schmo with a mummy bite. So, like a zombie, that is been eaten from the waist down, you, sir, have no leg to stand on.
Good boy. Here’s a cookie.
Oh, thank you.
Hey, fellas, what is going on?
Oh, mummies and zombies again.
Oh, they are not the same thing.
You get a cookie, too.
Thanks. Guess who picked up his new car this morning?
Congratulations. Does it have that new car smell?
Yep. For as long as I can keep my mother out of it. If you want to check it out later, it is parked right out front, space 294.
I am sorry, 294?
Yeah.
That is my parking spot.
Why do you have a parking spot? You do not have a car. You do not even drive.
It does not matter. That is my spot.
Maybe they reassigned it because you never use it.
Well, I am not using my nipples, either. Maybe they should reassign those.
Sheldon, someday, if you get a car, I am sure they will give you another parking space.

I do not want another parking space. I want my parking space. It is perfect. It is a corner spot, cutting the risk of door-dings in half. It is a mere 28 steps from the building entrance. The nearby tree provides shade on hot days and is also home to a delightful squirrel. Which is fortuitous because most squirrels are real jerks.
Fun story. Meanwhile, you still do not have a car.
Do not try to change the subject. This is about a parking space. It has nothing to do with cars.
Are you listening to yourself?
I always listen to myself. It is one of the great joys of my life. Now, get your car out of my spot.
Nope.
Very well. You leave me no choice.
The parking spot. Sheldon is trying to push Howard’s car out of the spot.
What are you looking at, you stupid squirrel?
The apartment.
Well, he is not wrong. Howard did go to the International Space Station.
Yeah, that was five weeks ago. How much longer is he gonna milk that cow?
Sheldon, let it go. It is not a big deal.

No, no, this is a slippery slope, Leonard. It starts with a parking space, where does it end? It is like my dad always said, first they say you cannot drink and drive, next thing you know, you cannot let your 10-year-old take the wheel while you sleep one off in the backseat.
All that story does is make me feel bad for your mother.
Leonard, you are my best friend. Why do not you ever take my side?
Because I can never understand your side.
Sheldon’s office.
Give it back.
I am sorry, but could you be more specific?
My Iron Man helmet. Koothrappali saw you take it. Give it back.
Oh, that. Well, see, I wanted it, and you were not using it. Apparently, those are the rules we live by now. Payback, it truly is the B word, is not it?
Sheldon, that is a five hundred dollar limited edition collectible, and I want it back.
I’d love to help you out, but unfortunately , I am using it.

Let’s get him laid!
Stop it. You are ruining girls’ night.
Raj, you are a great guy, you are in a bar full of single women, let us help you.
Yeah, you are a real catch. I know you are shy, but that does not mean you should not have someone wonderful in your life.
That is sweet of you. But what can you do to help?
We will nose around, see if we can find a nice girl, and then introduce you.
Okay. Well, a couple of things. Do not tell them I come from money. I want them to love me for me. They must be insanely hot. Like, nines or tens.
Nines or tens?
Okay, an eight is acceptable if she is willing to bring another eight to the hot tub.
Bottom line, you will take any woman who will have you, right?
In a New Delhi minute.
The apartment.
I do not remember you buying these miniatures in my store.
Oh, uh, yeah. I got ’em on Amazon.
Sure. I get it. Why support a friend when you can support a multinational conglomerate that is crushing the life out of that friend?
I know, but when I shop online, I can do it on the toilet.
Have you seen my store? The whole place is a toilet.
Can we please move this along?
Yeah, sorry. Uh, you come to the end of the tunnel and find a large chest. What do you do? And, Howard, do not say, I feel up the large chest.
Excuse me, I am a married man now. I was not going to say anything so juvenile.
Great. What do you do?
I walk up to the large chest, bury my face in it and go “blublublublublublublublu”
I open the chest.
It is locked, but suddenly the door behind you slams shut and now the walls of the room start closing in.
That is not good. My character and I both have claustrophobia.
Glowing letters appear on the chest that read, If squashed to death you wish not to be, sing of Svaty Vaclav and his victory.
Who the hell is Svaty Vaclav?
Walls are getting closer.
Oh, boy, happy place, happy place.
Wait, Svaty Vaclav was the Duke of Bohemia.
You are ten seconds away from getting crushed. Nine, eight.
What are we supposed to do?
Seven, six.
Wait, wait. Svaty Vaclav is better known as Good King Wenceslas from the beloved Victorian Christmas carol.
Never heard of it. Must be the one Christmas song not written by a Jewish guy.
Three, two.
Somebody sing the damn song.
Good King Wenceslas looked out, on the feast of Stephen. When the snow lay ’round about, deep and crisp and even
The walls are getting slower.
Brightly shone the moon that night, though the frost was cruel. When a poor man came in sight gathering winter fuel.
The walls stop. You are safe.
That was amazing, Sheldon.
How did you know that?

It was simple. I combined a well-known historical fact about Bohemia with the memory of my grandparents, Mee-Maw and Pop-Pop, singing Christmas carols while I sat in front of the fire and tried to build a high-energy particle accelerator out of Legos.
Okay, continuing our quest.

W-W-Wait. There is still four more verses. You do not sing a song and not finish it. Hither, page, and stand by me, if thou know’st it, telling. Yonder peasant, who is he? Where and what his dwelling? Brightly shone the moon that night, though the frost…
The bar.
Looks like he is doing pretty good.
Of course he is. Look, that girl just got dumped by her boyfriend. She is angry, she is drunk, and her favorite movie is Slumdog Millionaire. I mean.
That is some low-hanging fruit.
Oh, here he comes.
So, how’d it go?
Great. I bought her a couple of drinks, and she gave me her e-mail address.
Ooh!
Jennifer at not-even-if-you-were-the-last-guy-on-earth dot loser.
What?
I am sorry, Raj.
Why cannot I find someone? I am smart, I have got a cool job, and my naturally bronzed complexion means I can pull off mustard yellow in a way most guys cannot.
Oh, honey, it is not you, it is them.
No, it is not. She was too beautiful for me.
Why would you say that?
It is true. I am always attracted to women I cannot have. I do it all the time. I did the same thing with the two of you.
The two of them? I do not understand.
Well, uh, there was a time when I had a thing for Penny, and I thought she was into me, too, because she got drunk and naked and climbed into bed with me. But apparently I misread those signals.
And you liked Bernadette also?
That was before Penny. I make it a rule to only fall for one of my friends’ girlfriends at a time. I am very old-fashioned that way.
So at, uh, some point, you probably had a thing for me, too.
No, not really.
Oh, come on, Raj, not even a little bit?
Not that I can think of.
Think harder.
Nope. I guess the heart wants what the heart wants. Or in this case, does not, I mean, at all. What?
The apartment. Sheldon is still singing.
Ye who now will bless the poor, shall yourselves find blessing. Ba-da-bum.
Done?
I think the word you are looking for is bravo.
Okay, you leave the room and find yourself standing before a pool of melted snowmen.
Melted snowmen? Are there carrots and lumps of coal in the water?
I do not know. What is the difference?
Well it is a game of the imagination, Leonard. Paint a picture.
Fine. You leave the room and find yourself standing before a pool of melted snowmen. There are carrots and lumps of coal in the water.
What happened to the top hats and the corncob pipes?
You see those, too.
Oh, it is like I am really there.
I gotta tell you, this, this is the most holiday fun I have had since my therapist changed my anxiety medication and I stopped caring about the blood in my stool.
Good story.
What are you drinking there? A little eggnog?
Yes. What, is there a problem?
No, it is nice to see you enjoying a holiday beverage. Pretty Christmassy.
Since when is eggnog a Christmas drink? Eggs are available all year ’round. I have been known to enjoy this poolside.
Come on, Sheldon. You know all the Christmas stories, and the carols, you have got an eggnog moustache going on there. Just admit it. You are getting a little Yuletide spirit.
Oh, do not be silly. Christmas is a bunch of baloney created by the tinsel industry. Why is this so important to you?
Honestly, because I had enough crappy Christmases as a kid and I am tired of you sucking the joy out of them now.
What was so bad about them?

I grew up in a house full of crazy academics. Instead of leaving Santa milk and cookies, we had to leave him a research paper. And in the morning, you could tell he’d been there because the paper would be graded.
No wonder you love Christmas. That sounds amazing.
It was not amazing. I got a C-minus four years in a row.
Yeah, I am familiar with your work. C-minus was your gift.
The bar.
Amy, I am really sorry. I did not mean to upset you.
It is fine. I am used to being the girl who never gets looked at twice. I did not have my first kiss till I was 22, and the guy only did it so I’d give him back his insulin.
Sometimes the pancreas wants what the pancreas wants.
Forget it. I do not expect you guys to understand.
I understand. In seventh grade, I played Spin the Bottle and it landed on Alina Shankar. She said if I came near her, she would break the bottle and cut me.
You think that is bad? In college, I passed out at a frat party and woke up with more clothes on.
Sometimes I get so lonely, I sit on my left hand until it goes numb, then I put it in my right hand and pretend I am holding hands with another person.
I do that, too. Sometimes the left hand tries to cop a feel. And I let it.
It is kind of nice to talk to someone who understands what it feels like to be alone.
It is, is not it?
But you are not alone anymore. Now you have got Sheldon.
I do. And do not worry, someday you will have somebody, too.
Thank you. I hope she is half as lovely and amazing as you are.
Thank you, Rajesh. He wants me, I am good. We can go now.
Damn it.
What?
Now that I know she does not like me, I am kind of into her.
The apartment. Sheldon is writing numbers on a whiteboard.
All right. I think I cracked the code to lower the drawbridge.
Great. Let’s do it.
The drawbridge is lowering.
My carpal tunnel’s acting up.
Play through the pain.

You did it. The drawbridge is down. You cross the chasm and find yourself in a small dungeon room. And in the corner, chained to the wall, you see a bloodied and beaten Santa Claus. He says, ho, ho, help me.
Yes, we found Santa. Christmas is saved. Do not ever tell my mother I said that.
I take out my skeleton key and run to Santa to unchain him.

You cannot talk, you are paralyzed. I get right up in Santa’s big, fat face and say, well, well, well, jolly old Saint Nick, we meet again. Yeah, I believe the last time we spoke was in the Baybrook Mall in Galveston, Texas, when I was five years old, is not that right?
Uh, okay.

My mother dragged me there and she plopped me down on your lap and you asked me what I wanted for Christmas. And I told you, my Pop-Pop, because that was the year my grandfather died. I missed him and I wanted him back.

Pop-Pop was the only one in my family who encouraged me to pursue science. But you did not bring him back, did you? No, instead, I got Lincoln Logs. I take the skeleton key, and I toss it into the chasm, and on the way out, I give Santa a swift kick in his bowl full of jelly!
Okay. So Wolowitz and Stuart are paralyzed, Santa’s dead, and I picked this over having sex with my girlfriend.
The apartment, late at night.
Santa?
Oh, hello, Sheldon. You should be asleep.
Well, then, you should not have jingle bells on your boots.

I understand.
But I do have something special for you. Close your eyes.

Better.

The apartment.

Hey, Leonard.
Hey. Just playing a little Giant Jenga here.
Oh, I know, I am the one who had to buy him the helmet. So, do you have any plans this weekend?

Ooh. That is his take on John Wheeler’s quantum foam. That should be great.

Ah, I’d love to, but I am supposed to hang out with Penny.
Well, bring her.
Well, she is not really into that kind of stuff.
Yeah, okay. Well, if you want to hear about the lecture, I can tell you all about it at work, or, you know, over dinner sometime.
What?
Jenga, I win!
The cafeteria.

I did the research. Tony the Tiger, Dig’em the Frog, Cap’n Crunch, Toucan Sam, Count Chocula, Trix the Rabbit, Snap, Crackle and Pop. Not one cereal mascot is a girl. It is a total breakfast sausage fest.

How could you do that to me? You know I have been working it with Alex for weeks.
Working it? You cannot even talk to her.
I talk with my eyes.
You look like my little cousin when he is dropping one in his diaper.

To my bones. I mean, I am not gonna do anything about it. I love Penny. It is just nice to have a young, attractive woman sniffing around the goods.

I want to thank you all for coming on such short notice. Okay, look, it is not really about Ricardo and Tondelaya. It is really about her boss, who does not quite know how to handle this situation and could use your advice, which is surprising because Dr. Einstein Von Brainstorm, he is usually pretty smart about these things.
I am gonna kill her.
I am sure you have got nothing to worry about. Leonard would never cheat on you.
She is right. But say the word, I got a lab full of cocaine-addicted monkeys with nothing to lose. One of them could end up in the backseat of her car. Or her shower.

Ladies, ladies, please. We are not here to talk about Penny, okay? We are here to talk about me. Uh, I mean Einstein Von Brainstorm. Oh, darn it! All right, I guess the cat’s out of the bag. Let me explain what is going on. Ricardo is really Leonard.
We know what is going on, Sheldon!

Well, Alex is your employee. If she is doing something that is making Leonard uncomfortable, you should talk to her.
Oh, no, he is not uncomfortable at all. No, he is loving it. Yeah, he is strutting around like he is five-foot-six.
What? He is loving it?
Sheldon, you need to talk to Alex right away.
Talk to her? That is all you have got? With a cool name like Sheldon Cooper’s Council of Ladies, I really expected more. Give me back the T-shirts.
Sheldon’s office.
Alex, check my schedule. What does my afternoon look like?
I think it is pretty wide open. Oh, wait. Here’s something at four o’clock. Give Alex a talking to?
Well, that snuck up on us, did not it?
Is there a problem?
Let’s not call it a problem. Let’s call it an opportunity. To solve a serious problem.
What did I do?

You do not know? Oh, you poor dear. Your ovaries are squirting so much goofy juice into your brains you do not even know which way is up. You made an inappropriate sexual advance towards Dr. Hofstadter.
What? I did not make a sexual advance on anybody.
Now, there is no need to get defensive. I am not unsympathetic to your plight. My father used to say that a woman is like an egg salad sandwich on a warm Texas day.

Full of eggs and only appealing for a short time.
This conversation is making me uncomfortable.

Yeah, you and me both, sister. Now, please understand, I do not hold you responsible for your behaviour because, see, from an evolutionary standpoint, you are a slave to your desire to reproduce. But during the work day, when you feel possessed by amorous intent, may I suggest that you suppress it by leafing through this illustrated book of sexually transmitted diseases? Let’s see here. Oh, yes. Check out this oozy doozy.
I have to go.

The stairwell.

Oh, you seem extra happy.
