Any particular reason why?
I do not know, just having a good day. This morning Sheldon fell asleep on the way to work, so I got to listen to the radio. That was pretty crazy.
Mm-hmm. Anything else?
Mm. I found this quiz online called Which Star Trek Character Are You? and it only took me four tries to get Captain Kirk.
That is great.
Oh. It. Was.
Hmm. Well, I am glad you are having such a great day.
Yeah. And the one thing that could make it even better is an evening with my special girl.
Oh, and who’s that?
What do you mean?
Oh, I just did not know if you meant me or Alex.
Um, why would I mean Alex?
Because I know she hit on you and I know you liked it.
What?
Do not play dumb with me, Ricardo Shilly-Shally!
I am missing something. Did you say something to Penny about Alex?
Oh, yes. Yeah, and a fat lot of good it did me. All she did was get mad at you.
Why would you do that?
I needed advice about a woman. I would have asked you, but if the last few years have proven anything, it is that you cannot tell a uterus from a unicycle.
At least I know not to blab to a girl about somebody flirting with her boyfriend.

Good to know. Yeah, a few more helpful hints like that, you may find yourself on the Council of Ladies. Hello. I see. Uh, what time? Very well, then. Huh. That was the Human Resources Department at the university. Apparently, my assistant Alex has filed a complaint accusing me of inappropriate behaviour in the workplace.
Oh, my God, what did you do?
Hmm, let me think. Nothing. I am a delight.
The Human Resources Department.
Human Resources Department.
Come in.
Hello.
Ah, Dr. Cooper, have a seat.
Thank you.
I called you in today because your assistant Alex Jensen has lodged a complaint against you.

So I have been told. But I cannot understand what she has to complain about. I mean, she has a front-row seat as I make scientific history. There is string cheese in my mini-fridge, and that is for anyone. Yeah, and just yesterday I led her away from a life of sexual promiscuity by making her look at pictures of disease-ridden genitalia.
Cancel my next appointment. This is gonna take a while. Dr. Cooper, you said things to your employee that you just cannot say in the workplace.
Like what?

Well, according to Ms. Jensen, you said that she was a slave to her biological urges and called her an egg salad sandwich. I do not even know what that means, but I am gonna go ahead and tell you you cannot say it.
Oh! I see the confusion here. No, no, Alex thought I was singling her out. No. I meant that all women are slaves to their biological urges, you know? Even you. You are a slave.
I am a what?
Well, y-you, I-I am just saying, you know, at a certain point in a woman’s menstrual cycle…
Whuh-ah! Woah! You cannot talk about that, either, Dr. Cooper. Your language is entirely inappropriate, and I am gonna advise that you shut your mouth right now.

I do not see why I am the one being persecuted here. Dr. Hofstadter, he was bragging about his sexual desirability to anyone who would listen. You know, and Howard Wolowitz, he spent two years using university resources building a six-breasted sex robot. Oh, and at the office Christmas party, I heard Rajesh Koothrappali refer to you several times as Brown Sugar.
Hofstadter… Wolowitz… and the last one was Rajesh Koothrappali?
Yes. No, yeah, but in his defense, that was not racist. He is also brown.
Penny’s apartment. Penny answers the door. Leonard is playing his cello outside.
I am sorry Alex hit on me, hit on me, hit on me. I am sorry Alex hit on me, I’d no idea I am cute.
Oh, damn it, you are.
Please forgive me. I should have told you about Alex.
I do not care about Alex. Fine, I care. Okay, I hate that bitch. But what really hurt is that you liked it so much. I mean, do I need to be worried?
Of course not. No. Why?
Because, she is pretty and smart, and when you talk about work, she does not have to go home and look up words in the dictionary to understand what you said.
You do that?
No.
Hang on. Are you feeling insecure? Because that is my thing, and if you take it away, I do not know what I am bringing to this relationship.
Yes, Leonard, I am insecure. Happy?
No, I am not happy.
Why are you smiling?
I am sorry. I just never think of you having feelings like that.
Well, I do.
Why? Nothing is ever going to happen between me and Alex.
Good.
Come here. Tell you a secret?
What is that?
With all these women chasing me, I kind of do feel like Captain Kirk.
Can I tell you a secret?
Sure.
Keep talking about Captain Kirk, and we are all gonna stop.
Message received. Ah, excuse me. Hello. This is Dr. Hofstadter. Okay. All right, thank you. That is weird. I am getting called in to Human Resources.
What did you do?
I do not know.
Howard and Bernadette’s kitchen.
Huh. I just got called in to Human Resources.
Why?
I do not know.
Raj’s apartment.
Huh. That is so strange. Human Resources wants to talk to me tomorrow. Could you stop licking your ass for two minutes? I have a problem here.
Human Resources department.
Do you really think you should be drinking right now?
How else am I supposed to talk to the Human Resources lady?
I do not know. Seek professional help?
I did. The guy at the liquor store said this stuff tastes great in coffee.
Wait, you got called in, too? What is going on?
Sheldon threw us all under the bus.
Oh.
I feel like I have been called down to the principal’s office. Although I would not mind if Brown Sugar suspended me. From a sex swing. This may have been a mistake.
Relax. Everything’s gonna be fine. Before I met Bernadette I was in here every other day. Uh, little tip, turn off your I Like Big Butts ringtone before you go in.
Well, this is all your fault.
How is this my fault?
If you were not screwing around with Sheldon’s assistant, none of this would be happening.
I was not screwing around with anyone.
Oh, of course not. She was just sniffing around your goods because she was hunting for truffles.
Ah, Mr. Wolowitz, it is been a while.
Hey, Janine. How are Tom and the kids?
Fine. You must be Dr. Hofstadter.
Yes, but I think this is all a big misunderstanding.
Yeah, yeah, me, too. I did not do anything.
Is that alcohol on your breath?
Howard built a sex robot.
That is not true. All I did was build a robot.
Did it have six breasts?
I am sorry, I am a feminist, I do not notice things like how many breasts a robot has.
Well, hello.
What are you doing here?
Actually, I came to speak to Mrs. Davis.
And I am a little busy right now.
But I came to file a complaint. Somebody has made me feel uncomfortable in the workplace by using language of an inappropriate and sexual nature.
And who was that?
You, you dirty birdie. I-I thought about the things you said to me yesterday, and I realized I am deeply offended. Now, be a dear and get me one of those complaint forms.
That is it. All of you, in my office now!
And thanks to you, I know better than to ask if you are menstruating. And based on your behaviour, I do not have to.
Sheldon’s office.
It has been pointed out to me that some of the things I said to you could be construed as offensive, and I would like to offer you my sincerest apology.
Thank you, Dr. Cooper.
Yeah, additionally, you should know that the university has mandated that I take an online sexual harassment seminar so this sort of thing does not happen in the future.
Okay.
Yeah. Now, unfortunately, uh, my time is much too valuable to waste on nonsense like this, so, um, I am gonna need you to take it for me. Oh, and, uh, you’d better ace it, they are pretty mad.
The apartment.
So, hey, I was thinking about that stuff with Alex.
Oh, would you stop worrying about that?
I cannot help it. But, look, I figured I could sit around and feel insecure, or I could do something about it. So I got a course catalogue at school and looked at some of the science classes.
That is great.
No, it is not, they are extremely boring. I mean, how do you not kill yourself, like, every day? Anyway, I decided I do not need to be a scientist, I could just look like one. So I bought these.
Glasses? I really do not think that is gonna change… oh, my God, you look so smart and hot.
I know, right? Watch this. Molecules.
Okay, come with me.
Where are we going?
To my bedroom, so I can take everything off but those glasses. And maybe the boots.
The apartment. Sheldon is steaming a Star Trek uniform.
Hey, will you steam my uniform next?
Interesting. Do you recall this conversation? Leonard, want to go halfsies on a steamer? No, Sheldon, we do not need a steamer. Looks like that rumpled chicken’s come home to roost.
Hi. Here are the make-up sponges you asked for.
Oh, thanks, I thought I had more.
Damn, you have got more makeup than I do. You have got better makeup than I do. Yeah, I am borrowing this.
Hey, hey, hey, hey. This is my Comic-Con makeup. I love you, but there are some things a man does not share with his girlfriend.
That is a wise policy. I once borrowed my sister’s makeup for a costume contest. Got a terrible case of pinkeye. But luckily, I was going as a zombie. I won second place.
I feel like you guys just went to Comic-Con.
That was San Diego Comic-Con. This is Bakersfield Comic-Con.
Is that better?
Well, it is a lot smaller. It is more about the comic books. The way these conventions used to be before they went all Hollywood.
So to answer your question, no, it is not better.
Well, then why are you going?
It is a comic book convention. You know, it is like pizza or particle accelerators, even the stinky one’s still pretty good.
All right. Well, you guys have fun. I guess I will see you Sunday night.
Yeah.
Okay.
Oh, hang on a second. Hold this.
What was that for?
To show people when they do not believe me.
A restaurant.
Oh, this is the best. You have booze with breakfast on a Tuesday, you got a problem. You do it on the weekend, you got brunch.
Sheldon does not believe in brunch. He cannot stand being at a table where one person’s having an omelette and another person’s having a sandwich.
He is not exhausting at all.
Oh. It is Leonard. He says they are on the road and headed for Bakersfield at warp speed. Maybe it is the mimosa, but I am gonna give the kid an LOL.
It is cute how excited they are. You should have seen Howard sewing his costume all week for the convention.
When did Howard learn to sew?
When he was a little boy, every couple months, he would have to let his mom’s pants out.
I do not even understand why they go to these conventions.
I know. The four of them work at a major university. They are all super smart. How can they still be into something made for 12-year-olds?
I do not mind it. I think Howie’s just in touch with his inner child. Although when he comes to bed in his Batman pyjamas, sometimes it feels like I am touching his inner child.
It is probably because they were bullied growing up. In a world where you cannot fight back, superheroes provide meaningful wish-fulfillment.
Mmmm. Now I feel bad for picking on all those kids. Although, in my defence, if Danny Biffle did not want to eat a mouthful of dirt, he should not have shown up to school wearing a bow tie.
I have never even read a comic book. You guys?
Uh-uh.
No.
I mean, it is such an important part of their lives. Maybe we should try reading some.
Seriously?
The comic book store is not far from here.
That is an amazing idea. Okay, how many of these have I had?
Leonard’s car.
I think you should turn on the GPS.
It is on.
But the turn-by-turn voice option is not on. I know I’d feel more safe if you turn on the turn-by-turn voice option. I love the turn-by-turn voice option.

A hush falls over the crowd as Cooper studies the board. He makes his move. He is dividing both sides by I. He is adding back the coefficient. He has a value for P. He is plugging that back in. He takes the derivative, and he solves the equation. The crowd goes wild. Nobel! Nobel!

You are not sick. You just do not want to face Kripke.
No, look.
See?
What did you do, put this in your tea?

Sheldon Lee Cooper, I do not have time for this nonsense. Now, go put your clothes on, get in the car, and lets go to work.

Howard’s lab.

Cooper, we have a pwobwem. Your work is weawy not at a wevew I expected it to be.

At any point, did it dawn on you to talk to me about spending this kind of money?
It is kind of dawning on me now.
I do not believe you. Howie, we cannot afford to waste money on junk like this.
What are you talking about? We make plenty of money.
I make plenty of money. You make peanuts.
Yes, but we are married now. That means, when you get sick, I take care of you. And when you make a bunch of money, I get to buy stuff. Sorry if you do not like it, but that is how love works.
No, here’s how love works. You are gonna return the machine, or you can print out a working set of lady parts and sleep with those. Oh, my God! Are you actually thinking about it?
The apartment.
All right, I do not understand. Why did not you just tell Kripke the truth?
Because the truth made me look bad, whereas a ridiculous bald-faced lie makes me look good. Anyway, if Kripke asks, tell him my coitus with Amy is frequent, intense and whimsically inventive.
Is my coitus whimsically inventive?
That is what I write on the bathroom walls. For a whimsically inventive time, call Leonard Hofstadter.

Sheldon’s office.

Yes.

Yeah, tell me if this sounds familiar. You pay fifteen dollars to park, you stand on the pavement for an hour until you break down and give the bouncer twenty bucks to let you in. You push your way to the bar, where you drink an eighteen dollar cosmopolitan, then you stare at a pretty girl and imagine your perfect life together. Your children, grandchildren. Hello, I am Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Welcome to Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. My apologies that this episode is coming late. I did shoot one last week, in honour of Black History Month, but I was informed by my roommate that my spot-on portrayal of George Washington Carver could be considered wildly racist. My heart goes out to the members of the African-American community, who, like me, have been kept down by The Man. Now, Fun with Flags is not just for the flag aficionado, it is also for the flag novice, so, to help me with that, please welcome my friend, neighbour, and flag virgin, yeah, not a real virgin. She is had coitus many times. Sometimes within earshot of this flag enthusiast. Once while he was trying to watch The Incredibles. Penny.
Hello.

What is wrong?

Interesting. A few people in the comments section have said that my delivery is robotic. Perhaps that is not the compliment it sounds like.

Yeah, let’s try it again, and maybe, this time, you could work on your body language a bit. You know, when you are all hunched like that, you are shutting the audience out, but when you are relaxed and open, you are inviting them in.
Right. And which one do I want?
Let’s try open.

You are all wasting your time. Sheldon is the most qualified for the job, and no amount of gravity-defying bosom’s going to change that. Seriously, is that tape? Like, how are they staying up like that?

How about it, Sheldon?
What do you think I should do?
Well, you will always be an academic success, but I seriously question whether you will make any more friends.
I do not want any more, but let’s go.
Are you kidding? I would wove to baby-sit for you.
I could not ask you to do that.
Nonsense. Childwen wove me. Something about me just makes them waugh and waugh.

Should have taken my breasts out while I had the chance.

Raj’s office.

Just a little? That is great.

Penny’s apartment.

Ooh! Sorry, I thought you were gonna do that.

The love spell takes effect. When Sheldon looks at Amy, she is the most beautiful half-orc he is ever seen, and he is overcome with a desire to rip her armour off and gaze fondly at her four hairy breasts. When Amy sees Sheldon, he looks, well, just like Sheldon, ’cause apparently she is into that. What do you do?
I do not like this.
You see what happens when you let girls play D&D?
Sheldon’s bedroom.
Amy. Amy. Amy.
What?
I have never knocked on my own door before. That was a wild ride.
You do not have to come in here and cheer me up.
Thank you. Would you go tell everyone else that? Because they sure think otherwise.
I will tell you what they think. They think our relationship is a joke.
Well, I do not think our relationship is a joke. I think “a horse goes into a bar, bartender says, why the long face?’, that is a joke. It is a good one, too, because a horse has a long face.
Sheldon, are we ever going to have an intimate relationship?
Oh, my. That is an uncomfortable topic. Amy, before I met you, I never had any interest in being intimate with anyone.
And now?
And now what?
Do you have any interest now?
I have not ruled it out.
Wow. Talk dirty to me.
I know it does not seem like it to you, but, for me, what we have is extremely intimate.
I guess I know that. It is just, part of me wants more.
More? I mean, look at us. It is only been three years, here we are in bed together.
Come on. Let’s go back out there.
Well, no. Hold on. My Elven magic-user and your half-orc warrior did have a love spell cast on them. We would not really be playing the game right if we did not see that through.
Okay.
I believe that, uh, we just killed a dragon. While the others pillage the corpse, I lead you to a secluded area where I attempt to remove your leather armour. It comes off.
Oh.
What do you do?
I kiss you on the lips.
I kiss you back on the lips as well. Your turn.
I remove your armour. What do you do?
I erotically caress your nose.
Keep rolling.
Outside Sheldon’s bedroom.
Hey, you guys have been in there for a while. You doing okay?
We are fine, thank you.
Okay, we just want to say, we feel really bad about…
Go away! Sheldon is nibbling on my 14! Yes!
The cafeteria.
So, anyway, last night on video chat, I spent, like, twenty minutes just staring into Lucy’s eyes.
Oh, that sounds romantic.
It was until I realized the screen had frozen. Still one of my top three dates of all time.
So, are we ever gonna hang out with this girl?
I’d love that, but she is not really comfortable around people.
Yeah, I used to be uncomfortable around people, but then I learned a trick. I pretend everyone I meet is a beloved character from Star Trek.
How’s that been working for you?
Oh, like a charm, unnamed crewman in a red shirt.
Leonard, I may have gotten you a job.
I have a job.
Yes, he does. He caters to my every whim.

No, in a couple of weeks, Stephen Hawking’s team is sending an expedition to the North Sea to test hydrodynamic simulations of black holes. One of their experimental physicists dropped out, and I recommended you.
Well, do you really think I have a shot?
Yeah, I have worked with Hawking. I talked you up. He knows your research. I think this could happen.
He knows, wow.
Well, now, but do you think that is a good idea? Uh, you know Star Trek. Should a guy with no name and a red shirt really go on an expedition?
Hey, do not discourage him. This is a fantastic opportunity.
No one asked you, Uhura.
Leonard’s car.
Would you like to hear a classic Sheldon Cooper factoid?
What do you think?
Great. I have been doing some reading about vehicular safety. Did you know that the highest number of drowning accidents happen on or around boats?
Interesting that you would bring that up when I might go work on a boat.
Well, that is the thing about factoids, they are interesting.
I know what you are doing. You do not want me going on this research trip because you are afraid to be alone.
I am not afraid to be alone. On land. On the sea, it would be terrifying. Because of all the drowning.
Sheldon.
Fine, no more drowning talk. I will change the subject. Oh. Who do you think would win in a fight, you or a shark?
Look, I appreciate your signature blend of concern for me and incredible selfishness. If I get the chance to do this, there is nothing you can say that is going to stop me.
Very well. Things between you and Penny have never been better. I hope four months apart does not change anything. I should have opened with that, huh?
Raj’s apartment. Lucy is looking through Raj’s telescope.
If you look carefully at Venus, you should be able to see the International Space Station pass by.
Wow. Your friend was actually up there?
Yeah. He brought me back a T-shirt that said My Friend Went to the Space Station and All I Got Was This Lousy T-Shirt
Did he take the T-shirt to space?
Nope. It is exactly as lousy as advertised. Speaking of friends, they have been asking to meet you. I was thinking maybe we could all hang out sometime?
I do not know. How many are there?
Let’s see. Six. That is pretty cool, I have six friends. Kind of like Sinatra.
Six strangers? That is a lot of pressure. Staring at me, asking me personal questions. Like, what do you do? Where are you from? Why did you lock yourself in the bathroom?
Okay, how about you just dip your toe in and meet one of them?
Will you be there?
Of course.
Well, that is two. Three if you count me. Oh, this is getting out of hand.
Penny’s apartment.
So, then, during my afternoon shift, I spilled an entire tray of drinks on myself.
Oh, that is awful.
Not really. My shirt was soaking wet. I got, like, the biggest tip of my life.
So, listen, do you remember when I said the similarities of the equations of general relativity and hydrodynamics suggest you could find the equivalent of Unruh radiation in a large body of water?
I thought I said that to you.
Anyway, Stephen Hawking’s team is looking into that, and I have been invited to join them.
Wow, Hawking. Good for you.
Well, it is. Just, you know, I’d be gone for a while.
Well, how long?
Three, four months.
Whoa. When would you leave?
Couple of weeks.
Wow. Oh, okay, well, I will just come visit you.
That is the thing, you cannot. I will be on a ship in the North Sea.
On a ship? Are not they afraid Hawking will just roll overboard?
Uh, he is not gonna be there. He is just sending a team to research his theory.
Oh, sure. Like when you send me to kill spiders in your bathtub. Wow. Okay. Four months.
Yeah. And I am a little worried because things between us have been so great, and I’d hate to do anything that screws that up.

Oh, sweetie, if you are gonna screw things up, it is gonna be while you are here, not while you are away. No. I mean, look, you have to go. It sounds like an amazing opportunity. And I am just basing that on how much I did not understand what you said about it.
Okay. I will confirm the travel arrangements in the morning.
Okay. Good.
I do have to ask you one favour.
Sure.
Sheldon’s nervous about me leaving. Just keep an eye on him while I am gone.
Oh, I do not know. Remember what happened when I took care of your goldfish?
Well, flush Sheldon down the toilet and get me a new one.
The apartment.
Really, you guys do not need to throw me a going-away party.
Are you kidding me? How often can you say bon voyage to somebody when they are actually going on a voyage?
Hello, Rajesh.
Hello, Amy. Nice to see you. What can I say? It is funnier with the accent.
There is beer in the fridge. Anyway, you guys really do not need to make a big deal.
Leonard, you are being selfish. We need to give you a proper send-off so we will have closure when you die at sea and crabs eat your face.
Sheldon, sweetie, shut up.
You know, one of the things that helped me get through Howard being in space for so long was getting married before he left.
Bernadette, sweetie, shut up.
Okay. I have a request to make.
And now he can talk. I want to cut open your brain and see what the heck’s going on in there.
The only person allowed inside this head is Dr. Phil. Anyway, I, I spoke to my new lady friend about meeting you all, and she thought it would be easier for her to start with just one.
Oh, gee, I do not know. My schedule’s a little busy.
Actually, I was thinking Leonard.
Oh. Thank you, Raj. I’d be honoured.
What the hell? I thought I was your best friend.
You are, but you have got kind of a big personality, with your flashy clothes and your Woody Allen swagger.
You know, maybe she’d be more comfortable meeting a girl first.
Good idea. Bernadette?
What the hell?
Well, you are very pretty. That could be intimidating to another woman.
Oh, yeah.
Hey, you do not think I am pretty enough to scare your girlfriend?
Calm down, Bernie. You are very scary.
It should be me.
Why? So you can make jokes about cutting open my brain?

A, that was not a joke, that was a sincere request. And B, more importantly, I was the outsider to this group, and I know how frightening that can be. But you guys took me in and made me feel loved, like I was family.
Fine, I will do it.
Raj’s apartment.
So, after I started dating Sheldon, I met Leonard, and then everybody else, and they have all been so wonderful to me.
That is really nice to hear.
Maybe next week, we could all get together.
Oh, Lucy, you do not have to answer that. Do not put her on the spot. She hates that. Am I right? Tell her how much you hate being put on the spot. Go ahead, tell her.
Ignore him. He is a little nervous ’cause he does not think I understand the severity of your social anxiety.
What the? Are you crazy? You cannot talk about social anxiety to someone who has social anxiety. It makes them socially anxious!
Excuse me, but I am a neurobiologist. I think I am a little more qualified than you to understand what is not working in your girlfriend’s brain!

Do not call her my girlfriend. We have not discussed whether or not we are girlfriend or boyfriend yet. Now that it is out there, are you my girlfriend? By the way, if you say no, I will never be happy again. Not to put you on the spot.
I think I have to go to the bathroom.
We might as well go ahead and eat. She is not coming back anytime soon.
A store.
This is ridiculous, we are shopping for a party and this store does not even have a party section.
Yeah, it does, and here we are.
You know, I have to say, Penny, I do not understand why you of all people are encouraging Leonard to do this.
Well, I am his girlfriend, of course I am gonna support him.
Yeah, well, you are his girlfriend for now. You know, maybe you are not aware of this, but there is a rich tradition of men at sea finding comfort in each other’s arms and britches.
Honey, this is a big deal for Leonard, okay? He gets to work with Stephen Hawking. Who, by the way, will not be on the boat. I checked it out.

It is not that big of an opportunity. And even if Hawking’s theories are correct, all they prove is where the universe came from, why everything exists and what its ultimate end will be. I mean, me? I am interested in the big questions.
Oh, my God, Sheldon the genius is jealous of Leonard.
I am not jealous. I am just very unhappy that good things are happening for him and not happening for me.

Look, sweetie, this is a natural thing to feel, okay? But just because good things are happening to Leonard does not take anything away from you. You know what? Let me tell you a little story. Once there was a girl who worked at the Cheesecake Factory, and she was not very good at her job.
It was you.
It was not me. But she was also an actress, and we were both up for the same part in a toothpaste commercial. She got it. Look, I was so jealous. But instead of ripping out her fake blonde hair…
You ripped out your own fake blonde hair.
I, looked her in the eye, smiled and said, I am happy for you. Because that is what friends do.
They lie so they do not look petty.
Yeah.
How?
Like this. I am so happy for you.
Wow. No wonder you did not get that toothpaste commercial.
Raj’s apartment.
Hey.
Hi.
I want to apologize for Amy last night. She was completely out of line. Are you, are you not speaking to me or did the screen freeze again?
Amy was not the problem.
Okay. I know. It was me. I, I pushed too hard. I am sorry.
Thank you.
You know, I, I have been thinking that maybe meeting somebody one-on-one is too intense, so Friday night, my friends are having a party.
A party?
A little one. It is, it is a farewell for Leonard, so all the attention will be on him. If you wear something brown and sit on the couch, they will not even know you are there.
I am not sure.
Oh, please?
Raj.
Come on. Do not make me beg. And I am from India, so I know how to do it.
Okay.
Yeah, thank you! This means a lot to me. My friends are like my family. Unless you do not like them, in which case, they are dead to me.
The apartment.
So, have you ever spent a long time on a boat before?
Yeah.
Are you referring to the time we got stuck on the Small World ride at Disneyland?
Yeah.
I am proud of you, Leonard. Working out on the North Sea for months, that is really something.
I know. As far as science goes, this is the adventure of a lifetime.
Maybe your lifetime. I went to space.
It is not a competition.
You are right, you are right. I am really proud of you, and I am gonna miss you when you are gone. And space beats water.
Rajesh, I thought Lucy was coming.
She is. She is just running a little late. You know how it is, girls always fussing about their hair, their makeup. She will be here. Just give it a rest, okay?

Um, can I have your attention, everyone? That is, uh, B-flat, for those who do not have perfect pitch. I would like to propose a toast to my best friend, Dr. Leonard Hofstadter. He has been presented with a wonderful opportunity, and I could not be happier for him.
Thank you, Sheldon. That must have been very hard for you to say.
Well, I mean it. I am really happy for you. And that is how you get a toothpaste commercial. Cheers.
Cheers.
Cheers.
It was really nice of you to try to be happy for Leonard.
Thank you.
It must have killed you when I went to space.
Oh, no.
Buddy, you okay? Oh, man.
What is going on?
Uh, go ahead. Read it.
Raj, I cannot come to the party. This is all just too much for me. I do not think we should see each other any more. Sorry. Lucy.
Excuse me.
Raj, I am so sorry.
Me, too.
It did not kill me when you went to space. Monkeys went to space.
Penny’s car, outside the Airport.
Well, here we are.
Yep. I am really gonna miss you.
I am gonna miss you, too.
Penny, we are in the red zone. The white zone is for loading and unloading. We are breaking the law.
Okay, there is no space in the white zone, so…
Anyway, we can e-mail, and I think the phone connections are pretty good.
All right, you have to get out of the car right now. I am not going to jail for you.
Would you just relax?
Oh, I see a space in the white zone. Quick, circle the airport.
Did you bring enough inhalers?
Yeah.
And, uh, extra Dramamine? You remember what happened on It is a Small World.
I am covered.
Okay.
Oh, dear Lord, a police officer’s glancing in our direction. We have been made.
Calm down. I am getting out. I have something I want to give you.
Oh, Leonard.
It is just a heart-shaped locket with a picture of Leonard’s face in it. He got it at the mall on clearance. Now move, move, move.
I love you.
I love you, too.
Do not worry, Officer. They just love each other. We are not smuggling drugs.
Raj’s apartment.
Raj, it is Penny. Are you in there?
Hang on.
Hey. I am just coming back from the airport. I wanted to see how you are doing.
That is, that is very nice of you. Uh, come, come. Come on in.
Cannot stay long. I left Sheldon in the car with the window cracked open. He is gonna go through that activity book in, like, 30 seconds, so… Are you okay?
No.
Oh. I am so sorry.
No. It is my fault. You know, I finally found someone who was right for me, and I, I drove her away.
Oh, Raj.
Penny, I, I miss her already.
I know how you feel. I miss Leonard, too.
What is like, what is wrong with me? Why, why cannot I ever have love?
You will.
No, I, I will not. I am, I am unlovable.
That is just the booze talking.
No, it is not. I have not had a drink since last night.
You are talking to me.
I am. And now I am crying for a whole different reason!
Oh, me, too.
Penny’s apartment.
So I guess what I am saying is I get where Lucy’s coming from.
That is great. Do you want some wine?

Uh, no, water’s fine. Anyhow, I have been thinking about it a lot and, and I totally see why Lucy did what she did. I pushed too hard. But you know what? If I back off and give her enough space, maybe there is still a future for us. Yeah, the funny thing about life is that, you know, sometimes…
Does he ever shut up?

… but then it turns good again, and that means it is better than if it had never been bad for a while. I know that now, thing’s are not good, they are in fact very very bad but at least my heart is starting to heal. Slowly but surely. And oh how I cried. It was like a little, uh, thunderstorm on my face. But I am a man, okay? So I need to pull myself together, pick up a pen and get it all out in my journal. I mean, it is not all bad, right? Having my heart broken has allowed me to finally speak in front of you, so, you know, a silver lining….
Sheldon, it is not a great time, what do you want?
Hello to you, too. I am sorry, but this is important.
What is it?
Back to the Future II was in the Back to the Future III case, and Back to the Future III was, get this, in the Back to the Future II case.
So?
So, did you do that, or am I in the house with an intruder?
Sheldon, I got to go inside. It is getting rough out here.
You are dodging the question, I knew it was you. What was that?
What was what?
This is not a very good connection, but it sounded like someone just released a kraken.
Okay, I am hanging up now. You know there is no such thing as a k…
No!
Penny. Penny. Penny.
What is the matter?
Um, well, I was worried that you might be missing Leonard. And that might be causing you to have bad dreams, like the kind you’d get if you watched Clash of the Titans right before you went to bed.
Sweetie, did you have a bad dream?
To be honest, I did.
Aw.
Back to the Future II was in the Back to the Future III case. Leonard did it.
Good night.
No, wait. Perhaps I should sleep here so you do not miss Leonard as much, uh, ’cause you are being kind of a baby about it.
You know what? That would make me feel better. Thank you.
You are welcome. Good night.
I think you’d be pleased to hear that this morning in the parking garage I saw this oil stain on the ground that was shaped just like my ex-girlfriend, Lucy, and I did not get upset at all.
I am proud of you.
Well, you should be, ’cause she was looking good.
Dear Lord, you are an astronomer. Although you may have earthly woes, get your mind back on the stars. Gee, even the lowly dung beetle chooses to plot its course by using the Milky Way.
Is that true?

Everything I say is true. Now, of course, the dung beetle also enjoys eating faeces, living in faeces and making little balls out of faeces, so, you know, pick and choose which aspects of its lifestyle you want to embrace.
Come on, you can talk to girls now. It should not be hard for you to meet someone new.
How can I meet someone new when everywhere I look, I see Lucy’s face? Tell me you do not see her smile in the crust of this chicken pot pie.
Oh, will you stop it. Now, listen to me, there is a welcome party for incoming post-docs tonight. Go to it and meet someone who is not made of grease or pie.
You think you are so cool because your wife is a person?
Look, Bernie’s at a neuroscience conference with Amy, I will go with you.
You would do that for me?
Of course. You are my friend. I want you to be happy.
Thanks. Oh, Sheldon, since Amy’s out of town, would you like to join us?
I want you to be happy, too, but not enough to do anything about it.
Howie, stop. I cannot talk like that. Amy’s right here.
Sheldon, stop. For the last time, I will not bring home bed bugs.
The hotel’s nice. There is a pool, a gym, the bar looks like fun.
Because I looked in the bed, and there are no bugs.
Aw, I love you, too. If I do not talk to you before you go to sleep, I will meet you in dreamland.
Good night. No, I will not consider sleeping in my garment bag.
Penny, did you ever wonder how Starfleet captains…
No.
Well, now that I have piqued your interest, welcome to the exciting world of 3D chess.
Why do not you just admit you only want to play this game because you always play it with Leonard and you miss him?
You overestimate his significance in my life.
Mmm.

Do I miss how he makes a face on my toaster waffle with syrup? No. Do I miss the way he fixes the zipper on my jacket when it gets stuck? I do not think so. Do I miss how we say good night to each other through the walls of our bedroom using Morse code?
Okay, I get it, I get it. You are an emotionless robot.
Well, I try.
All right, let’s just get this stupid game over with.
Great. I will go first.
Okay.
By the way, how are you with zippers?
Why?
Well, I really need to go to the bathroom, and this one’s gone all cattywampus.
Wow, your work on jellyfish neural nets sounds so interesting.
It is. You can download my paper off the university server.
I will. You can download my paper on the Van Allen Belts from the university server as well.
I will.
All right.
How’d it go?
Well, if you like dry, factual statements interspersed with painful moments of silence, it was bananas.
Check it out. Mrs. Davis from Human Resources is here. She is probably on the lookout for sexual harassment.
Oh, great. There go my chances of being sexually harassed.
I heard her husband left her for a hot, young undergrad.
That is so much better than the old, ugly ones.
Mr. Wolowitz, Dr. Koothrappali.
Mrs. Davis, nice to see you.
You know, I recently read a fascinating article on infidelity among penguins.
Okay.
So if the fact that your husband left you makes you feel unattractive, just remember, penguins get cheated on, and they are adorable.
It was better when you could not talk to women.
I was thinking of going to the lecture on posterior cingulate cortex lesions in the formation of autobiographical memory.
Oh, brain lesions are fascinating. Unless they are yours, then they are a drag.
To the advancement of science.
And to the sick and dying who make it possible.
This is fun, we never really get to talk shop with Penny around. We usually just end up talking about boys.
Which is fine, but it is nice to mix it up with a little intellectual conversation.
From the two gentlemen at the bar.
Oh, my gosh, boys bought us drinks, boys bought us drinks. Thank you, thank you, thank you so much.
Be cool.
You be cool. Guys are hitting on us, and not just to get to Penny.
You are right. Thank you.
Ooh. Bad move.
Really? Why?
My queen can now take your rook from below.
So that means I lose, right? It is over?
If I make this move, but I will not because we are having too much fun.
Okay, let’s take a break.
We are all out of alcohol.
I was not going to get alcohol. Gosh, I wonder what Leonard’s doing right now. I miss him so much.

Well, if you’d like, we could call him. I mean that you could call him. As I have explained, the absence of my friends does not cause me pain. As rock and roll bad boy Paul Simon once said, I am a rock, I am an i-i-i-island.
I am calling him.
Oh, goodie, put him on speaker phone.
Excuse me, ladies, my pants are buzzing. North Sea, how can I kelp you?
Leonard?
Penny? Hey, it is Penny. Everybody say hi to Penny.
Hi, Penny!
Wow, it sounds like you are having a good time.
Best time of my life.
Is not it five thirty in the morning there?
Is it? Hey, everybody, it is five thirty in the morning!
Uh, okay, well, we were just calling you because we were missing you.
Iceberg!
Uh-oh, hang on.
Are you in danger?
No, it is a drinking game. Whenever we see an iceberg, we take a shot!
Berg! Berg! Berg! Berg! Berg! Berg!
Leonard, Leonard? I cannot believe we were missing that jerk.
You were.
So what happened? How’d it go?
It is fine. I thanked them again and let them know we are not available.
So I can drink this without having to give up the goodies?
Yes, it is all cool. Although, if you wanted to talk to one of them, no one would blame you.
And why would no one blame me?
I do not know what I am saying.
Well, it sounds like you are saying that I could do better than Sheldon.
Boy, these drinks are strong. Hoo, mama, I am gonna be huggin’ the toilet tonight.
No, tell me, I want to know what you meant by that.
I just meant that you are not married and your boyfriend’s kind of, Sheldon.
And your husband is extremely Howard. What is your point?
Sorry. I have no point. That was a stupid thing to say. Can we please just go back to having a nice time?
We could, but unfortunately my brain is lesion-free and I remember that rotten thing you just said about my sweet baboo.
Come on. I apologize. Can we please just let it go?
Sure.
Thanks.
Your husband’s weird and his clothes are ridiculous.
I cannot believe it. All this time I have been doing nothing but sit around and miss that guy. And you know what the worst part is?
That you are having to process your emotional pain without vodka?
No. Yeah. But you know what the second-worst part is? He does not miss me at all.
Allow me to comfort you. At least you have got your health.
Really? That, that is it? That is comforting?
Um, uh, in a hundred years, you will both be dead and it will not matter?
No. Come on, you are supposed to say, of course he misses you, the only reason he is partying is to cover up his pain.
Oh, no, I do not think that is true at all.
This is ridiculous. Why am I upset just because he is off having a good time?
Well, perhaps you are obsessively picturing him engaged in drunken coitus with another woman. Is that it? Did I get it right?
Okay, that, that is great. You can stop trying to make me feel better now.
Actually, I cannot. Before Leonard left, he made me promise that I’d take care of you.
He did?
Yes.
Oh, that is really sweet.
Plus, if I do a good job, he said he’d bring me back a sailor’s cap.
Well, now I miss him even more.
Well, if it is any consolation, I am sure Leonard’s tormented every moment he is away from your warm embrace and cherry lips.
Thanks.
Oh, seriously?
Uh, excuse me, Mrs. Davis?
What?
I’d like to apologize for being insensitive. And for possibly making penguins seem like jerks, because 99% of them are stand-up guys.
Forget about it.
You know, you, you and I, you and I have a lot in common.
Is that right?
Oh, yes, I, I too am in the throes of heartbreak. Okay, fine, I will tell you about it.
Here is a hot beverage to comfort you. It is in a to-go cup. Make of that what you will.
Come on. It is still early. Let’s do something.
Well, I have been toying around with an idea for 4D chess.
How about we just talk?
All right. In 4D chess…
No. Come on, let’s talk about our lives. Tell me something about you I do not know.
I own nine pairs of pants.
Okay, that, that is a good start, but I was thinking maybe something a little more personal.
I see. I own nine pairs of underpants.
How about I go first?
But I do not want to know how many underpants you own. Although, based on the floor of your bedroom, I’d say it is a thousand.

Okay, look, here’s something people do not know about me. When I first moved out to L.A., I did a topless scene in a low-budget horror movie about a killer gorilla. Ugh! After I did it, I felt so ashamed. Thankfully, that thing never came out.
I have seen that. Yeah. Serial Apeist. Howard found it online the day we met you.
Oh, God.
And it was literally the moment you walked out the door. But I see the type of personal revelations you are going for. Okay, here’s one I thought I’d take to the grave.
Okay.
Hmm. A while back, YouTube changed its user interface from a star-based rating system to a thumbs-up rating system. I tell people I am okay with it, but I am really not.
That is your big revelation?
Yes. Whew, I feel ten pounds lighter.
Okay, you know what? I give up. I am going to bed.
Here’s something else you do not know about me. You just hurt my feelings.
What did I do?
I opened up and shared something deeply upsetting to me, and you treated it as if it were nothing.
I, I did not think it was a big deal.
It is to me; that is the point.
Sheldon, you are right. I am really sorry. I should have known better.
Your apology is accepted.
Thank you. How about a hug?
How about a hearty handshake?
Come on.
Now I know how you felt getting mauled by that sex-crazed gorilla.
Good night.
Mm-hmm. It was rather flattering to have strangers send us drinks.
Yeah, that felt nice.
Maybe tomorrow morning we put on some hot pants and see if we can score us some free omelettes.
So, hypothetically, if, if we were to have gone with them, which one would you have picked?
I think I would have gone with the short one with the goofy haircut.
Oh, good, ’cause I liked the tall thin one. He seemed intelligent, kind of a loner, maybe a little sexually inexperienced, like I’d have to teach him a thing or two.
Not my guy. I caught him staring at my rack. It’d be nice to be with a man who wants to know what is underneath my cardigan. FYI, it is another cardigan.
Your short sexed-up guy kind of sounds like Howard.
Your brainy virgin kind of sounds like Sheldon.
Good night.
All right, Dr. Koothrappali, it is been nice talking to you, but I need to go home and relieve my babysitter.
Yeah, I can relate to being a single parent. I have a dog.
Yeah, it is exactly the same thing. Good night.

Mrs. Davis, I, uh, I must confess, I came here tonight in a futile attempt to pick up some lonely postdoc, but instead I got to connect with you at a human level. That is a much better evening. You are a lovely person.
Are you hitting on me?
No, no, no, that would be crazy. I mean, if I were hitting on you, you’d know it ’cause you’d feel uncomfortable and a little sad for me.
You are sweet. Good night, Dr. Koothrappali.
Good night.
Looks like she accepted your apology.
And then some. I think we had a moment.
Oh, please, you did not have a moment.
Who died and made you king of moments?
Okay, fine. Let’s say there was a moment.
There was.
There was not. But, but even if there was, what are you gonna do about it?
I will slowly seduce her until she falls helpless into my bed, hungry for the pleasure only I can give her.
So nothing.
No, not a thing.
Ah, I am so glad the police finally caught that psychotic genetically engineered ape.
That is my girlfriend. I swear to God.
Leonard! Leonard! Leonard! Leonard!
Aaaaaaah!
And here’s another interesting weather fact.
Another? Great.
Changes in jet streams can affect the speed at which the Earth rotates on its axis, so bad weather can actually make the day longer.
Well, there must be a hell of a storm somewhere.
Joke if you must, but you are going to miss these moments. With Leonard home in a few days, this was your last time driving me to the grocery store.
You know, I will miss this.

I will tell you what, if my apples are mealy, we will hit the produce section for one last crazy blowout. Heck, you can even push the cart. Please do not take my looking forward to Leonard’s return as criticism of the job you have been doing in his absence.
I will not.
That criticism will come later in your report card.
Yeah, I did not stay for the detention, I am not gonna read the report card.
Hello.
Leonard! Hi!
Keep your voice down.
Oh, my God. You were not supposed to be here till Sunday.
We finished the experiment early, so I thought I’d come home and surprise you.
Oh, my gosh, why are we whispering?
I did not tell Sheldon, so we could have a few days alone.
Oh, that is so romantic.
Uh, sure, that is why I did it.
Oh, I just cannot believe you are here.
Penny, it is your lucky day. Three of the eggs are clearly not jumbo. Grab your keys.
Uh, Stuart, I was wondering if you could help me find something.
Happy to, unless it is hope or a reason to live.

Oh, you make me laugh, sad clown. Anyhoo, Leonard will be back in a couple days and I need a welcome home gift for him. As he is been at sea, perhaps something with a nautical theme might be appropriate.
Okay, well, I do not know how much you want to spend, but I do have this pretty cool Aquaman statue.
Aquaman? Oh, this is not a gag gift, Stuart.
Yeah, just as well. It is a pretty rare piece. I’d rather just sell it to a real collector.
I am a real collector. How rare is it?
Oh, I should not even have mentioned it. How about a Batman squirt gun?
Do not try and trick me into buying something I do not want. Now let’s talk Aquaman.
What were they thinking, putting Doctor Octopus’s mind in Spider-Man’s body?
Well, I have been quite enjoying that. It combines all the superhero fun of Spider-Man with all the body-switching shenanigans of Freaky Friday. Both versions, original and Lohan.
Both versions: original and Lohan. You are an idiot.
Hey, what is your problem?
I am sorry, I have been kind of snippy lately. It is probably this stupid diet I am on.
Why are you on a diet?
I have put on a couple pounds. Had to buy these pants in the men’s section.
Well, we have all seen your mom. That Butterball turkey was bound to come home to roost.
Twelve hundred dollars. That is my final offer.
All right, Sheldon, you win. I am sure Leonard is gonna love this.
Oh, right, a present for Leonard. You better throw in that squirt gun.
Ooh, yeah, I do not know. This squirt gun, it is, uh, it is pretty rare.
Oh.
And this is me doing the Titanic pose on the boat.
Ah.
And, oh, that is me getting rescued after I fell in.
Oh. Oh, that is the pizza.
Yep. Here’s some money.
Thank you.
And I am gonna hit the head. That is what us salty sea dogs say when we have to go pee-pee.
Hey.
Twenty-two fifty.
Okay, here’s, uh, twenty-five. Keep the change.
Seriously? I just walked up, like, four flights of stairs.
Oh. Okay. Well, here’s, um, thirty something cents and a promise I will not call your boss and tell him you reek of marijuana.
Oh, Penny, I see you have ordered pizza. I have Chinese food.
That is nice.
Oh, that is a rather earthy cologne. My uncle used to wear that. Perhaps we can enjoy one last meal together before Leonard returns.
Yeah, thanks, but I kind of feel like eating alone tonight, so…

Are you sure? With your Italian pizza and my Chinese noodles, we could play Marco Polo. I mean, of course, a re-enactment of a meal in the life of Marco Polo the Venetian explorer, not Marco Polo the terrifying water sport.
Uh, yeah, it sounds fun, but no thanks. Have a good night!
What, now, do you have company?
No. No, no, no. You know what? The toilet’s been doing that. I called the building manager, so…
Oh, I can take a look at it.
Well…
I am quite familiar with plumbing. Not to brag, but I spent most of fifth grade with my head in a toilet.
Yeah, no, no, no. You know what, Sheldon, it is okay. You do not have to go into the bathroom.
That is curious. If there is no one here, why are there two glasses of wine on the table?
Oh. Well, you know, I, I have got two hands and a bit of a drinking problem.
Of course. Ask a silly question.
Oh.
That is odd.
Um, what?
There are takeout containers in the trash can.
So? That is my dinner from last night.
What is odd is they are in the trash can.
Okay. Look, honey, I promise there is no one’s here. ‘ve had a long day. I just want to have a quiet dinner by myself.
Oh, very well. I am no stranger to enjoying the pleasures of solitude. Oh!
What?
Have you gotten Leonard a welcome-home gift yet?
No.
Oh, great. Do you want to go halfsies on a two hundred dollar squirt gun?
Hi, honey.
Hey.
I made some brownies. You want one?
You are kidding, right? I mean, you know I am trying to lose weight. God, I thought we were partners in this marriage.
We are. Stop it. And for the last time, you are not fat.
Really? Tell that to the bathroom scale, ’cause one of you is lying.
Fine, forget I asked. How was dinner at your mom’s?
Awful. I had to rub her ointment all over her again.
Why cannot she do it?

‘Cause we have got a deeply unhealthy relationship. Which reminds me, do you think you can get any samples of this from work? This was supposed to last her a month, but they did not take into account the square footage of her back.
Let me see. How long have you been putting this on her?
I do not know. Few weeks. Why?
This is really strong oestrogen cream. Please tell me you have been wearing gloves.
Like these swollen sausages could fit in gloves.
Howie, the oestrogen’s getting absorbed by your skin. That is why you have been all bloated and moody and a giant pain in the ass.
You are full of oestrogen and you do not act like that.
That is ’cause I am a woman. I have had years of practice riding the dragon.
Fine. I will wear gloves next time.
It is still gonna take a few weeks for the hormones to leave your system.
I feel so stupid. And fat.
It is okay. You still look great to me. In fact, why do not we go in the bedroom and I will prove it to you?
Sex? Really? I mean, that is just your solution to everything.

Oh, and here’s a fun thing. I worked it out so that there are two different words for spoon, planko and janko. Planko is a spoon with food, janko is a spoon without food. Janko is spelled with a silent ptang. Sheldon, you are not even listening to the rules of my made-up language.
Yes, I am.
Then what does tweepadock mean?
Uh, elephant?
Lucky guess.
I am sorry. I am just distracted by something that happened over at Penny’s.
What happened?
I fear Penny is being unfaithful to Leonard.
What?
She claimed to be alone when there was obviously someone else in her apartment. I have no choice but to assume the worst, given Leonard’s lengthy sea voyage and her famously ravenous nether regions.
I do not think Penny would cheat on Leonard.
Oh, really? She and I once had a staring contest. She clapped really loud and made me blink. It is a small leap from there to sexual infidelity.
You are being ridiculous.
Amy, there were Chinese food containers in the trash can.
Poor Leonard.
Do you hear anything?
I hear a woman’s voice.
Is it Penny?
No, it is you. All right, I hear whispering and giggling. Now I think I hear kissing.
Yeah, like you know what kissing sounds like.
There is kissing in Star Trek, smarty-pants.
Let me listen. Sounds like Leonard.
Please. Why would Leonard come home early and waste his time kissing Penny when he could be hanging out with his best buddy? Yeah, that is it. I am catching her in the act.
No, Sheldon, do not.
Aha.
What the hell?
Leonard?
Sheldon, you cannot just barge in here like that.
Right. Penny. Penny. Penny. Are you going to answer the door or should I open it and say aha again?
I am sorry, Sheldon. I should have told you I was back. I just wanted to have a couple days alone with Penny.
Oh, no, I should apologize. Uh, I never realized to what extent our friendship was a burden to you.
That is not fair. I complain about what a burden it is at least once a month.
Oh, no, no, let’s not sugarcoat this. You find me finicky, pedantic and annoying.
No, he does not.
I actually have used those exact words before. In that order.
Well, Leonard, I think it is high time you and I address the tweepadock in the room.
The what?
Amy?
Please leave me out of this.
Fine. Leonard, there is no need for you to pretend to like me anymore.
Come on, I said I was sorry.
No, no, you save your apologies for after you have had disappointing coitus with Penny.
It was fine.
Come on, this is silly. Hey, um, I brought you back a little present from my trip, huh? It is that sailor cap that you wanted. It is neat, huh?
You honestly think you can buy back my friendship with a cheap souvenir?
I do not. I really do not. Just try it on. Oh, yeah.
Hello, sailor.
Ooh, now we are talking.
Excuse me. This changes nothing. Except the Halloween costume I am wearing this year. Amy, you are going to be Olive Oyl. Lay off the doughnuts.
Thanks for coming over.
No problem. Ooh, you made little sandwiches.
Yeah, that is cucumber and cream cheese. That is turkey and loganberry. And do not tell my hips, but I am warming up a brie in the oven.
Nice. So, mmm. What is up?
Okay, well, I have been reading up on all the side effects you can get from oestrogen, and, I need you to be honest with me. Do my boobs look bigger to you?
Well, it is kind of hard to tell.
Come on, Raj, it is a yes or no question.
I am not sure. Um, wait. Jump up and down, let’s see if they jiggle. Uh, no, I, I still cannot tell, uh, oh, you know what? Okay, uh, give me some of this.
Seriously?
Do you want my help or not?
Fine.
Okay, yup. See, see, that, that looks like, that looks like they could be bigger. But you know, I bet, I bet when I do it, mine do the same thing.
Yeah, they kind of do.
Hmm. Uh, let me see something.
Hey, easy, my nipples are sensitive.
Oh. Sorry, sorry, uh, okay. I mean, yeah, maybe.
Okay, let me feel. No, I am definitely up a cup size.
You know, but, but they are very firm, so you have got that going for you.
You think?
Yeah, yeah, yeah, very perky.
Thank you. I really needed to hear that today. Ooh, brie’s ready.
Yay.
Good morning.
Hello.
So am I driving you to work or are you still mad at me?
I’d like a ride. Assuming you actually do take me to work.
Where do you think I would take you?

Who knows? Uh, you said you’d be home yesterday, but you came home three days ago. You say you are taking me to work, but for all I know, I will end up in a deserted amusement park. Or a cornfield maze. Or a back alley dog fight. You tell me.
I am going to work. You can come if you want.
Okay. By the way, you have something on your shirt.
No, I do not.
Hurts, does not it? You know, I find myself wondering if anything you have ever told me is true.
I did not make it back. The ship sank, I am in hell.
You say you are from New Jersey, but how can I believe you?
Why would anyone claim to be from New Jersey if they were not?
All right, I will give you that one.
Hey, I said I was sorry. What else do you want from me?
I want you to admit that what you did was wrong.
Fine. What I did was wrong.
I wish I could believe you.
You know what? I am not driving you to work, because you are incredibly annoying.
You say one thing and do the other, so then you are driving me and you find me a delight.
Stop it.
Keep it up?
Bye.
Hello. So I guess you are really holding up the other four fingers?
Oh, hey, what are you doing here so early?
Driving Sheldon to work.
He is still mad at Leonard, huh?
Well, he is mad at you, too. He says you are the succubus who led his friend astray.
I do not know what succubus is, but it has suck in it, so that cannot be good.
Thought I heard you out here.
Hey, Sheldon.
You do not get a hey. You get a hmm.
Come on, do not be like that. We had so much fun together the last couple of months.
You are right. Which makes your betrayal all the more devastating.
Sheldon.
I let you buy feminine hygiene products with my supermarket club card. You have any idea the kind of coupons I am going to get in the mail now?
Sheldon, your fight’s with Leonard. Penny’s got nothing to do…
Careful, Amy. The friend of my enemy’s girlfriend is my enemy.
Really?
Yes. You are either with me or against me.
You want to take the bus to work?
Maybe there is a third option.
FYI, I had a doughnut for breakfast, you jerk.
So now we are just waiting for the data from the ship to be crunched, but the numbers look pretty promising.
That is so great. If you guys prove the existence of Unruh radiation… Hey, hey, hey, hey. My eyes are up here.
Howard, Raj. Judas.
You know what? You are a crazy person.
A crazy person with a long memory, and if all goes according to plan, a robot army.
Stop it.
Or a mutant army. It depends on how my Kickstarter goes.

I said, stop it. Now, listen to me. You two are not just friends. You are best friends. And that is a beautiful thing. I mean, Leonard, you know why he is so mad at you? It is ’cause he missed you. Yeah, and as his friend, you should be happy he has love in his life. As I do. This man held my breast the other day and I love him for it.
A little loud, dude.
So, can we please put aside these petty differences and just be glad we are here together?
Okay.
I suppose so.
Thank you.
Uh, it was not anything weird. It was just to see how big they were.
And then Leonard took me to the barber and the dentist, and then to cap off the perfect day, the Los Angeles Bureau of Weights and Measures.
I thought the measures were going to be the stars of the show, turns out it was the weights.
I am so glad you guys are friends again.
And I am glad you and I are friends again, too.
Aw.
Which reminds me. This came in the mail, and I want you to have it.
Fifty cents off Vagisil.
Think of me when you apply it.
Uh, can I just say, I have missed all of us hanging out together.
Yeah.
Me, too.
Um, since when can Koothrappali talk in front of the girls without a beer?
Oh, that happened right after you left.
And no one told me?
Cannot believe we forgot to tell him.
Think of Sheldon when you apply it.
So, could not help but notice none of you RSVP’d to my murder mystery dinner party.
Oh, yeah. We were meaning to do that.
No, you were not because it was a week ago and nobody came. So, if you want to solve the mystery of who stabbed Koothrappali in the back with the weapon of indifference, it was all of you.
I do not think thatqualifies as a mystery, we all knew what we were doing.
We are sorry, Rajesh.
Maybe we can do it next week.
Whoa, whoa, we are not that sorry.
Do not worry, I can take a hint. No more murder mystery parties.
Great.
Thank you.
Hallelujah.
Because I have got something even better planned.
Aw.
Why?
Come on.
Just hear me out. I am going to make you guys a scavenger hunt like they have at M.I.T.
Oh, I loved those. I did them every year there.
We did them at Princeton, too.
Oh, that is cute. Like it is a real college.
That is amusing, I was going to say that about M.I.T., but it works for Princeton, too.
Scavenger hunts at Harvard were really tough. I always got stuck on the first challenge, trying to find someone to be on a team with me. I guess that story’s more sad than funny.
I love scavenger hunts. My friends and I had them all the time.
Oh, these are a little different. There is a tradition at elite universities…
And Princeton.
A tradition of hunts full of puzzles that rely on logic and obscure knowledge, science.
Oh, in ours we would just run around town looking for a store that would sell us beer.
So, uh, who’s in?
I think it sounds fun.
Yeah, me, too.
I am in, let’s do it.
I am sorry. Are we really doing this or are we tricking Koothrappali again like with the dinner party?
What is all this?
Oh, everything I could possibly need to win the scavenger hunt.
You really think he is gonna send us to a bowling alley?
Well, if he does, do you know how filthy those rental balls are? They might as well stand on the corner and give away free rectal exams.
Okay, everybody. Who’s ready for a scavenger hunt?
He is a born showman.
Any questions?
Yes, to be fair, do people who went to Princeton get a head start?
It is not funny.
No, Oh, it actually is if you get the joke. It is based on the premise that Princeton is not a very good school.
Ha-ha.
Oh, see? Now he gets it.
Okay, guys, go ahead and divide yourselves into teams of two.
Should we just do couples?
Couples sounds great. Or we could mix things up. Maybe pick names out of a hat. Whatever.
Whoa, whoa, whoa. Why do not you just admit you do not want to be on a team with me.
I just said, couples sound great.
Mm-hmm, yeah, you do not think I am smart enough. You think I am gonna be a liability. Even though I totally just used the word liability correctly in a sentence. Yeah.
All right, let’s, let’s do couples. I want to.
No, no. Let’s mix things up. I choose Sheldon, and we are gonna kick your ass!
Really? The only time I am ever picked first for a team and I am stuck with the liability?
Stop that. Penny is not a liability.
Thank you. Do you want to be on my team?
Maybe we pick names out of a hat.
All right, hurry up and close the door so they cannot hear us. Would you stop pouting? So, you picked my name. Get over it.
Yes, and do you know what the odds are I’d pick your name?
No.
It is not hard, one in five. Now you know why I am pouting.
What are you doing? You have to start with the edges.
Well, there is no right way, Sheldon. I already found a few pieces that fit.
Yeah, well, take them apart and start with the edges. And stop wasting time.
Wow, you are really good at puzzles.
I did them all the time as a kid. As my mom used to say, when you are doing a puzzle, it is like having a thousand friends. She was full of fun lies like that.
If it makes you feel any better, my mom’s just full of pound cake.
I am sorry you got stuck with me. I bet you wanted to be with Bernadette.
Have you ever played a game with Bernadette?
No.
Have you ever gone into a steel cage with a wolverine?
Faster, faster, faster! Do you not know that word? It means more fast!
Stop yelling at me.
Hey, you will know when I am yelling at you.
Ooh, ooh, it is the comic book store. All right, come on, that is where we have to go.
But we have not finished the puzzle.
But, it, it does not matter. We know the answer, come on.
You think you know the answer. But it could be a trick. What if when the puzzle’s complete, there is a sign in the window that says go to the train store?
Okay, it is not gonna say that.
Well, I hope you are wrong. I really want to go to the train store.
It is the comic book store. Let’s go.
Come on, numb nuts, it is the comic book store.
It is the comic book store, it is the comic book store, it is the comic book store.
It is the comic book store.
Do you think Penny’s mad at me?
Because you are in the right lane behind a bus and you will not go around it? I am sure she finds it charming.
No, because I did not want her on my team.
I am starting to think she dodged a bullet. The slowest bullet in the world.
Geez, I never realized you were so competitive.
Yeah, I know. Its, it is probably because I grew up with five brothers and sisters so I had to fight for every… Oh, my God, you did not just slow down for a bird, you know they fly, right?
I think this is the first time we have ever actually been alone together.
Huh, I guess you are right. Wonder why that is?
Well, off the top of my head, I’d say we do not have a lot in common except for the people we are involved with. Plus, when we first met, Penny warned me never to get into a car alone with you.
Yeah. You know, I bet you and I have more in common than we think.
Such as?
I do not know. Tell me some things you like.
Uh, let’s see. I like harps, Little House on the Prairie, medieval poetry, medieval literature…
Hey, how about some music?
Great. Sheldon never lets me listen to music in the car. He does not want to be mistaken for a gang member.
Find something you like.
Beatles, boring. Eminem, scary. Weird Al? How old are you? Neil Diamond?
Yeah, I love Neil Diamond.
I love Neil Diamond.
Sweet Caroline, bum-ba-da, good times never seemed so good, so good, so good, so good. I have been inclined…
Oh, hey, thanks for letting me use the comic book store as part of the scavenger hunt.
Oh, my pleasure. Always happy to help out with fun things that I was not invited to be a part of.
Oh, congratulations. You are the first team to arrive.
Yes, it is not a ruse to make fun of me. It is a real game and I am winning it.
Your next puzzle is a riddle. And who better to give it to you than The Riddler?
Go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go! How am I faster than you? I am in heels and I stopped to take a phone call.
I have asthma. Back off.
Riddle me this. Arrah, Arrah, and gather round, the work of this hero is legion-bound. He multiplies N by the number of He, and in this room the thing you will see.
Good riddle, huh?
Yeah. So when you guys plan fun activities, does my name even come up, or…?
I invited you to my murder mystery party.
No, you did not.
Oh.
Ugh, we are the last ones here, hurry up.
It is a marathon, not a sprint.
People run in a marathon.
Not with a bowling ball on their back.
Hey, Penny, I just wanted to say good luck, and I hope there is no hard feelings.
Hey, Romeo. Repair your relationship on your own time.
Relax, it is a hard puzzle. It is gonna take a while to solve.
Riddle me this…
Got it.
Hey, Princeton, look at that, Team Community College Night School is in the lead.
I thought we were the Lightning Sharks.
Hey, you know what this could mean
Oh, oh, that is good. Then this would be
That is it.
To the Neil Mobile.
I knew it, we are gonna lose.
Wait, I got it. I got it/
Congratulations, you got it last.
You are really mean, you know that?
So no one’s gonna buy anything.
Aha. Okay, let’s see. To continue on your quest, leave no stone unturned. Ooh.
The next clue must be hidden under one of these rocks.
Oh. Okay. Sheldon, I, I have got to ask, how did you figure out that it was the geology lab?

Oh, simple, the ‘arrah, ‘arrah in the riddle mean Jan Arrah, a member of the Legion of Superheroes, known as Element Lad. And then the word He, it was not the masculine pronoun, but rather H e, the abbreviation for helium. See where I am going with this?
Yes.

Nice try. Now, Element Lad’s ability is the power to transmute chemical elements. Helium has an atomic number of two. If you multiply that by the atomic number of N, nitrogen, you get 14, which is the atomic number of? I am just funnin’ you, silicon. And that is the most common element in the Earth’s surface. So that narrowed it down to the geology lab or the chemistry lab.
Wow. I can drink a beer underwater.
And I am sure your parents are proud. Now, finally, the line in this room the thing you will see was an obvious reference to Fantastic Four member The Thing, who’s made entirely of…
Shut up. I solved it.
Those are map coordinates. Got ’em. Let’s go.
Well, wait. Do not you want to know how I figured it out?
No one likes a know-it-all, Penny.
On the boats and on the planes.
They are coming to America.
Never looking back again.
They are coming to America… ♪
Um, I am okay with you driving my car. I am not okay with you flying my car.
Do not sweat it, my dad’s a cop. He can fix things.
Uh-huh. Like death?
Penny’s not answering my texts.
Who cares? Focus on the game.
This stupid game is why she is mad in the first place. I am telling her I am quitting.
No. Quitting would be the worst thing for your relationship.
Why?
Because it would make you seem like something she already thinks you are.
What does she think I am?
How do I put this? She is been known to call you a name that usually applies to a lady part. Or a cat. Or a willow.
I cannot believe she would say that about me.
If you are gonna cry about it there is tissues in my purse. Unless you got some in yours. Big willow.
They are coming to America, They are coming to America.
Today!
Today!
Today! Today!
Okay, another 30 feet.
Okay. Oh, it is a bowling alley.
Yes. Yes. My brain is better than everybody’s.
Love on the rocks.
Ai not no big surprise.
Just pour me a drink.
And I will tell you some lies.
Call me a lady part. We will see about that.
Can you reach the clue?
Almost.
Hurry, Sheldon and Penny were right behind us in the bowling alley.
Got it.
Great, climb back up. Come on.
Yeah, Penny might be onto something.
To the planetarium.
Let’s go.
To the tar pits.
Let’s go.
There is a Neil Diamond concert next month.
Let’s go.
Three bags, no one’s opened ’em. we are the first ones here.
It is dirty laundry. You are up.
What? Why me?
Because you have been training for this your whole life. You live in a pile of dirty laundry.
They are here first. This is because you made me slow down for that blind guy.
Okay, the clue must be in the bag.
The clue must be in the bag.
It is just a bunch of pants.
It is just a bunch of pants.
You know, I am surprised you want to copy my answers since I am not even smart enough to be on your team.
Well, why would you want to be on someone’s team who you like to call a, I cannot even say it in front of Sheldon.
What are you talking about?
You know exactly what I am talking about.
No, she does not. I just made that up.
Why would you do that?
Because you were about to quit like a big, Sheldon, cover your ears.
I am not a child. I know the word ninny.
Yeah, well, you should have quit ’cause I am still gonna beat your ass.
Wish I had a man like her on my team.
Hey, I am every bit as much of a man as Penny. Now, let’s do this.
Wait, it is not all pants, there is one shirt.
Oh.
Hey, that is my shirt.
This one is, too.
No, no, that is not mine. It has a big spot on it.
But wait. So does this one.
Maybe the spot’s the clue.
Sheldon’s spot. The coin is in your spot.
Oh, that is clever.
Be there in a minute. I just have to pre-soak these.
Stop her, Leonard, stop her.
Well, where the hell’s the coin?
Was not the answer Sheldon’s spot?
Oh, yes, Leonard. Yes, it was.
Then where’s the coin?
Yes, exactly. Where is the coin? Why do not you look in your pockets? I slipped them in there earlier today.
I do not get it.
Do not you see? When we are all having fun together, we are already winners. Oh, look. See? Even I am a winner.
Are you kidding me?
That is the stupidest thing I have ever heard.
You suck so hard.
Well, I thought… Come on, I did not want anyone to feel bad at the end of the game. And some of those puzzles were really hard and I did not know who was gonna get Penny.
Run.
Okay, okay, that-that came out wrong, but you have to admit, you all had a wonderful time.
Run to India.
I just wanted to do something beautiful.
Hey, she got the way to move me, Cherry,
She got the way to groove me.
Cherry, baby
She got the way to move me, honey.
She got the way to groove me. She got the way to move me.
Cherry
She got the way to groove me, yeah!
So what’d you think?
It was good.
That is it? Good”
I enjoyed it. When you told me I was going to be losing my virginity, I did not think you meant showing me Raiders of the Lost Ark for the first time.
My apologies. I chose my words poorly. I should have said you were about to have your world rocked on my couch. Anyway, thank you for watching it. It is one of my all-time favourites.
It was very entertaining despite the glaring story problem.

Story problem? You, oh, Amy, what a dewy-eyed moon-calf you are. Raiders of the Lost Ark is the love child of Steven Spielberg and George Lucas, two of the most gifted filmmakers of our generation. I have watched it 36 times, except for the snake scene and the face-melting scene, which I can only watch when it is still light out, but, I defy you to find a story problem. Here’s my jaw, drop it.
All right. Indiana Jones plays no role in the outcome of the story. If he were not in the film, it would turn out exactly the same.
Oh, I see your confusion. You do not understand. Indiana Jones was the one in the hat with the whip.
No, I do, and if he were not in the movie, the Nazis would have still found the ark, taken it to the island, opened it up and all died, just like they did. Let me close that for ya.
Hey.
Hi. I thought you went to the comic book store on Wednesdays.
Yeah, but Sheldon and Amy were having date night and they do not need me there to make it awkward. They have each other for that. So, how was school?
Oh, good. Check it out, The Disappointing Child by Beverly Hofstadter.
You bought my mom’s book?
Yeah. It is on the recommended reading list for my psychology class.
Oh, come on. Not that book. It, it is got, like, every horrible story from my childhood in it.
Oh, cool. Are there pictures?
Seriously, please find another book.
Oh, come on. Why? How bad could it be?

There, there is chapters about potty training, and bed-wetting and masturbation. Basically, if something came out of me, she wrote about it. You know what? Do whatever you want, just do not talk to me about it.
Not even the chapter on the breast-feeding crisis?
It was not a crisis. Apparently, I favoured the left one, she got a little lopsided.
Oh, my God, you still go left.
Which celebrity would you say I look like the most?
Halle Berry. Why?
Stuart and I are putting dating profiles online, and it is one of the questions. And thank you, I’d kill for that woman’s bone structure.
Why are you reading Pride and Prejudice?
I will tell you why. Amy ruined Raiders of the Lost Ark for me, so now I am trying to find something beloved to her and ruin that.
Because her life was not enough?
Wait, how can, how can anyone ruin Raiders? It is perfect.
Yeah, except for the fact that Indiana Jones is completely irrelevant to the story. With or without him, the Nazis find the ark, open it and die.
Aw!
Hey, wait a minute. No, the Nazis were digging in the wrong place. The only reason they got the ark was because Indy found it first.
Actually, they were only digging in the wrong place because Indy had the medallion. Without him, they would have had the medallion and dug in the right place.
Aw!
Okay, I know you do not want to talk about it, but can I just ask you one question about your mom’s book?
No.
I just want to know why a five-year-old boy puts on his mom’s make-up and wears balloon boobies.
They were not boobies, they were muscles. And the make-up was green. I was pretending to be The Hulk.
You were wearing her bra.
That was to keep my muscles from sagging. Can we please stop talking about this?
Okay, okay. But you know, as a student of psychology who got a check-plus on her first homework assignment, I think, sometimes, it is good to open up about these things.
Okay, fine. Do you want to know why I dressed like The Hulk? Because I was always mad at my mom and I wanted to smash my way out of that house.
Well, why were you so angry?

Gee, I do not know. Maybe it is because I was always the subject of her little experiments. Did you get to the chapter where she staged the Easter egg hunt with no eggs to see how long I’d keep looking? The answer, by the way, June.
Sweetie, I am so sorry. I wish there was something I could do to make you feel better.
I do, too, but there is not.
Really? Are you sure about that?
Of course, who am I to argue with a check-plus student? Just warning you, I am gonna go right. Do not make a big deal out of it.
Is make-up really necessary?

Well, when someone looks at your dating profile, the first thing they see is your picture. I just want to make sure you look fun and full of life and not like a body they just pulled out of the river. All right, here we go, and smile. Okay, uh-uh, that one’s in the bank. How about this? Turn away, and then turn back into it. But when you do, imagine the camera is the girl you want to meet.
You got it.
Okay, uh, let’s try it again. Uh, but this time, pretend the girl you want to meet does not want to hurt you.
I do not think I can give you that.
Come on. One more time. Yeah, it is, it is a little blurry, but I think that works in your favour. Do you want a beer?
Sure. Hey, have you finished writing your profile yet?
Almost. Oh, what did you put as the one-word description of yourself?
I put unobjectionable. But now that I hear it out loud, it just seems like I am being cocky. What did you put for your best feature?
My parents’ money. Uh, what did you put for your best feature?
I put: not applicable.
Come on, dude, you are being too hard on yourself. You have got a lot of good stuff going on.
Really? Like what?
Well, okay, you are a, you are a talented artist, you own your own business.
Neither of those things have ever helped me meet a woman.
Okay, well, can we imply that you are well-endowed?
I do have one oddly long testicle.
Okay, now you are talking like a winner!
Whatcha doin’?
Oh, it turns out Amy’s beloved Pride and Prejudice is a flawless masterpiece. He is got too much pride, she is got too much prejudice, it just works.
So you are looking to ruin something for her in the funny pages?
Amy has a fondness for the comic strip Marmaduke.
Mm-hmm. And?
And I think I have got it. Consider, a family possesses a dog that is so large and poorly disciplined, he causes nothing but problems. Why do they keep him?
Maybe they fell in love with him as a puppy and did not know how big he was gonna be.
