Of course. You know, why could not she just like Ziggy? Yeah? That thing’s riddled with plot holes.
Sorry, buddy.
Ooh, I think she is a fan of Garfield as well. Oh, darn it, now so am I.
I will see you later. I gotta go watch a stupid football game with Penny.
Wait, hang on. You have spent time with Amy. Can you think of anything she is fond of that has a bunch of flaws she has not noticed?
I gotta go.
You ready to go?
Yep. Hey, and maybe this time you do not try and talk sports with the guys.
Some sports bar. It is like they never even heard of Quidditch. Do we really have to go?
Oh, come on. Every time we are about to hang out with my friends, you do not want to. It is like, It is too loud, or the bathroom’s too dirty, or they put a chicken wing in my ear. I mean…
Well, you are, you are right. Let’s just go.
Hey, what is going on with you?
Nothing, I am fine.
All right, hang on. is this still about your mom’s book?
No. Not everything is about my mom.
‘Cause if you are still upset about that, we do not have to go.
Except this is totally about my mom.
I am so sorry. I never should have read that book. You know what? You want to just get dinner and watch the game here?
That sounds nice. Yeah.
Okay.
Or, you know, we could get take-out and watch the Blu-ray extended version of The Hobbit movie with commentary track. On account of how sad I am about my mom.
Leonard, you ready for lunch?
One sec. Hey. Sorry.
Hi, Penny.
Hi. All right, sweetie. You hang in there today.
I will try, but I might be sad again tonight.
Okay.
Wow. Sex at work?
Leave it alone. That is my girlfriend.
Sorry.
Who just had sex with me at work.
Damn. How’d you swing that?
Well, whenever I talk about how awful my mom was, Penny will do anything to make me feel better.
Seriously?
Look, I mean, I am not proud of it, but it does work. I got her to watch a six-part documentary on Monty Python. Even I was bored, I just wanted to see if she’d make it to the end.
You sound kind of proud of it.
I am, I am really proud.
Hello, Sheldon. Is everything okay?
Yes. Why?
Well, the last time you made an unscheduled video-chat, there was a curly fry in your regular fries and you thought someone might be trying to slip you a mickey.
April 13, a dark night, indeed.
So what can I do for you?
I am calling to invite you to a spontaneous date night tomorrow evening.
Really?

Yes. You were kind enough to watch Raiders of the Lost Ark with me. So I’d like to return the favour by inviting you to watch an episode of your favourite childhood television series, Little House on the Prairie.
That sounds lovely. Why are you rubbing your hands together?
Um, I am putting on lotion. Are you in or not?
Of course I am in.
Excellent. Then I shall see you tomorrow. Good night, Dr. Fowler.
Good night, Dr. Cooper.
Good night, indeed. What a rube. Why would I put on lotion when I have such soft hands?
You were really quiet during dinner. Is everything okay?
Yeah. I guess I was just thinking about my mom, and how sad my childhood was.
Yeah, I bet it sucked. I am gonna take a bath, you do the dishes.
How about I take a bath with you and see what happens.
Here’s what is gonna happen. I am gonna take a bath, and you are gonna do the dishes.
That is it? No compassion?
Aw, poor Howie. We good? I am gonna take a bath.
Bernie…
God, what is going on with you?
I am sharing my pain.
And I am not buying it. Try again.
I am learning to be a man in a culture where it is increasingly difficult to know how?
Strike two.
I am copying Leonard. When he does this to Penny, they have sex and watch Monty Python.
Howard.
I know. It was dumb, I should not have done it. And it is making me feel sad. So sad. You know, why do not you take a bath? I will do the dishes.
Three, two, one.
That is it. Our dating profiles are live on the Internet.
Attention all shoppers, my business is open for business!
That is right, ladies. For all you know, I am confident and fun to be around.
Oh, cool, it tells you when someone’s reading your profile. Jenny309. I hope that is not her weight.
If it is, I will take her. Ooh, I got one, too. The ladies are coming to us. Oh, man, if I’d started this years ago, I’d be divorced two or three times by now.
What? Another one. You know, it, it is weird. When they are reading your profile, does it, does it make you feel exposed? Like they see you naked?
Well, they are not running away screaming, so, no.
I love Little House. It made me want to live on a farm so much I tried to milk my cat. That tangy bowl of Cheerios was not worth the stitches.

Well, you sit back, relax and enjoy a beloved childhood memory. You see that cabin there? I read they were illegally squatting on Indian land. Yeah. Personally, I think what we did to the Native Americans was wrong, but this is your favourite show, not mine. Oh, look at little Laura Ingalls, eating that peanut butter sandwich. Peanut butter? Huh? That is strange, since peanut butter was not introduced until the early 1900s. If I knew this show was about time travel, I would have watched it much sooner.
You are trying to get back at me for what I said about Raiders of the Lost Ark.
That is silly. Almost as silly as Dr. Baker having a telephone, since telephones only existed in large cities at that time. This is more like Little House on the Preposterous.
Sheldon, we are in a relationship. When you get angry, just tell me. You do not need to seek revenge.
Are you sure? Every time my dad stayed out all night, my mom would put hamster poop in his chewing tobacco.
Well, that is not how we are going to do it.
Fine. I am mad at you. Not only did you ruin Raiders for me, you may have ruined the whole franchise. Except for the fourth one, which was bad before you got your mitts on it.
I should not have said it. I am sorry.
Thank you.
Do you feel better?
Yes. But not as good as I am going to when I tell you that your precious Garfield has no reason to hate Mondays. He is a cat. He does not have a job.
Hey, I was just… what is happening?
Oh, just a little treat. I know you have been feeling really bad about your mom lately.
Oh, oh, I have. So bad.
And I wanted to make you feel better, so I planned something very special for you.
Uh-huh, I can already feel it working.
Hello, Leonard.
Mom?
I understand you have been whining about my parenting in order to emotionally manipulate your girlfriend.
I… uh…
Bernadette told me everything. Now you do not get the left or the right.
Let’s discuss why you continue to involve me in your sex life.
Oh, please, Mommy. No, Mommy.
When you were six years old, you walked in on me and your father naked. I was swatting his bottom with your brand new Ping Pong paddle.
I did not dream that?
How did that make you feel?
Penny, come back. I am sad for real now.
In the last two hours, 162 women have read our profiles. How many of them have sent us messages?
Combined?
Yes.
Zero.
Dude, this is, this is brutal.
I do not think I have ever felt so rejected. And I had a rescue dog who ran back to the pound.
This is the worst. If we are gonna get shot down, we might as well just go to a bar and do it old school.
And make them look us in the eye.
Yeah, anything is better than this.
Hello.
Not interested.
I was wrong. This is worse.
Wait, wait, if it was not for Indiana Jones, the ark would never have ended up at the warehouse.
That is true. He collected and delivered the ark to the proper authorities for filing.
Like a hero.
Yeah!
Although, technically, Indy was supposed to take the ark to a museum to be studied. He could not even get that done.
Aw!
Awkward silence, Sheldon on his phone, no touching. Somebody’s having date night.
It is actually steamier than it looks. Sheldon’s looking up the phallic symbolism of root vegetables in Renaissance paintings.
Oh, no, I got bored with that. I am just browsing cuticle scissors on Amazon.
How do you not tear off his clothes and take him right here on this table?
If you do that, I will scream.
Sheldon, I have some exciting news to tell you.
That makes two of us. My new cuticle scissors will be here in one to two business days. Come on, one.
I have been invited to consult on an experiment at your university for a few months. Is not that great? We could have lunch together. We could carpool.
You know, riding with Leonard has gotten a little tedious lately. The only car game he ever wants to play is the Quiet Game. And he is terrible at it, I always win.
So, you are okay with this?
Well, why would not I be?
Well, this project would have us working in close proximity to one another. And there is the vulgar adage that one should not defecate where one eats.
My father used to say that all the time. That and, um, who does one have to orally gratify to get a drink around here? But what does that have to do with you working at the university?
Sheldon, do not defecate where you eat means do not have a romantic relationship in the workplace.
Really?
Yes.
Huh. Yeah, I always took it literally. That is why I have never once moved my bowels in this or any restaurant. Hmm.
I am relieved that you do not have a problem with us working together.
Not as relieved as I am about to be. It is a brave new world, little lady.
Are you crazy? You do not want your girlfriend at work with you. Hell Clam.
Why not? Hairy Fairy.
I think it could be romantic. You know, my parents met at his place of work.
Your father’s a gynaecologist.
I know. What started as a pap smear turned into a date. Which turned into her working there, which turned into marriage, which then turned into hatred, which continues to this day. Two-Eyed Cyclops.
Would you please tell him this is not a good idea?
No, no, I think it will be great. Maybe next time he gets conjunctivitis at work, she can hold his head and try to put the drops in his eyes. Giant baby.
That is a Raging Ogre.
Yeah, I know.
I am just saying, I’d never want to work with Bernadette. Can you imagine seeing someone all day long and then you are supposed to hang out with them after work, too?
Hold on. We do that all the time. You and I work together and play together.
Yeah, I know, and it drove me into the arms of another woman. Bipolar Bear.
Well, I appreciate your concern, but I will not be seeing any more of Amy than I already do. I assume we will deduct any extra time we spend together at work from our weekly quota.
Please let me be there when you tell her that.
Why? So you can see the look on Amy’s face when she hears my top-notch idea?
Please, oh, please, just let me be there.
So, Amy, what are you gonna be working on at Caltech?
I am leading a study to see if deficiency of the monoamine oxidase enzyme leads to paralyzing fear in monkeys.
If they are anything like humans, the answer’s yes.
Wait, you have, you have done this experiment on humans?
You mean like death row inmates with nothing to lose? No, that would be unethical.
You know, not a lot of people know this, but the monoamine oxidase enzyme was discovered by a woman, Mary Bernheim. That is right, my phone is just as smart as you guys.
Amy, Bernadette, Penny. Amy, Bernadette, Penny. Amy, Bernadette, Penny.
He is never gonna stop doing that, is he?
I do not mind. I am hoping to put his love of repetition to good use someday.
Hi. Um, I have reconsidered. Uh, you cannot work where I work. Enjoy the rest of your evening.
Sheldon. I already signed the contract. I cashed a cheque.
Mmm, you are not going to come out of this looking good.
Sheldon, I do not understand. I thought you said you were fine with it.
Well, I was. But that was before Howard explained to me how awful it would be if he had to work with his significant other.
He said what?
Now, do not be insulted. He just thinks too much of you would be mind-numbingly tedious.
Excuse me, I need to have a chat with my husband.
Yeah, well, now, well, keep it short. From what I gather, brevity is your friend. So, are we good here?
No, we are not good here. I am working on this project.
Yeah, and you cannot tell her what she can and cannot do.
Last week, you told Leonard he could not wear his Wookie jacket out in public.
That is different. I am not going to the mall with someone dressed like a dumb space bear.
Sheldon, you do not have to worry about me bothering you. I will be in a different building. And we do not even have to have lunch together.
Really?
Yes. Before all things, I am a scientist. I am just there to do my work and, with a little luck, scare the living crap out of some monkeys.
Hmm. You sure your mothlike personality will not be drawn to this blazing fire that is myself?
More and more sure.
Well, then, you have my permission.
I did not ask for your permission.
Too late. No backsies.
No, no, listen to me. Sheldon misunderstood. What I meant was, if we worked together, there’d be too much of me for you, not the other way around.
Howard, if you are going to lie to your wife, do not start the sentence with Sheldon misunderstood. That is a dead giveaway.
Well?
Okay, fine. I did say that, and I think it is true. I think if we worked together and lived together, we’d get sick of each other.
Yeah, but to be fair, he only said the part about him getting sick of you.
For the love of God, why?
What exactly do you think you’d get sick of?
His only options here are to fake a heart attack or have a real one.
It is nothing in particular. I…
Is it my voice? Am I too bossy? What?
My arm is feeling numb.
Nailed it.
That is the wrong arm for a heart attack, doofus.
My point is, I am sure there are things about me that would drive you crazy if you had to deal with them all day long.
Like looking me in the eye and lying to me?
Oh, well, come on, where am I supposed to look when I lie to you?
Find somewhere else to sleep tonight.
Bernie…
If it makes you feel any better, Amy and I are fine. I mean, really good.
So, boys, how was the pyjama party? You guys jump on the bed and sing into hair brushes?
It was not a pyjama party. It was just a couple of bros hanging out, giggling, eating cookie dough and watching Princess Bride.
Please, stop talking.
As you wish.
I mean, you know, Sheldon, none of this would have happened if I had not tried to help you.
Uh, it also would not have happened if, in the early universe, hydrogen was a little more common or a little less common. This is fun. Your turn.
Gentlemen.
Amy.
Hey.
Hello.
That was kind of icy. You two okay?
Oh, we are fine. As Howard advised, she is merely respecting our professional boundaries.
Smart. Take relationship advice from a man who spent last night braiding Raj’s hair.
Yeah, you make a good point. It would appear I was worried for nothing. Look at her, desperately wishing she was over here at the cool table. Do not worry, little moth. The flame will come to you.
Oh, uh, on the off chance that Bernadette does not call back and apologize, how do you feel about Mexican food for dinner tonight?
I do not know. Sounds kind of heavy.
That is ’cause you always fill up on chips.
And this is Dr. Gunderson from Stockholm.
Ah, Sweden. Yeah, home of my favourite Muppet and, uh, second favourite meatball. Okay, the Nordic reputation for lack of humour is well-founded. Boy, is his name Gunderson or No-Funderson?
Where are we going with this, Dr. Cooper?
Oh, please, I am your boyfriend. You call me Sheldon. That is right, I am in a boy-girl relationship with this cute little lump of wool.
Sheldon.

It is a physical relationship, too. Hand-holding, hugging, even on hot days. Ow. Okay, here’s a new one. Apparently now we kick each other in the shin under the table. How do you like it when I do it to you? Not so much, huh?

Test subject D7, aka Betsy, fear response study. Image number one, Frenchman on bicycle carrying baguettes. No visible reaction. Image number two, sousaphone. Still no reaction. Okay. Let’s kick things up a notch. Image number three, crocodile with a mouthful of monkeys. Okay, now we are talking.
Dr. Fowler?
What do you want, Sheldon?
Well, I am done with work, so… ugh!
Oh, sorry, sorry, sorry. Sorry, uh, better?
Oh, baguettes. Yes, I like baguettes. What exactly are you doing?
Determining baseline fear levels in capuchin monkeys by measuring their response to visual stimuli.

So, goofing off. As I was saying, I am done with work and Leonard’s not. So good news, you get to take me home. Play your cards right, I will let you drive me past the lot where the buses park at night.
I cannot leave now, Sheldon. I am very busy. Besides, why would I want to do you a favour after the way you treated me in the cafeteria? Image number four, boa constrictor.
What on earth are you talking about? My behaviour in the cafeteria was delightful. Maybe your friend Gunderson needs to head over to IKEA and assemble a sense of humour.
You embarrassed me in front of my colleagues on my first day here. Image number five, kitten in a teacup.
Aw. Embarrassed you?
You know what? I do not have time for this. Find another way home.
I am starting to get the sense that you are angry with me.
Really? What tipped you off?
Couple things, actually. Your tone of voice, your body language…
Get out.
Well, now, that.
Image number six, woman giving birth.
Bleugh!
It is nine o’clock, where you been?
Oh, I had to take the bus home. Fell asleep and missed my stop.
Oh, no.
Did you know that Los Angeles has a Little Sri Lanka?
I did not.
Well, I do now. They are a lovely people. Although terrifying when you wake up face-to-face with them. If you are hungry, I brought home some mutton and coconut milk.
Why’d you get that? You hate lamb.
I was asking for directions. Apparently, there was a communication problem.
I thought Amy was gonna drive you home.

Yeah, I thought so, too, but she is acting very strangely. I was discussing it with a Sri Lankan fellow on the bus, and he hypothesized that a tiger may have recently run across her shadow. Although he may have just been trying to drum up business for his brother-in-law’s witch doctor practice.
Okay, Sheldon, what happened between you and Amy?
Well, can you believe she said I embarrassed her?
Yeah.
But you did not even hear the details.
Sheldon, I have known you a long time, and I am going to tell you this with all the love I can possibly muster. Amy’s right. You are wrong.
But you do not even know…
Does not matter.
But, now, but in my defence…
Does not matter.
You are not listening to my side of it.
Okay, fine, Sheldon. What is your side?
Well…
Nope, got to go with Amy on this one.
Ooh, shrimp was spicy.
You want a TUMS?
You got the tropical fruit kind?
No, if I buy those, I just go through them like candy.
Tell me about it. One time, I swear I pooped out a stick of chalk.I will get it.
Thanks.
Hi.
Oh, hi.
I may have overreacted.
Yeah, well, I did not handle it so great, either.
It is just sometimes I feel like you enjoy spending time with your friends more than with me.
That is not true.

It is not? You spend all day together at work, and then you all hang out at night playing games, going to the comic book store. Last week, you two got a couples massage. So, when you said you would not want to spend that much time with me, it really hurt my feelings.
Oh, wow. Yeah, no, I get that. I am so sorry. Starting tomorrow, I am turning over a new leaf. Time with you is my number one priority.
Why tomorrow?
Well, we are real close to finishing off the new Batman game.
It is awesome. Uh, you should probably go after her.
Should I go after you?
No!
Thanks for getting me in trouble.
Amy. Amy. Amy.
Sheldon, what are you doing here so late?
I could not sleep because I kept thinking about what happened earlier between us. Also, I had one heck of a bus nap. Oh, speaking of which, do you want some mutton and coconut milk?
No.
Well, I cannot give this stuff away.
What do you want?

Amy, this is not easy to say. All relationships are difficult, but even more so when you are in one with a person who struggles with everyday social interactions. And frankly, who can strike some people as being kind of a weirdo.
Sheldon, you are not a weirdo.

I was not speaking about me. I mean, honestly, there is no telling what will set you off. You know, introducing myself as your boyfriend. Giving you the opportunity to drive me home. Breaking the ice with your colleagues using ethnic humour, the funniest kind of humour.
What is your point?
My point is, we are a couple, and I like you for who you are, quirks and all.
I like you, too.

Well, I should hope so. I do not see anyone else banging on this door to put up with your nonsense. Not even a good-bye? You see, that is the kind of thing that makes people think you are weird. Poor kid. She just does not see it.
I am not apologizing to Howard. He can come beg me on his knees.
Sheldon, too. If I see him at work, I am just going to ignore him.
All right, do not worry. I talked to Leonard. He is gonna sit the guys down and set them straight.
Laser’s warmed up.
Pull.
Yeah!
What are you working on?
Cannot talk. In the zone.
Do you know what he is doing?

Could be anything. Last time he was like this, he figured out electron transport in graphene. The time before that, he was making a list of who’s allowed in his tree fort if fe ever gets one. Still cannot believe I did not make the cut.
Uh, Sheldon, you want to take a break? Your food’s ready.
No, no, what are you doing? He is both happy and quiet. It is like seeing a unicorn and Bigfoot at the same time.
Sorry we are so late. Bernadette got stuck at work.
Great news. A raccoon virus just crossed the species barrier and now can infect humans.
Why is that great news?
In the pharmaceutical business we have a saying, mo’ infections, mo’ money.
Wait, Maybe you want to wash your little raccoon hands first.
Oh, calm down. If I had it, I’d be dead already.
Guys, listen up.
Cannot listen, zone. Also do not care.
Next week is the anniversary of my first date with Bernadette.
Really do not care.
I want to do something special, and I was hoping you guys could be a part of it.
Aw, what horrible thing are you trying to make up for?
Just putting something in the bank for what horrible thing I do next.
Ah.
Look, she is gonna be back any second, so here’s the deal. I am writing a song, and I was hoping we could all play it for her together.
Aw.
Oh, I love that.
That is so beautiful.
Sheldon?
When did we get to the Cheesecake Factory?
It is really sweet what Howard wants to do for Bernadette.
Yeah. Hey, how come you have never done anything romantic to celebrate our first date?
Well, for starters, you have broken up with me so many times, which first date are we talking about?
Ooh, somebody call the burn ward. And back to the zone.
And besides, I do romantic things for you all the time. Can you even name one romantic thing you have done for me?
I can name tons.
Sex does not count.
Oh. I know, what about that bed-and-breakfast?
Well, I took you there. All you did was…
I know what I did. I bet they had to throw out that rocking chair. You know, I can be romantic if I want to.
It is fine. And also not true.
Okay, just you wait and see. I am gonna romance your freakin’ ass off.
That is beautiful. Is that Shakespeare?
Sheldon?
Zone.
He will figure it out when he falls off the roof.

Sheldon, I know you are in the zone, but do you want some tea? All right, I cannot believe I am gonna say this, but you have not spoken in hours and I am starting to get worried. Please say something.
Leonard, prepare to be humbled and weep at the glory of my genius.
Nope, it was better before.
Look at it. I feel like my mind just made a baby. And it is beautiful. It is not like human babies, which are loud and covered in goop.
Holy crap, Sheldon, did you just figure out a method for synthesizing a new stable super-heavy element?

Did I? Well, that cannot be right. No one’s ever done that before. Except me, because I just did it. Sheldon and his brain, yeah. Sheldon and his brain, yeah. Sheldon and his brain, yeah. Sheldon and his brain, yeah. Sheldon and his brain…
Yeah, definitely better before.
So I am almost done writing the song for Bernadette. Are you cool playing the cello?
If by cool you mean willing to, yes. If by cool you mean cool, clearly you have never seen me play the cello.
Great. Will you play the ukulele?
Of course. I’d be happy to shred it on my ax.
Or you could just play your tiny, ridiculous guitar.
Fine. I will melt her heart. And her face.

Gentlemen. Uh, no doubt you heard about my little breakthrough. Now, if your plan is to hoist me on your shoulders and carry me around the cafeteria, please refrain. I do not care for heights, motion sickness or the thought of your necks touching my buttocks.
Seriously, congratulations, Sheldon.
Yeah, I read your paper online. That technique for creating a new heavy element is inspired.
Oh, well, thank you. Believe it or not, I just learned a Chinese research team at the Hubei Institute for Nuclear Physics ran a test on a cyclotron, and the results were extremely promising.
Sheldon, that is incredible.

Yeah, I know. They called it the greatest thing since the Communist party. Although I am pretty sure that the Communist party made them say that. I like China. See, they know how to keep people in line.
So, what happens next?
Oh, more testing, more success, more fame. Yeah, but do not worry, I will remain the same down-to-earth humble Joe I have always been.
Good to know.
Now give me that cookie, I discovered an element.
Thank you so much for coming.
You called the right person. I believe I have the perfect romantic evening for you to give Leonard.
Okay, good, ’cause I have been really struggling with this.
As I am sure you are aware, the quickest way to a man’s heart is through his…
Pants, but Leonard says sex does not count.
Oh. You poor thing. You have one arrow in your quiver, and you just cannot use it. Fortunately, another pathway to a man’s heart is through his stomach.

I do not know if I want to cook for him. He is kind of a picky eater. I mean, it is too salty, it is too dry, it is too burnt and frozen at the same time. Okay, come on, what else would sweep you off your feet?

Well, I have always had this fantasy that involves dancing. The sexual chemistry between my partner and me is electric. But boy, oh, boy, does my father not approve until he sees us in the big dance competition.
Okay, that is just the plot for Dirty Dancing. What else would you love? Other than being lifted over Patrick Swayze’s head.
Oh, oh, uh, you could, uh, stand outside his window with a boom box in the air.
That is from Say Anything.
Look, I am a lonely guy, I watch a lot of movies. Look, Penny, if you truly want to be romantic, it needs to come from you.
I get that, but why is this so hard?
Well, you have probably never had to do this stuff ’cause you are young and beautiful and men have always thrown themselves at you.
Yeah, I am trying to be sad about that. I cannot.
Let’s see, what is next? Okay, here. This is the Magic Marker I was using when I made the discovery.
I do not think the Smithsonian’s gonna want your marker.

And that is why you are not on a list for my tree fort. Ooh, guess who’s getting an article written about him in Physics Today? I will give you a hint. You measured the diameter of his suspicious mole yesterday.
Sheldon, I am so proud of you.
Well, you should be. My discovery is spreading like wildfire. Unlike my mole, which is holding steady at the size of a navy bean.
What is next?
This is the very copy of The Handbook of Chemistry and Physics in which I looked up the reaction rates of mendelevium and…
And what?
No. No, no, no, no.
What is wrong?
I have made a horrible mistake.
What are you talking about?
This table, it is in square centimetres. I read it as square metres. You know what that means?
That Americans cannot handle the metric system?
Amy, I was off by a factor of 10,000.
But the Chinese team found the element.
Yeah, well, they should not have. My calculations were wrong. There must be some resonance between the elements I did not know about.
So you just got lucky?
Sheldon Cooper does not get lucky.
You and me both, brother. It does not matter. The element was found because of you, and that is groundbreaking.
What matters is the greatest scientific achievement of my life is based on a blunder. I am not a genius, I am a fraud.
You know, Sheldon, in neuroscience, we are forever finding something in one part of the brain that we thought was someplace else.
Oh, great. Now I am worse than a fraud. I am practically a biologist.
: You got to stop beating yourself up over this. I mean, you made a mistake, but it was a happy mistake.
There is nothing happy about it. I am being given credit that I do not deserve.
Oh, people get things they do not deserve all the time. Look at me with you.

No, Leonard, this is going to haunt me for the rest of my life. Every science classroom, every periodic table, every textbook, this mistake will be staring back at me. Like that time you let Koothrappali wax your eyebrows. I have got to find a way to stop this thing.
Buddy, I do not think you can. I mean, once it is out there, it is out there. This thing is like the science equivalent of a sex tape.
You know, frankly, I’d prefer a sex tape.
You do not know what a sex tape is, do you?
No.
Make sure you guys get to the restaurant by eight. Bernadette’s meeting me there at eight thirty and I do not want to blow the surprise.
We will be there.
Got it. Now, uh, I have a question about the song. I was thinking at some point I could bust out a little rap.
E-Ni-Ni-Ni-Ni-No.
Come on, come on, you have not even heard it yet. Leonard, give me a beat.
I will not.
Oh, please?
No, I want this to be romantic.
It will be. I do not call anyone a ho, and the only time I use the phrase my bitch, I am referring to you.
There he is.
Stop it. Stop celebrating me.
Woo!

And no woos. Oh, not you, Dr. Woo. You are fine. I want you all to know that you have no reason to applaud me. My so-called breakthrough was not the result of my genius. It was nothing more than a boneheaded mistake. So please refrain from praising me for it in the future.
Wait, I do not understand. They did not find the element?
Oh, no, they found the element. No, no, stop it. I do not need to take this admiration from the likes of you people. How do I make them stop loving me?
Invite them to live with us.
Boy, Bernadette is gonna love this.
Yeah. It must be nice to have someone do something so romantic.
Okay, you know what is not romantic? Rubbing it in someone’s face.
Actually, it can be, but I told you sex does not count.
I am getting worried about Bernadette. I am gonna call and check on her.
The National Science Foundation wants to give me a substantial grant.
Oh, that is a big deal.
I know. When will this nightmare end?
Hey, I get that you feel bad about all the attention, but still, what you did is amazing. We are really proud of you.
I am not.
You are not?
Sheldon, I have been thinking about it, and you are right. You do not deserve any credit. All you did was misread some numbers on a table. A very easy table, too. Honestly, I am embarrassed for you.
That is the most romantic thing I have ever heard.
Damn it, everyone’s better at this than me.
Congratulations, Dr. Fowler. You just made the fort.
Guys, there was an accident at Bernie’s lab.
Oh, my God, is she okay?
Yeah, but she is at the hospital in quarantine.
What?
Poor Bernadette.
Oh, no.
I hate to pile on the bad news, but I just got a raise.
Oh, my God, Bernie, what happened?
Well, let’s just say the next time you move a dozen vials of raccoon virus to the fridge, make two trips.
You are sure you are okay?
Yeah, it is just a precaution. If there was a problem, I’d be throwing up out of my eyeballs by now. Sorry I messed up our date.
Oh, do not worry about it. I brought the date here. Guys, come on in.
What is all this?
Well, tonight is the anniversary of our first date, and I wanted to celebrate it by writing a song for you.
Howie.
Sheldon, get over here.
She might be contagious. Do not you think I am having a rough enough day?
Sheldon.
Is it me, or does she not look so good?
Shh.

A candle without a wick, a Watson without a Crick, I’d be one of my outfits without a dick-ie. I’d be cheese without the mac, Jobs without the Wozniak, I’d be solving exponential equations that use bases not found on your calculator making it much harder to crack. I’d be an atom without a bomb, a dot without the com, and I’d probably still live with my mom.
And he’d probably still live with his mom.

Ever since I met you, you turned my world around. You supported all my dreams and all my hopes. You are like uranium-235 and I am uranium-238, almost inseparable isotopes. I could not have imagined how good my life would get from the moment that I met you Bernadette.
Oh, Howie.

If I did not have you life would be dreary, I’d be string theory without any string. I’d be binary code without a one, a cathode ray tube without an electron gun. I’d be Firefly, Buffy and Avengers without Joss Whedon. I’d speak a lot more Klingon, Heghlu’meH QaQ jajvam.
And he’d definitely still live with his mom.

Ever since I met you, you turned my world around. You are my best friend and my lover. We are like changing electric and magnetic fields. You cannot have one without the other. I could not have imagined how good my life would get from the moment that I met you, Bernadette.
Oh, we could not have imagined how good our lives would get from the moment that we met you, Bernadette.
Howie, that was amazing. Look, I am shaking.
She is sick, I knew it. Bye.
I have to say, this is the best Top Ramen you have ever made.
I discovered a secret ingredient. The flavour packet. That sucker is well named. All right, lover boy, get ready, ’cause there is a crap storm of romance coming your way.
Stop it, you are gonna make me cry. All right. You seem pretty confident.
Oh, I am. Maybe if you follow this trail, you will see why.
Oh, rose petals.
Yes. The most beautiful and shockingly expensive of all the flowers.
You made the bed? You really are pulling out all the stops.
Okay, I gave this a lot of thought, and I finally found something to show you how much I love you.
Oh, wow.
It is a first edition of Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy. I remember it was your favourite book growing up.
This is great. It, thank you, it is, so much.
What?
Nothing. I love it.
No. Something’s going on. What is wrong with it? I remember you saying how great it would be to have a first edition.
It is true, I did. I did say that. When we were at the used bookstore together and I saw the first edition and I bought it.
Oh, my God, I am the worst.
No, no, it is okay. It is really thoughtful.

No, it is not. I mean, what is thoughtful is everything you do. Here, you know what? Look at this. Look, here’s the, the plane ticket you bought me when I was too poor to go home for the holidays. And the rose you left on my windshield just because. Here’s the, the thank-you letter you wrote me after the first time I slept with you. All 11 pages of it.
I cannot believe you saved all this stuff.
Of course I did. It is you.
Come here.
Oh.
Is that a pregnancy test?
Oh, yeah, just the first one. I did not save them all.
I cannot believe I read this table wrong. I blame you.
Me? What did I do?
You distract me. I have been distracted since the moment I met you.
Sorry.
Well, you should be. Because all I can think about is how much I want to kiss you. And not just on the cheek, but on the mouth. Like mommies and daddies do.
Oh, Sheldon.
Amy? Amy? Did you hear what I said?
Cannot talk, in the zone.
I have never seen him this happy before.
That is because you have never seen him on restock the medicine cabinet day.
Look. A new topical antihistamine with lidocaine. Wow. I cannot wait until I get a rash.
Oh, Gas-X has a new ultra strength. I guess they really do read their mail.
Hey, is not that Professor Proton?
Oh, yeah.
Look at him, just standing in line like he was not moderately famous 30 years ago. Let’s go say hello.
Oh, maybe we should not bother him.
I am not going to bother him, I am going to talk to him.
He thinks there is a difference.
Arthur? Arthur, it is me, Sheldon Cooper. You may not remember because of your advanced age.
Trust me, I, I remember.
This is my girlfriend, Amy. Amy, this is television legend Arthur Jeffries. His science show inspired millions of children.
Hold, hold, hold on. You, you have a girlfriend?
Yes, and I have heard so much about you. Hey look, we are wearing the same orthopaedic shoes. I cannot believe I dress like a celebrity.
Oh, okay, I get it now.
Dr. Jeffries, hello again. Leonard Hofstadter.
Oh, oh, right, I remember your, your girlfriend. Is, is she, is she here?
No, she is not.
So, what prescription are you getting filled?
Sheldon.
No. Wait, I want to guess. Do not tell me.
I was not going to tell you.
Sheldon, come on.
No, no, no. I am really good at this. All right, give me a hint. Does it involve difficulty initiating a stream of anything?
Well, given my age, that is more than just a lucky guess.
Hey, Sheldon, let’s go mock the people buying homeopathic medicine, you love that.
But I am hanging out with my friend, and we are having fun. Look how happy he is.
Bernie’s having a girls’ night on Friday at our place. You want to do something?
Actually, I am busy.
Doing what?
There is a new sports bar over on Colorado Ave…
You are going to girls’ night.
Yeah.
You know they are making jewellery right?
You think they came up with that? They were going to drink beer and play darts.
What is up?
Not his testosterone levels.
Excuse me. I happen to be very comfortable with my masculinity.
How is that possible?
Hey, I got an email from Professor Proton.
Goody. What is it say?
He is working on a paper about nano vacuum tubes, and wants to know if I’d take a look at it.

That is strange. That he would come to you for that and not me. Oh, I got two emails from him. Do you have Leonard’s email address? And. Never mind, I found it. I cannot believe he picked you over me.
You do not want to read a paper by some old has-been who has not done any real science in decades.
Yeah, it is nothing to cry about.
Sheldon Cooper does not cry.
It is true, you’d rust.
And to think I idolized that man. And why? At the end of the day he is just another Hollywood phony.
Is it really worth getting upset about?
Yeah, they say do not meet your heroes. Do not peek behind that curtain of fame and celebrity, because if you do, you will see them as they really are, degenerate carnival folk.
Come on, he is a retired kids show host.
That is even worse. Using the sweet candy of science to trick children into loving him. Pervert.
Have you ever thought about why Arthur did not want you to read his paper?
Yes, I have. And my only conclusion is the prescription he was picking up the other day was for cuckoo pills.
Maybe he found you, um, a bit much.

That is kind of a stretch. Look, when it comes to social skills, I have mastered the big three. There is the coy smile. There is the friendly chuckle. There is the vocalization of sympathy. Aw. That last one’s tricky, I am still working on it.
From what I saw the other day, I could understand why he and some people might find you…
What?
Does not matter.
No, go ahead, say it. I know what it is. I have heard it my whole life. The word’s annoying. Go ahead, say it. Say it. Say I am annoying.
Sheldon.

Oh, it will not hurt my feelings. Go ahead, Amy, say I am annoying. I am annoying. I am annoying. I am annoying. Yeah, now, uh, now where are you going? Look, you know you want to say it, say it. Say I am annoying. Go ahead, say it. Say it. Say it. Amy, say it. Well, she cannot stand it when I am right.
This is fun. I am going to feel like such a vixen wearing jewellery that does not have a list of medications I am allergic to.
Penny, how’s it going over there?
Good, I am just having little trouble with the glue.
How do you not know how to use glue? Did you ditch pre-school?
Yeah, but only because I was dating a second grader.
Hello, everyone.
Okay, let me have it. Let’s hear all the Raj is a girl jokes.
Nope. Bernadette told me it is not nice and I am not allowed.
Thank you.
So I will not be making fun of you, or the things you like, or the fact that you just want to have fu-un.
Howie, stop. Come on, look at what I am making.
Oh, that is actually pretty nice.
I am making a bracelet.
Yeah, I am just making a mess.
You know, instead of beads and glue, you guys can use my soldering iron. You’d be able to make much cooler stuff.
Oh, I think we are doing just fine, thank you.
Actually, I’d kind of like to try that.
Me, too.
Be right back.
When did I have pistachios?
Sheldon, what are you doing here?
I am sorry, did I wake you?
Of course you woke me, it is seven thirty.
Well, I would have been here sooner, but for some reason your home is not on this map of Hollywood stars.
What do you want, Sheldon?
It is been pointed out by my girlfriend that I may have been annoying to you.
She sounds like a keeper.
Anyway, I wanted to apologize. I am truly sorry.
All right, apology accepted. Have a nice night.
No, no, now that we have cleared the air, I wanted to discuss another matter with you.
Sheldon, in a couple hours I have to get up, pee and then wander around the house.

Well, then, I will make this quick. Um, I want to talk about the paper you sent Leonard. Now, I know he said it is promising and he is going to collaborate on it, but now that you and I are friends again, I am at your disposal. And, um, frankly, lending my name and reputation to it will help, because a lot of people think that you are a washed-up has-been. Or dead.
I should be so lucky.
So, uh, what do you say?
You know, if it is all the same with you, I, I think I will, I will stick with Leonard.
It is because I am annoying, right? I know it is. Say it. Say it. Say I am annoying.
Good night.
Say it. Arthur, say it. Say I am annoying. Say it. Say it. I am annoying. Say it.
You are annoying.
Well, that really hurt.
If you would have told me when I was a kid that someday I would be doing science next to Professor Proton, I would not have believed you.
If someone had told me that people would still call me Professor Proton when I was 83 years old, I never would have quit smoking.
I am sorry, Dr. Jeffries, I am just excited. This nano vacuum tube idea of yours is, it is really interesting.
Hello, Leonard. Oh, hello, Arthur. What an odd coincidence that you are both here.
Why is it odd?

Because as it just so happens, I am also spending the day with a beloved children’s television science personality. Is not that right, new friend and colleague Bill Nye the Science Guy. Sorry, I replaced you with a newer model.
Wow, Arthur Jeffries. It is an honour to meet you. My show never would have happened without yours.
That is what I told my lawyers.
Mr. Nye, hello. I am sorry he got you involved in this nonsense.
He said I’d be speaking to a class.
No, I said you were teaching someone a lesson. Now let’s go.
What are you guys working on?
Oh, uh, we are making nano vacuum tubes.
Oh, that is interesting.
Have not you stolen enough from me? Back off, bow tie.
Hey, guys, what do you think?
Wow, Penny, good job.
Thanks. Target, four ninety-nine. I am getting a drink.
What are you working on?
Ah, I am making a necklace for my mom.
That is sweet.
Yeah, she and my dad are going through a bit of a rough patch, so I wanted to do something to let her know I was thinking about her.
What is going on with them?

They are just having a little trouble communicating. My dad says it is because the sound of my mom’s voice makes him want to tear his ears off and sew them over his eyes so he never has to look at her again.
Hi.
Hey, guys.
Hello.
Look who’s here to put the Jew in jewellery night.
Oh, sure, so it is fine when you say it.
Sorry we are late. I wanted to swing by the lab and pick up some even cooler tools for us to use.
I did not know you were coming again.
Well, last week was a blast. Plus, I thought you might like having a guy here.
So, what tools did you bring?
Everything we need to make jewellery moulds. Here’s some silver, a crucible and an acetylene torch to melt it down.
Ooh, that looks like fun.
Maybe you should master glue before you move on to fire.
Okay, who’s up first?
Rajesh, do you want to make a bracelet for your mom to go with the necklace?
No, thanks.
I was gonna make a necklace for my mom, but unfortunately she does not have a neck. She is just chins and fat and feet.
Okay, we are almost ready to go. Once we bond the wires, we can test the tubes.
This is so exciting, I, I feel like I am 75 again.
Oh, God.
What, what is it?
Sheldon just sent me a picture of him and Bill Nye getting smoothies.
Can, can I ask you a question?
Yeah, sure.
Why do you put up with Sheldon?
Oh, uh, you know, because we are friends.
Why?
Wow, you ask really hard questions.
Yeah.
Look, I know he can be aggravating, but what you have to remember is that he is not doing it on purpose. It is just how he is. But he is also loyal and trustworthy and we have fun together.
You, you know you are describing a dog.
He did bite me once. But in his defence, I came up behind him while he was eating, so…
Yeah, they, they hate that.
You know what, Sheldon is the smartest person I have ever met. And he is a little broken and he needs me. I guess I need him, too.
Why, why is that?
Boy, you will not let this go, will you? Oh, jeez.
Another photo from Sheldon?
No, I have to go pick him up. Bill Nye ditched him at the smoothie place.
He probably stole his wallet, too.

You know, if you guys are interested, there is a technique where I can take a lock of your hair, refine it into carbon dust and use the hydraulic press at work to turn it into a tiny little diamond with your DNA in it.
Oh, that is amazing,
Yeah. See Bernie’s engagement ring? That came right off my mom’s back.
He is kidding. If that were true, it’d be so much bigger.
My name is Howard. I can make your hair into diamonds. My mom is morbidly obese. Everybody love me.
Whoa, where is that coming from?
I will tell you where it is coming from. All you do is make fun of me for coming to girls’ night and now you are here ruining it for everyone.
Raj, cool it, he is gonna make us hair diamonds.
How am I ruining anything? I am just trying to help you make better jewellery.
But this is not about the jewellery. This is about me having a place where I can open up about my feelings.
Since when cannot you open up with me?
There are just some things that I feel more comfortable sharing with the girls, because they will not make fun of me or and call me names, or ask me if my Koothrapanties are in a bunch.
Buddy, I was just joking around.
Yeah, well, sometimes your jokes hurt.
You are right. I did not realize I was making you feel that way. It was very brave of you to tell me.
Thank you. It was not easy.
They are gonna have sex before Sheldon and I do, I know it.
Arthur?
Hi, Sheldon.
I am surprised to see you here.
Yeah, me, too. Somewhere around the third floor I began to see a, a white light.
I will get Leonard.
No, no, no, I am, I am here, I am here to see you.
If you are hoping to get in touch with Bill Nye, I cannot help you. I have been informed that he is now Bill Nye the Restraining Order Guy.
No, I, I, I was thinking, if it is not too much trouble, I’d like to get your opinion about my, my paper.
Thank you. It would be an honour.
Oh. Uh, great.
Actually, I do not need that. I hacked into your e-mail account and read it.
And, what did you think?
Well, first, I think the fact that you use your birthday as a password is embarrassing.
Mmm. Thank you.
Second, um, I thought your paper was inspired.
Oh, well, that, that means a lot to me.
Can I invite you in for tea?
Uh, no, no. I, I really, I have, I have to run.
Hey, Arthur. How are you?
Well, I guess one cup would not hurt.
Oh, hey, buddy, what is up?
Well, I was feeling bad about how I acted the other night so I made you a little something.
You did not have to do that.
Well, it was fun. I used some of the jewellery techniques you taught us. It is a lightsabre belt buckle.
Wow, this is so cool. Thanks.
Oh gets better.
Wow.

Okay, first, talking to you while you are on the toilet is not exactly a picnic for me either, okay? Remember, when you can hear me, I can hear you. And second, you completely disregard how uncomfortable unresolved issues are for me. It is, it is like, a, an itch in my brain I cannot scratch.

What is wrong with you?
What is wrong with you?

Uh, we were actually gonna do it here.

I want to go.

Sheldon.

Sheldon.

Wuh, Penny.

Listen to Stretch.

I am trying to watch the game. Shut up. Oh, how do you not make a first down there?

I am getting ready to weigh in again.
Come on.

I would throw a quick slant to a wideout, given that the defence is showing blitz.

Well, you might have to cook for one more because she invited Zack.
What?
Ooh!

1993. Leon Lett blew the game in the final seconds and the Dolphins emerged victorious. Then I finally got to do my calculus.

Anyone need a beer?
Yeah.
Thank God.
So, does your dad still live in Texas?

I am sorry to hear that.

Here you go.

To your dad.

Broad shoulders, good hair.

Sheldon and your dad are bonding and completely ignoring me.
I know how you feel. Sheldon ignored me for a week when he got that Roomba vacuum. I kick it when he is not looking.

So why do not you do that with them?
They do not want me.
What do you mean?
Well, Sheldon started talking about how his dad is not alive any more, and they were toasting, and I tried to tell them about how sad I was when my dad abandoned…
Zack’s here!
Stir the gravy.

Sorry she made you come over here on a holiday.
It is all right. I did not have anything going on. Plus, Penny told me we are married, and Thanksgiving’s a time to be with family.

Okay.

Ooh.

I just think splitting up can be rough on kids.
We do not have any kids.
Are you sure? ‘Cause you did not know we were married until this morning.

Of course it was an impersonator. We could never afford a real Elvis.
You married him instead of me? Good call. Sign the papers.

That is not true.
Yeah, we could have waited till Monday, signed the papers, this all would have been over.
You are the one who invited him here.
Oh, there you go again, just another mistake you are throwing in my face.
Not cool, bro. I am starting to think you are not the kind of guy I want dating my wife.
Yeah, well, she is not gonna be your wife for long.

I am about to. Sign the paper.
Know what they say, happy wife, happy life. Let’s eat.
That is not what I expected when you said you were gonna burp pie.

The rooftop.

and then the next day was 73 degrees, and the day after that was 72, and then it was 72 again, uh, then it was 74, and that brings us to today, at I’d wear shorts if I had a pair. 78.

I am not a virgin, Sheldon.
So now you think you are better than Isaac Newton? Oh, no wonder women do not like you.

Oh, that is a paradox. I mean if you meant what you just said, then that means you may not have meant what you just said.
Careful, I saw this on Star Trek. Smoke’s gonna come out of his ears soon. Hey.

Yeah.

No, Raj, that is a terrible idea.

Really? Uh, little tip: jokes are often better when you end them with wocka wocka or ha-cha-cha.

You do not have a problem with this, do you?

I am not even engaged once. I do not even know if Sheldon thinks about marriage. I am not getting any younger. Honestly, I kind of thought by now, we might have had some sort of…

Oh, that is gonna make me cry.

Yes, this is remarkable.

That would mean that this delayed parameter should be increased 250 milliseconds.
Oh, that is much better. Yeah, boy, if good ideas came out of your brain the way mucus comes out of your nose, we’d be in good shape.
Now, take a sip, swirl it around your mouth, and try to notice the flavours, the tannins, the textures. Well?
I probably should have spit out my gum first.
Yeah. You know, the last couple of weeks have been pretty rough, but, uh, staying here with you guys has really helped take my mind off of it.

When did he leave?

You know, it is nice to spend time with people who do not talk about work like it is some kind of soap opera.

That is a daring and insightful solution.
We are finally making progress. I wish we could do it without fighting.
What if the fighting is the reason we are making progress?

Well, if that is the case, then your grandparents mumble and have bad posture.

It seems we have a choice to make. Abandon all ground rules in the name of science, or give up collaborating for the sake of our relationship.
There is only one clear choice.
Science it is.

Anyway, I know it is silly, but since Raj moved in, I have been feeling a little left out.
Well, sweetie, that is crazy.

Well, to be truthful…

Did you say you guys are working on the guidance system tomorrow?

Well, Sheldon said that he was gonna work with me on our quantum perception project.

When does that start?

Soon. See, I could have said in the near future, but I did not say in the near future, because in the near future is three more words than soon. In, one, the, two, near, three, future, four. See, in the near future is four, soon is just one, four is more than one, saving time already.

Well, if we run the xenon stream through the cryo-cooler, it will be cooled immediately before it reacts with the conduction.
Oh, sorry, uh, carrot chunk.
