Damn it, he is good at that, too.
Thanks. Wow, working on a top secret government project, that is so cool. Do you have a bodyguard to keep spies away?
I have Sheldon, that keeps most people away.
I miss that guy. He is like the Swedish Chef Muppet. I do not know what he is saying, but he is funny.
Oh, I know what he is saying, and he is not, he is not funny.
So, Penny, what is going on with you? How’s the job?
Uh, it is okay, I am still in pharmaceutical sales.
She is doing amazing. She can actually make a side effect, like 10% chance of liver failure, sound like a 90% chance of liver success.
Yeah, lying is not my favourite part of the job. Actually, I am not crazy about a lot of it.

Hey, if you are not happy there, I have been looking for a new head of sales at my company. And we do not sell drugs, just menus, so the only lie you will be telling is we print on recycled paper. We do not.
Oh, that is a nice offer.
You know, we’d make a great team. Or as we say in the menu business, I cannot do this without Me N U.
Right, ’cause it spells menu.
Yeah, right? It is funny. I got a lot of menu jokes, but that is my favourite.
All right, this is everything. What do you want to learn?
It really does not matter, as long as it is challenging.
Okay, well, how about, oh, I teach you some close-up magic.
Howard, I am trying to make myself uncomfortable, not everyone else.
So you wanted to learn something physical and you came to Howard Wolowitz?
Hey, the circus arts are very physically and mentally demanding. Have you ever tried to juggle?
Yes, I am juggling my love for you and my embarrassment of you right now.
And it is hard, is not it? So the key is, the moment one ball is at the top of its arc, you toss the next one. Hmm?
Okay, I think I got that.
Uh, hold on. There is an old saying in juggling.
Is it I am going to die alone?
No, it is if you want to have fun, start with one. Yours we think, but we do not say. All right, just toss it up and catch it a few times, get comfortable with it.
Okay. Just to be on the safe side, am I in any danger of getting juggler’s elbow?
No.
Are you sure? ‘Cause I am feeling a twinge.
See, that was not so bad. He even picked up the check.
Yeah. Although, when he was trying to figure out the tip, I am pretty sure I saw smoke coming out of his ears. You are not really considering working for him, are you?
Well, maybe, I mean, it seems kind of perfect. I have sales experience, and I have been a waitress, so I have restaurant experience, and if he is figuring out my Christmas bonus, we could buy a boat.
Do not you think it might be a little weird to work for someone you used to date?
You work with Sheldon, you tell me.
Yeah, it is weird.
Okay, are you seriously jealous of me working with Zack?
No, no, I am not jealous, I just think you have got a good thing going where you are right now, and you make great money and you have not slept with any of your co-workers.
Great, so you want me to stay at a job I am not happy at?
Uh.
You okay? You kind of look like Zack trying to figure out that tip.
Of course I do not want you to be unhappy, but I also want you to be smart, and working for an ex-boyfriend is not very smart. You do not have to stop, just slow down, I will jump out.
Amy, look, I am on a unicycle!
How did you get from croissants to a unicycle?
I hurt myself juggling.
Where did you get it?
Howard said I could borrow it, Bernadette said forever.
Have you tried letting go of the rope?
What, are you crazy? I am on a unicycle.
All right, well, have fun.
Wait, I need help getting down.
Well, what do you want me to do?
Drag out our mattress and put it over here, then go across the hall, get their mattress and put it over here. But before you do any of that, scratch my nose.
So you told her she was being dumb?
No, I told her she was being not smart. Which was dumb.
Why did you even go to dinner with the guy?
We covered this, I am dumb.
So he is my ex-boyfriend, who cares? I cannot believe Leonard would be so insecure.
Really? I have no trouble believing that at all.
And Zack’s engaged. Leonard has no reason to feel threatened.
We are talking about the same Leonard, right?
So you think it is fine if she works for Zack?
I do not know, maybe.
Well, he is much more attractive than Leonard.
Yes, but that is gonna be true of a lot of guys she works for.
Yeah, but she also used to sleep with Zack.
Again.
I would never let Howard work with an ex.
What, you would not trust him?
I would not trust her. He is thin and sexy like a Jewish greyhound.
Yeah, that, that is the sexiest dog.
And I’d like to think Howie would not take a job I was uncomfortable with.
‘Cause he is scared of you?
Terrified.
Yeah.
You know what? I am with Leonard, this is not cool.
Thank you.
I disagree. Penny is a strong, independent woman. The more you try to control her, the more she will push back.
So you think it is okay?
Oh, no, she is gonna leave you for someone, might as well get it over with.
What are you doing?
I am returning this stuff to Howard.
Oh. Well, Bernadette made me promise if you did not want it, we’d give it to a homeless clown. What happened to learning the unicycle?
Oh, I stopped that, it was dumb. Uni, bi, tri, menstrual, all cycles are dumb.
You said juggling was dumb, too.
Well, it is. If I wanted to hold three things at once, I’d wear cargo pants.
Sheldon, is it possible that when things get really difficult, you just give up?
Are you calling me a quitter?
Well, if you honestly…
This conversation is over.
His mother warned me. Everybody warned me. Actually, he warned me.
Hey.
Hi.
You want to talk?
That does not seem to be where I shine. How about I just give you one of these?
Look, we can have a reasonable conversation and I will not get mad. I do not like it after sex, and I do not like it now.
Yeah, sorry.
Yeah. All right, just come here. Look, I get me working with Zack is weird and I do not want you to be uncomfortable.
Well, thanks. And I do not want you to be stuck at a job you do not like.
Then what do we do?
Well, I do not love it, but if you really want to take this job, I will find a way to deal with it.
No, I know you will try, but it will make you miserable, which will make me miserable, and I am just gonna stay where I am at for now.
No, no, no, no, you are, you are unhappy there and then you are gonna blame me for making you stay, and it is fine, I will just, I will suck it up.
You do not need to do that, it is okay.
Yeah, see, now I feel terrible, like I am being selfish and holding you back. What? Say something. Yeah, that is pretty annoying.
I made you tea.
Thank you.
I am sorry I called you a quitter.
It is okay, I stopped being upset about that. And no, the irony is not lost on me.
What are you reading?
This article says the peak age for making a Nobel Prize-winning discovery is 40.
So?
So I am running out of time.
That is ridiculous, you are a brilliant man. The best years of your life are still ahead of you.
Oh, you have to say that, you are sweet on me.
Well, if you are really worried about your career, maybe you should consider spending a little less time with video games and comic books.
Hey, I thought you were sweet on me.

Okay, fine, let’s say you never win a Nobel Prize. Let’s say you spend your life doing solid scientific research surrounded by friends and loved ones who appreciate you, not for what you have accomplished but for who you are as a man. Would not that be a life well-lived?
You are so cute. I am gonna go learn how to walk on stilts.
So many warnings.
Okay, are you sure about this?
Absolutely. I just want you to be happy. And maybe a little turned on about how selfless I am being.
Penny, what is up?
Hey, uh, so I have been thinking about it and I want to take the job.
Oh, bad news. When my fiancée found out that I was offering a job to my ex-girlfriend, she said it was a stupid idea and threw a shoe at me.
Oh, so there is no job?
Nope, just a little bump on my forehead.
Okay, thanks anyway. Bye. Well, his fiancée thought the idea of us working together was stupid. You were right, I was wrong. Are not you gonna say anything?
Not if I want to be doing this later.
Hey, I did not know you were home. Where you been?
I went to see your mom.
Seriously, where were you?
I just told you, your mom’s.
Why?
Well, since you find my magic tricks so embarrassing, I got to wondering what cool hobbies you had as a kid.
Oh. What’d she say?
She did not say much of anything. But she said a lot. Hi, Bernadette, remember me?
First of all, that is not what she sounds like, she is from South Carolina.
I cannot believe you made fun of me all these years while you were a closeted ventriloquist.
Okay, it is not like I wanted to be a ventriloquist. I was in beauty pageants and I needed a talent besides spreading rumours that the other contestants were pregnant.
Well, since you enjoyed getting rid of all my stuff, you know, maybe we should throw this little lady in the wood chipper.
No. And the little lady has a name.
Which is?
Tammy Jo St. Cloud.
Tammy Jo St. Cloud. Oh, and I am a dork for juggling.
Sorry, you are not a dork. You are a clown. Tammy Jo, do not say that, you will make him feel bad. Look at him, what reason he got to feel good?
All right, very funny.
Do not listen to her, she is been in a box for, like, 25 years. Yeah, back when his haircut was fashionable.
That is enough, put her away.
Oh, big daddy, I do not think so. You marry Miss Bernie, you marry me. We all family now.
All right, you are freaking me out.
Do not be that way. If you do not mind a few splinters, we can have us a ménage à trois. Ooh.
I am doing it. I am doing it. I am tall and I am doing it. Ah, man.
Champagne, champagne.
Thank you.
And for the world’s tallest second grader, apple juice.
Thank you. No bendy straw, some party.
Hey, a toast. Thank you all for your support while we worked on our Air Force project. And please know that we could not have done it without you, so cheers.
Cheers.
You know, it is nice of you to acknowledge us, but this is your accomplishment.
Yeah, you guys did this all on your own.
Without me.
To success without Raj.
So what happens next?
Phase two, we test it, perfect it, and hope to live long enough to see the movie based on our lives starring more attractive versions of us.
Yeah, I will definitely live long enough. Vitamin C.
First thing tomorrow morning, we are back at it.
Without me.
I hope his character does not make it into the movie, he is kind of a bummer.
Leonard Hofstadter. Access granted.
Hmm. I do not care if this thing is burning out my retinas, it makes me feel special. Now, before we field test, I think we…
What the hell?
Where is everything?
Who else has access to this room?
It is a secure lab in a classified facility, only the U.S. government and us.
This is disconcerting.
But the movie did just get good.
Sir, I, I, I am sorry but I just do not get it. You came into our lab in the middle of the night and took our prototype and all of our research and did not even tell us?
Sounds like you get it.
But why would you do that?
You guys completed phase one, we will take it from here.
Where did you move it?
I cannot tell you that.
Are you implementing phase two?
I cannot tell you that.
Wait, so you are just going to take all the work we have done for the last year and toss us aside?
Williams: That one I can tell you, yes.
This is all very upsetting.
I am sorry to hear that. As you know, the primary focus of the United States military is people’s feelings.
If that is sarcasm, please save it for our enemies.
I may be moving out soon. I think I found a place to live.
Oh, I am sorry to hear that.
Really? You kept sending me apartment listings.
Um, well, I, yeah, you got me.
Where are you moving?
And when? But also where?
Bert has a room for rent.
So you are gonna be roommates with Bert?
Uh, no, it is, uh, pretty private, actually, it is over his garage. So the only time I will see him is when he pulls his car in, does his laundry or practices drums in my dining room.
Well, good for you. I actually have a little news myself.
Okay, we are just gonna circle back to when he is moving out? Okay, that is cool.
I was, uh, asked to be a visiting researcher at Princeton.
Hey, that is amazing.
Good for you.
Congratulations.
Thanks, but the thing is I will be gone for a few months and I do not know how Sheldon’s gonna feel about that.
Oh, come on, he is a grown man, he can take care of himself.
You really believe that?
Once again, you got me.
How can you work on something for a year and they just take it?
I cannot believe the Air Force would treat us like that.
You know, I have a good mind to stop paying my taxes. It is too bad I enjoy doing them so much. The Air Force did it again. They are erasing our lives.
Third floor, wrong apartment.
Although, if anyone’s gonna clean out your apartment and disappear, it’d be Penny.
She might disappear, but she is definitely not cleaning anything.
It is okay, everything’s here.
Oh, hey, what is going on?
You will not believe it, the military confiscated our project.
What?
You are kidding. Why would they do that?
They would not say.
I feel so betrayed. You know, all my life I thought Uncle Sam was a friendly uncle who brought you presents. Turns out he is the other kind.
Sheldon, I am so sorry.
Thank you. Can we just talk about something else?
Yeah, what is going on with you guys?
Give us some good news.
Amy’s got some news.
Yeah, um, Raj is moving out.
Oh, no. When?
You doing okay?
Not really.
Want me to put on some Neil Diamond? That always makes you feel better.
No. Then you will get all sexed up and I am not in the mood. I mean, an entire year wasted.
You might be forgetting another accomplishment of the past year.
Oh. Yeah, yeah, we brought life into the world.
Really? That is the importance you put on us having a baby?
I am happy about it, but, I mean, it is not like I did much. I mean, after the first three minutes it was pretty much all you.
So, did you tell him about Princeton yet?
No, I am waiting till he is in a good mood.
Oh, sweetie, you might not live that long.
I do not know, maybe I should not go.
Oh, stop it, he will be fine.
I guess. And he will have you and Leonard right across the hall the whole time.
Got to go. Morning.
I apologize for exceeding my allotted bathroom time.
Are you feeling okay?
Not really. Apparently grief can make one less regular.
Oh, I am sorry to hear that.
No, I sat and I sat, but to no avail.
Oh, the more details, the more sorry. Well, maybe this will cheer you up. I made your favorite oatmeal, plain.
What is the occasion?
No occasion, I just wanted to do something nice for you.
You are so kind. You know, I do not know how I ever got by without you.
Oh. That is sweet, but you, you did just fine on your own.
Well, I thought that, too, but I have come to realize, I am completely dependent on you.
Sheldon, you are, you are being silly.
No, to wake up every morning and know you are there is a great comfort to me. Mmm, tasteless. How do you do it?
You know, what you need to do is put this Air Force project behind you and just dive into something new.
Well, there is our quantum cognition experiment. You and I could spend more time on that.
Oh, I do not know, I mean, let’s say we succeed in proving that our consciousness creates reality. I mean, what will we have really accomplished? You know, a loaf of bread’s still three bucks.
I am confused. You are always saying that you want to spend more time with me.
That is true, I have said that.
Well, a lot, it is very annoying. Has something changed? Um, is there something that you are not telling me?
I was offered a summer research fellowship at Princeton.
Princeton? A fine institution. The place where Albert Einstein taught. And where Leonard got his PhD, so it may have gone downhill.
Yeah, that is the one.
Well, that is wonderful. Congratulations.
Well, I have not accepted it yet. I wanted to talk to you first.
What is there to talk about? You have to take it. It is important.
So are you.
Thank you, but I will be fine.
Are, are you sure?

Yes. I may have lost my guidance system and my girlfriend, but I still have a colon full of yesterday’s meals to keep me company. Although, thanks to your high fibre breakfast, I am sure that will be leaving me, too.
Really? He does not put raisins or banana slices or anything in it?
I do not think plain oatmeal was the point of that story.
I mean, I like a little brown sugar.
Guys.
Sorry.
You are still gonna go, right?
I do not know. Sheldon’s so vulnerable right now.
Oh, come on. Look, if the roles were reversed, he’d be on the first train to New Jersey, or the second train if there were teenagers on the first one.
Well, distance might be nice. The last time a big project ended for Howie, he would not stop following me around. He even went with me to get a mammogram.
Well, what is wrong with that?
No, he wanted to get one with me, like some kind of weird couple’s massage.
And yet you bore his child. Neato.
You are excited about this opportunity, right?
Of course. I get to be part of the first team to use radon markers to map the structures that…
Okay, a simple yes will do.
You have to go.
I know, but what if Sheldon…
Okay, listen to me. Your relationship can handle being long distance for a while. It is not like you two are very physical.
Hey, you do not know what goes on behind closed doors.
A lot of lectures?
All right, so you know.
I am telling you, if you do not go you will end up regretting it.
Hey, wait up.
Oh, great.
You left something at home. A big hug.
Oh.
I found it right next to these kisses.
It is too late for me. Save yourself.
So, are you excited to have your own place again?
I am, but I will miss you guys.
Ah, we will miss you, too.
You could try saying that without smiling.
I am trying. This is the best I can do. What are you doing?
What does it look like? I am playing sad harmonica in an apartment as empty as my heart.
Why?
I got the blues. My baby done left me.
Come on, Sheldon. Amy’s only gone for a few months. And now that I am moving out, your old room is empty, so you can stay there whenever you want.
Uh, could I talk to you in the hall for a sec?
Yeah, sure.
Sheldon, you are being silly.
Am I? Yesterday I had an Air Force project, a girlfriend who lived with me, and my good friend Raj right across the hall.
Do you really care about that last one?
No, but that list was sounding a little thin.
Instead of dwelling on the negative, think about this. Your girlfriend was given an amazing opportunity, which gives you an opportunity to show her that you are a loving and supportive boyfriend.
So trick her.
All right, let me start again. Uh, you and Amy…
Can I get my stuff? Sounds like it is gonna be a while.
I missed you.
Come here, let’s talk.
Ooh. Sounds serious. Have I been a bad boy? Am I gonna get a spanking ’cause you know.
Just listen. I do not know if you realize this, but whenever you are between projects, you tend to get a little insecure.
Oh.
A little clingy.
I know and I am sorry.
Oh, oh, oh, okay, stop. Stop. I love when you are affectionate, but this is not coming from a good place.
Well, excuse me, but what did you do when you worked on that allergy drug for two years and the FDA shut down your project?
I signed us up for ballroom dance class.
Okay, and what did you do when they took you off the antifungal team?
I made us have a baby.
So?
Bring it in.
And now the movie just got rated R.
Hey. You going somewhere?
No, but you are, so I got you this as a present.
Sheldon, that is not necessary.
No, it is. Leonard pointed out to me that I am not always a loving and supportive boyfriend, so here’s some quality luggage.
Thank you.
The salesman said it could survive a plane crash, so perhaps you should fly inside it.
Does this mean you are okay with me going?

Well, I am not looking forward to it, but it is a wonderful opportunity and you need to take it. Besides, Princeton is in New Jersey, so it is not like you are gonna want to stay. Uh, I know it is not your birthday, but if you are interested…
I am.
Okay. Oh, and just to be clear, I am not being intimate with you in order to keep you from going.
I was not thinking that.
Well, no, it is just, I am just warning you, you know, if you find yourself 3,000 miles away and craving a hit of this, you know, I cannot Skype it to you.
That is a risk I am willing to take.
All right, then. Let’s go to the bedroom, remove our clothes, fold them neatly and engage in frenzied lovemaking.
What if we do not fold our clothes at all?
Or, what if we fold them?
Well, here’s your key back.
Thank you.
As soon as I have the place set up I am gonna have you guys over.
Oh, we would love that.
I really cannot thank you enough for taking me in. You know, I was in a pretty low place in my life.
Oh, Amy, you naughty vixen.
Anyway, uh, as I was saying, I was at a pretty low place in my life and, uh, if it was not for friends
I cannot compete with that. Bye.
Should we give them their privacy?
I want to, but I do not think I can.
Whoopee!
Okay, I am good now.
Okay, the car is waiting. Do you want to walk me downstairs?
Of course. Here, here, let me. I have been doing a little research on New Jersey, and I was delighted to learn that their chief agricultural product is sod.
Is it?
Hmm, yes. Yeah, perhaps I have been harder on them than they deserve.
Do you think it is possible you might enjoy being on your own for a little while?
It is hard to say. I have never really lived by myself. What if I become strange and eccentric?
I will love you no matter what.
Howard Hughes saved his urine in milk bottles.
We will cross that bridge when we come to it.
And you will text me when you arrive at the airport?
I will.
And when you are at the gate?
Uh-huh.
And if you see any actors from Game of Thrones in first class?
I do not know what they look like, but sure.
And do not forget to Skype me when you arrive.
I will not.
And every morning.
Got it.
Now of course, my 9am is your noon, so let’s avoid the whole good morning, good afternoon minefield, and let’s just say hello.
Good thinking.
And just remember, I am proud of you and I support you in all that you do.
Thank you. That means a lot.

Oh, and one last thing. If you find yourself working with a male scientist who’s as smart as me, as tall as me and has hair like Thor, well, then I want you to step away from the situation and call me immediately.
How are you settling in?
Pretty well. Princeton has a beautiful campus.
Now, I have learned some fun facts about New Jersey to help you make small talk. Would you like to know the state bird or the murder rate? They are both shocking.
Actually, I want to hear about you. How are things at home?
Well, I am a lot less likely to see an Eastern Goldfinch or be murdered, I will tell you that.
I miss you.
I miss you, too.
It is so strange, earlier today I ended a sentence with a preposition and you were not there to correct my grammar.
I am sorry you had to go through that.
In fact, that is when I started to really miss you.
You know you just split an infinitive.
Did I? Are you gonna teach me a lesson?
I am. It is naughty to put an adverb between the word to and the verb stem.
What are you gonna do about it?
I am going to admonish you.
Vigorously?
That is the only kind of admonishing I do.
How’s Sheldon doing with Amy gone?

Well, the last three nights I have had to take him to get a haircut, to the train store, and to a Walgreens in Arcadia where they still have the good ibuprofen. Now ask me how I am doing with Amy gone.
How are you doing with…
Shut up.
If you’d like, we can help you out.
Oh, that would be great.
I mean, not me, I have got a wife and child, but this one posts video of himself flossing on Instagram.
It was a tutorial. And yes, I am happy to keep Sheldon company.
Great. Tonight he wants to look at ladders at Home Depot.
Oh, why does he need a ladder?
He does not; he just likes looking at them. Bring a book.
Gentlemen. You may remember Dr. Nowitzki, She is back at Caltech for her postdoc.
Hello.
Hello.
Hi. Oh, let me bring a chair for you.
Oh, thanks. Dr. Nowitzki’s going to tell me about the work she did at CERN. And she brought me this duty-free Toblerone.
Oh. I love those.
Let’s sit somewhere else.
What just happened?
A stranger just lured Sheldon away with a candy bar.
Wait, is not she the grad student that used to follow him around?
Oh, yeah. Back before he hit puberty and grew man parts.
So what do you guys think that is about?
Knowing Sheldon, nothing.
So, tell me about your scalar dark energy experiment.
Not ’til you tell me about your latest paper on quantum loop theory.
Oh. You must be one of those dessert before dinner people.
He just made her laugh, something’s wrong.
Do you see the way she is looking at him?
Yeah. Like Bernadette used to look at me.
I keep telling you, close the bathroom door.
Ah, did you see that? She just touched his hand and he did not swat it away. What is happening?
Okay, the simplest explanation is usually the right one.
Which is?
That ai not Sheldon.
Not only did they eat together, Leonard said he made her laugh.
That is nothing, Howie said she touched his hand.
Did he Purell?
No.
I cannot believe Leonard mentioned the Toblerone but left that part out.
Should we call Amy?
I do not know; we should not worry her if it is nothing.
I guess we could wait till we have more information about this girl.
Yeah. Do you think living with Amy has somehow stirred up Sheldon’s sexual appetite?
Ugh. How can you think that? Why would you even put those words together?
All right, then we agree. He is not making any moves, it is this Dr. Ramona chick.
Nowitzki. I googled her, she is pretty cute.
Really? All I got from Leonard was the Toblerone bar had nuts.
And get this, I saw an articulating ladder with dual-leg leveling, which delivers stability and adaptability to uneven terrain.
Sounds like a big night.
Yeah. Raj made the funniest joke, he said, which is the best ladder to use to hang myself?
So you are keeping busy? You are not lonely?
Oh, not at all. I have had outings with Leonard and Raj in the evening, and, oh, I had lunch
Who’s he?
Oh, Dr. Nowitzki is a woman.
Oh. Really? Uh, when did you meet her?
Many years ago. Back when she was a grad student. She is always been a huge fan of my work, and now she is doing research at Caltech.
Huge fan, you say?
Yes. I think you’d like her. She is extremely intelligent, just like you. Unlike you, she is tall, blonde and used to be an Olympic swimmer.
That is terrific. I will call you right back.
Oh, hey, Amy.
I gave you one job. Keep an eye on him. How hard is that?
We thought you meant not letting him run out into traffic.
Which he only did once.
Why did not you tell me?
We did not want you to worry.
Should I worry?
No. Come on, it is Sheldon. Nothing is gonna happen.
That is what you said to me when I started dating him. And then five years later, bingo bango, something happened.
Yeah, but you are gonna be back in three months.
You do not get it. I have been smacking that ketchup bottle for a long time. All she is got to do is tip it over and point it at her fries.
Well, what do you want us to do?
I do not know. Might be the New Jersey talking, but this Nowitzki broad needs to disappear.
That is ridiculous. As far as we know, all that happened is two scientists had lunch.
Yeah, but one of those scientists is a tall, blonde Olympic swimmer.
Come on. Looks do not matter to Sheldon. Because he only has eyes for you.
Nice try.
Thanks. I was scrambling.
It is unbelievable. Sheldon has lunch with another woman and somehow my wife yells at me.
Penny laid into me, too. Apparently, I am overly fixated on premium Swiss chocolate bars.
Can you even eat those things?
If I take a Lactaid a half-hour before and some Pepto right after.
Sounds like a lot of work.
Eh, I am worth it.
Guys. Focus. Should we do something about Nowitzki?
Like what?
Uh, well, she is single, so if somebody else asks her out and she says yes, then we know she is not into Sheldon.
I will do it.
No offence, Stuart, but the woman’s a doctor.
So? Doctors like me. Whenever I see mine he calls in a bunch of other doctors to have a look.
She is not that kind of doctor.
Oh. Well, her loss. I have been called a genuine medical oddity.
Actually, I was going to suggest me.
Great. Anybody’s better than, mmm.
Excuse me. They took out my spleen and gallbladder, not my feelings.
Dr. Nowitzki. Good to see you.
Good to see you, too.
May I join you?
No.
Good to see you.
We should call Guinness, that might be a record.
She is clearly having a working lunch and preferred to eat alone.
Dr. Cooper, over here.
I could have made her very happy.
You kept walking. I think you did.
Do you really think there is reason to worry?
Yeah, she is definitely going after Sheldon.
I made a play for her and she shot me down.
All right, well, that does not prove anything.
Yeah, there is a million reasons a woman would shoot Raj down.
Like, really, a million?
Fine, hundreds.
Thank you.
The point is this could be nothing and we are all overreacting.
Hey, everybody. This is my friend, Dr. Nowitzki.
Hi.
We just went swimming.
And you actually got in a pool?
I was scared, but I told myself it is just a big bathtub. Then I got scared again ’cause there are all these strangers in my bathtub.
I was proud of him, a lot of people do not put their face in the water on the first day.
Well, I was hiding from a bee, but it still counts.
Can I just squeeze in here?
So, Sheldon, have you talked to Amy?
Yes, we skyped this morning and I am sure I will check in with her before I go to sleep.
Sheldon talks about her all the time. I cannot wait to meet her.
That is true. She keeps asking how long Amy’s going to be gone.
Uh, so, Ramona, tell us about yourself. Do you, do you have a boyfriend?
Leonard, your wife is sitting right here. What are you doing?
No, my work does not leave me a lot of time for relationships.
I think you made that very clear.
She was part of the American team at CERN.
I had a front row seat when they detected the Higgs boson.
Do you know, I have corresponded with Peter Higgs. Would you like to see some of his letters?
Absolutely.
I will get them.
Well, hang on, I will come with you.
Oh, fun. Like a play date.
Okay, correct me if I am wrong, but is not that exactly what we were supposed to stop from happening?
I threw my body at them, what else did you want me to do?
You think you should call Amy?
You got fingers and a mouth, you call her.
Here you go.
Are these all from Peter Higgs?
Hmm? Oh, no, no, no. They are from many famous people. See? Oh, like this one. This is from Patrick Stewart. It says if I come to his house again, I get to meet his dogs. Oh, excuse me.
Hello, Sheldon.
Oh, hello, Amy.
I was missing you again.
I miss you, too. Hey, this is good timing. Remember that Dr. Nowitzki I told you about? She is right here.
She is what?
Hello.
Hi.
So nice to meet you.
Uh-huh. Hang on. Hello. A little late, Leonard. Sorry.
What is Leonard doing calling you at this hour?
It is not important.
I must tell you, that seems a little inappropriate. Do not you agree?
I do.
See? We both think so.
All right, this is making me crazy. Somebody’s got to go over there.
You got feet and legs, you do it.
Will you go with me?
To do what? Shake a can of nickels at them?
We are being ridiculous. There is no way a woman that attractive is trying to seduce Sheldon Cooper.
You done trying to make yourself feel better?
No. I have not played the race card yet.
Hey, I hate to break up the party, but Amy says I am tired and have to go to bed.
It was nice seeing everybody. Thank you for dinner.
Sure.
Our pleasure.
Whatever.
Walk me to my car?
Of course.
We will all go.
Excuse me.
Pardon. I just need to., yeah.
That was fun. It was like Mario Kart.
Bye.
We need to talk.
What? Is this about Leonard and Amy? I do not like it either.
Okay, I know you do not have a lot of experience with women, but Ramona seems to have a romantic interest in you.
That does not make any sense. She knows I have a girlfriend.
Well, sometimes women do not care. Sometimes it makes them want a guy even more.
That may be true, but Dr. Nowitzki’s just a friend. In fact, I would not have even noticed she is a woman if she had not worn that bathing suit that highlighted her bosom.
Okay. Um, let’s try this. Think of yourself as one of those limited edition toys people like to collect.
I already do.
Well, then you get it.
Because there is only one of me, I am more valuable.
Right.
Although, Amy’s already taken me out of my package and played with me.
Let’s forget the toy thing, okay? Um, maybe…
Penny, look. I appreciate your concern, but I do not think that is what is happening.
All right. What do you think is happening?
I think Dr. Nowitzki is a friendly colleague. I think you and Leonard need to see a marriage counsellor. And I need to update my résumé to include swimming as a special skill.
Do not look at me like that, I tried.
Hey, did you eat yet?
Uh, breakfast yes, lunch no. I did have a cough drop, but that really rides the line between sucking and eating.
Well, perfect. I made us sandwiches.
How thoughtful. Thank you.
Mmm. No big deal, I enjoy spending time with you.
And I with you. Question, are you seeking a romantic relationship with me?
What if I were?
Well, that would raise a number of problems. We are colleagues. I am currently in a relation… Excuse me a moment.
Amy. Amy. Amy. Will you marry me?
